story:
Short Summary

We believe that the development of a global consciousness of humanity is only possible
if there are international organizations that set the enforcing of such consciousness as their
goal. The VAC in Belgrade is our first step on a long road that leads to a global network of
similar hubs aiming to be a powerhouse of socially sensitive artistic and scientific work.
We are a completely independent non-profit organization, not a part of any existing
institution. Although we are not opposed to collaboration with governmental institutions, we
do not want our infrastructure to depend on anybody else but the community we are creating.
We want our unique artistic and scientific approach to stay free and individual, non-biased by
existing power structures and political tendencies.

We have successfully organized the School of Visual Anthropology workshop five years
consecutively; more than 100 people participated with the help of 30 lecturers and mentors.
This time is a bit different though: we are going international! What's more we would like not only our school to be open for applicants from all around the world, but for the whole initiative to be global!

What We Need & What You Get

We all know film-making is an expensive business. Shooting documentaries makes it even harder due to their non-commercial nature. What we are aiming for is not to collect funds for a film project and disappear. On the contrary: the workshop we are hosting is just the first step. We firmly believe that in the age of the internet it is possible to create an independent initiative, that doesn't depend on state subventions. Our team is very young and ambitious so your participation means the world to us: if we can make the first step our project may grow in to something  truly significant on the long run! 

What we need first and foremost is... you! The call for taking part in School of Visual Anthropology 2018 is open: you can join us in Belgrade between the 1st and the 10th of July and take part in our workshop. Broaden your perspectives with our lecturers, create your short documentary film with the help of our professional mentors and help us lay the foundations of an international hub of social sciences and film. If you can't join us this time you might still want to help us collect the necessary financial means to support the workshop and the work of Visual Anthropology Center. 

You can help us create a strong community of filmmakers and social scientists with a the naive yet ever so crucial goal of making the world a better place. The funds collected in this campaign will finance the 10 days workshop that is the first event hosted by VAC. 

There will be internationally renowned lecturers and workshop leaders from 8 different countries, 30 participants divided in 5 filming crews. Our goal is to demonstrate that if the costs are shared progressively by the participants and generous donors it is possible to host such an event without commercial sponsoring. The compensations of all lecturers, all participants living costs and the production costs of the short films that will be shot during the workshop will all be included in the workshops price. According to our calculations the average cost of one participant is approximately 600 euros. On the Balkans and in Eastern Europe barely any participant could afford to pay such a price, which is why we made the pricing progressive so the price range is between 100 and 1000 euros - it may be hard to believe but for an average Belgrader 100 euros is more or less equivalent of 1000 bucks for a New Yorker... 

If we don't reach our entire goal we will need to decrease the dimensions of the workshop proportionately, thus the funds will finance the aforementioned goals nonetheless.

The Impact

The goal of the project is to introduce visual anthropology to established professionals
in film making and/or social sciences who would like to broaden their perspectives as well as
to scholars who are new to this field(s).
We provide theoretical and practical workshops, involving filming and post-production
of short anthropological films. The call is open for applicants with or without experience - what
matters is enthusiasm towards promotion of social awareness through visual anthropology.
Our aim is to encourage critical thinking, fostering tolerance for the Other, while
broadening the knowledge of participants as film-makers and social scientists.

Risks & Challenges

The only risk we see is that the interest is going to be greater amongst a financially less prepared target group. In this case we would have difficulties in covering the costs of the workshop. 

We have organized the School of Visual Anthropology successfully 5 times and always managed to overcome the financial difficulties, but this time the project is bigger. We believe that if the interest is as high as we expect than we should have no problem now that the call is open for internationals as well. 

We will see the success of our first international workshop as a green light for Visual Anthropology Center as an world wide organisation.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share, share, share! Call your friends who might be interested and spread the word. 

One more way you can help is if you contribute to our cause with your knowledge. We'd be happy to publish your work on our pages and more than happy if you'd like to contribute to the creation of the VAC with your knowledge or a word of advice!
story_txt:
Short Summary
We believe that the development of a global consciousness of humanity is only possibleif there are international organizations that set the enforcing of such consciousness as theirgoal. The VAC in Belgrade is our first step on a long road that leads to a global network ofsimilar hubs aiming to be a powerhouse of socially sensitive artistic and scientific work.We are a completely independent non-profit organization, not a part of any existinginstitution. Although we are not opposed to collaboration with governmental institutions, wedo not want our infrastructure to depend on anybody else but the community we are creating.We want our unique artistic and scientific approach to stay free and individual, non-biased byexisting power structures and political tendencies.
We have successfully organized the School of Visual Anthropology workshop five yearsconsecutively; more than 100 people participated with the help of 30 lecturers and mentors.This time is a bit different though: we are going international! What's more we would like not only our school to be open for applicants from all around the world, but for the whole initiative to be global!

What We Need & What You Get
We all know film-making is an expensive business. Shooting documentaries makes it even harder due to their non-commercial nature. What we are aiming for is not to collect funds for a film project and disappear. On the contrary: the workshop we are hosting is just the first step. We firmly believe that in the age of the internet it is possible to create an independent initiative, that doesn't depend on state subventions. Our team is very young and ambitious so your participation means the world to us: if we can make the first step our project may grow in to something  truly significant on the long run! 
What we need first and foremost is... you! The call for taking part in School of Visual Anthropology 2018 is open: you can join us in Belgrade between the 1st and the 10th of July and take part in our workshop. Broaden your perspectives with our lecturers, create your short documentary film with the help of our professional mentors and help us lay the foundations of an international hub of social sciences and film. If you can't join us this time you might still want to help us collect the necessary financial means to support the workshop and the work of Visual Anthropology Center. 
You can help us create a strong community of filmmakers and social scientists with a the naive yet ever so crucial goal of making the world a better place. The funds collected in this campaign will finance the 10 days workshop that is the first event hosted by VAC. 
There will be internationally renowned lecturers and workshop leaders from 8 different countries, 30 participants divided in 5 filming crews. Our goal is to demonstrate that if the costs are shared progressively by the participants and generous donors it is possible to host such an event without commercial sponsoring. The compensations of all lecturers, all participants living costs and the production costs of the short films that will be shot during the workshop will all be included in the workshops price. According to our calculations the average cost of one participant is approximately 600 euros. On the Balkans and in Eastern Europe barely any participant could afford to pay such a price, which is why we made the pricing progressive so the price range is between 100 and 1000 euros - it may be hard to believe but for an average Belgrader 100 euros is more or less equivalent of 1000 bucks for a New Yorker... 
If we don't reach our entire goal we will need to decrease the dimensions of the workshop proportionately, thus the funds will finance the aforementioned goals nonetheless.

The Impact
The goal of the project is to introduce visual anthropology to established professionalsin film making and/or social sciences who would like to broaden their perspectives as well asto scholars who are new to this field(s).We provide theoretical and practical workshops, involving filming and post-productionof short anthropological films. The call is open for applicants with or without experience - whatmatters is enthusiasm towards promotion of social awareness through visual anthropology.Our aim is to encourage critical thinking, fostering tolerance for the Other, whilebroadening the knowledge of participants as film-makers and social scientists.

Risks & Challenges
The only risk we see is that the interest is going to be greater amongst a financially less prepared target group. In this case we would have difficulties in covering the costs of the workshop. 
We have organized the School of Visual Anthropology successfully 5 times and always managed to overcome the financial difficulties, but this time the project is bigger. We believe that if the interest is as high as we expect than we should have no problem now that the call is open for internationals as well. 
We will see the success of our first international workshop as a green light for Visual Anthropology Center as an world wide organisation.

Other Ways You Can Help
Share, share, share! Call your friends who might be interested and spread the word. 
One more way you can help is if you contribute to our cause with your knowledge. We'd be happy to publish your work on our pages and more than happy if you'd like to contribute to the creation of the VAC with your knowledge or a word of advice!

story:
The Zombie Research Society

The Zombie Research Society was created in 2007 by our founder, author, and zombie expert Matt Mogk. He dedicated our organization to the science, survival, and culture of the living dead. Our official Advisory Board, which consists of authors, academics, and scholars quickly became the ultimate authority on the undead for a number of official organizations and state governments including the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention:

  • The Zombie Research Society is on the bleeding-edge of zombie research.
  • Our members provide support for our research, articles, and scientific conferences.
  • Without the support of our members we are unable to continue our vital research.

We created Zombie Awareness Month; currently recognized by a number of local and state governments, including the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. We are dedicated to the promotion of STEM (science, technology, engineering, and mathematics) for children, students, and researchers by emphasizing the fun and imagination inherit in studying the living dead. We also encourage the application of epidemiology, statistical analysis, and neuroscience in order to share the benefits of our zombie research with the scientific world.

 

Join the Zombie Research Society!

Our research is only considered "fun" and "theoretical" until it's too late! So, we need your support to continue. We need your support to encourage the next generation of students, researchers, and scientists. We need your support to fund our website, our Advisory Board, our publications, our social media, and perhaps most importantly... our research:

  • The Zombie Research Society is a volunteer organization.
  • We rely entirely on our members for funding, for outreach, and for web hosting fees.
  • By joining the Zombie Research Society, you will help us pay our bills. We will be able to continue hosting the official website, additional research, and our social media accounts.
  • By joining the Zombie Research Society, you can help us attend scientific conferences, conventions & encourage students to dedicate their studies to STEM and the living dead.

Due to COVID-19 we're missing out on all of the live events, conventions, and conferences that help us keep going financially. So, if you join the Zombie Research Society during this official Membership Drive, you'll be one of the select few that we accept into our ranks sight-unseen. It's a rare privilege, and we're happy to offer this opportunity to our fans across the world!

 

We are Deadly Serious. How about You?

We do not believe that zombies exist... at least not yet. However, our studies and research are mostly theoretical. Many of our official Advisory Board members have used the living dead to expand the current study & scientific knowledge of epidemiology, statistical analysis, and neuroscience. And they apply these scenarios to engage and encourage their students:

  • Students love the living dead. Zombies are exciting and promote learning.
  • We have authored a number of books from analytical tomes like "Do Zombies Dream of Undead Sheep" to children's books including the "Zombie Zone" series from Bearport Publishing or "Nerd A to Z" from National Geographic Children's Books.
  • Our members support this outreach with their donations. Perhaps we've even inspired your own child to study science, technology, engineering, or mathematics!

Yes, we are serious; but we also have a lot of fun! During our appearances on AMC's "Talking Dead" with Chris Hardwick, we interacted with thousands of fans who had no idea that our research was real, legitimate, and innovative. Our official Advisory Board quickly changed their minds, and our publications are now cited and referenced in textbooks around the world.

 

We Can't Grow Without Your Support

The Zombie Research Society is a volunteer organization. None of our authors, contributors, researchers, or Advisory Board members are paid - period. By joining our organization you are supporting our operating costs, and that's it. There is no profit here. We simply need your support to pay for web hosting, research, conference attendance, and travel. The Zombie Research Society was never intended to be strictly an online resource. We want to send our representatives to schools, colleges, and conferences to encourage this field of research:

  • Sale of merchandise barely allows us to operate our website.
  • Many of the giveaways and contests that you've seen are completely out-of-pocket; paid for by us personally, simply because we believe in this organization.
  • With your help, and by joining the Zombie Research Society, we hope to fund the mission of our organization for the next fiscal year.

Let us repeat that the Zombie Research Society is a volunteer organization. If you've enjoyed our research, please consider joining our organization. Our authors, researchers, and Advisory Board Members are students, scientists, and fans - just like you! And we simply couldn't keep going without your support. Your contribution may help us grow in ways you'd never imagine!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even with this campaign, we've offered perks and incentives that cost us more than the amount of shipping; simply because we want to encourage and support those of you that believe in our organization. Just by wearing a button or posting a sticker you can help spread the word, and we most certainly appreciate your support.

Even if you can't help fund this campaign, please share articles from our official website (there is no ad revenue) online via Twitter and Facebook:

  • Twitter: @ZombieResearch
  • Facebook: @ZombieResearch
  • Website: https://zombieresearchsociety.com/

If you're a fellow student or zombie researcher interested in contributing an article, please feel free to reach out to us directly at - contact@zombieresearchsociety.com - we're always happy to have someone join our ranks and contribute to the cause. We need your help too!

Thanks again, and remember; what you don't know can eat you!

story:
2019 kerek évfordulók palettájával igazán érdekes témákat vet fel. 100 év, vagyis egy teljes évszázad telt el az első homoszexuális témájú némafilm megjelenése óta: 1919-ben a Más, mint a többiek két zenész történetén keresztül döntött tabukat a mozivásznon. 50 éve már az utcán zajlottak a legfontosabb változások: az LMBT vendégkör a manhattani Stonewall bárban fordult szembe a megalázó rendőri intézkedésekkel, és tette le az LMBT-mozgalom alapjait. 30 éve pedig olvadtak a “hideg diktatúrák”, a rendszerváltás alapjaiban változtatta meg az LMBT-közösség és -szervezetek politikai környezetét.

Több fontos személyhez köthetően is kiemelt év 2019: egyebek mellett Walt Whitman és Birtalan Balázs költők születésének, Habsburg-Lotaringiai Lajos Viktor főherceg és Galgóczi Erzsébet író halálának évfordulójára is emlékezünk.

A programsorozatot a Háttér Társaság és a Labrisz Leszbikus Egyesület közösen koordinálja, évek óta célként kitűzve a társadalom LMBT-ügyekkel kapcsolatos ismereteinek bővítését, a sztereotípiák, előítéletek csökkentését.

Idén is számtalan filmvetítéssel, előadással, kerekasztallal és egyéb programmal készülünk. Ahhoz azonban, hogy valóban színes programfüzetet tudjunk összeállítani és méltóképp nyúljunk az évfordulós eseményekhez, adományokra is szükségünk van.

  • Érték számodra a szexuális kisebbségek megjelenése a kultúrában, és szívesen visszaásnál a gyökerekig?
  • Támogatod az LMBT közösség jogbővítését, társadalmi helyzetének javítását, és úgy gondolod, figyelmet érdemelnek a mozgalom úttörői is?  
  • Szívesen hallasz történeteket rendszerváltás előtti LMBT sorsokról, aktivisták politikai mozgásteréről?

Ha ezekre a kérdésekre igen a válaszod, hozzád is szól ez a felhívás. Amennyiben teheted, itt segíthetsz nekünk, hogy minél jobb programokban, minél több emberhez tudjuk eljuttatni februárban az LMBT közösség történetének legfontosabb üzeneteit!

Az adományokat az esemény megnyitójának költségeire fordítjuk, valamint ebből tudjuk támogatni az egyes rendezvények meghívott előadóinak útiköltségét, a terembérletet, világítást, hangosítást és egyéb kiadásokat.

Minden támogatás ahhoz járul hozzá, hogy ez a rendezvénysorozat megvalósuljon és minél több emberhez jusson el.

http://www.lmbttortenetihonap.hu/

https://www.facebook.com/lmbttortenetihonap/

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Support us in presenting the history of the LGBT community with a colorful series of programs. This year we plan to discover together the significance of the now 50-year-old Stonewall riots and reassess the importance of free movements. To listen to the messages told by lives before the 30-year-old regime change. We wish to think, learn and have fun together, all linked to a good social cause. Do you share this aim with us? Help the 7th LGBT History Month, so that together we get acquainted with the history and all-important values of the LGBT community!

With a plethora of round anniversaries, our year 2019 raises extremely interesting topics. 100 years, a whole century has passed since the release of the first LGBT-themed film: in 1919, “Different from the Others” started to break taboos on the cinema canvas, through the history of two musicians. 50 years ago, the most important changes were already happening in the streets: in Manhattan, LMBT guests of the Stonewall Inn turned against the humiliating police raids and laid down the foundations of the LGBT movement. Then 30 years ago, “cold dictatorships” began to melt, the regime change profoundly altered the political environment of the LGBT community and organizations.

2019 is a unique year from the aspect of personal anniversaries as well: we commemorate the birth of two poets, Walt Whitman and Balázs Birtalan, just as the death of Archduke Ludwig Viktor of Austria and the Hungarian writer, Erzsébet Galgóczi.

Coordinated together by Labrisz Lesbian Association and Háttér Society, our event has the aim of expanding the knowledge of society about LGBT-related issues and the reduction of stereotypes, prejudices. But in order to make up a truly colorful program guide and treat these anniversaries right, we need your donations as well.

  • Is the representation of sexual minorities in culture a value for you and would you like to dig deeper into the subject?
  • Do you support the expansion of rights of the LGBT community and the improvement of its position in the society? Do you think the pioneers of the social movement deserve more attention?
  • Are you keen to listen to stories about the lives and political opportunities of LGBT activists from before the regime change?

Should you answer “yes” to these questions, this call addresses you as well. If you can, please help us on this platform, so that we can get the message of the LGBT community through to a large audience and through the best possible programs.  

Donations serve the opening ceremony of the festival, the travel and accommodation costs of the speakers and costs related to event venues such as lighting, sound and other.

All donations support the programs and making sure it reaches the most people.

story:
Kulturni centar mladih dolazi iz Kutine i glavna misija mu je organiziranje i unapređenje kulturnog života u Kutini.

Jedna od aktivnosti KCM-a bilo je i djelovanje kroz glazbeni klub imena “Baraka” koji je osnovan 1996. godine.

Bio je to prvi alternativni klub ovakvog tipa u Hrvatskoj, ali i ovom dijelu Europe.

Kroz svoje godine djelovanja klub je ugostio nebrojene glazbene sastave iz Hrvatske, Srbije, Bosne i Hercegovine, Makedonije, SAD-a, Japana, Brazila, Bugarske, Austrije i mnogih drugih zemalja.

Osim koncertnih djelovanja u sklopu Barake djelovao je i Nezavisni teatar Barake, organizirane su izložbe, predstave i performansi, dok je kroz projekt “Bukom protiv predrasuda” pružena podrška HIV pozitivnim djevojčicama Eli i Nini koje su udomljene u Kutini.

Isto tako klub je posjedovao i prostor u kojemu su bendovi, ali i oni koji su to tek imali postati održavali glazbene probe i druženja.

Iz kluba Baraka nastao je i jedan od prvih alternativnih festivala u Hrvatskoj imena Organizirani kaos, koji će 2018. godine obilježiti svoje 20. izdanje.

Godinama smo na razne načine pokušali dodatno osigurati prostor, no svi pokušaji i trud pali su u vodu 2013. godine kada su dva provalnika probila betonski zid i otuđili svu koncertnu opremu koja je bila smještena u prostoriji za probe.

Zbog niza problema, ponajviše financijskih koje nam je otuđenje opreme prouzročilo  bili smo prisiljeni zatvoriti klub.

Godine 2016. pokrenuli smo inicijativu pod nazivom #HOCEMOKLUB  kroz koju tražimo rješavanje imovinsko-pravnih odnosa grada Kutine i Petrokemije te dodjelu na korištenje čvrstog, zidanog objekta koji je napušten i nalazi se uz sami klub Baraka.
Ono što je godinama bilo gurano pod tepih sada je napokon izašlo na vidjelo i konačno mu se nazire kraj.

Krajem 2017. godine, grad Kutina i Petrokemija sporazumno su dogovorili parcelaciju zemljišta te se očekuje kako će u proljeće 2018. godine biti izdana građevinska dozvola za obnovu kluba mladih i kako će biti započeti radovi za njegovo uređenje.

Naša procjena je kako će troškovi obnove kluba, u što ulazi zamjena krova, uređenje unutrašnjih prostorija, sanitarnog čvora, električnih instalacija, grijanja, rasvjete i mnogih drugih iznositi cca. 100 000 €.

Klub je zamišljen kao multifunkcionalni prostor za djelovanje mladih koji bi se sastojao od  glavnog prostora za održavanje koncerata, izložbi fotografija i slika, radionica, predstavljanja knjiga, organiziranja predavanja i okruglih stolova…

Isto tako u sklopu kluba bi se nalazio i  prostor za održavanje glazbenih proba, nekoliko ureda za udruge mladih te glazbeni studio.

Jedan od prvih koraka prema cilju obnove kluba je i nabavka glazbene opreme koja nam je potrebna za održavanje mnogih kulturnih događanja u našoj organizaciji te kako do konačnog stavljanja kluba u funkciju, glazbeni i kulturni život grad Kutine ne bi doživio svoju propast.


Stoga smo u prosincu 2017. godine pokrenuli kampanju imena “Daj mi buke” kroz koju nam je cilj skupiti dovoljnu količinu nova potrebnu za nabavku nove opreme.

Kako nas provale u naše prostorije ne bi ponovno unazadile, do obnove kluba i dobro osigurane prostorije za opremu koja će se tamo nalaziti, putem grada Kutine osigurali smo sigurno mjesto na kojemu će nova oprema biti smještena.

Imaš pitanje, prijedlog ili nedoumicu oko kampanje?
Tu smo da te čujemo. Stvori buku!


Facebook stranica
e-mail: kcmkutina@gmail.com

The Cultural Center of Youth comes from Kutina, and its main mission is organizing and promoting cultural life in Kutina, Croatia.

Our club called Baraka, which has hosted many musicians since 1997, was burglarized in 2013 and all of our equipment was stolen. The burgles were found, but the equipment was never restored or it was destroyed.

Due to the number of issues that this case caused, we were forced to close the club.

In order for the musical life of Kutina to continue to function, we need your help.

With this campaign we are trying to collect the money to buy new concert equipment so that the urban life of Kutina and its surrounding will continue to be up-to-date and in order to organize events in our new club.

With your donation, you help organize not only musical but also many cultural and educational events and the development of our initiative for the new youth club.

You also help us not to make Kutina a city of silence and monotonous music sound, but a city of creative noise.

If you have any questions about shipping options for the perks or anything else about the campaign we are here for you.

Feel free to contact us and make some noise!

Facebook page
e-mail: kcmkutina@gmail.com

“Baraka” koji je osnovan 1996. godine.Bio je to prvi alternativni klub ovakvog tipa u Hrvatskoj, ali i ovom dijelu Europe.Kroz svoje godine djelovanja klub je ugostio nebrojene glazbene sastave iz Hrvatske, Srbije, Bosne i Hercegovine, Makedonije, SAD-a, Japana, Brazila, Bugarske, Austrije i mnogih drugih zemalja.Osim koncertnih djelovanja u sklopu Barake djelovao je i Nezavisni teatar Barake, organizirane su izložbe, predstave i performansi, dok je kroz projekt “Bukom protiv predrasuda” pružena podrška HIV pozitivnim djevojčicama Eli i Nini koje su udomljene u Kutini.Isto tako klub je posjedovao i prostor u kojemu su bendovi, ali i oni koji su to tek imali postati održavali glazbene probe i druženja.Iz kluba Baraka nastao je i jedan od prvih alternativnih festivala u Hrvatskoj story:
Our Story

Back in 2015, I realized none of my regular regional Burning Man festivals provided day bars, places for burners like me to hang out while the late-night ravers sleep it off. I decided to create a Bloody Mary Bar, playing off my burn name, Slaughter, and intended to create a gore-fest horror movie type theme camp.

Then in 2016, I got my period at 3 burns in a row, including Burning Man itself. And instead we launched the Bloody Bar, where we serve Bloody Marys and celebrate the Bloody Time of the Month. Over the last two years our little camp has poured hundreds of the best Bloody Marys on the Razorgrass and provided a place to acknowledge that every single one of us is alive because Mom missed her period that one time.

And that's the reason we exist - to normalize the reality that any given time, 1 in 4 of us is bleeding. Our Bar is gender inclusive - we talk about The Flow, not "being a woman." Serving Bloody Marys is the reason participants come by -- learning about our bodies, venting about periods and playing Menstrual Bingo is why people stay.

 

Why Now?

After attending 9 different burns over the last 3 years, our infrastructure is dying. The Bar itself has swollen with moisture and a piece has broken off:

Our hand-lettered sign is mildewing:

Our main easy-up that shelters the Bar busted a leg.

Our Camp has grown from 3 regular members to 23 regular members, so some of our residential components like the Camp Kitchen need some help.

Because of what De-commodification and Communal Effort means to us, we're pooling our resources as a camp, rather than charging camp dues at each event. Our regular "dues" are a handle of vodka, cans of plain tomato juice, and a pillow for the cuddle pit.

We're also inviting our beloved fans and patrons to assist with our infrastructure replacement needs, expansion, and of course, some fun things like plushies and swag!

 

Our Future

We have big dreams for expansion: attending larger Regionals like Lakes of Fire, To the Moon, and Transformus; adding workshops like the Virgin Mary Hour, an educational offering for young burners to learn about puberty and periods, providing a glorious public cuddle space with a subfloor to keep us out of the mud, and taking the Bloody Bar to Burning Man in 2023.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our fundraising goal is $2,500 to enable us to:

  • Replace the swollen, rotting, beat up Bar with a hardwood base!
  • Replace the hand-lettered mildewing sign with a larger, lit one!
  • Fund the new canvas tent that will house the Bar!
  • Replace the fading tarps on our monkey huts!
  • Add a subfloor to our larger (8'x8') cuddle space!
  • Add more playatech furniture for our Bar space, the Kitchen and the Lounge
  • Add important safety details, like rubber mats for the kitchen and fire safety!
  • Commission two local artists to design art for the new Bar and an icon for our swag

 

Did you catch that last bullet point? Don't you want some amazing swag with our new icon all over it? Check out the perks: enamel pins, patches, hoodies! Please allow us to know who to shower with our gratitude!

All contributions will be used, whether we reach our goal or not. The Bloody Bunch will work together to decide what gets bought first (pretty sure we start with a new Bar).

 

The Impact

I remember telling a (non-burner) acquaintance about the Bloody Bar, and she responded, wow, my husband could never hang out at your Bar. He gets entirely weirded out if you even mention periods! And I bet all of us are familiar with the "OMG you expect me to buy your tampons while I'm grocery shopping?" comedy bits about period hygiene supplies.

This stigma, embarrassment, ignorance, and confusion fuels our mission. The Bar becomes a venue for real conversation about bodies, bleeding, gender, sex, consent, and everything else. Attending larger and larger events will enable us to reach more people and change these attitudes, educate our youth, and be playful with this monthly curse.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, and that's 100% okay! Please help get the word out and make some noise about Slaughter's Bloody Bar and our fundraiser! Use the convenient sharing tools on this page! Drool over our swag!!!

Thank you for reading this far - love you all!

story:
Baile Maracujália has already 5 editions. We produced events in gardens, public squares, viewpoints and some really cool bars. We booked artist from 5 countries mixing national emerging talents with some established dj´s from around the globe. The first year of this event was a success giving people free access to culture and entertainment. 
 

To grow our "baile" we had 2 options : start charging tickets or try to engage the city community into this campaign. We need your support to keep the party completely natural and free. 

The collected amount will be totally reversed for the booking of artists, sound and visual structures. With your contribution we can promote art, creativity and culture through music and parties! Lets make things happen and turn our city more free and dynamic! 

 

Vimeo: https://vimeo.com/238900379

Soundcloud : https://soundcloud.com/oioba

Website : www.oioba.com

Email : geral@oioba.com

story:
2018  was a banner year for gender issues. The year gave us a group of new female icons including Dr. Christine Blasey Ford, Jameela Jamil, and all of the incredible women behind Time's Up. The country mobilized and elected a record 117 women across the United States in the mid-term elections. California passed a landmark bill that made the state the first in the nation to require more women in boardrooms. Yes, we made progress last year, but there is still a lot of work to do and we need your help.

What is theBoardlist?

theBoardlist is a global talent platform that curates, develops and connects exceptional women with board opportunities. It all started in May 2015 when our founder—Sukhinder Singh Cassidy—published an open letter on recode.com, titled “Tech Women Choose Possibility,” challenging the tech community to increase the rate of progress for women in the industry by leveraging its wealth of existing female talent. Sukhinder penned the letter, which was co-signed by 59 female technology entrepreneurs and investors, drawing from her own experiences as a tech entrepreneur coupled with research she conducted with 230 female founders and CEOs of technology companies.

Her eye-opening research, along with the tech community's overwhelmingly positive response to it, signaled an opportunity to build a better way for CEOs and corporate boards to find great female board candidates. And, theBoardlist was born. 

theProblem?

While women make up roughly 50% of the global population, they represent a shockingly small percentage of company board seats—women hold only 17% of Russell 3000 company board seats. Despite substantial evidence that diverse boards lead to better business outcomes, boardrooms overwhelmingly lack diversity. There’s an increasing demand for diverse board talent, but board recruiting still relies on stale, limited referral networks. 

theSolution?

theBoardlist goes beyond the networks that dominate boards today and connects a rising tide of powerful, qualified female talent with companies looking to build boards that more accurately reflect the customers they serve.

We know $200,000 is an ambitious goal, but it will help us make great strides in our work toward gender parity in the boardroom. Here's how you can help:

  1. Donate Now: Every dollar we raise allows us to identify additional exceptional candidates, arm them with the tools they need for board service, and place them on a board that currently lacks diversity. 
  2. Tell Your Friends: Please share the #BoardForward Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, email—whatever you can do to help us get the word out! Here are some sample posts so you can copy/paste to make it easy:
    • I just backed @theboardlist’s #BoardForward campaign to continue working toward gender parity in the boardroom. RT and visit bit.ly/BoardForward2019 to join me and contribute!
    • RT if you think it’s time to put women where they belong: THE BOARDROOM. @theboardlist is on a quest for gender parity—help them move the #BoardForward. DONATE ➡ bit.ly/BoardForward2019.
    • The boardroom is the most powerful and least diverse group in corporate America—it’s time to move the #BoardForward. RT if you agree and help @theboardlist bring more women into the boardroom. DONATE ➡ bit.ly/BoardForward2019.
    • Don’t think corporate America is lacking gender equality? Don’t click here: bit.ly/BoardForward2019 #BoardForward

Why we're raising money

For three important reasons:

  • To scale our platform to meet the increased demands from candidates and companies who lack gender parity.
  • To extend our reach across industries and double the number of companies that use our platform to find board candidates.
  • To scale our team to meet increased demand. 

Where your money goes

We began with a focus on privately funded technology companies in California, roughly 75% of which have absolutely no women serving on their boards. The money we raise with your help will allow us to expand our mission to effect change across the gamut of industries and geographies. More specifically, your donation to the #BoardForward Campaign enables us to:

  • Expand our pipeline and reach to include women leaders in every industry with the talent, track record, and smarts to be stellar board members.
  • Create additional resources, educational tools, and coaching events to invest in the pipeline of future female leaders.
  • Hire the team members we need to meet our goals.
  • Engage with more companies—ranging from early-stage startups to large public companies—to bring greater diversity to their boards
  • Enhance our technology to better match companies with candidates outside their first order network.

Since launching in 2016, theBoardlist has built a community of thousands of board-ready female CEOs and C-Suite executives and facilitated 500+ board searches. We have worked with companies whose leaders are committed to diversity and inclusion—including Shutterfly, Fossil, and Mindbody— to place exceptional women on their boards.  

We’re proud of the impact we’ve made since launching theBoardlist and we're ready to take the next step to move the #BoardForward.

 

Just a few of the companies that have searched for candidates on theBoardlist:

Mentorship is integral to advancing women in corporate America and moving the #BoardForward. We are excited to offer mentorship opportunity perks, thanks to the generosity of some incredible friends of theBoardlist who donated their time to our campaign.

Mentorship from the Media Legend, Katie Couric:

Our first mentorship opportunity perk is live right now! Media legend, Katie Couric is supporting the #BoardForward campaign by donating a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to spend time with her and her team behind-the-scenes at her new venture, Katie Couric Media, in NYC. This incredible perk includes a 1:1 lunch with Katie herself. Our sincere thanks to Katie for donating her time to our efforts!

"Mentorship Monday" Perks

Each "Mentorship Monday" of our campaign, we will be unlocking a new 1:1 mentor session perk with accomplished CEOs and Venture Capitalists. Whether you are an entrepreneur ready to raise your first round of capital, an aspiring business owner, or you're ready for the next step in your career, these perks represent a priceless opportunity. These 1:1 mentor sessions will take place in person over lunch—or via video chat—depending on your location. You set the agenda. Present your business plan for input, get advice on your VC presentation, talk through your career aspirations and game plan your next move. It's up to you.

"Mentorship Monday" perk roll-out schedule:

theBoardlist is a small (but mighty) team of women who share a passion for gender parity and are united by the belief that a woman's place is in the boardroom. Meet our leadership team:

Sukhinder Singh Cassidy, Founder/Chairman

Sukhinder Singh Cassidy is a leading digital executive and entrepreneur with 20 years of leadership experience scaling and founding companies including Google, Amazon, Yodlee, Joyus, Polyvore, and theBoardlist. She is currently President of StubHub, the world's largest ticket marketplace with tickets available for over 10 million live sports, music, and theater events in more than 40 countries, and an eBay company. Sukhinder also serves as a public board director at Urban Outfitters and previously served as a board member at Ericsson, TripAdvisor, J.Crew, and Stitchfix, as well as an advisor to Twitter. 

Shannon Gordon, Chief Executive Officer

Shannon Gordon is a technology executive and leader with proven experience building and scaling new customer experiences.  She is currently CEO of theBoardlist, a curated talent marketplace that connects highly qualified female leaders with board opportunities at public and private companies.  Before joining theBoardlist, Shannon was SVP Operations and Customer Experience at Shyp, a San Francisco startup that helped small businesses with their shipping needs.  

Lisa Corrigan Elting, Vice President of Partnerships

Lisa Corrigan Elting is an innovative and value-driven executive experienced in executing strategies that deliver business growth and value. She has worn many hats in her career - lawyer, sales professional, manager, director, vice president, researcher, writer and custom marketer - and has traveled and gained expertise across industries—legal, media, online communities, globalization, SaaS technologies, and managed services.

Nicole Kyner, Head of Search

Nicole Kyner is the Head of Search at theBoardlist. With more than 25 years in executive search and recruiting, Nicole has served as the Director of Talent Acquisition at SF-based ecommerce firm Delivery Agent; Executive Recruiter at a global bank; and as both Senior Associate and Research Director, Technology Practice at Spencer Stuart. Her client work at Spencer Stuart included Board, C-suite and EVP/SVP leadership searches for large public companies, private equity-backed companies, and growth stage companies. Nicole attended the University California at Berkeley and lives in the Oakland Hills.

Joanne Fedeyko, Managing Director of theBoardlist Canada

Joanne Fedeyko manages theBoardlist Canada and is the Founder of the Canadian Women’s Network in Silicon Valley, designed to help women grow their business, drive economic value back to Canada, and strengthen their own personal and company profile. Additionally, Joanne consults to the Government of Alberta's Economic Development and Trade department to increase the profile of its tech ecosystem, attract investment and help Alberta companies access international markets and is a Founding Board Member of Canadian Entrepreneurs in Life Sciences, an organization that helps connect life sciences startups with capital, customers and connections in Silicon Valley. 

We thank you for anything you can do to help. Together, we can demonstrate our passion for gender equality and move the #BoardForward.

Here's how you can help:

Donate Now: Every dollar we raise allows us to identify additional exceptional candidates, arm them with the tools they need for board service, and place them on a board that currently lacks diversity. 

Tell Your Friends: Please share the #BoardForward Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, email—whatever you can do to help us get the word out! Here are some sample posts so you can copy/paste to make it easy:
I just backed @theboardlist’s #BoardForward campaign to continue working toward gender parity in the boardroom. RT and visit bit.ly/BoardForward2019 to join me and contribute!
RT if you think it’s time to put women where they belong: THE BOARDROOM. @theboardlist is on a quest for gender parity—help them move the #BoardForward. DONATE ➡ bit.ly/BoardForward2019.
The boardroom is the most powerful and least diverse group in corporate America—it’s time to move the #BoardForward. RT if you agree and help @theboardlist bring more women into the boardroom. DONATE ➡ bit.ly/BoardForward2019.
Don’t think corporate America is lacking gender equality? Don’t click here: bit.ly/BoardForward2019 #BoardForward


Why we're raising moneyFor three important reasons:
To scale our platform to meet the increased demands from candidates and companies who lack gender parity.
To extend our reach across industries and double the number of companies that use our platform to find board candidates.
To scale our team to meet increased demand. 
Where your money goesWe began with a focus on privately funded technology companies in California, roughly 75% of which have absolutely no women serving on their boards. The money we raise with your help will allow us to expand our mission to effect change across the gamut of industries and geographies. More specifically, your donation to the #BoardForward Campaign enables us to:
Expand our pipeline and reach to include women leaders in every industry with the talent, track record, and smarts to be stellar board members.
Create additional resources, educational tools, and coaching events to invest in the pipeline of future female leaders.
Hire the team members we need to meet our goals.
Engage with more companies—ranging from early-stage startups to large public companies—to bring greater diversity to their boards
Enhance our technology to better match companies with candidates outside their first order network.
Since launching in 2016, theBoardlist has built a community of thousands of board-ready female CEOs and C-Suite executives and facilitated 500+ board searches. We have worked with companies whose leaders are committed to diversity and inclusion—including Shutterfly, Fossil, and Mindbody— to place exceptional women on their boards.  We’re proud of the impact we’ve made since launching theBoardlist and we're ready to take the next step to move the #BoardForward. Just a few of the companies that have searched for candidates on theBoardlist:Mentorship is integral to advancing women in corporate America and moving the #BoardForward. We are excited to offer mentorship opportunity perks, thanks to the generosity of some incredible friends of theBoardlist who donated their time to our campaign.Mentorship from the Media Legend, Katie Couric:Our first mentorship opportunity perk is live right now! Media legend, Katie Couric is supporting the #BoardForward campaign by donating a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to spend time with her and her team behind-the-scenes at her new venture, Katie Couric Media, in NYC. This incredible perk includes a 1:1 lunch with Katie herself. Our sincere thanks to Katie for donating her time to our efforts!"Mentorship Monday" PerksEach "Mentorship Monday" of our campaign, we will be unlocking a new 1:1 mentor session perk with accomplished CEOs and Venture Capitalists. Whether you are an entrepreneur ready to raise your first round of capital, an aspiring business owner, or you're ready for the next step in your career, these perks represent a priceless opportunity. These 1:1 mentor sessions will take place in person over lunch—or via video chat—depending on your location. You set the agenda. Present your business plan for input, get advice on your VC presentation, talk through your career aspirations and game plan your next move. It's up to you."Mentorship Monday" perk roll-out schedule:theBoardlist is a small (but mighty) team of women who share a passion for gender parity and are united by the belief that a woman's place is in the boardroom. Meet our leadership team:Sukhinder Singh Cassidy, Founder/ChairmanSukhinder Singh Cassidy is a leading digital executive and entrepreneur with 20 years of leadership experience scaling and founding companies including Google, Amazon, Yodlee, Joyus, Polyvore, and theBoardlist. She is currently President of StubHub, the world's largest ticket marketplace with tickets available for over 10 million live sports, music, and theater events in more than 40 countries, and an eBay company. Sukhinder also serves as a public board director at Urban Outfitters and previously served as a board member at Ericsson, TripAdvisor, J.Crew, and Stitchfix, as well as an advisor to Twitter. Shannon Gordon, Chief Executive OfficerShannon Gordon is a technology executive and leader with proven experience building and scaling new customer experiences.  She is currently CEO of theBoardlist, a curated talent marketplace that connects highly qualified female leaders with board opportunities at public and private companies.  Before joining theBoardlist, Shannon was SVP Operations and Customer Experience at Shyp, a San Francisco startup that helped small businesses with their shipping needs.  
Lisa Corrigan Elting, Vice President of Partnerships

Lisa Corrigan Elting is an innovative and value-driven executive experienced in executing strategies that deliver business growth and value. She has worn many hats in her career - lawyer, sales professional, manager, director, vice president, researcher, writer and custom marketer - and has traveled and gained expertise across industries—legal, media, online communities, globalization, SaaS technologies, and managed services.
Nicole Kyner, Head of Search

Nicole Kyner is the Head of Search at theBoardlist. With more than 25 years in executive search and recruiting, Nicole has served as the Director of Talent Acquisition at SF-based ecommerce firm Delivery Agent; Executive Recruiter at a global bank; and as both Senior Associate and Research Director, Technology Practice at Spencer Stuart. Her client work at Spencer Stuart included Board, C-suite and EVP/SVP leadership searches for large public companies, private equity-backed companies, and growth stage companies. Nicole attended the University California at Berkeley and lives in the Oakland Hills.
Joanne Fedeyko, Managing Director of theBoardlist Canada

Joanne Fedeyko manages theBoardlist Canada and is the Founder of the Canadian Women’s Network in Silicon Valley, designed to help women grow their business, drive economic value back to Canada, and strengthen their own personal and company profile. Additionally, Joanne consults to the Government of Alberta's Economic Development and Trade department to increase the profile of its tech ecosystem, attract investment and help Alberta companies access international markets and is a Founding Board Member of Canadian Entrepreneurs in Life Sciences, an organization that helps connect life sciences startups with capital, customers and connections in Silicon Valley. 
We thank you for anything you can do to help. Together, we can demonstrate our passion for gender equality and move the #BoardForward.

story:
A JOURNEY OF HOPE

 

UPDATE: 

MY NAME IS SOHAN LAL AND MY AMBITION IS TO TAKE A JOURNEY OF HOPE FOR HUMANITY.

 

EARLY SEPTEMBER 2017 I START A 5500 KM RIKSCHA JOURNEY FROM BERNE SWITZERLAND TO DEHLI INDIA, FOR 3.5 MONTHS  THROUGH 10 COUNTRIES AND CROSSING 9 BOARDERS.

MY DREAM HERBY IS TO INSPIRE HUMANITY WITH THIS SIMPLE MESSAGE: 

I BELIEVE THAT WE ARE ALL HERE TO HELP EACH OTHER.

TO UNDERSTAND MY MOTIVATION MORE CLEARLY TO TAKE THIS CRAZY JOURNEY YOU NEED TO HEAR THE STORY WHERE I CAME FROM:

I WAS BORN IN NEW DEHLI INDIA AND I STARTED WORKING WHEN I WAS 9 YEARS OLD; FIRST AS SHOESHINER AND LATER AS RIKSCHA. I WAS LIVING IN THE SLUM OF NEW DEHLI FOR ABOUT 10 YEARS. ONE OF THE BEST TIMES OF MY LIFE.

I AM LIVING IN BERN SWITZERLAND SINCE 12 YEARS WITH MY FAMILY  DOING VERY GOOD AND STILL WORKING AS A RIKSCHA DRIVER.

MY HEART HAS ALWAYS BEEN WITH PEOPLE IN NEED:

WITH THIS CAMPAIGN I’D LIKE TO RAISE MUCH AS POSSIBLE FOR THE DEHLI BASED AAINA FOUNDATION THAT HELPS DRUG AND ALCOHOL ADDICTS TO GET AWAY FROM THE STREETS – PROVIDING THEM SHELTER, FOOD, MEDICINE AND TO GET A NEW PERSPECTIVE IN LIFE.

I KINDLY ASK YOU TO HELP ME TO MAKE THIS JOURNEY OF HOPE COME TRUE.

WITH YOUR SUPPORT I WILL BE ABLE TO TAKE THIS JOURNEY AND WE CAN SUPPORT DIRECTLY THOSE IN NEED.

THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT. TOGETHER WE CAN MAKE THIS JOURNEY HAPPEN THAT REMINDS US TO HELP EACH OTHER.

I'D SPECIALLY LIKE TO THANK GLOBETROTTER TRAVEL COMPANY TO SUPPORT MY DREAM COME TRUE.

NAMASTE.

SOHAN LAL

THE ROUTE

 

SCHEDULE PART 1 SWITZERLAND TO GREECE

Leaving Bern 3. September

Zurich 4. September

Ravensburg 6. September

Munchen 8/9. September

Linz 12. September

Prag 15./16. September

Brunn 19. September

Wien 21. September

Bratislava 23. September

Budapest 24. September

Belgrad 29 Sept.

Skopje 5 Okt.

Athens 18. Okt.

Rikscha shipped to Bombay about  9-12 days.

SCHEDULE PART 2 BOMBAY TO NEW DELHI

Mumbai 07. November

Malegaon 10. November

Sendhwa 13. November

Indore 15. November

Bhopal 18. November

Chhatarpur 22. November

Kanpur 25. November

Harpalpur/Telipahari 27.November

Jhansi 29. November

Agra 1. Dezember

New Delhi 5. Dezember

Exact dates may vary due to unforseen circumstances on the road.

RAISED FUNDS

10% OF THE RAISED FUNDS WILL DIRECTLY GO TO AAINA FOUNDATION IN DELHI INDIA. ONCE THE CAMPAIGN GOAL IS REACHED, EVERY CENT ABOVE THE GOAL WILL GO DIRECTLY TO THE AAINA FOUNDATION. THE FUNDS FROM THE CAMPAIGN GOAL (30K EUR) WILL BE USED TO COVER THE EXPENSES FOR "A JOURNEY OF HOPE", PRIMARLY THE BUDGET WILL BE USED TO FINANCE THE FILM PRODUCTION AND THE JOURNEY ITSELF: BOARD AND LODGING ON THE ROAD, TRAVEL EQUIPMENT, TECHNICAL SPARE PARTS AND REPAIRS ON THE ROAD. ALSO THE BUDGET WILL BE USED FOR SAFE PARKING FEES (ESPECIALLY IN INDIA) FOR OTHER UNFORESEEN EXPENSES. PLEASE NOTE THAT PRESENTING PARTNER AND LOGO PERKS ARE NOT AVAILABLE FOR TRAVEL COMPANIES AND AIRLINES.

PLEASE VISIT WWW.A-JOURNEY-OF-HOPE.NET AND WWW.RIKSCHAWALLA.CH FOR FURTHER INFORMATION. NAMASTE

 

CITY TRIP PERKS WITH RIKSCHAWALLA

FOR THE PURCHASED CITY-TRIPS WITH RIKSCHAWALLA PLEASE CONTACT SOHAN ON +41791053505 TO GET A CITY TOUR. PLEASE NOTE THAT SOHAN WILL LEAVE THE 3RD OF SEPTEMBER AND WILL BE BACK WITH THE RIKSCHA BUSINESS AROUND MIDDLE OF MARCH 2018. NAMASTE

story:
1 DAY On Wednesday, June 21st, from dawn through dusk, NYC will come together to ring in the first day of summer on the longest day of the year with a celebration of music like no other…

400+ VENUES A “music holiday” that will bring our shared, outdoor spaces to vibrant life with free performances in public plazas, parks and community gardens; in front of restaurants, bars, shops and businesses; and in partnerships with cultural institutions across all five boroughs…

1,000+ CONCERTS A festival featuring performances representing every conceivable genre and style of music...

5,000+ PERFORMERS And a music holiday starring the amazing talents and passions of local New Yorkers of all ages, backgrounds and skill levels.

The Make Music New York team was putting the finishing touches on the eleventh consecutive edition of our annual music holiday when we got word that we will not be receiving an expected funding grant of $20,000. Since receiving this news two weeks ago, we have exhausted every resource to cut this 20K gap in half and now are just $10,000 shy of our goal.

Now, for the first time in our eleven-year history, we are appealing directly to our artists, fans and all NYC music lovers to come together, step up, and contribute to our remaining $10,000 need. Because although the festival is free to the public, it is not free to produce. 

This is not a typical appeal for support to help Make Music New York launch a special project or take on a new initiative. We have very real and immediate expenses of $10,000 to cover before the end of the month, specifically:

We need to secure an additional 145 sound permits at $45 each, for a total cost of $6,525.
When a Make Music New Yorker musician wants to present an amplified concert, we must secure a sound permit from the City of New York to make their wish come true. We have already procured half of the permits required for June 21st, but still need an additional 145 permits for outdoor locations in all five boroughs. Help us keep the festival plugged in!

We also need to raise $1,706 to maintain our general liability insurance coverage.
We know that is about the most uncool sounding expense imaginable, and it is likely the last thing on the minds of our artists and fans.  That’s as it should be! But we cannot safely and legally present over 1,000 free, outdoor concerts without this required coverage in place.

Lastly, we need $2,000 to print our 2017 Make Music New York program guides.
Thanks to innovative media partnerships and social media resources, Make Music New York manages to publicize our annual festival with very little marketing overhead. But we do have one highly popular marketing piece that comes with real costs: 50,000 program guides distributed citywide that help fans map out their music day on June 21st, acknowledge the thousands of participating musicians and bring advanced visibility to the public at the grassroots level. 

The day-long Make Music New York celebration is inclusive, ambitious, unpredictable and fun–and we hope that you rightly take pride in our collective achievements over the past ten years. Please take a moment right now to invest in music makers of all ages, backgrounds and skill levels and to bring free music to neighborhoods all across NYC. 

Thank you and please help to spread the word to all of your friends!

story:
What is Assemble Fest?
Assemble Fest is a vibrant one-day festival which takes place across businesses and public spaces on Newland Avenue in Hull. We have a fantastic programme of theatre which runs throughout the day, as well as over 20 free activities, performances and events for all ages – such as circus, music performances, family workshops, craft activities and more!

Assemble Fest is a vibrant one-day festival which takes place across businesses and public spaces on Newland Avenue in Hull. We have a fantastic programme of theatre which runs throughout the day, as well as over 20 free activities, performances and events for all ages – such as circus, music performances, family workshops, craft activities and more!

This year, as part of Hull City of Culture 2017, we're holding a special one-off free evening event called Our Street Our Stage.

The event will celebrate the wonderfully diverse area of Newland by recreating moments from its forgotten heritage – such as its origins as green fields, its connection to Hull Pals, the Sailor Home’s Whitsun Carnivals and the old Monica Cinema.

Why are you doing Our Street Our Stage?
The event will truly shine the spotlight on Newland and draw attention to its fantastic local community spirit. The event will take place on the street itself, and will bring the avenue to life. Not much is known about the heritage of Newland, and so through Our Street Our Stage, we hope to educate, inspire and entertain. As the audience move down the avenue, a new scene will take place.

Why should I donate?
This is a completely free event, and we have had a huge level of support from local businesses and residents who believe in what we're doing. We are working with choreographer Jon Beney, musicians Dan Bye and Boff Whalley, local theatre company Broccolily, the phenomenal Hull Samba and Lo:Cus Dance to name a few - but we need your help to make this happen. Your pledges for Our Street Our Stage will go towards costumes for dancers and St Nicholas Primary School pupils, rehearsal costs, props and more. 

We are passionate about breaking down the barriers some face when accessing art; this event will be completely free to attend (you don't even need to book a ticket), right on the doorstep of the local community and provide opportunity to be involved whatever your experience.

What will my donation pay for?
We are fundraising £2000 towards Our Street Our Stage.

  • £1000 of that will pay for costumes for dancers, street performers and 20 young cast members to recreate parts of the Whitsun Carnival and the Hull Pals.
  • £750 will pay for rehearsal costs so that the local community cast, choir and dancers will be able to rehearse in a large enough space.
  • £250 will pay for props such as 1960s vintage prams and wheelie bin’s to be upcycled into incredible portable speakers made by a local sound artist.

story:
OUR JOURNEY TO RECOVER AN ISLAND'S TRUE RICHNESS

About the Venue

There exist a countless number of unexplored but very attractive areas in Japan where human lives still coexist with nature. The Seto Inland Sea, where Teshima is located, is one such beautiful place in Japan which retains unique scenic beauties. The entire region, including the sea and the coastal areas around it, is often collectively called “Setouchi.” The sea water is calm, like that of a lake, and the scenic beauty, consisting of the sea dotted with thousands of islands, makes it one of Japan’s most beautiful places. The unique cultures and traditions that are nurtured by the region’s nature and its history of trade serve as significant attractions; these aspects are still deeply rooted in people’s everyday lives today.

There are some 700 smaller islands in the Seto Inland Sea, only 160 of which are inhabited. Even the inhabited islands have suffered depopulation, as well as aging populations; as such, it is not uncommon to have islands where residents have an average age above 70. Teshima is no exception; it is a small island with around only 800 inhabitants, challenged with depopulation and an aging population. As the name “Teshima” (literally, “rich island”) indicates, the island is blessed with spring water. Local residents have supported themselves by growing rice, dairy farming, fishing and growing vegetables. Dairy farming has enabled island residents to be self-sufficient and produce abundant food.  The original landscape of Japan has been preserved, along with traditional styles of living that have been lost in more urban areas.

Behind the Story

However, at the height of the rapid economic growth of Japan, when mass consumption became a virtue, a grave incident occurred; a huge amount of industrial waste was disposed illegally in Teshima. Old things were destroyed, new things were produced one after another, and the huge amount of waste caused from such consumption was illegally dumped on this otherwise beautiful, untouched island in Setouchi. The beautiful beach was filled with garbage from unauthorized dumping, which was buried in the sand or piled up in heaps and burnt, causing black smoke to rise here and there. The residents of Teshima continuously complained to the municipal authorities about the appalling, abnormal situation that had befallen the island, but the authorities did not recognize the problem for a long time.

The people of Teshima, with a strong desire to protect their island, at last filed for arbitration at the Kagawa prefecture. After a long legal battle, the issue was finally settled and the cleaning of the island started, which was completed on March 29, 2017. It took as long as 14 years for all of the industrial waste that had been dumped on the island to be removed. (937,000 tons in total) This incident is now considered to be a turning point for the nation, highlighting the need to transition from a mass consumption and mass waste style of life to a more recycling-oriented society.

As the new era was ushered in, the Benesse Art Project commenced in Teshima following a successful project at Naoshima, with the hope of supporting the suffering island residents and helping to recover pride in their island. With the opening of the internationally-renowned Teshima Museum in 2010, the island is now also rich in art. The concept of the Benesse Art Project is “coexistence of nature, art, and architecture”, and with this concept it aims to create works that suit the surrounding environment of the venue.

Thus it has served as a venue for projects related to food and art. Artwork has been created based on themes such as “art and a rich diet” and “recovering nature and humanity.” Due to its favorable location in which nature and art are united, along with its fascinating food culture, Teshima attracts visitors from both Japan and abroad as the second largest art island after Naoshima, the world-famous art island.

Our Project Summary

In this new era, Teshima is attracting many more domestic and international visitors as tourists. However, there are few places where foreign tourists can both learn from such a tragic past and experience the story of the island itself, and experience the beautiful nature the island is blessed with. Only limited services for tourists are available; even though an increasing number of foreign guests visit the island, there is virtually no place for them that enables communication with each other and no accommodation where they can spend their time on the island comfortably but with the experience of traditional Japanese living.

This leads us to the concept of branding Teshima by reusing what is available on the island to create what is now needed. We are starting a project with the aims of reviving pride in Teshima and increasing the value of Japan’s provincial towns, of opening the doors of the provincial towns of Japan directly to the world, and of making a first step forward towards a sustainable future.

In the villages on the island where untouched Japanese scenery still remains, there are many traditional Japanese houses. Half of them are not inhabited; some were abandoned a long time ago and have been neglected. We aim to provide accommodation to visitors who want to experience life on the island by making use of these unused houses.

We luckily found a small house whose owner kindly understands the value of our project. The house has been unoccupied more than a decade having a leaking roof, an unkempt garden and all livingware of the former owner.  We are renovating them to introduce modern comfort but carefully retaining the charms of traditional Japanese houses. We also include local products for interior or houseware to introduce with their stories to our guests.

 

The house which stand within the existing residential areas will let those who stay in them feel the daily life of local people close by. Quiet nights, the tweets of birds, and daily lives that start very early in the morning…there is a lot to see and learn from the lives of the local people, and it may remind visitors of what is really important in life. For those who want to experience the ever-changing seasons and relaxing moments, our accommodation will offer unique moments of ease and peace on an island where time seems to flow slowly.

Current progress:

The design is finalized and it is about to start the construction. We are planning to rent the entire house for one group with around 300 USD per night, four persons maximum.  

We named the accommodation "結 - YUI" which literally means "connection" in Japanese wishing for becoming a bridge between Teshima and the world.   

About us:

We are based in Kagawa prefecture in Japan. Our mission is to pave the way to Shikoku for travelers worldwide. www. via-tor.com

We will be happy to have your questions or comments, please e-mail to:

admin@via-tor.com

We appreciate and thank you from the bottom of our hearts for your support.
story_txt: OUR JOURNEY TO RECOVER AN ISLAND'S TRUE RICHNESSAbout the VenueThere exist a countless number of unexplored but very attractive areas in Japan where human lives still coexist with nature. The Seto Inland Sea, where Teshima is located, is one such beautiful place in Japan which retains unique scenic beauties. The entire region, including the sea and the coastal areas around it, is often collectively called “Setouchi.” The sea water is calm, like that of a lake, and the scenic beauty, consisting of the sea dotted with thousands of islands, makes it one of Japan’s most beautiful places. The unique cultures and traditions that are nurtured by the region’s nature and its history of trade serve as significant attractions; these aspects are still deeply rooted in people’s everyday lives today.There are some 700 smaller islands in the Seto Inland Sea, only 160 of which are inhabited. Even the inhabited islands have suffered depopulation, as well as aging populations; as such, it is not uncommon to have islands where residents have an average age above 70. Teshima is no exception; it is a small island with around only 800 inhabitants, challenged with depopulation and an aging population. As the name “Teshima” (literally, “rich island”) indicates, the island is blessed with spring water. Local residents have supported themselves by growing rice, dairy farming, fishing and growing vegetables. Dairy farming has enabled island residents to be self-sufficient and produce abundant food.  The original landscape of Japan has been preserved, along with traditional styles of living that have been lost in more urban areas.Behind the StoryHowever, at the height of the rapid economic growth of Japan, when mass consumption became a virtue, a grave incident occurred; a huge amount of industrial waste was disposed illegally in Teshima. Old things were destroyed, new things were produced one after another, and the huge amount of waste caused from such consumption was illegally dumped on this otherwise beautiful, untouched island in Setouchi. The beautiful beach was filled with garbage from unauthorized dumping, which was buried in the sand or piled up in heaps and burnt, causing black smoke to rise here and there. The residents of Teshima continuously complained to the municipal authorities about the appalling, abnormal situation that had befallen the island, but the authorities did not recognize the problem for a long time.The people of Teshima, with a strong desire to protect their island, at last filed for arbitration at the Kagawa prefecture. After a long legal battle, the issue was finally settled and the cleaning of the island started, which was completed on March 29, 2017. It took as long as 14 years for all of the industrial waste that had been dumped on the island to be removed. (937,000 tons in total) This incident is now considered to be a turning point for the nation, highlighting the need to transition from a mass consumption and mass waste style of life to a more recycling-oriented society.As the new era was ushered in, the Benesse Art Project commenced in Teshima following a successful project at Naoshima, with the hope of supporting the suffering island residents and helping to recover pride in their island. With the opening of the internationally-renowned Teshima Museum in 2010, the island is now also rich in art. The concept of the Benesse Art Project is “coexistence of nature, art, and architecture”, and with this concept it aims to create works that suit the surrounding environment of the venue.Thus it has served as a venue for projects related to food and art. Artwork has been created based on themes such as “art and a rich diet” and “recovering nature and humanity.” Due to its favorable location in which nature and art are united, along with its fascinating food culture, Teshima attracts visitors from both Japan and abroad as the second largest art island after Naoshima, the world-famous art island.Our Project SummaryIn this new era, Teshima is attracting many more domestic and international visitors as tourists. However, there are few places where foreign tourists can both learn from such a tragic past and experience the story of the island itself, and experience the beautiful nature the island is blessed with. Only limited services for tourists are available; even though an increasing number of foreign guests visit the island, there is virtually no place for them that enables communication with each other and no accommodation where they can spend their time on the island comfortably but with the experience of traditional Japanese living.This leads us to the concept of branding Teshima by reusing what is available on the island to create what is now needed. We are starting a project with the aims of reviving pride in Teshima and increasing the value of Japan’s provincial towns, of opening the doors of the provincial towns of Japan directly to the world, and of making a first step forward towards a sustainable future.In the villages on the island where untouched Japanese scenery still remains, there are many traditional Japanese houses. Half of them are not inhabited; some were abandoned a long time ago and have been neglected. We aim to provide accommodation to visitors who want to experience life on the island by making use of these unused houses.We luckily found a small house whose owner kindly understands the value of our project. The house has been unoccupied more than a decade having a leaking roof, an unkempt garden and all livingware of the former owner.  We are renovating them to introduce modern comfort but carefully retaining the charms of traditional Japanese houses. We also include local products for interior or houseware to introduce with their stories to our guests. The house which stand within the existing residential areas will let those who stay in them feel the daily life of local people close by. Quiet nights, the tweets of birds, and daily lives that start very early in the morning…there is a lot to see and learn from the lives of the local people, and it may remind visitors of what is really important in life. For those who want to experience the ever-changing seasons and relaxing moments, our accommodation will offer unique moments of ease and peace on an island where time seems to flow slowly.Current progress:The design is finalized and it is about to start the construction. We are planning to rent the entire house for one group with around 300 USD per night, four persons maximum.  We named the accommodation "結 - YUI" which literally means "connection" in Japanese wishing for becoming a bridge between Teshima and the world.   About us:We are based in Kagawa prefecture in Japan. Our mission is to pave the way to Shikoku for travelers worldwide. www. via-tor.comWe will be happy to have your questions or comments, please e-mail to:admin@via-tor.comWe appreciate and thank you from the bottom of our hearts for your support.

story:
It’s time to revitalize the Old 4th Ward Water Tower!

We at the National Trust for Historic Preservation, in collaboration with Heineken USA and ABV Agency and Gallery, are on a mission to revive the historic water tower in Sweet Auburn, a neighborhood reflective of Atlanta’s rich African American history and the birthplace of Martin Luther King, Jr. With your support, we’ll be one step closer to bringing this Sweet Auburn staple back to its heyday.

Today, Sweet Auburn is thriving as an epicenter for young artists and entrepreneurs. While their creativity is making an old neighborhood new again, Sweet Auburn’s historic landmarks—like the Old 4th Ward Water Tower—remain a testament to its storied past.

As the oldest surviving water tower in Atlanta, it was built as a state-of-the-art water suppression system for the cotton compress factory next door in 1906. The workers who lived across the street not only saw the water tower when they woke up in the morning, but would occasionally be tasked with scaling the tower’s ladder with buckets of water to fill the top—an adventure not for the faint of heart!

For decades, it stood at the ready until the factory closed its doors. Today, the land the tower stands on is known as Water Tower Park, but the tower itself has been tagged with graffiti over the years and has no functional use. The time has come to give this local landmark a little TLC.

Success! We're happy to report that our campaign raised $38,415! That's $23,415 above our original goal of $15,000!

Thanks to the generous support of our backers, the tower will be revived inside and out. Inside, rubble and garbage will be cleared for future revitalization projects, and so local artists can paint an interior mural depicting the story of Atlanta. On the outside, the structure will be power-washed, and new cast iron windows and a door will be installed.

Please stay tuned to the updates section of this page for additional project news.

I claimed tickets to the Bruno Mars: 24K Magic World Tour as my perk and have questions.

Thank you for supporting our project! You will find answers to your questions in our FAQ. If you have specific questions about how to redeem your tickets, please email fulfillment@lifeinmobile.com. Enjoy the show!

What is the National Trust for Historic Preservation?

The National Trust for Historic Preservation, a privately funded nonprofit organization, works to save America’s historic places. We are the cause that inspires Americans to save the places where history happened. The cause that connects us to our diverse pasts, weaving a multi-cultural nation together. The cause that transforms communities from places where we live into places that we love. As the leading voice for preservation, we are the cause for people saving places.

Our mission is to protect significant places representing our diverse cultural experience by taking direct action and inspiring broad public support.

Where is my donation going?

More than 90% of all funds raised will support the cities' projects and the National Trust’s ongoing work to save historic places in Atlanta and around the country. Up to 10% will cover Indiegogo costs and processing fees as described in Indiegogo’s Terms and Conditions.

When will I get my perk (non-ticket)?

Perks will be delivered later this summer (July/August).

Can I visit the project site?

Yes! You can go visit the Sweet Auburn Water Tower. However, you cannot go inside and right now it is not as decorated and beautified as it can be with your generous support!

When will the project be complete?

Saving places takes time! But with your generous support, we hope to get the Sweet Auburn Water Tower project completed as soon as possible.

How do I get support for my project? Or can I submit a project for consideration?

We at the National Trust are always interested in hearing about what is important to you. Although we may not be able to save it immediately, you can always contact your state’s historic preservation office and see how you can get started on the road to preservation!

Is the National Trust involved in other restoration projects?

Yes! We’re the country’s leading advocate for saving historic places. As such, we’re on the ground in communities across the nation. Visit our website to explore other historic places that we are trying to save like the Sweet Auburn Water Tower.

Media Inquiries

For further media inquiries about these projects, check out our Press Center.

My question wasn’t answered above. Who can I contact?

First, please see the full FAQ for the Cities Project.

If you have questions about the projects or how to claim perks other than tickets, please email cities@savingplaces.org.

If you have questions about how to redeem your tickets, please email  fulfillment@lifeinmobile.com.

If you have questions about the Cities Project, please email corporaterelations@heinekenusa.com.
