story:
Short Summary

My name is Natelegé Whaley. I'm a journalist, creative, and founder of Hearts Converse. Since founding HC in 2010, I have created safe spaces for young adults of color to discuss relationships, life, and culture through blogs, events, and video content.

In 2013, I began looking for a space to host an HC live discussion event. Either the space was too expensive for my budget or the owners weren't interested. I grew anxious and frustrated figuring out how to throw this event.

Then one day, an opportunity fell into my lap. 

In January 2014, a friend invited me to an art showcase event at a small venue space in Brooklyn formerly known as OG Studios. There I met the owner, who was interested in the vision for my event. After a few conversations, and pitching my proposal, he gave me the space to host my event for free.

In March 2014, I launched my first Kickback event! That evening, 30 young adults of color passionately shared and listened to each other's thoughts on the subjects that mattered most to them during the two-hour rap session.

Emotions ran high as we discussed everything from social justice to relationships. We ate, we drank, we healed, and built community. For many participants, this was a rare opportunity to connect on an intimate level with individuals who were just as open to sharing perspectives as they were listening to others share theirs.

My goal was to create a social event that wasn't your traditional "So what do you do?" networking! Just something more real. Here that happened.

And I continued. I hosted four more Kickbacks up until December 2015. Now I'm ready to bring it back!

 

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise $600. These funds will go towards renting a space to host my next TWO events in October 2017 and January 2018. Here is a photo of the room below.

Breather has been a phenomenal space to host #HCKickback events. From experience, I prefer these quiet rooms rather than bars/lounges where the environment can be noisy. Breathers provide a quieter space to focus on the discussion, and privacy to maintain a space safe for participants so that they are not disrupted by outsiders during the discussion.

What You Get

Perks available: 

  • Thank You Cards
  • Free Entry to event (Still must RSVP) 
  • Sponsorship Opportunities for Brands

NOTE: Even if I don't reach my entire goal, the funds will go to cover the venue costs.

 

The Impact

By contributing to this venue fund, you will continue to help provide a safe space for people of color to discuss what matters to them. For many young adults, the weight of racism and other -isms weigh on their emotional and physical health everyday. With this space, I am able to provide my peers an outlet to discuss these issues. Here they are seen. Here they are heard. Here they get to BE.

THE CHALLENGES

Between March 2014 and December 2015, I hosted four more sold-out events. But the cost was heavy. I came out of my pocket and acquired a bit of debt. Even when I asked my participants to pay, it was enough to break even but not enough to make profit. My goal was and still is to keep the event as financially accessible as possible. And I'm asking for my community's monetary support to kickstart this event again.

What people have been saying about the event over the years:

 

Preview for the Next Event

The Kickback No. 6 Theme: "CAN I LIVE?!"

The conversation for the forthcoming event will invite participants to discuss how they drown out a noisy society to affirm and BE themselves. We will answer the following questions:

  • How do you get to know yourself when you are being marginalized?
  • How do you go about knowing yourself in an age of digital facades?
  • When are you most free?
     

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please share this campaign with friends on your social media. Any little bit helps. Use the Indiegogo sharing tools below!

story:
***[English version below]***

***(Deutsche Version unten)***

 

Ko su čuvari kulture?

Čuvari kulture su grupa mladih iz Bosne i Hercegovine okupljenih oko zajedničke misije da zaštite tradicionalne zanate, rukotvorine, kao i drugo kulturno-istorijsko blago BiH, Hrvatske, Srbije, Slovenije, Makedonije i Crne Gore. 

Glavni cilj kampanje je da se olakša plasman rukotvorina malih proizvođača što bi povećalo prihode njihovih domaćinstava i omogućilo im da se nastave baviti proizvodnjom tradicionalnih rukotvorina. To bi spriječilo nestajanje ovih zanata i omogućilo da nove generacije preuzmu izradu tradicionalnih rukotvorina od svojih predaka. Drugi cilj kampanje je da omogućimo dostupnost ovih proizvoda svima bez obzira gdje se nalazili. 

Mali proizvođači nemaju mogućnost plasmana svojih proizvoda izvan lokalne zajednice zbog velikih transportnih troškova, što daleko smanjuje njihovo tržište. Naš cilj je da prikupimo ove proizvode, plasiramo ih u turističkim centrima i izvezemo ih na inostrana tržišta. Podržavanjem naše kampanje podržavate našu misiju zaštite kulturno-istorijskog nasljeđa, zapošljavate male proizvođače i povećavate njihove prihode od tradicionalnih rukotvorina.

Koliko imamo do cilja?

Nama je potrebno 6.050 $ (~4.900 €) da obezbijedimo početni kapital da bi stvorili ponudu rukotvorina na jednom mjestu u BiH. Nakon što imamo ponudu, možemo da registrujemo izvoznu djelatnost koja bi nam omogućila da vršimo distribuciju i izvoz tih proizvoda na inostrana tržišta. Mali proizvođači bi imali sigurno tržište što bi njima obezbijedilo stabilne prihode, a nama omogućilo formiranje ponude tradicionalnih rukotvorina za domaće i internacionalno tržište. Ekonomska održivost proizvođača tradicionalnih rukotvorina bi na ovaj način doprinijela trajnoj zaštiti kulturno-istorijskog nasljeđa što je naša osnovna misija!

Kako nas podržati?

Podržati nas možete donacijom za bilo koji od poklona (kliknete na perk koji želite), a koji se nalaze sa desne strane ili prostim doniranjem (kliknete na back it). Za ovo vam je potrebna bankovna kartica, a ukoliko to prvi put radite pogledajte video: LINK. Ukoliko nemate odgovarajuću bankovnu karticu našu kampanju možete podržati uplatom na račun. Svi koji uplate na račun, zaštićen iznos pod njihovim imenom će biti prenesen na kampanju. Informacije za uplatu iz BiH i inostranstva imate na: https://cuvari.org/instrukcije-za-placanje/.

Pokloni

Doniranjem za poklon od 5$ dobijate 3 digitalne fotografije visoke rezolucije kulturno-istorijskih spomenika Bosne i Hercegovine, koje možete izraditi u fotografiju, poster ili plakat da ukrašava Vaš dom. Ovo je poklon u elektronskoj formi i za njega se ne plaća poštarina.

Doniranjem za sve ostale poklone, pored naše kampanje, podstičete i umjetnike koji su ih izradili. Troškovi poštarine zavise od vaše lokacije, ako želite donirati za određeni poklon i preuzeti poklon lično, onda je dovoljno da odete na donate i unesete tačan iznos tog poklona (onda vam poklon neće biti poslan poštom, nego vas čeka u Banjoj Luci od kraja aprila).

Svi pokloni su u potpunosti ili većim dijelom ručno rađeni, a fotografije perkova (poklona) su orijentacione i mogu biti sa manjim izmjenama. Npr. Ukoliko želite da na šoljicama za čaj budu oslikani Stari most ili Sebilj, a da na tanjiriću piše Mostar/Sarajevo 2018 ili želite da šoljica bude bijela to uopšte nije problem i to ulazi u cijenu poklona. Ali ako želite da umjesto šoljica to bude oslikano na fildžanima, i to nije problem, ali cijena će u slučaju izmjene predmeta na kojem se oslikava biti uvećana zbog veće nabavne cijene fildžana. 

Pojedinačne poklone vam šaljemo odmah nakon završetka kampanje (poslednje sedmice aprila i prve sedmice maja), a poklon pakete za firme i ugostiteljske objekte (zbog većeg broja komada) šaljemo u toku maja (dok se ovi pokloni izrade). 

Uz svaki poklon dobijate i kratku priču o tome šta ste kupili, kako su nastale te tradicionalne rukotvorine ili fotografije kulturno-istorijskih spomenika, po čemu su pokloni jedinstveni i ko je izradio koji poklon (ukratko o autoru). 

Kada nam donirate i dobijete određeni poklon zauzvrat, možete nam napisati u komentarima gdje putuje naš poklon, a mi ćemo vam reći tačnu lokaciju (sela ili grada) iz kojeg putuje taj poklon i minimalan broj kilometara (vazdušnom linijom) koje će poklon da pređe na tom putu!

Svaki donator će bez obzira na donirani iznos biti evidentiran na posebnom dijelu sajta https://www.cuvari.org/ sa imenima svih koji su pomogli registrovanje izvozne djelatnosti u socijalnom preduzeću, sa izuzetkom onih koji žele da ostanu anonimni (donirali anonimno). Ukoliko naša inicijativa prikupi malo više sredstava od očekivanih, onda ćemo višak sredstava investirati u obuku mladih ljudi da se počnu baviti proizvodnjom tradicionalnih rukotvorina, odnosno daljoj zaštiti kulturno-istorijskog nasljeđa prostora zapadnog Balkana. Ako naša inicijativa skupi puno više sredstava od očekivanih, onda ćemo formirati i distributivne centre u Hrvatskoj i Srbiji, a u budućnosti isti plan imamo i za Sloveniju, Makedoniju i Crnu Goru.

Naš uticaj

Vi i mi zajedno činimo da se zaštite kulturno-istorijski spomenici na području Bosne i Hercegovine i bivše Jugoslavije, a prije svega kultura koja je u nekim slučajevima opstala samo kod pojedinaca u malim udaljenim naseljima. Svi trebamo pomoći ovim pojedincima, jer njihovi proizvodi su dugotrajni (na pojedine imate garanciju od 100 godina), proizvedeni sa ljubavlju i nose dio njihovih autora, a služe da njihove porodice obezbijede u nekim slučajevima samo najosnovniju egzistenciju. 

Živimo u modernom, potrošačkom društvu i jako često zaboravljamo ljude koji stoje iza svakog proizvoda. Zbog toga sve češće kupujemo industrijski proizvedene predmete, koje je uglavnom sastavio robot, nego što kupujemo rukotvorine koje nose u sebi dio njihovih autora. Kupovinom industrijski proizvedenih ili još gore proizvoda koje su proizvela djeca u nehumanim uslovima dalekih zemalja podržavate kapitalistički i robovlasnički sistem, a da toga nerijetko niste ni svjesni! Pružanjem podrške našoj kampanji, podržavate i male proizvođače i obezbijeđujete njihovim porodicama zadovoljavanje osnovnih potreba od svog rada!

Ako niste u prilici da nam donirate, možete nam pomoći i tako što ćete proširiti priču o nama, dijeljenjem ove kampanje na vašoj Facebook stranici, Instagramu, slanjem e-maila prijateljima ili širenjem putem bilo koje druge društvene mreže ili medija. 

Sve dodatne informacije o našoj kampanji možete dobiti putem web sajta: https://www.cuvari.org/ Na ovom sajtu se mogu registrovati i zainteresovani mali proizvođači rukotvorina sa kojima još nismo ostvarili saradnju. 

Kontakt

Za sve dodatne informacije nas možete kontaktirati u komentarima, putem e-maila: info@cuvari.org ili telefona +38765575985 ili +38765950819.

 

Who are the Guardians of Culture?

The Guardians of Culture is a group of young people from Bosnia and Herzegovina gathered around a mission that includes protecting the traditional crafts, handicrafts, as well as the historical treasures of Bosnia and Herzegovina, Croatia, Serbia, Slovenia, Macedonia, and Montenegro.

The main goal of the campaign is to make handcrafted items easily available which would increase the earnings of the manufacturers. This means that they would also have enough money to continue making traditional handcrafted items. Additionally, this would preserve the handicrafts, and younger generations would see it as something that is worth pursuing. The second goal of the campaign is to make these products available to everyone, regardless of their location.

Small manufacturers are usually not able to sell their products outside of their communities due to large costs of transport. We want to gather up their merchandise, present it in the tourist centers, and export to other markets. If you decide to support our campaign, you are also supporting our mission of protecting the historical treasures, as well as helping the small manufacturers get more work, and increase their earnings. 

The goal

We need $6.050 (or €4.900) to secure the initial funds in order to create the selection of handcrafted items in a single place in BiH. We need orders to register the trading company that would enable us to distribute the products to the international markets. Small manufacturers would have a larger market that would secure the income for them. We would be able to put together a selection of traditional handcrafts for both domestic and international markets. This means stable earnings for the manufacturers of the traditional handicrafts that would lead to protecting the cultural and historical heritage which is our mission!

How to support us?

You can support us by selecting any of the perks which are located on the right side of this page, or by simply backing up our campaign. You will need a credit card for this. If this is your first time using the website, you can watch a video tutorial HERE. For those of you without a credit card, you can also support our campaign by sending money to our bank account. Every bank account donation will be transferred to the campaign with the donor’s name next to it. If you want to send the money from Bosnia and Herzegovina and abroad, click https://cuvari.org/instrukcije-za-placanje/ to learn how to support us.

Perks

Signing up for a $5 perk means that you will receive 3 high-resolution digital photographs of well-known cultural and historic sights of Bosnia and Herzegovina. You can turn them into a photo or a poster that will serve as a home decoration. This is a digital perk which means you will not pay any postage for it.

If you select any other perk from our list, you will support both our campaign and the people who made them. The postage will depend on your location. If you don’t want to pay the postage, you can personally pick up the gift in Banja Luka at the end of April. Simply click on Donate and type in the exact amount of the gift.

All of the perks are completely or partially handcrafted. The images of the perks serve as an example, and there could be a couple of minor changes. For instance, if you want your teacups to have an image of the Old Bridge or Sebilj, but you want the saucer to say Mostar/Sarajevo 2018, it can be arranged. But if you want to switch from a teacup to a small coffee cup (fildžan), keep in mind that a price might be higher because small coffee cups are more expensive to get.

The perks will be sent as soon as the campaign ends (the last week of April and the first week of May). Due to the larger orders, the perks for companies and restaurants will be sent throughout May.

Each perk will arrive with a short background story that describes exactly what you bought, as well as the process of manufacturing the particular traditional handicraft. The same goes for the digital photographs of historical sites in Bosnia and Herzegovina. You will find out what makes your perk unique, and learn about the person who made it.

Once you donate and receive a particular perk in return, you can contact us via comments and tell us your location. We will tell you exactly from where your perk will be shipped and the number of kilometers it will travel (by air) to get to you!

Every supporter’s name regardless of the amount they wish to donate will be displayed on https://www.cuvari.org/ with everyone else who helped us register the trading company with the exception of the donors who want to be anonymous. If our campaign slightly surpasses the goal, we will use that amount to invest in teaching young people how to make traditional handicrafts in order to preserve the traditions of the western Balkans. If we go way beyond the initial goal, we will form distribution centers in Croatia and Serbia, with plans of doing the same in Slovenia, Macedonia, and Montenegro.

Our influence

Together we protect the cultural and historical monuments of Bosnia and Herzegovina, as well as the ex-Yugoslavia. But most of all we want to preserve cultures of small and remote places. All of us should help these individuals because their products are long-lasting (some of them have a 100 years guarantee), they are made with love and come with a great backstory. In some instances, the handicrafts are the only means of supporting the manufacturers’ families.

We live in a modern society that often forgets the people who make the products. Buying mass produced items which were put together by a machine is a part of our everyday lives, and we rarely pay attention to the handicrafts created with a lot of love. Purchasing products from an assembly line or items made by children in third world countries usually mean that you are also supporting the capitalist system without even realizing it. If you decide to back up our campaign, you will support independent manufacturers and provide their families with extra income from their hard work!

If you are unable to donate, you can help us spread the word by sharing this campaign on your Facebook or Instagram profile (and any other social media platform), as well as by sending the link via e-mail to your friends and family.

You can find additional information about the campaign on our website: https://www.cuvari.org/

If you are an independent manufacturer who wants to collaborate with us, you can register on the website and get in touch.

Contact

For any additional information, leave us a comment here or send an email to info@cuvari.org 
You can also contact us at the following phone numbers: +38765575985 or +38765950819

 

Wer sind die Kulturpfleger?

Die Kulturpfleger sind eine Gruppe junger Menschen aus Bosnien und Herzegowina, die eine gemeinsame Mission haben - das traditionelle Handwerk, Kunsthandwerk sowie andere kulturelle und historische Güter von Bosnien und Herzegowina, Kroatien, Serbien, Slowenien, Mazedonien und Montenegro zu schützen.

Das Hauptziel der Kampagne ist es, den Kleinproduzenten von Kunsthandwerk, die Platzierung ihrer Produkte zu erleichtern, denn dadurch würden sie ihr Einkommen erhöhen und die Produktion des traditionellen Kunsthandwerks wäre nicht gefährdet. Dies würde das Verschwindendieser Handwerke verhindernund den neuen Generationen ermöglichen, das traditionelle Handwerkskunst von ihren Vorfahren zu übernehmen. Das zweite Ziel der Kampagne besteht darin, die Verfügbarkeit dieser Produkte für alle unabhängig von ihrem Standort zu ermöglichen.

Was den Markt stark einschränkt, ist die Tatsache, dass die Kleinproduzenten aufgrund hoher Transportkosten keine Möglichkeit haben, ihre Produkte außerhalb der lokalen Gemeinschaft zu platzieren. Unser Ziel ist es, diese Produkte zu sammeln, sie in touristischen Zentren zu platzieren und sie in ausländische Märkte zu exportieren. Indem Sie unsere Kampagne unterstützen, unterstützen Sie unsere Mission, das kulturelle und historische Erbe zu schützen, Kleinproduzenten zu beschäftigen und ihr Einkommen aus traditionellem Handwerk zu erhöhen.

Wie weit sind wir von unserem Ziel entfernt?

Wir benötigen 6.050 US-Dollar (~4.900 €), um Startkapital für die Schaffung einer Reihe von Kunsthandwerk an einem Ort in Bosnien und Herzegowina bereitzustellen. Sobald wir ein Angebot haben, können wir ein Exportgeschäft registrieren, das es uns ermöglicht, diese Produkte auf ausländische Märkte zu verteilen und zu exportieren.
KleinproduzentenhätteneinensicherenMarkt, der ihnen stabile Einnahmenbringenwürde, und wirkönnten das Angebot von traditionellemHandwerkfür den nationalen und internationalenMarktbilden. Die wirtschaftlicheNachhaltigkeit der traditionellenHandwerksbetriebewürde auf diese Weise zumdauerhaftenSchutz des kulturellen und historischenErbesbeitragen, was unsereGrundaufgabeist!

Wie kann man uns unterstützen?

Sie können uns unterstützen, indem Sie für eines der Geschenke spenden (klicken Sie auf den gewünschten Vorteil), die auf der rechten Seite stehen oder eine kostenlose Spende (klicken Sie auf zurück). Dies erfordert eine Bankkarte, und wenn Sie zum ersten Mal suchen, schauen Sie sich das Video an: LINK. Wenn Sie nicht über die entsprechende Bankkarte verfügen, können Sie unsere Kampagne mit Zahlung auf Ihr Konto unterstützen. Jeder, der eine Rechnung bezahlt, einen geschützten Betrag unter seinem Namen, wird in die Kampagne übertragen. Die Informationen zur Zahlung aus Bosnien und Herzegowina finden sie unter: https://cuvari.org/instrukcije-za-placanje/, Informationen zur Zahlung aus einem anderen Land unter: https://cuvari.org/instrukcije-za-placanje/.

Geschenke

Wenn Sie für ein Geschenk von 5 $ spenden, erhalten Sie 3 digitale Fotografien von hochauflösenden kulturellen und historischen Denkmälern von Bosnien und Herzegowina, die Sie auf einem Foto oder Poster erstellen können, um Ihr Zuhause zu dekorieren. Dies ist ein Geschenk in elektronischer Form und es werden keine Versandkosten verrechnet.

Indem Sie für alle anderen Geschenke spenden, ermutigen Sie neben unserer Kampagne, auch die Künstler, die sie erstellt haben. Die Versandkosten hängen von Ihrem Standort ab, wenn Sie für ein bestimmtes Geschenk spenden und ein Geschenk persönlich mitnehmen möchten, genügt es, auf spenden zu drücken und den genauen Betrag einzugeben (dann wird das Geschenk nicht per Post verschickt, sondern Sie nehmen es persönlich Ende April in Banja Luka).

Alle Geschenke sind komplett oder größtenteils von Hand gemacht und Fotos von Geschenken können mit geringfügigen Änderungen sein. Zum Beispiel,wenn Sie die Alte Brücke oder Sebilj auf den Teetassen gemalt haben möchten oderwenn auf der Untertasse Mostar / Sarajevo 2018 stehen sollte, oder wenn Sie wollen, dass die Tasse weiß ist, macht man das gerne für Sie und das ist schon alles im Preis inkludiert. Aber wenn sie den Wunsch haben, dass man statt auf Tassen, auf Fildzan malt, geht das auch in Ordnung, aber der Preis wird aufgrund des höheren Kaufpreises des Fildzans etwas höher sein.

Die individuelle Geschenke werden direkt nach der Beendigung der Kampagne (die letzte Aprilwoche und die erste Maiwoche) und die Pakete für Unternehmen und Catering-Einrichtungen (wegen der Stückzahl) im Mai versendet (bis diese Geschenke angefertigtsind).

Mit jedem Geschenk erhalten Sie auch eine kurze Geschichte darüber, was Sie gekauft haben, wie diese traditionellen Handarbeiten oder Fotos von kulturellen und historischen Denkmälern entstanden sind, wieso die Geschenke einzigartig sind und wer welches Geschenk erstellt hat (kurz über den Autor).

Wenn sie uns mit ihrer Spende unterstützen und ein bestimmtes Geschenk erhalten, können Sie uns in den Kommentaren schreiben, wo unser Geschenk gelandet ist, und wir werden Ihnen den genauen Ort (Dorf oder Stadt), die Geschenkherstellung und die Mindestanzahl der zurückgelegten Kilometer (Fluglinie) auf diesem Weg offenbaren!

Jeder Spender, unabhängig von der Spendensumme, wird auf einemseparatenTeil der Website https://www.cuvari.org/ mit den NamenallerPersonenregistriert, die dazubeigetragenhaben, die ExportaktivitätimSozialunternehmenzuregistrieren, mitAusnahmederjenigen, die anonym bleibenmöchten (anonym gespendet). Wennunsere Initiative etwasmehrMittelalserwarteteinnimmt, werdenwirden Geldüberhang in die Ausbildungjunger Menschen investieren, um sichmit der Produktion von traditionellemKunsthandwerkzubefassen, oder um das kulturelle und historischeErbe des westlichen Balkans weiterzuschützen. Wennunsere Initiative vielmehrGeld alserwartetsammelt, werdenwirVertriebszentren in Kroatien und Serbieneinrichten und in Zukunfthabenwir den gleichen Plan für Slowenien, Mazedonien und Montenegro.

Unser Einfluss

Sie und wirschützengemeinsam die kulturhistorischenDenkmäler auf demTerritorium von Bosnien und Herzegowina und demehemaligenJugoslawien, und vorallem die Kultur, die in einigenFällennur in kleinenabgelegenenOrtschaftenüberlebt hat. Wirallemüssendiesen Menschen helfen, dennihreProduktesindlanglebig (Siehabeneine 100-jährige Garantie), mitLiebeproduziert und manchmal verschaffen den Autoren und deren Familien die Existenz.

Wir leben in einer modernen Konsumgesellschaft und vergessen oft die Menschen, die hinter einem Produkt stehen. Leider kauft man viel mehr Industriegüter, die oft von einem Roboter zusammengesetzt werden, als Handarbeiten. Durch den Kauf von industriell produzierten oder noch schlimmer, die von Kindern unter unmenschlichen Bedingungen in fernen Ländern hergestellten Produkten,unterstützen Sie das kapitalistische und sklavische System, und dieser Tatsache sind Sie sich oft nicht bewusst! Mit der Unterstützung unserer Kampagne unterstützen Sie auch Kleinproduzenten und somit können sie ihre Familien versorgen!

Wenn Sie nicht in der Lage sind, zu spenden, können Sie uns helfen, indem Sie die Geschichte über uns verbreiten, indem Sie diese Kampagne auf Ihrer Facebook-Seite und auf Instagram teilen, Freunden e-mailen oder über andere soziale Netzwerke oder Medien verbreiten.
Alle zusätzlichen Informationen über unsere Kampagne können über die Website abgerufen werden: https://www.cuvari.org/ 
Kleinproduzenten von Kunsthandwerk, mit denen wir noch nicht zusammengearbeitet haben, können sich auf dieser Seite registrieren.

Kontakt

Für weitere Informationen kontaktieren Sie uns bitte per E-Mail: info@cuvari.org oder telefonisch unter +38765575985 oder +38765950819.
story_txt: ***[English version below]******(Deutsche Version unten)*** Ko su čuvari kulture?Čuvari kulture su grupa mladih iz Bosne i Hercegovine okupljenih oko zajedničke misije da zaštite tradicionalne zanate, rukotvorine, kao i drugo kulturno-istorijsko blago BiH, Hrvatske, Srbije, Slovenije, Makedonije i Crne Gore. Glavni cilj kampanje je da se olakša plasman rukotvorina malih proizvođača što bi povećalo prihode njihovih domaćinstava i omogućilo im da se nastave baviti proizvodnjom tradicionalnih rukotvorina. To bi spriječilo nestajanje ovih zanata i omogućilo da nove generacije preuzmu izradu tradicionalnih rukotvorina od svojih predaka. Drugi cilj kampanje je da omogućimo dostupnost ovih proizvoda svima bez obzira gdje se nalazili. Mali proizvođači nemaju mogućnost plasmana svojih proizvoda izvan lokalne zajednice zbog velikih transportnih troškova, što daleko smanjuje njihovo tržište. Naš cilj je da prikupimo ove proizvode, plasiramo ih u turističkim centrima i izvezemo ih na inostrana tržišta. Podržavanjem naše kampanje podržavate našu misiju zaštite kulturno-istorijskog nasljeđa, zapošljavate male proizvođače i povećavate njihove prihode od tradicionalnih rukotvorina.Koliko imamo do cilja?Nama je potrebno 6.050 $ (~4.900 €) da obezbijedimo početni kapital da bi stvorili ponudu rukotvorina na jednom mjestu u BiH. Nakon što imamo ponudu, možemo da registrujemo izvoznu djelatnost koja bi nam omogućila da vršimo distribuciju i izvoz tih proizvoda na inostrana tržišta. Mali proizvođači bi imali sigurno tržište što bi njima obezbijedilo stabilne prihode, a nama omogućilo formiranje ponude tradicionalnih rukotvorina za domaće i internacionalno tržište. Ekonomska održivost proizvođača tradicionalnih rukotvorina bi na ovaj način doprinijela trajnoj zaštiti kulturno-istorijskog nasljeđa što je naša osnovna misija!Kako nas podržati?Podržati nas možete donacijom za bilo koji od poklona (kliknete na perk koji želite), a koji se nalaze sa desne strane ili prostim doniranjem (kliknete na back it). Za ovo vam je potrebna bankovna kartica, a ukoliko to prvi put radite pogledajte video: LINK. Ukoliko nemate odgovarajuću bankovnu karticu našu kampanju možete podržati uplatom na račun. Svi koji uplate na račun, zaštićen iznos pod njihovim imenom će biti prenesen na kampanju. Informacije za uplatu iz BiH i inostranstva imate na: https://cuvari.org/instrukcije-za-placanje/.PokloniDoniranjem za poklon od 5$ dobijate 3 digitalne fotografije visoke rezolucije kulturno-istorijskih spomenika Bosne i Hercegovine, koje možete izraditi u fotografiju, poster ili plakat da ukrašava Vaš dom. Ovo je poklon u elektronskoj formi i za njega se ne plaća poštarina.Doniranjem za sve ostale poklone, pored naše kampanje, podstičete i umjetnike koji su ih izradili. Troškovi poštarine zavise od vaše lokacije, ako želite donirati za određeni poklon i preuzeti poklon lično, onda je dovoljno da odete na donate i unesete tačan iznos tog poklona (onda vam poklon neće biti poslan poštom, nego vas čeka u Banjoj Luci od kraja aprila).Svi pokloni su u potpunosti ili većim dijelom ručno rađeni, a fotografije perkova (poklona) su orijentacione i mogu biti sa manjim izmjenama. Npr. Ukoliko želite da na šoljicama za čaj budu oslikani Stari most ili Sebilj, a da na tanjiriću piše Mostar/Sarajevo 2018 ili želite da šoljica bude bijela to uopšte nije problem i to ulazi u cijenu poklona. Ali ako želite da umjesto šoljica to bude oslikano na fildžanima, i to nije problem, ali cijena će u slučaju izmjene predmeta na kojem se oslikava biti uvećana zbog veće nabavne cijene fildžana. Pojedinačne poklone vam šaljemo odmah nakon završetka kampanje (poslednje sedmice aprila i prve sedmice maja), a poklon pakete za firme i ugostiteljske objekte (zbog većeg broja komada) šaljemo u toku maja (dok se ovi pokloni izrade). Uz svaki poklon dobijate i kratku priču o tome šta ste kupili, kako su nastale te tradicionalne rukotvorine ili fotografije kulturno-istorijskih spomenika, po čemu su pokloni jedinstveni i ko je izradio koji poklon (ukratko o autoru). Kada nam donirate i dobijete određeni poklon zauzvrat, možete nam napisati u komentarima gdje putuje naš poklon, a mi ćemo vam reći tačnu lokaciju (sela ili grada) iz kojeg putuje taj poklon i minimalan broj kilometara (vazdušnom linijom) koje će poklon da pređe na tom putu!Svaki donator će bez obzira na donirani iznos biti evidentiran na posebnom dijelu sajta https://www.cuvari.org/ sa imenima svih koji su pomogli registrovanje izvozne djelatnosti u socijalnom preduzeću, sa izuzetkom onih koji žele da ostanu anonimni (donirali anonimno). Ako naša inicijativa skupi puno više sredstava od očekivanih, onda ćemo formirati i distributivne centre u Hrvatskoj i Srbiji, a u budućnosti isti plan imamo i za Sloveniju, Makedoniju i Crnu Goru.Naš uticajVi i mi zajedno činimo da se zaštite kulturno-istorijski spomenici na području Bosne i Hercegovine i bivše Jugoslavije, a prije svega kultura koja je u nekim slučajevima opstala samo kod pojedinaca u malim udaljenim naseljima. Additionally, this would preserve the handicrafts, and younger generations would see it as something that is worth pursuing. The second goal of the campaign is to make these products available to everyone, regardless of their location.Small manufacturers are usually not able to sell their products outside of their communities due to large costs of transport. We want to gather up their merchandise, present it in the tourist centers, and export to other markets. If you decide to support our campaign, you are also supporting our mission of protecting the historical treasures, as well as helping the small manufacturers get more work, and increase their earnings. The goalWe need $6.050 (or €4.900) to secure the initial funds in order to create the selection of handcrafted items in a single place in BiH. We need orders to register the trading company that would enable us to distribute the products to the international markets. Small manufacturers would have a larger market that would secure the income for them. We would be able to put together a selection of traditional handcrafts for both domestic and international markets. This means stable earnings for the manufacturers of the traditional handicrafts that would lead to protecting the cultural and historical heritage which is our mission!How to support us?You can support us by selecting any of the perks which are located on the right side of this page, or by simply backing up our campaign. You will need a credit card for this. If this is your first time using the website, you can watch a video tutorial HERE. For those of you without a credit card, you can also support our campaign by sending money to our bank account. Every bank account donation will be transferred to the campaign with the donor’s name next to it. If you want to send the money from Bosnia and Herzegovina and abroad, click https://cuvari.org/instrukcije-za-placanje/ to learn how to support us.PerksSigning up for a $5 perk means that you will receive 3 high-resolution digital photographs of well-known cultural and historic sights of Bosnia and Herzegovina. You can turn them into a photo or a poster that will serve as a home decoration. This is a digital perk which means you will not pay any postage for it.If you select any other perk from our list, you will support both our campaign and the people who made them. The postage will depend on your location. If you don’t want to pay the postage, you can personally pick up the gift in Banja Luka at the end of April. Simply click on Donate and type in the exact amount of the gift.All of the perks are completely or partially handcrafted. The images of the perks serve as an example, and there could be a couple of minor changes. For instance, if you want your teacups to have an image of the Old Bridge or Sebilj, but you want the saucer to say Mostar/Sarajevo 2018, it can be arranged. But if you want to switch from a teacup to a small coffee cup (fildžan), keep in mind that a price might be higher because small coffee cups are more expensive to get.The perks will be sent as soon as the campaign ends (the last week of April and the first week of May). Due to the larger orders, the perks for companies and restaurants will be sent throughout May.Each perk will arrive with a short background story that describes exactly what you bought, as well as the process of manufacturing the particular traditional handicraft. The same goes for the digital photographs of historical sites in Bosnia and Herzegovina. You will find out what makes your perk unique, and learn about the person who made it.Once you donate and receive a particular perk in return, you can contact us via comments and tell us your location. We will tell you exactly from where your perk will be shipped and the number of kilometers it will travel (by air) to get to you!Every supporter’s name regardless of the amount they wish to donate will be displayed on https://www.cuvari.org/ with everyone else who helped us register the trading company with the exception of the donors who want to be anonymous. If our campaign slightly surpasses the goal, we will use that amount to invest in teaching young people how to make traditional handicrafts in order to preserve the traditions of the western Balkans. If we go way beyond the initial goal, we will form distribution centers in Croatia and Serbia, with plans of doing the same in Slovenia, Macedonia, and Montenegro.Our influenceTogether we protect the cultural and historical monuments of Bosnia and Herzegovina, as well as the ex-Yugoslavia. But most of all we want to preserve cultures of small and remote places. All of us should help these individuals because their products are long-lasting (some of them have a 100 years guarantee), they are made with love and come with a great backstory. In some instances, the handicrafts are the only means of supporting the manufacturers’ families.We live in a modern society that often forgets the people who make the products. Buying mass produced items which were put together by a machine is a part of our everyday lives, and we rarely pay attention to the handicrafts created with a lot of love. Purchasing products from an assembly line or items made by children in third world countries usually mean that you are also supporting the capitalist system without even realizing it. If you decide to back up our campaign, you will support independent manufacturers and provide their families with extra income from their hard work!If you are unable to donate, you can help us spread the word by sharing this campaign on your Facebook or Instagram profile (and any other social media platform), as well as by sending the link via e-mail to your friends and family.You can find additional information about the campaign on our website: https://www.cuvari.org/If you are an independent manufacturer who wants to collaborate with us, you can register on the website and get in touch.ContactFor any additional information, leave us a comment here or send an email to info@cuvari.org You can also contact us at the following phone numbers: +38765575985 or +38765950819 Wer sind die Kulturpfleger?Die Kulturpfleger sind eine Gruppe junger Menschen aus Bosnien und Herzegowina, die eine gemeinsame Mission haben - das traditionelle Handwerk, Kunsthandwerk sowie andere kulturelle und historische Güter von Bosnien und Herzegowina, Kroatien, Serbien, Slowenien, Mazedonien und Montenegro zu schützen.Das Hauptziel der Kampagne ist es, den Kleinproduzenten von Kunsthandwerk, die Platzierung ihrer Produkte zu erleichtern, denn dadurch würden sie ihr Einkommen erhöhen und die Produktion des traditionellen Kunsthandwerks wäre nicht gefährdet. Dies würde das Verschwindendieser Handwerke verhindernund den neuen Generationen ermöglichen, das traditionelle Handwerkskunst von ihren Vorfahren zu übernehmen. Das zweite Ziel der Kampagne besteht darin, die Verfügbarkeit dieser Produkte für alle unabhängig von ihrem Standort zu ermöglichen.Was den Markt stark einschränkt, ist die Tatsache, dass die Kleinproduzenten aufgrund hoher Transportkosten keine Möglichkeit haben, ihre Produkte außerhalb der lokalen Gemeinschaft zu platzieren. Unser Ziel ist es, diese Produkte zu sammeln, sie in touristischen Zentren zu platzieren und sie in ausländische Märkte zu exportieren. Indem Sie unsere Kampagne unterstützen, unterstützen Sie unsere Mission, das kulturelle und historische Erbe zu schützen, Kleinproduzenten zu beschäftigen und ihr Einkommen aus traditionellem Handwerk zu erhöhen.Wie weit sind wir von unserem Ziel entfernt?Wir benötigen 6.050 US-Dollar (~4.900 €), um Startkapital für die Schaffung einer Reihe von Kunsthandwerk an einem Ort in Bosnien und Herzegowina bereitzustellen. Sobald wir ein Angebot haben, können wir ein Exportgeschäft registrieren, das es uns ermöglicht, diese Produkte auf ausländische Märkte zu verteilen und zu exportieren.KleinproduzentenhätteneinensicherenMarkt, der ihnen stabile Einnahmenbringenwürde, und wirkönnten das Angebot von traditionellemHandwerkfür den nationalen und internationalenMarktbilden. Die wirtschaftlicheNachhaltigkeit der traditionellenHandwerksbetriebewürde auf diese Weise zumdauerhaftenSchutz des kulturellen und historischenErbesbeitragen, was unsereGrundaufgabeist!Wie kann man uns unterstützen?Sie können uns unterstützen, indem Sie für eines der Geschenke spenden (klicken Sie auf den gewünschten Vorteil), die auf der rechten Seite stehen oder eine kostenlose Spende (klicken Sie auf zurück). Dies erfordert eine Bankkarte, und wenn Sie zum ersten Mal suchen, schauen Sie sich das Video an: LINK. Wenn Sie nicht über die entsprechende Bankkarte verfügen, können Sie unsere Kampagne mit Zahlung auf Ihr Konto unterstützen. Jeder, der eine Rechnung bezahlt, einen geschützten Betrag unter seinem Namen, wird in die Kampagne übertragen. Die Informationen zur Zahlung aus Bosnien und Herzegowina finden sie unter: https://cuvari.org/instrukcije-za-placanje/, Informationen zur Zahlung aus einem anderen Land unter: https://cuvari.org/instrukcije-za-placanje/.GeschenkeWenn Sie für ein Geschenk von 5 $ spenden, erhalten Sie 3 digitale Fotografien von hochauflösenden kulturellen und historischen Denkmälern von Bosnien und Herzegowina, die Sie auf einem Foto oder Poster erstellen können, um Ihr Zuhause zu dekorieren. Dies ist ein Geschenk in elektronischer Form und es werden keine Versandkosten verrechnet.Indem Sie für alle anderen Geschenke spenden, ermutigen Sie neben unserer Kampagne, auch die Künstler, die sie erstellt haben. Die Versandkosten hängen von Ihrem Standort ab, wenn Sie für ein bestimmtes Geschenk spenden und ein Geschenk persönlich mitnehmen möchten, genügt es, auf spenden zu drücken und den genauen Betrag einzugeben (dann wird das Geschenk nicht per Post verschickt, sondern Sie nehmen es persönlich Ende April in Banja Luka).Alle Geschenke sind komplett oder größtenteils von Hand gemacht und Fotos von Geschenken können mit geringfügigen Änderungen sein. Zum Beispiel,wenn Sie die Alte Brücke oder Sebilj auf den Teetassen gemalt haben möchten oderwenn auf der Untertasse Mostar / Sarajevo 2018 stehen sollte, oder wenn Sie wollen, dass die Tasse weiß ist, macht man das gerne für Sie und das ist schon alles im Preis inkludiert. Aber wenn sie den Wunsch haben, dass man statt auf Tassen, auf Fildzan malt, geht das auch in Ordnung, aber der Preis wird aufgrund des höheren Kaufpreises des Fildzans etwas höher sein.Die individuelle Geschenke werden direkt nach der Beendigung der Kampagne (die letzte Aprilwoche und die erste Maiwoche) und die Pakete für Unternehmen und Catering-Einrichtungen (wegen der Stückzahl) im Mai versendet (bis diese Geschenke angefertigtsind).Mit jedem Geschenk erhalten Sie auch eine kurze Geschichte darüber, was Sie gekauft haben, wie diese traditionellen Handarbeiten oder Fotos von kulturellen und historischen Denkmälern entstanden sind, wieso die Geschenke einzigartig sind und wer welches Geschenk erstellt hat (kurz über den Autor).Wenn sie uns mit ihrer Spende unterstützen und ein bestimmtes Geschenk erhalten, können Sie uns in den Kommentaren schreiben, wo unser Geschenk gelandet ist, und wir werden Ihnen den genauen Ort (Dorf oder Stadt), die Geschenkherstellung und die Mindestanzahl der zurückgelegten Kilometer (Fluglinie) auf diesem Weg offenbaren!Jeder Spender, unabhängig von der Spendensumme, wird auf einemseparatenTeil der Website https://www.cuvari.org/ mit den NamenallerPersonenregistriert, die dazubeigetragenhaben, die ExportaktivitätimSozialunternehmenzuregistrieren, mitAusnahmederjenigen, die anonym bleibenmöchten (anonym gespendet). Wennunsere Initiative etwasmehrMittelalserwarteteinnimmt, werdenwirden Geldüberhang in die Ausbildungjunger Menschen investieren, um sichmit der Produktion von traditionellemKunsthandwerkzubefassen, oder um das kulturelle und historischeErbe des westlichen Balkans weiterzuschützen. Wennunsere Initiative vielmehrGeld alserwartetsammelt, werdenwirVertriebszentren in Kroatien und Serbieneinrichten und in Zukunfthabenwir den gleichen Plan für Slowenien, Mazedonien und Montenegro.Unser EinflussSie und wirschützengemeinsam die kulturhistorischenDenkmäler auf demTerritorium von Bosnien und Herzegowina und demehemaligenJugoslawien, und vorallem die Kultur, die in einigenFällennur in kleinenabgelegenenOrtschaftenüberlebt hat. Wirallemüssendiesen Menschen helfen, dennihreProduktesindlanglebig (Siehabeneine 100-jährige Garantie), mitLiebeproduziert und manchmal verschaffen den Autoren und deren Familien die Existenz.Wir leben in einer modernen Konsumgesellschaft und vergessen oft die Menschen, die hinter einem Produkt stehen. Leider kauft man viel mehr Industriegüter, die oft von einem Roboter zusammengesetzt werden, als Handarbeiten. Durch den Kauf von industriell produzierten oder noch schlimmer, die von Kindern unter unmenschlichen Bedingungen in fernen Ländern hergestellten Produkten,unterstützen Sie das kapitalistische und sklavische System, und dieser Tatsache sind Sie sich oft nicht bewusst! Mit der Unterstützung unserer Kampagne unterstützen Sie auch Kleinproduzenten und somit können sie ihre Familien versorgen!Wenn Sie nicht in der Lage sind, zu spenden, können Sie uns helfen, indem Sie die Geschichte über uns verbreiten, indem Sie diese Kampagne auf Ihrer Facebook-Seite und auf Instagram teilen, Freunden e-mailen oder über andere soziale Netzwerke oder Medien verbreiten.Alle zusätzlichen Informationen über unsere Kampagne können über die Website abgerufen werden: https://www.cuvari.org/ Kleinproduzenten von Kunsthandwerk, mit denen wir noch nicht zusammengearbeitet haben, können sich auf dieser Seite registrieren.KontaktFür weitere Informationen kontaktieren Sie uns bitte per E-Mail: info@cuvari.org oder telefonisch unter +38765575985 oder +38765950819.

story: Help Sam Become An Icon of London Street Fashiaun
story_txt: Help Sam Become An Icon of London Street Fashiaun

story:
Short Summary

In Feminis Veritas is an Eastern European Women's Festival that started as a student project at the Freie Universität Berlin. Our festival was created in response to the czarny protests in Poland, where the government's decision to restrict abortion rights was met with large-scale protests. We wanted to show solidarity with and bring to light the current plight of women in Eastern Europe who are facing a retraditionalization of gender roles under increasingly repressive governments. The best way to further this message, we believed, was to highlight Eastern European female artists, allowing their art to speak for their experiences and illustrate their political circumstances. From this idea, the festival was born.

The festival last year, included various formats, highlighting and contextualizing the cultural and political situation for women in Eastern Europe. We held a podium discussion on the protests movements in Poland, held a STI-education workshop through a feminist lens, screened an Oscar-nominated short-film, held a digital art exhibition, and presented a reading of a new novel. You can still view all of these events here on our Youtube page.

This year we want to top our festival from last year! We already have an amazing program and group of artists who are excited to participate in this years festival. Once the program and artist list are finalized, we will published it here as well as on our social media. We've even raised a significant amount of money already through grants. All we need now is an additional 750€ to help put on the best festival possible.

This years festival will include:

  • a podium discussion
  • a short film screening
  • an art exhibition with live music
  • a reading from a graphic novel
  • a workshop on intersectional feminism
  • a podcast collaboration 

Any amount you can donate will be greatly appreciated!!

The festival will take place August 20th to 22nd in Berlin, Germany.

Further information on the exact location of the festival will be published as we get closer to the event. There will be no entrance fee for the festival; anyone located in Berlin is more than welcome to join us. All the events will be recorded and put on Youtube, so everyone who donates will be able to partake in the festival! 

Thank you for all your support,

The In Feminis Veritas Team

What We Need & What You Get

We have currently received funding from two foundations: Heinrich Böll Foundation and the German-Czech Future Fund. From these foundations we've received 2,000€. However, in oder to put on the best festival possible and offer the program both in-person and digitally, we need to raise another 750€. Below is a copy of our budget to see what this money would provide.

For your generous donations we have lots of exciting perks! 

Risks & Challenges

Due to the pandemic, in-person convening will need to be limited and adhere to the German governments current rules regarding exhibits.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can afford to donate.  If you' d like to show your support for our festival in other ways, please follow and subscribe to our social media pages listed below. Be sure to share our crowdfunding page! And, of course, come join us from August 20th-22nd for the the festival! See you then!

Youtube  Facebook  Instagram

story:
>>> Scroll down for English <<<


 

„Becsüljék meg ezt a tevékenységet, amely példaértékű lehet Európa-szerte”

- Dr. Bereczky Lóránd
művészettörténész,
a Magyar Nemzeti Galéria korábbi főigazgatója

 

Artcolony

Az 1996-ban alapított Artcolony Cered egy nemzetközi művésztelep, ahol a meghívott résztvevők az aktuálisan meghirdetett projekt keretein belül vesznek részt a művészeti színtér és műhely alkotómunkájában. A művészek, személyes jelenlétükkel, helyszíni megfigyeléseikből kiindulva hozzák létre alkotásaikat, amelyek reagálnak a mindenkori tematikus – Ceredhez kapcsolódó - felhívásra. Mára több, mint 20 ország képviseltette magát nálunk Mexikótól Ausztráliáig és csatlakozott missziónkhoz: a képzőművészet segítségével megmenteni eltűnőfélben lévő értékeket. 

 

A képzőművészet segítségével megmenteni eltűnőfélben lévő értékeket.

A művésztelep kiemelt figyelmet fordít a társadalmi szerepvállalásra, hogy a helyi társadalommal párbeszédet kezdeményezzen a kortárs művészet eszközeinek segítségével és az eltűnőben lévő magyar vidéki kultúrát nemzetközileg elismert művészek alkotásaiban tovább örökítse a jövőnek, ezáltal egy egyedi kortörténeti dokumentumot létrehozva.

Az Artcolony idei művészeinek témája az Anzix, amelyről itt olvashatsz többet:
https://artcolony-cered.com/hu/ceredi-anzix-2019/

 

Cered

A nemzetközi művésztelep és az Artpiknik otthona a Nógrád megye északkeleti szegletében megbúvó palóc falu, Cered. A település természeti adottságai miatt mindig is el volt szigetelve a nagyvilág zakatolásától, de a felvidéki települések elcsatolása és a falvak elnéptelenedése hatványozottan érezteti itt hatását.

Az aranyzöld domboldalak, a Medves őshonos növény- és állatvilága, a házfalakból áradó palóc szellemiség hagyományai, az utcákon a mindenkinek köszönő helyiek és az a megingathatatlan béke, ami a faluból árad – ezek teszik Ceredet egyedülállóvá. Ezért szerettünk bele 24 évvel ezelőtt.

„Kérdezhetnénk: miért épp Cered? Mi van Cereden? Semmi és minden.”

- Dr. Keserű Katalin
Kossuth és Széchenyi-díjas művészettörténész,
az ELTE Művészettörténeti Tanszékének professor emeritusa

 

Miért támogass?

Az Artcolony 24 éve teljes egészében non-profit művészeti projektként működik, hogy a művészekre és az alkotás folyamatára semmilyen üzleti érdek, eladhatósági szempont ne legyen hatással.

Szeretnénk, ha ez a jövőben is így maradna, éppen ezért a nyílt nap megszervezéséhez támogatásra van szükségünk. Az így gyűjtött összeget a fellépőkre, a helyszínek felépítésére, az eszközök beszerzésére, a helyi segítőink díjazására és a nyílt nap kommunikációjára fordítjuk. Ha kampányunk a cél felett teljesít, a fennmaradó összegből a jövőévi fesztivál szervezési munkálatait finanszírozzuk.

A legkisebb kategóriát leszámítva a nyílt nap belépőjét minden támogatási kategória magába foglalja. Ezen felül a segítség mértékétől függően egy ceredi konyharuhával, egy névre szóló színházi örökhellyel, egy mű vázlatával vagy egy konkrét művel szeretnénk kifejezni köszönetünket.

 

Hogyan használjuk fel támogatásod?

A költségek 5 fő csoportba sorolhatók. Szerintünk a következők elengedhetetlenek a nyílt nap megszervezéséhez.

  1. Technikai költségek
    Energia, színpad- és hangtechnika - 430.000 Ft
  2. Program
    Fellépők - 600.000 Ft
  3. Dekoráció
    Helyszíni tájékoztató anyagok, karszalagok - 330.000 Ft
  4. Bútor és felszerelés
    Sátorok, asztalok, mobil mosdók - 1.050.000 Ft
  5. Személyzet
    Szervezők, biztonsági személyzet, fotós, önkéntesek költségei - 1.220.000 Ft

Részletesebb költségekért kattints át a FAQ fülre.

 

A nyílt nap

Tervezett programok - Augusztus 10., Cered

Egész napos programok
Palóc ételek kóstolása
Pálinka kóstolás
Művészeti könyvek és albumok, képeslapok vására

Napközbeni programok
Gyerekplanetárium
Kispárna zenekar koncertje
Déli kamarazene a templomkertben
Fesztivál avatás, művésztelep zárása
Szoborpark avatás és kiállítós megnyitó
Capelle Galéria kiállítás megnyitó
Rönkszínház Társulat - William Mastrosimone: PULÓVERGYŰJTŐ
Szentmise

Esti programok
Szőke Attila tábortűzi gitár - soloshow
Gáspár Károly Trió - jazzkoncert
Kárpáti Dódi Privati Projekt - koncert
A Tanu c. film felújított változatának bemutatása
Zenés esti program

 

Ahogy még segíthetsz:

Ha anyagi támogatásra nincs is lehetőséged, akkor is tudod támogatni ügyünket: kürtöld világgá, szólj minden művészetkedvelő ismerősödnek, küldd el nekik oldalunkat:
https://igg.me/at/artpiknik

 

Akik már írtak rólunk

__________________________________________________________________________________________
__________________________________________________________________________________________

 

Summary in English

Twenty-four years ago, with a few fellow artists we founded an art colony in a small rural village called Cered in Nógrád County. We have created this community not only to be part of the Hungarian and the European art scene, but to support a collection of values which had been, and still are at risk of becoming extinct. 

We invited contemporary artists from all around the world and let them use this wonderful, unspoilt environment as their inspiration. Every year we gave the selected artists a theme - something connected to Cered, the country life, the loss of village population -  and asked them to try to capture what Cered and these values mean with their art. 

Over the past few years, hundreds of talented people from more than 23 countries have joined us and spread the word of our mission in the world. At the last day of the art colony, we have always organised an open day where we have presented the created artworks to friends and followers.

Last year the number of visitors has exceeded 200, and even though we have huge families, this unexpected level of interest has surprised us and inevitably has risen a question: Is it possible that this unique encounter of international artists and a tiny Hungarian village could be an interest for others, and not just for us?

So this year we decided to go after this...

 

On 10 August 2019 we will organize the 1st Cered ArtPiknik, a contemporary art festival where we will open our gates for the wider public and show what Cered means to us.

During the event, our guests will have the chance to see the artworks and meet the artists at the house where they have been working and got their inspiration. At the same time, the guests can visit the village and the surrounding area to try local culinary delights, to attend concerts and plays.

To make this all possible, we have started this crowd-funding campaign and now we need your help. Of course, we won’t ask this as a donation - please check the list of  perks to see how are we planning to thank you for your support. 

 

  1. „A köszönet” – $3 USD
    We will write your name on a house at Cered. This will stay as a proof your generosity forever (or at least until the paint peels off).
  2. „A jegy” - $10 USD
    If you choose this perk, you will get a ticket to the ArtPiknik which you can collect at Cered, on the day of the festival.
  3. „Az album” - $25 USD
    You will get a ticket, your name will appear on a wall, and beside all this, we will thank you your support with an album about the previous 24 years of the art colony. 
  4. „A páholy” - $100 USD
    Behind the location of the art colony, there is a small wooden theatre. If you choose this perk, one its will be always yours. We will engrave your name on a seat and of course you will also get a festival ticket. 
  5. „A vázlat” - $500 USD
    As one of our main benefactor you will have the opportunity to get the sketch of your favourite artwork. Moreover you will get two tickets to the festival.
  6. „A mű” - $2 500 USD
    If you decide to be the one who helps us the most, we will thank your extraordinary support in a unique way, with an artwork of the art colony. Our Founder, Csaba Fürjesi will help you personally to pick the art piece which fits your collection.
story_txt:
>>> Scroll down for English <<<
 
„Becsüljék meg ezt a tevékenységet, amely példaértékű lehet Európa-szerte”
- Dr. Bereczky Lórándművészettörténész,a Magyar Nemzeti Galéria korábbi főigazgatója
 
Artcolony
Az 1996-ban alapított Artcolony Cered egy nemzetközi művésztelep, ahol a meghívott résztvevők az aktuálisan meghirdetett projekt keretein belül vesznek részt a művészeti színtér és műhely alkotómunkájában. A művészek, személyes jelenlétükkel, helyszíni megfigyeléseikből kiindulva hozzák létre alkotásaikat, amelyek reagálnak a mindenkori tematikus – Ceredhez kapcsolódó - felhívásra. Mára több, mint 20 ország képviseltette magát nálunk Mexikótól Ausztráliáig és csatlakozott missziónkhoz: a képzőművészet segítségével megmenteni eltűnőfélben lévő értékeket. 

 
A képzőművészet segítségével megmenteni eltűnőfélben lévő értékeket.
A művésztelep kiemelt figyelmet fordít a társadalmi szerepvállalásra, hogy a helyi társadalommal párbeszédet kezdeményezzen a kortárs művészet eszközeinek segítségével és az eltűnőben lévő magyar vidéki kultúrát nemzetközileg elismert művészek alkotásaiban tovább örökítse a jövőnek, ezáltal egy egyedi kortörténeti dokumentumot létrehozva.
Az Artcolony idei művészeinek témája az Anzix, amelyről itt olvashatsz többet:https://artcolony-cered.com/hu/ceredi-anzix-2019/
 
Cered
A nemzetközi művésztelep és az Artpiknik otthona a Nógrád megye északkeleti szegletében megbúvó palóc falu, Cered. A település természeti adottságai miatt mindig is el volt szigetelve a nagyvilág zakatolásától, de a felvidéki települések elcsatolása és a falvak elnéptelenedése hatványozottan érezteti itt hatását.
Az aranyzöld domboldalak, a Medves őshonos növény- és állatvilága, a házfalakból áradó palóc szellemiség hagyományai, az utcákon a mindenkinek köszönő helyiek és az a megingathatatlan béke, ami a faluból árad – ezek teszik Ceredet egyedülállóvá. Ezért szerettünk bele 24 évvel ezelőtt.
„Kérdezhetnénk: miért épp Cered? Mi van Cereden? Semmi és minden.”
- Dr. Keserű KatalinKossuth és Széchenyi-díjas művészettörténész,az ELTE Művészettörténeti Tanszékének professor emeritusa
 
Miért támogass?
Az Artcolony 24 éve teljes egészében non-profit művészeti projektként működik, hogy a művészekre és az alkotás folyamatára semmilyen üzleti érdek, eladhatósági szempont ne legyen hatással.
Szeretnénk, ha ez a jövőben is így maradna, éppen ezért a nyílt nap megszervezéséhez támogatásra van szükségünk. Az így gyűjtött összeget a fellépőkre, a helyszínek felépítésére, az eszközök beszerzésére, a helyi segítőink díjazására és a nyílt nap kommunikációjára fordítjuk. Ha kampányunk a cél felett teljesít, a fennmaradó összegből a jövőévi fesztivál szervezési munkálatait finanszírozzuk.
A legkisebb kategóriát leszámítva a nyílt nap belépőjét minden támogatási kategória magába foglalja. Ezen felül a segítség mértékétől függően egy ceredi konyharuhával, egy névre szóló színházi örökhellyel, egy mű vázlatával vagy egy konkrét művel szeretnénk kifejezni köszönetünket.
 
Hogyan használjuk fel támogatásod?
A költségek 5 fő csoportba sorolhatók. Szerintünk a következők elengedhetetlenek a nyílt nap megszervezéséhez.


Technikai költségekEnergia, színpad- és hangtechnika - 430.000 Ft

ProgramFellépők - 600.000 Ft

DekorációHelyszíni tájékoztató anyagok, karszalagok - 330.000 Ft

Bútor és felszerelésSátorok, asztalok, mobil mosdók - 1.050.000 Ft

SzemélyzetSzervezők, biztonsági személyzet, fotós, önkéntesek költségei - 1.220.000 Ft

Részletesebb költségekért kattints át a FAQ fülre.
 
A nyílt nap
Tervezett programok - Augusztus 10., Cered 
Egész napos programokPalóc ételek kóstolásaPálinka kóstolásMűvészeti könyvek és albumok, képeslapok vására
Napközbeni programokGyerekplanetáriumKispárna zenekar koncertjeDéli kamarazene a templomkertbenFesztivál avatás, művésztelep zárásaSzoborpark avatás és kiállítós megnyitóCapelle Galéria kiállítás megnyitóRönkszínház Társulat - William Mastrosimone: PULÓVERGYŰJTŐSzentmise
Esti programokSzőke Attila tábortűzi gitár - soloshowGáspár Károly Trió - jazzkoncertKárpáti Dódi Privati Projekt - koncertA Tanu c. film felújított változatának bemutatásaZenés esti program
 
Ahogy még segíthetsz:
Ha anyagi támogatásra nincs is lehetőséged, akkor is tudod támogatni ügyünket: kürtöld világgá, szólj minden művészetkedvelő ismerősödnek, küldd el nekik oldalunkat:https://igg.me/at/artpiknik
 Akik már írtak rólunk
____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ Summary in EnglishTwenty-four years ago, with a few fellow artists we founded an art colony in a small rural village called Cered in Nógrád County. We have created this community not only to be part of the Hungarian and the European art scene, but to support a collection of values which had been, and still are at risk of becoming extinct. We invited contemporary artists from all around the world and let them use this wonderful, unspoilt environment as their inspiration. Every year we gave the selected artists a theme - something connected to Cered, the country life, the loss of village population -  and asked them to try to capture what Cered and these values mean with their art. Over the past few years, hundreds of talented people from more than 23 countries have joined us and spread the word of our mission in the world. At the last day of the art colony, we have always organised an open day where we have presented the created artworks to friends and followers.Last year the number of visitors has exceeded 200, and even though we have huge families, this unexpected level of interest has surprised us and inevitably has risen a question: Is it possible that this unique encounter of international artists and a tiny Hungarian village could be an interest for others, and not just for us?So this year we decided to go after this... On 10 August 2019 we will organize the 1st Cered ArtPiknik, a contemporary art festival where we will open our gates for the wider public and show what Cered means to us.During the event, our guests will have the chance to see the artworks and meet the artists at the house where they have been working and got their inspiration. At the same time, the guests can visit the village and the surrounding area to try local culinary delights, to attend concerts and plays.To make this all possible, we have started this crowd-funding campaign and now we need your help. Of course, we won’t ask this as a donation - please check the list of  perks to see how are we planning to thank you for your support.  

„A köszönet” – $3 USDWe will write your name on a house at Cered. This will stay as a proof your generosity forever (or at least until the paint peels off).

„A jegy” - $10 USDIf you choose this perk, you will get a ticket to the ArtPiknik which you can collect at Cered, on the day of the festival.

„Az album” - $25 USDYou will get a ticket, your name will appear on a wall, and beside all this, we will thank you your support with an album about the previous 24 years of the art colony. 

„A páholy” - $100 USDBehind the location of the art colony, there is a small wooden theatre. If you choose this perk, one its will be always yours. We will engrave your name on a seat and of course you will also get a festival ticket. 

„A vázlat” - $500 USDAs one of our main benefactor you will have the opportunity to get the sketch of your favourite artwork. Moreover you will get two tickets to the festival.

„A mű” - $2 500 USDIf you decide to be the one who helps us the most, we will thank your extraordinary support in a unique way, with an artwork of the art colony. Our Founder, Csaba Fürjesi will help you personally to pick the art piece which fits your collection.

story:
Funded by a growing community of foundations, corporations, and people like you, the Dollar Bank Three Rivers Arts Festival (TRAF) is for everyone who believes in the arts. This iconic Pittsburgh celebration draws more than 500,000 people each year, and with good reason. Since 1960, the festival has delivered world-class visual and performing art from Ella Fitzgerald and Ray Charles, Wilco and the Black Keys, Lar Lubovitch and Arnie Zane, and Otto Piene and Louise Nevelson, to name just a few.

But we can’t do it without YOU. Please help us to keep the festival free!

Your gift will help make the entire festival possible, including these incredible 2017 highlights:

Stardust, an original aerial dance piece choreographed by Blue Lapis Light flies from the Fifth Avenue Place facade. Like nothing ever presented in Pittsburgh before, dancers will be suspended from the building and will enliven the structure through aerial balletic movements, igniting a sense of wonder and transcendent beauty. Presented in partnership with the Pittsburgh Dance Council. 

Umbrella Sky Project, a vibrant and colorful public art installation from artist Sexta Feira makes its way from Portugal’s famous annual Ágitagueda Art Festival to Pittsburgh’s Gateway Center.

Tidal, a geofeedback installation from Indian artist Shilo Shiv Suleman simulates a suspended storm of metal and fabric clouds with LED lights that respond to the flow of Pittsburgh’s iconic three rivers. In the center will stand a bowl full of clear water, trace your fingers inside the bowl of water and watch as you start to stir up a storm.

A diverse lineup of musical acts throughout the 10-day festival including Michael Kiwanuka, Las Cafeteras, St. Paul and The Broken Bones, and Birds of Chicago.

story:
Click here to be redirected to our Final Run campaign for the Spiral Knights

 

What is Free and Real and the Telaithrion Project?

The Telaithrion Project’s mission is to create the first, much needed, eco-community model in Greece that will work as a school of self-sufficiency and an exemplar model of sustainability, healthy and harmonic living conditions with respect to human values and the ecosystem,  renewable sources of energy, clean and efficient means of transportation, continuous research and education on all relevant topics and technologies, made available equally to all.

The project is being created in Evia island for almost 7 years now, with more than 25000 visitors from every corner of the world and a weekly outreach of more than 120000 people! Visit our facebook page by clicking here, to get all the insight from the course of events, from the very first day until now, and feast your eyes on the countless photo albums depicting, your own remarkable and priceless help for everything that is being achieved. 

More information on the subjects that we research, our goals, our collaborations and everything that has to do with Free & Real can be found @ Telaithrion.freeandreal.org (in 6 languages and counting) and @FreeandReal.org (Greek and English version available).

Also don't forget to check out all the videos in the "Gallery Section" or by clicking here

With this campaign, and with your invaluable support, we aim to rise the project to the next level of cooperation and co-creation!

This year we would like to raise the necessary funds to complete new infrastructure that is needed to make the Spiral Knights Eco-Fest 2017 (5 to 10 of September) an even greater event, with sustainability as our main compass and collaboration and co-creation our main goals.

Check out 1000 photos from last years Spiral Knights

What We Need & What You Get

Getting into more detail:

Last years Spiral Knights Festival was something that we were cooking in our brains for many years now and it really, really paid off. We had a magnificent off-grid celebration of sustainability and it was an amazing way to bring together people and projects from Greece and the world, to co-create and achieve beautiful realizations together. It was a truly unique experience but we realized 4 days are not enough.. So this year we go for 6! Join Us!

So we double down on everything and again this year during the event there will be live music, theater and dance performances, more enhanced practical workshops (eco-building, cooking, permaculture and more) and part from the daily seminars (yoga, tai-chi, thai-massage, acrobatics, capoeira, chi kung and more), all the teacher and teams will run the individual "Summer Camps" @ the Spiral Knights Eco-Fest. This means you can book your spot and do your favorite seminar 2 times per day with food and camping included and also be part of an amazing festival!

  • Acrobatics Camp @ Spiral Knights Eco-Fest 2017
  • Healing Camp @ Spiral Knights Eco-Fest 2017
  • Sound & Self Healing Camp @ Spiral Knights Eco-Fest 2017
  • Yoga & Thai Massage Camp @ Spiral Knights Eco-Fest 2017
  • Yoga & Tantra Camp @ Spiral Knights Eco-Fest 2017

This is an early bird campaign and it is connected with the designing and building of a mobile off-grid trailer solar/battery system that will be able to support all the energy needs of our off grid efforts! We are in the process of designing this off-grid monster, with the valuable help of our friends from SEYN  as also other off grid systems that will be used in the Spiral Knights and will be build during our Energy Mastercourse Vol II workshop in June.

Participations, Live acts and performers will be announced during the summer and through the second participatory campaign that we will run in July. Trust us the Line Up is on fire!!!

Many new different stages and event domes will be set-up and there will be in site camping for the participators . Also a brand new food-court with amazing vegan food, with recipes from all over the globe, and many other constructions and surprises will be set up all over the place. A kid's area and playground will be also there and also many games for young and not so young people will be prepared.

Basically through this campaign we give you the chance to reserve your camping spot on the mountain site. We will be opening new perks with this specific focus all the way to the festival.

The sooner you get your perk the less you will contribute!

This event will be a co-creation and everyone will participate in its realization one way or another. Everyone will be personally responsible for the cleanness and safety of the space and the surrounding forest. Recycling, up-cycling and composting will be as always a must!

Stay tuned and check back periodically for news and updates!

Setting up this festival will give us the chance to create the infrastructure for future events in and around the Telaithrion Project's site. Be part of it!

Spiral Knights Festival 2017

Do you imagine an international festival bringing people from all over Greece and the world to celebrate sustainability in all its aspects and forms? Waking up on a mountain site with a dreamy ocean view, after that participating in inspiring workshops, eating amazing food and dancing (under a late summer full moon) inside a geodesic dome full of lights, dance and laughter?... We had imagined that and did it too! But last year was just the beginning,now it’s time for the second one, and probably it’s the time for you to join us!

Last year’s festival was the fruit of intensive 2 and half month labour done by an international team of young creative people and the years of the collective experience and knowledge of the people that are co-creating and supporting the ‘’Telethrion Project’’, Free and Real’s baby.

Served in a nutshell,all this knowledge will perform around us once again, through possibly ‘’life changing’’ workshops, talks and presentations happening on the many different stages of the Spiral Knights grounds

Other Ways You Take Be Part 

If you are not in a position to help by participating in the event, don't worry, there are many ways to help us achieve not only this goal, but also the project as a whole.

Post this campaign again and again, on your favorite social media (facebook, twitter, youtube, etc).

Invite your friends to like our FB Page (https://www.facebook.com/FreeandReal)

Send an e-mail to your friends and family letting them know about us.

Volunteer for the event! We will need a lot of help setting all this up!

If you are part of a business or company, or you own a business or company, make a donation through your company and see the name of it display among all the other contributors to all our media outlets.  Also you can offer us materials that we so much need to set up the festival! Contact us for more details

Send us an e-mail letting us know what else you can offer (skills, tools, know-how, ideas etc)

Come visit us, work with us and lend us your hands to create a more sustainable future!

Thank you all for sharing and supporting!!!
