story:
Who are the Moms of Furries?

"Carrie and Joelle are absolute treasures, the work they're putting in to making the fandom better for young furs and parents is amazing! They're both so wonderful and from their first video their love for their kids was so apparent. Since then they've become moms to so many of us. They really are a special pair of MoFs." - Twitter Fan

Hi! We're Carrie and Joelle, aka the Moms of Furries! We are best pals whose kids introduced us to the furry fandom. We are grateful to our teens because they bravely took the initiative to educate us about being furry.

Thankfully, they didn't give up on us!

After initial hesitation, we decided to take our kids to our first convention. We instantly felt welcomed into this amazing community! On the last day of the con, we decided it was our duty to share our experience with other - possibly hesitant - parents. Our first YouTube video garnered more support than we could have ever imagined. We have now become part of this wonderful community.

Our overall mission is to share the benefits of the furry fandom and to dispel myths, as well as, negative stereotypes. We believe this fandom is not only appropriate for young furries but also a positive outlet for their creativity and self-expression.

As part of our mission, we want to create fun, age-appropriate furry convention activities tailor-made to youths and their families. We are especially proud of our Young Furry Chill Space©, a room where kids and guardians can take a break from con activities and maybe meet friends, make a craft, or just chill out for a while.

We hope to expand this space to include special guests that can share share information about crafting, art, and other things kids may want to know.

MoFs in Action!

"Mom's of Furries do an exceptional job creating a mellow space for young furries to hang out, build friendships and create beautiful art together. Behind the scenes they provide so much support to both the young and old in the fandom. They really do so much to bring out the best in everyone they meet.” - Gabriel, Founder of AnthroNW

We have had the great pleasure of being asked to bring our Young Furry Chill Space back to AnthroNW in November! Many young people and their guardians shared with us how much they enjoyed the space and we are very excited to be returning!

However, the budget for travel, food and lodging, crafting supplies and other necessities to make this space happen can be quite costly. While in the past we have been able to do much of this out of pocket, we find that while supporting our own families, it's not feasible for us to continue sustaining this alone.  We love this fandom, we love helping the youth of this fandom to become the individuals they want to be in a loving, open, and inclusive environment and we hope to continue providing this for them at AnthroNW and other conventions.

Here's How YOU Can Help...

After crunching the numbers, we have determined the total cost to take the Young Furry Chill Space© to ANW again is $4500.  This is the whole kit and kaboodle. This will get the MoFs to the convention, provide us sleeping space (Sleep? What's sleep? We're Moms!) and allow us to get all of the crafting and other supplies needed to make it the most awesome room at the convention (well, at least WE think so)!

To achieve this goal, we've created some fun little perks. There's something for everyone even if you can't make it to AnthroNorthwest (we're very excited about the brunch option, just sayin).

The Impact

"I absolutely love how kind and supportive the @MomsofFurries are of the fandom and it’s members! They are just too sweet for words! <3" - Leilia Spaniel

The Moms of Furries do more than just create room for arts and crafts for the younger members of the fandom.  They provide a safe space for kids and adults to come in and talk about their experiences.

Many members of the fandom, both young and old, identify somewhere on the LGBTQ+ spectrum.  As parents to children that also identify on this spectrum they know the importance of having a space to be able to openly talk about the issues they face daily. Parents can use this space as a resource on how to approach their children and speak openly and honestly with them.

The MoFs can provide valuable insight and resources for anyone wishing to learn more about their special kids. They also communicate with kids who feel they want to open a dialog with their parent or guardian about their sexuality or gender identity.

This, above all, is why more furry conventions need the space that the Moms of Furries provide. It’s one thing to have a room labeled for youth, and another to bring what some feel only the Moms of Furries can provide.  Experience. Understanding. Love.

Risks & Challenges

It is our hope that the campaign will be successful and we’ll be on our way to ANW in November. Any risks fall to us. If we do not make 100% of the goal, we will seek other ways to offset the costs to bring our Young Furry Chill Space back again!

Other Ways You Can Help

We TOTALLY understand if you can't contribute at this time. There are plenty of other ways you can help! Such as:

  • Share the campaign! Tweet it, post it to Facebook or anywhere else where you think people may be interested in what we do.  There's no wrong way to share!
  • Start a small fundraiser and link people to the big one!  Perfect for YouTubers, Twitch Streamers, or even an IRL event!

Pretty simple, right? Right!

We can't thank this community enough for joining us in creating this fun, but important little space for the fandom. Kids and parents have been thankful to have a place outside of the hustle and bustle to come sit down, work on a fun craft,  and just talk to us about their experiences and what it means to them to be furry parents or young furries.

And with that, we hope to see you at AnthroNW 2019!
story_txt:
Who are the Moms of Furries?"Carrie and Joelle are absolute treasures, the work they're putting in to making the fandom better for young furs and parents is amazing! They're both so wonderful and from their first video their love for their kids was so apparent. Since then they've become moms to so many of us. They really are a special pair of MoFs." - Twitter FanHi! We're Carrie and Joelle, aka the Moms of Furries! We are best pals whose kids introduced us to the furry fandom. We are grateful to our teens because they bravely took the initiative to educate us about being furry.Thankfully, they didn't give up on us!After initial hesitation, we decided to take our kids to our first convention. We instantly felt welcomed into this amazing community! On the last day of the con, we decided it was our duty to share our experience with other - possibly hesitant - parents. Our first YouTube video garnered more support than we could have ever imagined. We have now become part of this wonderful community.Our overall mission is to share the benefits of the furry fandom and to dispel myths, as well as, negative stereotypes. We believe this fandom is not only appropriate for young furries but also a positive outlet for their creativity and self-expression.As part of our mission, we want to create fun, age-appropriate furry convention activities tailor-made to youths and their families. We are especially proud of our Young Furry Chill Space©, a room where kids and guardians can take a break from con activities and maybe meet friends, make a craft, or just chill out for a while.We hope to expand this space to include special guests that can share share information about crafting, art, and other things kids may want to know.MoFs in Action!"Mom's of Furries do an exceptional job creating a mellow space for young furries to hang out, build friendships and create beautiful art together. Behind the scenes they provide so much support to both the young and old in the fandom. They really do so much to bring out the best in everyone they meet.” - Gabriel, Founder of AnthroNWWe have had the great pleasure of being asked to bring our Young Furry Chill Space back to AnthroNW in November! Many young people and their guardians shared with us how much they enjoyed the space and we are very excited to be returning!However, the budget for travel, food and lodging, crafting supplies and other necessities to make this space happen can be quite costly. While in the past we have been able to do much of this out of pocket, we find that while supporting our own families, it's not feasible for us to continue sustaining this alone.  We love this fandom, we love helping the youth of this fandom to become the individuals they want to be in a loving, open, and inclusive environment and we hope to continue providing this for them at AnthroNW and other conventions.Here's How YOU Can Help...After crunching the numbers, we have determined the total cost to take the Young Furry Chill Space© to ANW again is $4500.  This is the whole kit and kaboodle. This will get the MoFs to the convention, provide us sleeping space (Sleep? What's sleep? We're Moms!) and allow us to get all of the crafting and other supplies needed to make it the most awesome room at the convention (well, at least WE think so)!To achieve this goal, we've created some fun little perks. There's something for everyone even if you can't make it to AnthroNorthwest (we're very excited about the brunch option, just sayin).The Impact"I absolutely love how kind and supportive the @MomsofFurries are of the fandom and it’s members! They also communicate with kids who feel they want to open a dialog with their parent or guardian about their sexuality or gender identity.This, above all, is why more furry conventions need the space that the Moms of Furries provide. It’s one thing to have a room labeled for youth, and another to bring what some feel only the Moms of Furries can provide.  Experience. Understanding. Love.Risks & ChallengesIt is our hope that the campaign will be successful and we’ll be on our way to ANW in November. Any risks fall to us. If we do not make 100% of the goal, we will seek other ways to offset the costs to bring our Young Furry Chill Space back again!Other Ways You Can HelpWe TOTALLY understand if you can't contribute at this time. There are plenty of other ways you can help! Such as:
Share the campaign! Tweet it, post it to Facebook or anywhere else where you think people may be interested in what we do.  There's no wrong way to share!
Start a small fundraiser and link people to the big one!  Perfect for YouTubers, Twitch Streamers, or even an IRL event!
Pretty simple, right? Right!We can't thank this community enough for joining us in creating this fun, but important little space for the fandom. story:
IFEEL GOOD TOUR IS ABOUT PEOPLE. AND ANIMALS. AND YOU, TOO.

It's time for a different kind of tour... I put together music, health and compassion into a tour that will help people and animals and it could help you, too. It does not matter if you are vegan, vegetarian or non-vegan, this tour will entertain you and provide you with practical advice to help you feel your best. And you will be a part of a pretty cool feel-good-do-good movement!

HEALTH + COMPASSION + MUSIC = FEEL GOOD

On October 19, I will leave Zagreb to visit 20 major European cities in 14 countries in 60 days to show people how to feel good with a healthy, fit vegan lifestyle. I will accomplish that by doing IFEEL GOOD PARTIES where it matters the most – in real communities - in people's homes, where I will teach them how to exercise the smart way, eat healthy and learn new habits to feel good. There will also be a house concert at every home (total 40 concerts!)

IFEEL GOOD PARTIES are absolutely FREE for all hosts of the event and all their invited guests! Everything is free, including a concert in their home.

During the tour, I will also do interviews on TV and radio to talk about the project, meet with some positive social media people (bloggers, youtubers, instagram influencers) and do healthy, fit flash mobs.



How will animals benefit from this? By helping people feel better with a healthy, compassionate lifestyle, more animals will be safe and happy, so it's a win-win. And there are also four special pigs involved. More about them below...

WHY WOULD YOU CARE ABOUT THIS PROJECT?

By supporting this tour, you can do good and feel good, too. You will make a real difference in lives of people and animals and help bring more compassion into the world. AND you will SEE the difference we make because I will take you with me every step of the way!

There is also real value for you and your wellbeing in this tour. I will show you everything that happens on this tour AND give you all that you need to start feeling good, too! You will receive all the information, healthy tips & tricks, feel-good habits, recipes and exercises from the tour. So by sponsoring this project we will together make a positive impact in real communities and in lives of animals and you will feel good as well. How does that sound? Here is what will happen on this tour...

FOUR THINGS I WILL ACCOMPLISH DURING THIS TOUR

1. Show people how to feel good with a healthy, fit vegan lifestyle FOR FREE by doing IFEEL GOOD PARTIES in their homes... 2 in every city. That's 40 events!
2. Meet, connect and brainstorm - in every city of the tour - with people following this project, bloggers, social media influencers and organizations that promote healthy, compassionate lifestyle in a positive way and invite them to join in and do IFEEL GOOD (fun, fit) flash mobs. You can join us! That's 40 flash mobs!
3. Record the official tour song on the road and shoot a music video.
4. Help my four pig friends Sissy, Superljilja, Sausage and Stella - from four different animal sanctuaries. I will share their stories and raise money (donations) for their care in every city during the tour. Meet the crew...
 



ABOUT ME = KNOWLEDGE + EXPERIENCE + PASSION

I have put together years of my knowledge and experience into this project. It combines all that I have been doing for many years: making music that gives animals a voice, helping people feel good and promoting healthy, fit vegan lifestyle in a positive way. As a rapper, I record music, perform at festivals and make music videos that tell animal stories and inspire people to be more compassionate (www.MusicIFEEL.com). As a lifestyle coach and ACE certified fitness trainer, I help people get fit, healthier and feel better with the right combination of healthy habits, tasty food and smart exercise.

I do workshops about healthy, fit lifestyle at vegan festivals and events and help animal rights organizations promote compassionate messages through public campaigns (see billboard below), on TV and radio. As an animal rights advocate, I organize volunteering activities at shelters and animal sanctuaries and speak out for animals in creative ways in the community and in media.

Pushups on watermelons... why not? This was a billboard campaign to show that vegans can be strong, too, and to invite people to one of the largest vegan festivals in Europe.



IFEEL GOOD TOUR will take place in 14 countries, in these 20 cities:

Ljubljana (October 19-22), Munich (October 22-25), Vienna (October 25-28) Bratislava (October 28-31), Praha (October 31 - November 3), Berlin (November 3-6), Hamburg (November 6-9), Copenhagen (November 9-12), Amsterdam (November 12-15), Brussels (November 15-18), London (November 18-21), Brighton (November 21-24), Paris (November 24-27), Toulouse (November 27-30), Madrid (November 30 - December 3), Barcelona (December 3-6), Nice (December 6-9), Torino (December 9-12), Zurich (December 12-15), Milano (December 15-18). And back to Zagreb on December 19.

INFORMING PEOPLE AND CLEARING MISCONCEPTIONS

Vegan movement is on the rise as more people are getting informed about animal abuse and benefits of plant-based lifestyle for health, animals and planet. But there is a problem: there are a lot of misconceptions and questions about a vegan lifestyle. And some people think that vegans are some strange cult... I am doing this tour to help clear misconceptions, answer questions and help people feel good. From experience I know that informing and inspiring people works better than blaming them or forcing them to make a change. Especially when it comes to veganism.

EMPOWERING PARTY THAT INSPIRES COMPASSION

Since IFEEL GOOD PARTIES show people how to feel good by experiencing a healthy, fit vegan lifestyle, they are an ideal opportunity for someone who wants to inspire their friends to try a vegan lifestyle.

IFEEL GOOD PARTIES are FREE! People who apply to be hosts simply invite their friends to IFEEL GOOD PARTY in their home. And have fun and learn together! If you or someone you know would like to be a host in one of the cities of the tour, send me a message so I can tell you how to apply!


HOW DO IFEEL GOOD PARTIES INSPIRE PEOPLE?

And now the "science" behind this... I have been experimenting with this formula for years. IFEEL GOOD PARTY guides people to physically, mentally and emotionally experience feeling good in six specific steps:

1. EXERCISE - learning how to exercise the smart way
2. COOKING – learning easy new plant-based recipes
3. EATING – enjoying food that we cook together
4. EMPOWERING – learning feel-good healthy habits
5. FEELING – hearing stories from animal sanctuaries
6. HOME CONCERT – music inspires people

Again, it does not matter if you or people on this tour are non-vegan, vegetarian or vegan. Everyone will receive information which will help them feel better. Healthy vegan lifestyle will be presented in a most positive way so no one feels attacked.

WHY DO SUCH A TOUR? REAL-LIFE CONNECTION IS THE KEY.

One thing I realized by going to animal sanctuaries is that connecting with animals face-to-face  made me a better, more motivated promoter of compassionate, vegan lifestyle. It's the same with people. Meeting people in person creates a more spontaneous, stronger connection than just communicating online. Add empowering information, food, drinks and laughter to that and you have a fun, creative, meaningful experience that people will never forget. And since the cause of this event is to help and inspire people to feel better and learn how to help end animal suffering with their lifestyle, then we have a win-win situation... for people and animals.

MUSIC VIDEOS MY VEGAN LIFE AND MEET ME

This is my music video MY VEGAN LIFE. It talks about vegan lifestyle and it was shot with vegans, vegetarians and vegans getting along and having a great time together.
 


And this is MEET ME - pig Superljilja's story... she was saved from a ditch on a side of the road, went to an animal sanctuary and then found a loving home. She is the main actress in the video. Meet Superljilja:

 


FEEL-GOOD SUPPORTER PERKS!

I will take you with me every step of the way so you can see what kind of impact we are making in 20 communities throughout Europe: on the road, in homes, during meetups, and all behind-the-scenes moments! You will also receive recipes, list of healthy, feel-good habits and exercises that I will be doing with people on tour – so you can feel good together with us! Please take a look at the perks to receive even more value and to help finance the tour faster.

COSTS + WHAT IS NEEDED TO MAKE IFEEL GOOD TOUR HAPPEN

I will make sure to find the right sponsors for some major expenses: tour car that I will drive, cameras, laptop and some food. But there are other costs left to make this tour happen. Here is what they are:

- $1400: gas for the car, toll road costs and vignettes (8500 kilometers!)
- $640: printed materials, stickers + shirts to give away, projector, speaker
- $900: song production (studio time, producer, mixing, mastering) and music video production and promotion of the video
- $900: food for me and some food and supplies for IFEEL GOOD PARTIES
- $400: emergency funds for unexpected problems. This will go as donation to our 4 pigs if there are no problems on the road.
- $260: Indiegogo processing fee that Indiegogo will take at the end of campaign
- $700: perks + mailing perks (all the incentives listed + mailing them out)

TOTAL COST = $5200

The bottom line is, I need YOUR SUPPORT AND HELP to make this happen! I am not backed by a music label or a general sponsor for my music, videos or projects. That is why I am reaching out to you to help make this project happen.

I NEED YOUR HELP. LET'S MAKE A POSITIVE IMPACT TOGETHER!

I am confident in my ability to give true value to these communities with this tour, but as far as this campaign goes, I need support. I believe that with your help, IFEEL GOOD TOUR can make a powerful positive impact and not only help people feel better, but also help save animal lives. Because vegan lives help animal lives.

Please take a look at the incentives (perks) on the right part of the screen and choose something that you would like to receive. ANY help will be great! Also, please share this link with your friends and people you think might want to support this tour. Help me make a positive impact in 20 communities. I really appreciate your help and hope to see you on the road!

WHAT WILL HAPPEN IF WE REACH MORE THAN THE GOAL

If we happen to collect more funding than our goal, I will expand the tour to more cities, of course! That would be real wild!! The extra funding would also be used for extra promotion of the tour and music video, to have even more impact – during and after the tour is completed.

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

There is always a chance that our goal is not met. In that case, I might not be able to do the tour and will return the funds to everyone. Or if we raise 80% of the goal, I might still do the tour but will visit less cities and have less events. If there are unexpected difficulties and delays during this tour, I will let you know as soon as possible so you know everything that is happening. I promise to keep you informed about this entire tour because it is our project.

Let's make it happen! Thank you.

Dragan (IFEEL)

story:
Summary

Hope for Today is weekly inspiration featuring biblical preaching providing real hope in a real God for real people facing the challenges of real life. Pastor Randy makes the Bible plain with the goal of encouraging people to trust and follow Jesus.

  • Our effort is to complete our fundraising campaign after successfully raising half of our targeted funds in August.
  • Your contributions will at worst double our reach and discipleship and at best triple the effort. This will allow real hope to be shared locally on the radio and nationally/internationally via podcast.

What We Need & What You Get

Our desired need in simple detail:

  • We are looking to raise $9000 that will directly go to the Hope For Today fund to immediately ad an additional programing day to its schedule. This will permit Saturday and Sunday programs to exist back to back at 8am. Please note 100% of all funds we receive will go to pay for this program expansion.
  • We will also be offering free 'Bootcamp for the Last Days' book by Pastor Maxwell in addition to a virtual bible study of the same topic.

story:
The Infringement Festival

BIF is a vital part of Buffalo's art culture, and a summer tradition that's been going strong for 14 years. We have acts that cover theater, music, art, dance, spoken word, film, and even some artists that defy genre categorizations altogether.  All proceeds---cover charges, pass-the-hat donations---go directly to the artists, with the bare minimum set aside to cover technical expenses. We need your financial help to produce the festival program and cover technical expenses.

What We Need & What You Get

We will self-publish and distribute our map and event calendar this year. We also rent PA and stage gear for a limited number of venues.

We still need about $1500, on top of what we've raised through fundraiser concerts.

Every little bit counts. We've never fallen short, and with your help, 2010 will be no different.

Impact

We are the largest (but not the only) festival of our kind. Although the original Infringement Festival was started and is still run in Montreal, QC by one of the original founders, Buffalo's festival is the only one that has expanded to 11 days and 400+ artists.

Your donation supports artists. It allows for works to be presented both in interesting, unique spaces and by artists who do not normally get a lot of exposure. We cover a range of aesthetics, experience-levels, and we allow artists to get out of their comfort zones and present original, new, and challenging work.

Your donation also supports audiences. Without the people who come out to shows, this festival would not continue to exist.

Risks & Challenges

There is always the risk of a budgetary shortfall, or that some venue will suddenly close. Our organizer committee is our biggest strength. Collectively, we have 100+ years of experience making this thing a reality. We are also constantly bringing in new people to help us figure out how to make things happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that you may not be able to help us financially. Here's how you can help us:

  • Share this campaign with your networks.
  • Sign up to be an ongoing Patreon at https://www.patreon.com/InfringeBuffalo
  • Volunteer to help at the festival or in the weeks leading up to it. We'll find something for you to do.
    • We will have a couple volunteer orientations in the weeks leading up to the festival.
    • Join us every first Monday at the Allentown Association at 7pm for our monthly general meeting.
  • Come out and support us. Attend BIF 2019 July 25-August 4!

We cannot do this without you! Thank you so very much.
story_txt:
The Infringement Festival
BIF is a vital part of Buffalo's art culture, and a summer tradition that's been going strong for 14 years. We have acts that cover theater, music, art, dance, spoken word, film, and even some artists that defy genre categorizations altogether.  All proceeds---cover charges, pass-the-hat donations---go directly to the artists, with the bare minimum set aside to cover technical expenses. We need your financial help to produce the festival program and cover technical expenses.

story:
Comics for Everyone

As an ex comic store employee, rogue librarian, and general reader, I've always wanted to see more people reading and enjoying comics. A library seems like the easiest way to do this. We already have a space, shelves, and thousands of comics, but we could do better with more.

Needs & Rewards

We're asking for money that will help us...

  • pay rent.
  • get better shelves and signage.
  • buy more comics!

In return, you (and others) get a membership at the library. Simple enough, right?

Impact

Financial security now will help us look to our future plans, including...

  • paid internships & residencies.
  • better branding & web presence.
  • expanded hours & reduced membership costs.
  • nonprofit status.

Risks & Challenges

If this campaign fails, the library will continue be open until my own money runs out, which is a bummer, but it's a possibility. The hard part's done, though: thousands of books are cataloged and shelved, our lending program is in place, and word is starting to spread

Other Ways to Help

Don't have the money? Don't live in Minneapolis? No problem!

  • Post on social media; you can share right from the campaign.
  • Donate stray comics.
  • Ask about how to get involved as a volunteer!

story:
Lone Star Zine Fest is back for a fourth year on Sunday, March 1st, noon-6pm in the spacious, accessible luxury of the Blue Genie Big Top! This year is going to be the biggest and best fest yet, with over three times as many exhibitors as our last Fest!

The Fest is a free, fun, and engaging event open to the general public and appropriate for all ages. At the heart of the event is an exhibition featuring 70+ zine creators, collectives, distributors, retailers, libraries, and small presses sharing their amazing work and showcasing the diversity of expression made possible by independent- and self-publishing. We invite you to come buy zines directly from the creators, learn about zine libraries and places you can buy zines both locally and online, and even learn to make a zine of your own at our kid-friendly Zine Creation Station!

This year we are celebrating Zine Fest Eve (aka Leap Night: 2/29) with an informal mixer, group zine release party, and zine reading at Buzz Mill Shady! We’ll be hanging out from 7-9pm with an hour-long zine reading starting at 7:30. Come by to celebrate the Eve of the Fest and toast all the zine creators with fresh material out for 2020!

Here are some of the things folks have to say after attending Lone Star Zine Fest:

  • “I liked the variety of exhibitors as well as the zine creation space.”
  • “Great selection/curation of artists, themes, and subject matter.”
  • “I loved the diversity of the zine artists represented and the general vibe of the event. I walked away with amazing art and a warm, fuzzy feeling in my belly. <3”
  • “The energy!! Everyone seemed genuinely happy to be there and open to chatting about their work.”
  • “As a zinester, I loved how open all of the vendors were to trading/looking at my zine! It was awesome to have librarians there as well.”
  • “It made me feel like I was home. Being mixed race and queer doesn’t give you a lot of safe places, but this one felt really special. I’m so happy that people are out here creating this art and spending their time to keep this community growing. I felt inspired and am now working on making a zine to contribute next year!”
  • “I love everything about it, truly.”

Lone Star Zine Fest is organized by a local group of volunteers who are passionate about creating space for zine creators and zine fans to come together. We feel it is important to keep Lone Star Zine Fest free and accessible to as many zine creators and fans as possible. If you are in a position to contribute, we hope you can support this mission with a generous donation so that we can continue to make the Fest better for everyone.

To find out more, please visit lonestarzinefest.org, facebook.com/lonestarzinefest, instagram/lszinefest, or search for #lszinefest.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise at least $1500 through this campaign to cover the cost of the venue and table/chair rental. If we raise more than our goal, the extra money will be spent on increasing accessibility for our exhibitors and volunteers. If we don't reach our entire goal, we’ll still put on a Fest but the organizers will have to pay for some of the Fest’s expenses out of our own pockets. That would suck, but we’d do it. That’s how much we love you. Love us back if you can?

We’ve put together some fun goodies to thank you for your generosity. Depending on your contribution level, you’ll be rewarded with a shout-out on our website, a grab bag of mini-zines (including a fresh edition of Jennifer LaSuprema’s Handy Zine Info for Central Texans), a grab bag of zines and merch donated by this year’s exhibitors, or even a SPECIAL SURPRISE GIFT if you are feeling extra generous!

We are also seeking additional donations of money, goods (for door prizes), and services (like printing, or food for our exhibitors). If you’re interested in connecting with our audience, have an idea for a unique way to support the event as a sponsor, or just want to donate more than $75, please contact the organizers.

The Impact

Despite the fact that zines are experiencing something of a Renaissance right now, there aren’t a lot of places in Austin to buy zines. And there certainly aren’t many opportunities to meet and hang out with zine creators and hear them read from their work! We hope to provide that venue & we need your help to make it comfortable and accessible for as many people as possible.

Last year’s Fest was a big success and we are making it bigger and better this year with 70+ exhibitors in a great space with plenty of light and A/C. With your help, everybody will have a chair to sit in :)

Risks & Challenges

Raising enough money to pay for the venue is the biggest challenge of putting on this event. This is the fourth year of LSZF, so we have a roadmap and plans in place for organizing all the aspects of the event. We aren’t worried about pulling this thing off, we just need a little cash to make it all work.

Other Ways You Can Help

We totally understand if you aren’t in a position to contribute ca$h to this project. (If we were rich, we’d just pay the rent ourselves instead of asking y’all for money!) If you are into helping us pull off this event, please share this campaign on your social media(s). Someone you know might have a little money to throw our way, and all the little contributions really do add up!

We’ll also need volunteers to help out on the day of the Fest, so drop us a note, or follow us on Facebook or Instagram if you wanna get involved, or just stay in the loop.

And most importantly, COME TO THE FEST! and maybe bring someone with you :)

story:
About Fresh Traditions

Fresh Traditions is a nonprofit organization founded in 2006 by Kathy Mouachepao through the Center for Hmong Arts & Talent in Saint Paul, Minnesota. Fresh Traditions was created in the hopes of building a platform for Hmong designers to channel their creativity and inspire younger generations to create fresh and contemporary interpretations of our history and cultural aesthetics. Our programming nurtures and develops Hmong American artists from all over the country in fashion design and branding. Over the years, we have worked with about 100 Hmong designers and captivated over 6,000 people through our annual fashion shows.

Looking for support

As a nonprofit organization, we rely on the community to support us and keep our platform for Hmong fashion alive. Our goal is $5000, which will go towards the production and venue costs. Due to the pandemic, our budget has shrunk but, our dream to provide a magical fashion show experience for the designers and for the attendees has not. Every donation will take us a step closer to making "Once Upon A Time" a dream come true. 

For more information about the Center for Hmong Arts & Talent, visit https://www.aboutchat.org/.

For more information about Fresh Traditions, follow us on social media!

Instagram: @freshtraditionsfashion

Facebook: Fresh Traditions

story:
ABOUT US: 

My name is Camile Elizabeth Messerley, I am a current senior at the Kansas City Art Institute where I am finishing up my thesis project in the converging media and art history department. Over the last two years I have been developing a studio practice based around reciprocal generosity, this simply means that I am devoted to cultivated, rich relationships and uplifting the community around me through the organizing of events and public programs to the curation of exhibitions and performances. This indiegogo campaign has been created to support the events for W/in ~ W/o and the artists taking part and leading projects.

 

W/in ~ W/ois a project stemming from this original concept to better understand the way we as individuals may exchange methods of support with others. W/in ~ W/o: Support + the NeoNoAge is construction project. The construction consists of a breathing archival catalog, a mobile space for community gatherings and artist projects.

 

The questions that I am posing to both myself, my collaborators, and my greater community is—how do we positively construct systems of support within Kansas City, who has a wealth of inspiring communal spaces, and aid in regenerating or join those spaces that are already in place?

 

The concept of the NeoNoAge is what the project is centered on. This is a term that works as a seam between contemporary artists as facilitators who engage with questions of power—power in relation to the agency each one of us holds, as well as a more scientific definition of power, being the rate at which work is performed or energy is expended. Each and every one of us has a set of responsibilities to which we must attend in order to maintain mental, physical, and economic stability. The artists projects developed for this project will build upon already existing community by creating temporary spaces to share knowledge, skills, critical dialogue and energy that can be carried into relationships outside of the W/in ~ W/o space.

 

Primary collaborators and contributors to this project include Izzy Vivas (Coordinator of Communications and Archive), JC Franco (Executive Designer), Kelly Runningen (artist), Silvia Beatriz Abisaab (artist), Skylar Brennan (artist), Lauren Louvel Louise Whitacre (artist), Zane Smith (artist), and 2007 Balquier (artist).

 

Other individuals who have supported and or taken part in the development of this project from sharing advice over coffee to planning and contributing to the project include Madison Leeson, Boi Boy, William Plummer, Cambria Channing Floyd, Kendell Harbin, Molly Spisak, Selina O’Neil and Stefanie Kae Dlugoz-Acton, Sherry Sparks, Lynnette Miranda, Julia Cole, Amy Kligman, Cyan Meeks, Diana Heise, Paige Gordon, Emily Milner, Graham Carroll, B Becvar, Evugh Ohman, Carmen Munoz, Steve Rowell, and Scout Dearth.

 

To all of you I am incredibly thankful.

 

HOW WE WILL USE THE FUNDS: 

Funds from this Indiegogo campaign will go to support the exhibitions and public programming in the space, transportation of the space and artist materials, providing modest stipends to artists, as well as printing costs for the project catalog and archive.

 

With the help of my fellow collaborators, studio mates, professors, and peers this space was designed and built. With their confidence and support in the building of the space we are now asking members of our local and national community for their support as well.

 

W/in ~ W/o has been built entirely out of recycled and alternative building materials to be easily transported and self-sustaining, this spatial design and construction allows for the primary focus of the project to be on supporting the artists involved. Your support today will help make this happen! When you donate you will receive perks and rewards from the projects archive and developing catalog, as well as have the opportunity to get up close and be apart of this project!

 

Although you may not be able to contribute financially to this project we would appreciate you sharing this fundraiser with other folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign by sharing with your friends!

 

TIMELINE: 

These public programs and exhibitions will be taking place throughout March and April, 2018.

story:
CHI SIAMO

Siamo un gruppo di giovani artisti di tutta italia, che ha deciso di fare dell’arte la propria vocazione di vita e che credono che un mondo senza arte smetterebbe di interrogarsi e di sognare e che non avrebbe né interesse nel passato né curiosità per il futuro.

COSA VOGLIAMO FARE

Il 12 maggio 2018 vogliamo dare il via alla prima edizione dell’AlfredClown Festival a Bosconero, un festival di teatro e arti di strada.

LA NOSTRA IDEA

L’idea del Festival nasce da Alfredo, cuore pulsante del nostro gruppo, che grazie alla sua personalità e al suo talento naturale ci ha ispirato, regalato sorrisi e insegnamenti di vita preziosi.

Con il Festival vogliamo coinvolgere la città di Bosconero tutta e farlo diventare il pretesto per sfogare l’identità clownesca di tutti coloro che parteciperanno.

Un giorno di grande festa in cui tutto sia consentito, in cui si possa giocare seriamente, come una piccola finestra colorata da cui guardare il mondo con occhi diversi!

COME VOGLIAMO FARLO

Per fare questo non ci interessa lavorare da soli ma vogliamo provare a coinvolgere attivamente tutto il paese e chiunque voglia dare il suo contributo. Vogliamo attivare logiche comunitarie, coinvolgere associazioni locali, categorie sociali di ogni tipo e chiunque condivida con noi i nostri stessi intenti in un’ottica di libero lavoro e libero scambio. Crediamo che questa possa essere un’occasione di crescita importante individuale e collettiva, sia per noi che per Bosconero!

Partendo dal basso ed essendo la nostra prima edizione, abbiamo deciso di lanciare sul web una campagna di crowdfunding per finanziare il nostro progetto!
Ma abbiamo bisogno anche del tuo contributo.

 

ECCO COSA VOGLIAMO FARE CON I SOLDI CHE DONERETE:

- sostenere e accogliere tutti gli artisti del cartellone coinvolti;

- creare un allestimento scenografico con materiali ecologici e/o di riciclo all’interno di un’area   della città scelta appositamente per il Festival;

- sostenere le spese di produzione di tutto il materiale promozionale, di comunicazione e di grafica;

- creare uno stand all’interno del Festival e organizzare la “Merenda Sinoira”: una degustazione di prodotti tipici del territorio;

- organizzare attività e laboratori per bambini;

- rimborsare le spese di viaggi e spostamenti di tutto lo staff.

 

DUNQUE PERCHÈ FINANZIARE PROPRIO NOI?

Perché prima dei soldi crediamo nel potere delle persone, perché ci piace sognare, perché vogliamo farvi divertire, perché crediamo di poter fare un buon lavoro di connessione con il territorio e tutta la comunità bosconerese, perché vogliamo provare a farvi vedere cos’è il teatro di strada in maniera professionale.

Vogliamo che L’Alfred Clown Festival abbia una continuità, che cresca sempre di più negli anni e che questo primo esperimento ci dia l’opportunità di creare edizioni future sempre più grandi e più strutturate!

Il 12 maggio ci immaginiamo Bosconero invasa da artisti in ogni angolo della città, musica e colori, ci immaginiamo di far indossare un naso rosso a tutti gli spettatori del festival facendoli tornare un po’ bambini. Che tutti, nessuno escluso, vengano contagiati dalla sana stupidità tipica del clown!

Siamo un gruppo di giovani artisti di tutta italia, che ha deciso di fare dell’arte la propria vocazione di vita e che credono che un mondo senza arte smetterebbe di interrogarsi e di sognare e che non avrebbe né interesse nel passato né curiosità per il futuro.
COSA VOGLIAMO FARE
Il 12 maggio 2018 vogliamo dare il via alla prima edizione dell’AlfredClown Festival a Bosconero, un festival di teatro e arti di strada.
LA NOSTRA IDEA
L’idea del Festival nasce da Alfredo, cuore pulsante del nostro gruppo, che grazie alla sua personalità e al suo talento naturale ci ha ispirato, regalato sorrisi e insegnamenti di vita preziosi.
Con il Festival vogliamo coinvolgere la città di Bosconero tutta e farlo diventare il pretesto per sfogare l’identità clownesca di tutti coloro che parteciperanno.
Un giorno di grande festa in cui tutto sia consentito, in cui si possa giocare seriamente, come una piccola finestra colorata da cui guardare il mondo con occhi diversi!
COME VOGLIAMO FARLO
Per fare questo non ci interessa lavorare da soli ma vogliamo provare a coinvolgere attivamente tutto il paese e chiunque voglia dare il suo contributo. Vogliamo attivare logiche comunitarie, coinvolgere associazioni locali, categorie sociali di ogni tipo e chiunque condivida con noi i nostri stessi intenti in un’ottica di libero lavoro e libero scambio. Crediamo che questa possa essere un’occasione di crescita importante individuale e collettiva, sia per noi che per Bosconero!
Partendo dal basso ed essendo la nostra prima edizione, abbiamo deciso di lanciare sul web una campagna di crowdfunding per finanziare il nostro progetto!Ma abbiamo bisogno anche del tuo contributo.
 
ECCO COSA VOGLIAMO FARE CON I SOLDI CHE DONERETE:
- sostenere e accogliere tutti gli artisti del cartellone coinvolti;
- creare un allestimento scenografico con materiali ecologici e/o di riciclo all’interno di un’area   della città scelta appositamente per il Festival;
- sostenere le spese di produzione di tutto il materiale promozionale, di comunicazione e di grafica;
- creare uno stand all’interno del Festival e organizzare la “Merenda Sinoira”: una degustazione di prodotti tipici del territorio;
- organizzare attività e laboratori per bambini;
- rimborsare le spese di viaggi e spostamenti di tutto lo staff.
 
DUNQUE PERCHÈ FINANZIARE PROPRIO NOI?
Perché prima dei soldi crediamo nel potere delle persone, perché ci piace sognare, perché vogliamo farvi divertire, perché crediamo di poter fare un buon lavoro di connessione con il territorio e tutta la comunità bosconerese, perché vogliamo provare a farvi vedere cos’è il teatro di strada in maniera professionale.
Vogliamo che L’Alfred Clown Festival abbia una continuità, che cresca sempre di più negli anni e che questo primo esperimento ci dia l’opportunità di creare edizioni future sempre più grandi e più strutturate!
Il 12 maggio ci immaginiamo Bosconero invasa da artisti in ogni angolo della città, musica e colori, ci immaginiamo di far indossare un naso rosso a tutti gli spettatori del festival facendoli tornare un po’ bambini. Che tutti, nessuno escluso, vengano contagiati dalla sana stupidità tipica del clown!

story:
The roar of rumba. The aroma of cafecitos. The swirl of color. There’s nothing more Miami than Little Havana.

That’s why we at the National Trust for Historic Preservation, in collaboration with Heineken USA, want to show the world who—and what—makes this vibrant place so riveting. With your support, people everywhere will see Little Havana as they never have before, at a time when the neighborhood needs it most.

Always swaying to a rhythm all its own, Little Havana is the heart of Miami and a cherished symbol of the American melting pot. From its role as a haven for Cuban Americans to its more recent position as a home to immigrants from Central America and the Caribbean, Little Havana has been shaped by generations of people making a new life for themselves. In doing so, they have created a place so beautiful in its complexity that it’s now one of the biggest tourist destinations in the country.

But it’s not just the people that make Little Havana so endearing. This bustling neighborhood is also home to untouched, uniquely Miami architecture. Block after block, Little Havana's streets are lined with charming, historic houses and churches, including a collection of Art Deco buildings that rivals those of South Beach. And of course, there’s the undeniable energy and exuberance of its main drag, Calle Ocho.

Unfortunately, all this could soon change in a big way.

Despite everything that makes it so rich, Little Havana is currently facing intense development pressure that, if left unchecked, could forever destroy its historic character and displace its longtime residents. We can’t let that happen.

That's why we want to team up with Miami artists to capture what makes Little Havana worth saving. Each artist will use his or her chosen medium to capture the sights, sounds, tastes, and smells of Little Havana and showcase this diverse community as a vital representation of Miamian and Cuban cultures.

Together, these artists will take to the streets to document the daily lives of Little Havana’s residents—the homes where they live, the coffee windows they patronize, the people they visit, and the places they love. Through their photos and words, the artists will tell the true story of Little Havana. In the end, this rare glimpse into the grit of a neighborhood will be exhibited for everyone to see—and to celebrate.

Success! We're happy to report that our campaign raised $38,270! That's $23,270 above our original goal of $15,000!

Thanks to the generous support of our backers, we’ll soon be able to tell the story of Little Havana and its residents like never before. 

Please stay tuned to the updates section of this page for additional project news.

I claimed tickets to the Bruno Mars: 24K Magic World Tour as my perk and have questions.

Thank you for supporting our project! You will find answers to your questions in our FAQ. If you have specific questions about how to redeem your tickets, please email fulfillment@lifeinmobile.com. Enjoy the show!

What is the National Trust for Historic Preservation?

The National Trust for Historic Preservation, a privately funded nonprofit organization, works to save America’s historic places. We are the cause that inspires Americans to save the places where history happened. The cause that connects us to our diverse pasts, weaving a multi-cultural nation together. The cause that transforms communities from places where we live into places that we love. As the leading voice for preservation, we are the cause for people saving places.

Our mission is to protect significant places representing our diverse cultural experience by taking direct action and inspiring broad public support.

Where is my donation going?

More than 90% of all funds raised will support the cities' projects and the National Trust’s ongoing work to save historic places in Miami and around the country. Up to 10% will cover Indiegogo costs and processing fees as described in Indiegogo’s Terms and Conditions.

When will I get my perk (non-ticket)?

Perks will be delivered later this summer (July/August).

Can I visit the project site?

Yes! Little Havana in Miami is warm, sunny, and welcoming all year round and has many shops, stores, and activities for everyone to enjoy.

When will the project be complete?

Saving places takes time! But with your generous support, we hope to get the Little Havana project completed as soon as possible.

How do I get support for my project? Or can I submit a project for consideration?

We at the National Trust are always interested in hearing about what is important to you. Although we may not be able to save it immediately, you can always contact your state’s historic preservation office and see how you can get started on the road to preservation!

Is the National Trust involved in other restoration projects?

Yes! We’re the country’s leading advocate for saving historic places. As such, we’re on the ground in communities across the nation. Visit our website to explore other National Treasures like the Little Havana.

Media Inquiries:

For further media inquiries about these projects, check out our Press Center.

My question wasn’t answered above. Who can I contact?

First, please see the full FAQ for the Cities Project.

If you have questions about the projects or how to claim perks other than tickets, please email cities@savingplaces.org.

If you have questions about how to redeem your tickets, please email  fulfillment@lifeinmobile.com.

If you have questions about the Cities Project, please email corporaterelations@heinekenusa.com.

story:
What is POMADA?

  • It is a queer culture festival which takes place in Warsaw.

  • It is an independent initiative organized by artists, curators, producers, enthusiasts of nonheteronormative mazes of human desire and anyone who wants to participate.

  • It includes an exhibition, performances, concerts, film screenings and parties.

 

What do we do?

Since 2010 we have been inviting people to nonheteronormative meetings. We discuss the body, sexuality, alternative family concepts, functioning in the public sphere, the media, queer spirituality. POMADA is created thanks to the combined efforts of many volunteers as well as organizations and institutions, which support the initiative through their involvement.

This year the slogan SEX, LIES AND VIDEOTAPES takes us to the past and to the future, which both require some thorough queering. Does Poland have any queer heritage and if so, what is it?

We won’t be able to answer this question without your help!

Our goal is to raise funds necessary to create an artistic program which will stand out against heteronormative artistic events organized in Poland – mainly exhibitions at public institutions and art galleries. Currently it is difficult to find at least one cultural proposition which would be openly queer.

Help us organize three completely queer days in Warsaw, during which you will take part in free artistic events.

 

What will POMADA 7 include?

The HERITAGE exhibition, where 19th and 20th century writers, secret revolutionaries, contemporary and past artists will reveal stories which the Polish society – shamed – blocked out.

*

The event SZYMANOWSKI & THE BOYFRIENDS will liven up the 18th century palace with the great composer Karol Szymanowski’s music. “Roxana’s Song” from King Roger, The Swan or Mazurkas will be performed by the (Dwóch) głos duo.

*

During the NIGHT WITH VIDEOTAPES we will show a curious collection of adult films made available by Krzysztof Jung. The videotapes, which the neo avant-garde artist brought to Poland in the 1980s, will inspire the performative night meeting with porn.

*

In order to present the practices of queering history we will show, for the first time in Poland, films by Colombian artist CARLOS MOTTA. The artist, who recovers the queer heritage of pre-Columbian history, has already exhibited his work at New York’s The New Museum and MoMA PS1 as well as at London’s Tate Modern, among others.

*

You will be able to join us for performative tours of the Heritage exhibition, which will liven up our queer archive. The artists will merge their private stories and fascinations with works of masters, and reinterpret passages from Polish literature.

*

“Life, my dear, lasts as long as a dance!” During POMADA’S final evening artists from Warsaw and Berlin will present, with their dance concert MAKE QUEER FUTURE AGAIN, fragments of their works from the past and the future, concerning time, history and provisional utopias. Will we recognize queer when it returns?

You can read more about the program and the festival guests at: www.pomadapomada.pl.

 

Why is organizing POMADA so important now?

The current situation in Poland – governed by a populist-rightist party, which has been continuously attempting at curtailing civil rights – is resulting in a clear violation of democratic liberties. The government is trying to exert pressure on NGOs, threatening their existence, which directly affects the LGBTQ community in terms of both legal regulations and their well-being. It causes us great concern to see growing consent for hate speech in the public sphere, most often targeted against minorities. At the same time, the authorities have been making attempts at manipulating history, writing it anew, with voices of nonheteronormative individuals or movements being not so much marginalized, as completely ignored. In the current situation we can’t really count on official funding for cultural events which openly tackle queer or feminist issues – that is why it is so crucial, in this difficult time for Poland, to provide financial support to the festival.

 

What will we do with the money?

As a self-organizing team we are for the first time openly asking for financial support in order to make POMADA 7 a reality. The funds which you will provide will, first and foremost, allow us to cover the travel and accommodation expenses of artists coming from outside of Warsaw and the costs of the organization of the exhibition and the accompanying events (transportation, printing posters and flyers, promotion, set design, equipment rental). Apart from barter support provided by cultural institutions, POMADA does not have any budget. It is a non-profit festival which offers free access to all of its cultural events. Without your help the beautiful and strong POMADA will have to be significantly scaled down.

What else can you do?

We will also appreciate any non-financial form of promotional support – share our campaign with your acquaintances and friends, LGBTQ people and anyone queer-friendly. If we collect more money we will use it to oragnize POMADA 8 next year.

Let’s write our own history, let’s take action, be together!

 

http://www.pomadapomada.pl

https://www.facebook.com/PomadaFestival

https://twitter.com/PomadaFestival

story:
What is “Art of hitchhiking”?

 Art of Hitchhiking - a collection of works inspired by the roads, is an exhibition that would take place in Warsaw in May.

The event will gather 15 artists from 11 countries coming with artworks reflecting on the subject of hitchhiking. Each artist comes with its own experience of hitchhiking and its own focus such as hitchhikers, drivers, their stories, the chaos of the journey or the fragility felt by the hitchhikers...

Selected art projects vary from black and white analog photos to installations and clothes design. Please visit our website to get to know the artists and their works.

The exhibition will take place in Warsztat Warszawa, a very active cultural center located in the heart of Warsaw. 

 

Be one of our sponsor and receive an artwork

We need 1300€ to make it happens.

This money will be used very efficiently for printing and mailing of the art pieces, setting up the exhibition, communication and advertising campaigns etc.

***

Summary of our budget:

Communication in Warsaw (Posters & flyers): 272€

Communication in the exhibition (Leaflets, Kakemono, boards): 205€

Print and framing of artist's photos and visuals: 208€

Mailing the artist's pieces: 160€

Vernissage: 70€

Rent of the Exhibition's room: 0€

Arstists' and  organisators' remunaration: 0€

Indiegogo's perks and fees: 392€

Total: 1307€

***

In hitchhiking, every ride, whatever the distance, can be decisive. Similarly, each of your contribution will bring us closer to our goal.
Because we value a lot your help, we prepared unique perks to thank you. According to what you give, you can receive:

  • 6 Postcards with our artworks (20€)
  • The brochure presenting the exhibition (30€)
  • A screenprinted t-shirt designed by one of our artist (40€)
  • A silverprint made in a traditional fashion in a darkroom (100€)

In  all perks, shipping is included!

If we do not reach our goal, we would have to cut on communication, solicit more the artists, and have less freedom, not being able to exploit all the potential of the project. It would really be really a pity!

And if we get more funds, we would be able to make more communication and  would have more freedom in the setup of the exhibition.

Help us to start an artistic reflection on hitchhiking

Contemporary artists inspired by hitchhiking were never gathered in one exhibition, that is why the collection of works we seek to exhibit will not leave anyone indifferent.

It promotes more than just the idea of hitchhiking as a way of travelling but also common values such as mutual trust, adventure, freedom of spirit, solidarity, creativity and human exchanges within different generations or society classes.

Exhibition's entrance will be free.

We found the place and talented artists, your contribution is now needed for the realization of the project.

 

Some thumbs on Facebook and on the roads

Two easy ways to help us to promote our project:

  • Follow us on Facebook, join the event and share our project within your network
  • Speak about our exhibition on the roads

Acknowledgements

This crowdfinding video has been fully realized by Robin Aiche. He is currently shooting a documentary about hitchhiking, in French, and is also running a crowdfinding campaign until the end of March. More info on the Facebook page of the documentary.

story:
TALENT TIME NEEDS YOUR HELP

Talent Time is special. Its unique brand of irreverent humour doesn’t work so well in the world of corporate sponsorships or government grants. We don’t want to have to tone down and behave, and we know our fans don’t want us to either. This crowdfunding campaign is our best shot at making a go of it so, if you love Talent Time just the way it is and you want to show your support, please donate!

 

I’ve always been curious about normal people with intriguing hobbies and I’m drawn to unique personalities, ones that others might consider strange. And people expressing themselves simply for the pure pleasure of being alive! These people are often ignored by shiny mainstream entertainment.

Talent Time cuts through the boredom of people trying to be something they’re not, or trying to be fancy, and gets to the heart of what makes people want to share their passions in the first place. We dig into what makes raw expression so captivating. 

Paul Anthony’s Talent Time launched 2008 in the basement of the Biltmore Cabaret in Vancouver, BC. Canada. Within 6 months we were shooting the live show and editing it into half-hour episodes that aired on public access television.  Things were going well... until last year, when Shaw TV cancelled all community programming.  We are still being broadcast on Novus TV but they are a smaller company and don’t have the equipment we need. 

Talent Time is a crazy undertaking...shooting for grandiose production, virtually every month for a decade without any real budget? It has only been possible because people saw what I was doing and felt passionate that Talent Time had to continue. They felt it was important to celebrate our differences with ridiculous fun.  

On the surface, this show shouldn't work. There are too many contrasting elements. On any other show putting a comedian on after a marching band would be death. It's the open honesty and genuine spectacle that allow it all to come together. 

 

The Nitty-Gritty

We are only crowd funding for the actual cost of renting all the camera gear, headsets, video mixer, sound technician, BNC cable etc for 9 episodes. We are prepared to pay for all other costs with what we collect from the door. 

If we can raise $11k we can rent the gear necessary to do an 11th season. If we don't raise $11k all your donations will be returned and Talent Time throws in the towel for good.

However! If we can raise $17k we can BUY most of the gear necessary to produce the show into infinity.

If we own the gear we won't have to struggle every month... we won't have to beg, borrow, and steal to make one show happen at a time. Struggling so much has affected the quality of some episodes. If we can be self-sufficient we can put all our focus and resources into making Talent Time bigger and better, forever!

This show isn't easy to do, but my incredible crew & I are dedicated to bringing you rare and spectacular entertainment. We have the skill and passion. All we need is your support. Together we can do this!

We're not just begging for money, we have some great perks to offer you too:

- You can sit in with the house band on an instrument of your choice!

- We all know how tricky it can be to fit a hair cut into our busy schedules. Get your hair cut at the Rio while waiting for the show to begin from our hair sponsors Craft Academy Salon!

- Out-of-towners? Apart from various "endorphin rush" packages and "Talent Time Forever" shirts you can choose a theme for a show we must produce, provide the video loop for the monitor in my desk, or become a producer! All producers will have business cards made for them with the Talent Time logo, your position and name. There is no telling the value of this perk in all the free lunches you could also win!

- New gift certificates added weekly from local businesses wanting to help. This is a great option to support the show while receiving a comparable value in good & services.

- Many more perks on the perk page, with new ones added often so please check back frequently. 

What Talent Time Means

I've received so many emails and phone calls over the years from people and groups whose experiences on Talent Time have enriched their life so much that they felt compelled to reach out.

Groups like Antique Gold; who were named Best Senior Citizen Barbershop Quartet in world (2006). They were nervous beforehand, worried the crowd wouldn't like them as it was a younger audience than they were used to playing for. Afterwards, they said Talent Time was the best audience they had ever experienced. The support and appreciation – standing ovation and selfies with people – was unexpected and gave them a sense of belonging that they hadn't felt in a while.

The good news is…8 episodes of Talent Time have been picked up by Amazon’s Prime Video who boast 80 million subscribers.  Also a partial archive has been picked up by virtually every public library in North America through Hoopla. This is just proof that people are connecting with it and want to see more.  But Amazon is not producing new episodes of our show so if we want to go further, we need to do it ourselves.

The media have also been very supportive of the show. Here are some selected quotes:

"Something of a phenomenon" - The Vancouver Sun

“There is no funner night out ” - The Georgia Straight

"Talent Time is the most innovative, raucus, totally silly and inspired show I have seen in years.  Watching it is like freebasing sheer fun!"  - Matthew Hays, independent journalist for the Globe & Mail/CBC Arts Online)

"I just loved it.  You don't see this kind of show in Vancouver.  I highly recommend it." - Jaeny Baik, CBC Radio

"The single best live event in Vancouver...an unforgettable - epic even - night of entertainment" - Bob Kronbauer, Vancouver Is Awesome

"A cult phenomenon that’s been flying under the radar...since 2008. A true comedy original. Talent Time defies genre. You have to experience it to truly appreciate it." - The Georgia Straight 

We are living in very unsettling times. I think the question becomes: what do you want to see more of in the world?  I think it’s important to oppose terrible things happening in our society but I believe it’s equally important to then focus your energy on things that cultivate positive momentum and connection. We cannot give into the politics of division. Community celebrations are actually a powerful political act.

 

We Need Your Help...

...And we'll take whatever we can get!

We've been successfully pulling off strong shows virtually every month for a decade. We've proven that we can do this. I've been putting on a version of this show my whole life. It's maybe the only thing I know how to do. We have a very talented rotating cast and crew. We have an audience for both the live show & the TV show. We have great local businesses supporting us through with goods & services. We have received nothing but glowing reviews from the media and we are just on the precipice of being noticed on a much larger scale. To throw in the towel now would be so depressing.  

All we need is a lil' bit of moolah.

If you can’t help with money right now but you have some skills or energy you want to contribute, please reach out. If all you are able to do right now is share this campaign, that is still something…Please don’t let it stop here. This is our last resort for survival and we need all the help we can get.

Thanks for all your support!!

Yer pal,
Paul Anthony
story_txt:
TALENT TIME NEEDS YOUR HELP
Talent Time is special. Its unique brand of irreverent humour doesn’t work so well in the world of corporate sponsorships or government grants. We don’t want to have to tone down and behave, and we know our fans don’t want us to either. This crowdfunding campaign is our best shot at making a go of it so, if you love Talent Time just the way it is and you want to show your support, please donate!
 
I’ve always been curious about normal people with intriguing hobbies and I’m drawn to unique personalities, ones that others might consider strange. And people expressing themselves simply for the pure pleasure of being alive! These people are often ignored by shiny mainstream entertainment.
Talent Time cuts through the boredom of people trying to be something they’re not, or trying to be fancy, and gets to the heart of what makes people want to share their passions in the first place. We dig into what makes raw expression so captivating. 
Paul Anthony’s Talent Time launched 2008 in the basement of the Biltmore Cabaret in Vancouver, BC. Canada. Within 6 months we were shooting the live show and editing it into half-hour episodes that aired on public access television.  Things were going well... until last year, when Shaw TV cancelled all community programming.  We are still being broadcast on Novus TV but they are a smaller company and don’t have the equipment we need. 
Talent Time is a crazy undertaking...shooting for grandiose production, virtually every month for a decade without any real budget? It has only been possible because people saw what I was doing and felt passionate that Talent Time had to continue. They felt it was important to celebrate our differences with ridiculous fun.  
On the surface, this show shouldn't work. There are too many contrasting elements. On any other show putting a comedian on after a marching band would be death. It's the open honesty and genuine spectacle that allow it all to come together.

story:
How did this project start? Our history and our mission

PlaceMates — it’s a project about loving Russia. It started with my wish to see the good in our country and tell people from all over the world about it. A few years ago I went to Iceland for 3 months to work at a guest house, to learn about another country’s culture. While there, I often met stereotypes that people from the other countries attribute to Russia. Any discussion about our country would quickly devolve into politics. But politics is just one part of a country. The most important part are its people. And so the idea was born to tell about Russia through the stories of real people that live here. Those who are ready to welcome guests and share with them their own experiences, their culture, show them unique places and teach new things. From the very beginning I had the support of my ex-coworkers Maria and Anton, my friends,  and my family.

Little by little, the project grew; the website came along and so did the first members of the project. Over the span of a year I made a long and difficult (but exceptionally interesting) journey: at the moment our website features two cities, Novosibirsk and Saint-Petersburg, and 40 activities with the locals. Our project now has a small team. We have launched the stories section, acquired partners. I don’t intend to stop on that; after all, we have big dreams and a clear goal in mind, that, which we hope you can share with us.

I dream that one day PlaceMates will have made a great many people get to know each other. I dream that they make a lot of great memories together, so that the travellers would want to visit again and the locals would be glad to have new guests. I deeply believe that heartfelt companionship can break the most robust stereotypes; that mutual understanding of another’s culture can help achieve peace. And, to understand, first you need to make an acquaintance.

And that’s why we really need your support!

 

What do we need the financial support for?
We want to offer the best possible service, make it easy to access and make it maximally useful. So, first of all, we need the funds for:

  • creating a fully functional website

We’d like for it to be possible, with the help of PlaceMates, to see on the inside of as many Russian cities as possible. And so, in addition to the already available Novosibirsk and Saint-Petersburg, we’re planning to:

  • add three new cities to choose from, with local guides and tours

The locals are not only the experts on their own city, but also skilled craftsmen that create amazing, truly authentic souvenirs. And that’s exactly why we want to:

  • launch a gift shop to sell souvenirs made by Russian artisans

We have great plans for the future! And to realize them, we need to:

  • gather a great team for the project.

 

The perks

We thought, what would we bring as a gift from Russia to our foreign friends? What souvenirs could best tell about our culture? For a few months we’d been searching for people that would make authentic, tasty and pretty little things; the tastiest tea, homemade Pastila, pine cone jam, mittens with ethnic ornaments and many more. So were created our parcels.

You can order a parcel and try out our traditional delicacies, make additions to your interior or gather friends and organize a Russian tea party! Artisans from all corners of Russia are glad to share with you a piece of their culture. Every week we will share stories about these people on our social media pages. Follow us so you will never miss a thing! 

 

 

Among our friends and partners there’s a notable project — The Great Baikal Trail. It’s a project run by volunteers; its objective is to make the trail around Lake Baikal safe, eco-friendly and easy to use. A share from our crowd funding campaign will go towards the development of this wonderful project.

 

 

Having been inspired by the classical Russian literature (and we know that it has admirers all over the world), we’ve created a collection featuring quotes of the great literary authors. And as a result of creative cooperation with female artists from Saint-Petersburg Vera and Polina, we offer prints on stylish and comfortable clothes. 

 

 

We’d like to express our gratitude to our friends: journalist Paul Richardson and photographer Michail Mordasov; their book can be acquired as a reward. Paul’s been publishing his magazine Russian Life for over 20 years, and in 2015 he and Michael made a journey of 6000 kilometers, resulting in the creation of this book. It’s a vivid portrait of modern Russian life, and includes over 40 environmental portraits of “heroes” interviewed in depth by the journalists, each of whom was asked the timely question: "Do you consider yourself a patriot, and if so, of what and why?"

 

 

In case you or someone of your friends is planning a trip to Russia, we’d be glad to welcome you in Saint-Petersburg and Novosibirsk. Gift certificates offer participation in 1, 3 or 5 activities — a great way to begin (or to continue) learning about our country. You could also buy a Membership card and book activities at low prices.

 

WE ARE WAITING FOR YOU!

 

How else can you help PlaceMates?

If you like our project but don't have the means to offer financial support, you could take part in the global community of PlaceMates! 

• Follow us on Facebook and tell your friends — the more people learn about PlaceMates, the better! 

• Simply tell your friends (after all, the more people learn about PlaceMates, the better)

• Follow us on Instagram

• Share the link to our group in your social media of choice and Indiegogo

 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR ATTENTION!!!

story:
Who We Are

Heart & Mind Festival is a quarterly festival founded by elder Maestro Manuel Rufino of M.A.I.S.C,, A.U.M., the Golden Drum, and the Sacred Arts Research Foundation. .

Heart & Mind Festival invites elders, teachers, indigenous wisdom keepers, and people devoted to the consciousness movement worldwide to come together and offer their visions, wisdom, and traditional ways. 

Heart & Mind Festival is a transformational global movement.

Heart & Mind Festival is held in multiple locations around the globe including New York, London, and Poland. This year we plan on expanding to other countries throughout the world, including Canada, Iceland, and Austria

Our Campaign

This Summer Solstice festival will feature an incredible lineup of indigenous elders and spiritual leaders from around the world including:

  • Chief Arvol Looking Horse and Paula Looking Horse, White Buffalo Calf Pipe Bundle Keeper of theSioux Nation
  • Deepak Chopra, World-Renowned Pioneer in Integrative Medicine and Transformation
  • Maestro Domingo Dias Porta and Maria Guadalupe Abundis de Dias, Founder of the Association of the Solar American Indian (M.A.I.S.) and “Acción por la Unidad Mundial” (A.U.M. - Action for Global Unity)
  • Maestro Manual Rufino, Taino Elder and World Director of M.A.I.S.C.
  • Joanne Shenandoah, Grammy Award Winner and Member of the Wolf Clan, Oneida Nation
  • Grandmother Clara Soaring Hawk, Deer Clan Chief of the Ramapough-Lenape Nation
  • Sister Vivian Papson, Founder of the Council of Women A.U.M.
  • Alex and Allyson Grey, Artists and Co-foudners of the Chapel of Sacred Mirrors
  • Rabbi Yom Tov Glasser, Senior Rabbi at Aish Hatorah Jerusalem
  • Tata Pedro Cruz, Member of the Mayan Council of the Elders of Tz’utujil
  • Nana Marina Cruz, Mayan healer from the Tz'utujil
  • Melanie Stoneman and Mary Ann Bear Heels, Sicangu Lakotas from Rosebud, South Dakota
  • Kumu Hula Ali'i Kahuna Nui Ehulani, Ali'i Kahuna Nui (high priestess) from Hawaii
  • Yube Huni Kuin and Yawa Bane Huni Kuin from Brazil
  • Tito La Rosa, Descendant of Quechua Indians of the Peruvian Andes
  • Theresa Bear Fox, Haudenosaunee, Wolf Clan
  • Kevin Nathaniel, Scholar of the House of Yale University​
  • More to be announced!

Due to the expenses associated with bringing the above presenters to New York city, ticket sales for the event are currently by donation. We would like to continue to make this event accessible to all people, which is why we are asking for your support!

What We Need

Your contribution to this cause will help us to cover the expenses for:

  • Flights
  • Accommodations
  • Space rental 
  • Professional sound and lighting
  • Meals
  • Transportation
  • Advertising

What You Will Get

  • For those that wish to attend, your donation will reserve your place at the event and help make sure that anyone who does not have the funds to attend, can still participate
  • For those that cannot attend, you will receive a recording of the event and access to livestream certain moments of the festival.
  • More perks to come including CDs, handcrafted art, remote healing sessions, yoga classes (in person and remote). 

The Impact

We know that when incredible people come together to pray for a cause, the effect is felt around the world. This is why we want to bring everyone mentioned above to the event and have as many people attend as possible.

  • We have a successful track record of sold out events, including this past March in collaboration with The Rubin Museum of Art. 
  • More past events can be viewed here: https://www.heartandmindfestival.org/festivals 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute financially you can still help by sharing the festival on social media via the link below:

  • https://www.facebook.com/events/591878574648720/​
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to promote the campaign!
