Other Ways You Can Help
If this idea excites you please tell your friends, family and community about it.  Please join in spreading the word.  Thank you!

story:
TheWaysBeyond 2.0


>>Version en français en bas de page<<


No matter who you are or where you are from, Culture connects us all.  Whichever boundary life might bring onto our paths, Culture remains a place for exchange and dialogue.
For centuries French creation and art-de-vivre have been radiating and influencing the entire world. Today whether with ancestral practices or cutting-edge technology the French Touch perpetuates the tradition of Excellence in the works of women and men dedicated to their passion. TheWaysBeyond was born out of the idea of exploring the backstage of French creation and give you a closer look at it during unique experiences based on Excellence and Exchange.

After one year of selecting and organizing activities for individuals, we decided to launch the first Cultural Learning Expeditions based in Paris – an upgraded version of our service that goes deeper into the discovery of culture and creativity.  This future flagship product is open to corporates, institutions and groups of individuals, to bring positive impact and inspiration to a broader public.

 

The First Cultural Learning Expeditions based in Paris

With Cultural Learning Expeditions you get out of your usual routine and enter the unexpected through meeting, exchange and experience. It is a moment to learn from creative minds, from your friends or your team members and also from yourselves.
 

Positivity & Fulfilment: 2 Birds, 1 Stone

By engaging in Culture and Heritage, companies play an essential role in society. Today, facing the increasing phenomenon of "burn-out" or "bore-out", many though are striving to give back meaning to their employees. While some have already understood that Art and Culture can be the surprising element that energizes and inspires their teams. With TheWaysBeyond, you can bring back positivity and fulfilment to your organizations and revitalize your staff with the inherent strength of Art and Culture.

From a refreshing way of celebrating to a team-building, a 1-day city break or a 7-day journey, our ​Cultural Learning Expeditions are both a creative retreat and an open-air school, as we focus on the valuable role Culture can play to surprise, reward and inspire.

 

What We Have Achieved In One Year

Since we launched TheWaysBeyond 12 months ago, our efforts have started to bear fruits: 

  • We have tested numerous activities in order to select the best, and organize punctual events for individuals and private groups;
  • Many agencies, platforms, cultural institutions, artists, designers and foundations came to us to integrate our network;
  • German publisher Travel Colours contacted us to curate their Paris City Guide for Design Lovers, presenting the newest generation of Parisian hospitality;
  • We were invited to the National Assembly to discuss entrepreneurship in Culture with Parisian deputies, and to the Sorbonne University to exchange with Master students in Tourism.
     

All the support and confirmation have only convinced us even more of the meaning and the importance of what we are doing.  Yet, like many other young companies, TheWaysBeyond is still not profitable and this is where you can help. Because with your help, we can ride on the wave and definitely spread Culture towards a larger public!
 

 

What More Could Be Said About Paris?

Paris is the most visited city in the world. It is so striking, yet at the same time so invisible. But as we were both born and bred in different countries, we are still discovering Paris with the eyes of outsiders. With TheWaysBeyond, you will confront yourself to French culture from the inside, but also from the outside! Especially as for us, Paris is not only about luxury or romanticism – what we want to show you goes beyond the clichés; it is about the people, the heritage, the future and the things we all seem to know, but sometimes tend to forget.

  • Did you know for example that a member of the Rothschild family created a foundation in the early 20th cent. that is still active today to support young French artists?
  • Did you know that young craftsmen were bringing back to life old French brands that have been asleep for centuries?
  • Or have you ever imagined there could be a flower farm at the very heart of Paris and even an urban farm along the Champs Élysées?
     

These are but a few questions we want to answer for you, to show you history in the making, with passionate people and everlasting creative energy.
 

 

Why We Need You

After a year trying out our offer, we would like to raise €12,600 to launch TheWaysBeyond 2.0, an upgraded version of our current offer. Your contribution is crucial for us to broaden our portfolio, propose greater experiences, and raise awareness from companies and institutions. 

These €12,600 will be used as follows:

  • €4000 / Offer Development: We will go hunt for more hidden gems in Paris and beyond  (2 hours away from Paris) to propose you the best this territory can offer. 
  • €4000 / Client Development:  Marketing, fairs and international exposure.
  • €4000 / Upgrading our Website: Optimisation of the booking system; Work on the SEO compliance…
  • €600 / Indiegogo Fee.


All these changes, YOU, dear contributors, can help us achieve!
 

 

What We Offer In Return

First of all, a major thanks to all our (future) backers!

Plus, every backer will automatically join TheWaysBeyond Culture Club! Membership allows you to get a 10% discount on all our activities and to access, 3 times per year, very special events organized for TheWaysBeyond Culture Club! We will also share invitations, good plans and our picks of the month, from gastronomy to exhibitions.

  • Perk 1 / €10: You become a member of TheWaysBeyond Culture Club and receive a personal thank you e-mail.
  • Perk 2 / €20: You receive Perk #1 + a TheWaysBeyond tote-bag
  • Perk 3 / €50: You receive Perk #1 + our Paris City Guide for Design Lovers 
  • Perk 4 / €100: You receive Perk #3 + 2 tickets for any future activity
  • Perk 5 / €250: You receive Perk #3 + a private discovery walk of a Paris district (to choose in the list in the F.A.Q.) for max. 15 pax.
  • Perk 6 / €400: You receive Perk #3 + a personalized weekend city trip planning to Paris (without bookings).
  • Perk 7 / €800: You receive Perk #6 + a private museum visit (to choose in the list in the F.A.Q.) for max. 15 pax. 
  • Perk 8 / €1500: You receive Perk #6 + a 1-day personal cultural experience in Paris with TheWaysBeyond.
     

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by spreading the word.  Crowdfunding has proven over and over to be a powerful tool to build awareness and generate seed money for start-ups; at its core is the essence of the crowd and THAT starts with spreading the word.  

  • Share our campaign on Social Media: Instagram || Facebook || Twitter || LinkedIn
  • Tag your friends 
  • Use the #TheWaysBeyond
     

We can't do this without you!

 

TheWaysBeyond - A Project From Our Hearts

TheWaysBeyond is the story of Nikki and Frederic.  Nikki and Frederic met in Paris years after their arrival in the City of Lights.  She is from Beijing and has always worked in Finance and in the private sector; he is from Belgium and has worked for several cultural institutions – nothing at first seemed to bring them closer together, except for love, their attachment to Paris and their endless curiosity for culture and humanity.

(And now this is the part where you can laugh at us feeling awkward for our first "official portrait" in our apartment…)

 

Read About Us In These Press

(In French & Dutch)

De Morgen magazine || HEC Stories || Gael || Feeling Wonen || Gael Maison

 

Advisers & Friends Who Help Us Along

We would like to specifically thank the following people who have been supporting us since the very start of our adventure, who have believed in us and advised us when we needed advice.

Advisers
 
 
Friends:
  • Julien Tang, for the video;
  • Geoffroy Montel and Franck Marguin of Minizza, for the music on the video – "Tournée de crêpes", taken from the soundtrack of "Voyage au Groënland" by Sébastien Betbeder.
     

We also want to thank everyone who in the last year have helped us and supported us in a way or another! They will recognize themselves ;-)

 

THANK YOU!

 

>>VERSION FRANÇAISE<<

 

Peu importe qui vous êtes ou d'où vous venez, la culture nous relie tous. Quels que soient les obstacles que la vie nous réserve, la culture reste un lieu d’échange et de dialogue.
Depuis des siècles, la création et l’art de vivre français n’ont cessé de rayonner et d’influencer le monde entier. Aujourd’hui encore, qu’elle répète des gestes ancestraux ou les fasse évoluer avec des technologies de pointe, la French Touch perpétue les traditions d’excellences dans le travail de femmes et d’hommes dédiés à leur passion. TheWaysBeyond est né de l’envie d’explorer les coulisses de la création française et de vous la faire découvrir au cours d’expériences uniques placées sous les sceaux de l’Excellence et de l’Échange.
Après un an de tests et d’organisation d’activités pour particuliers, nous avons décidé de lancer les premières Cultural Learning Expeditions basées à Paris ("expéditions d'apprentissage culturel") – une nouvelle version de notre service qui va plus loin encore dans la découverte de la culture et de la créativité. Ce futur produit phare de TheWaysBeyond est ouvert aux entreprises, aux institutions et aux groupes de particuliers, afin de surprendre et d’inspirer un public encore plus large !
 

LES PREMIERES CULTURAL LEARNING EXPEDITIONS BASÉES A PARIS

Avec les Cultural Learning Expeditions, vous sortez de votre routine habituelle et découvrez l’inattendu au travers de rencontres, des échanges et des expériences. C'est un moment pour apprendre au contact d’esprits créatifs, de vos amis ou des membres de votre équipe et aussi surtout, de vous-mêmes.

Positivité & Épanouissement : faire d’une pierre deux coups

En s’engageant dans la Culture et le Patrimoine, les sociétés jouent un rôle essentiel dans la société. Aujourd’hui cependant, face aux phénomènes de burn-out et de bore-out (l’épuisement par la surcharge de travail ou par l’ennui au travail), beaucoup d’entre elles cherchent à rendre un sens au travail de leurs employés. Alors que certaines ont déjà compris que l’Art et la Culture peuvent jouer le rôle d’éléments de surprise qui redynamisent et inspirent leurs équipes. Avec TheWaysBeyond, vous pouvez aider votre organisation à retrouver positivité et épanouissement à travers le pouvoir inhérent à l’Art et à la Culture.

D’un apéro culturel à un team building, en passant par un city break d’une journée ou un voyage d’une semaine, nos Cultural Learning Expeditions sont à la fois une retraite créative et une école en plein air, car nous nous concentrons sur le rôle précieux que la culture peut jouer pour surprendre, récompenser et inspirer.
 

UN AN DE THEWAYSBEYOND

Depuis le lancement de TheWaysBeyond il y a 1 an, nos efforts ont commencé à porter leurs fruits :

  • Nous avons testé de nombreuses activités afin d'en sélectionner les meilleures, et d'organiser des événements ponctuels pour des groupes de particuliers ;
  • De nombreuses agences, plateformes, institutions culturelles, artistes, designers et fondations nous ont contactés pour intégrer nos réseaux ;
  • L'éditeur allemand Travel Colours nous a contacté pour curater l'édition parisienne de leur City Guide pour amateurs de design, présentant l'avant-garde de l'hospitalité parisienne ;
  • Nous avons été invités à l’Assemblée nationale pour discuter de l’entreprenariat dans la Culture, ainsi qu’à la Sorbonne pour échanger avec des étudiants en Master en Tourisme.
     

Ces soutiens et confirmations nous ont convaincus du sens et de l’importance de notre projet. Et pourtant, comme beaucoup de jeunes entreprises, TheWaysBeyond n’est pas encore rentable et c’est ici que vous pouvez nous aider. Car avec votre soutien, nous pouvons profiter du vent qui nous porte et réellement diffuser la Culture auprès d’un public plus large encore !
 

QUE DIRE DE PLUS SUR PARIS ?

Paris est en effet la ville la plus visitée au monde. De toutes les villes, elle est, comme le disait Cocteau, « la plus voyante et la plus invisible ». Mais nous sommes tous les deux nés et avons grandi dans des pays étrangers, et sommes donc constamment en train de découvrir la ville avec un regard nouveau  ! Aussi, avec TheWaysBeyond, vous vous confrontez à la culture française avec le regard d’un habitant, mais aussi d’un nouvel habitant ! D'autant plus que pour nous, Paris ne se résume pas au luxe et au romantisme. Ce que nous voulons vous montrer, c’est ce qui va par-delà les clichés – cette énergie invisible qui pousse constamment la ville à aller de l’avant.

  • Saviez-vous par exemple qu’un un membre de la famille Rothschild avait créé une fondation au début du XXe siècle, et qui existe aujourd’hui encore soutient et promeut de jeunes artistes français ?
  • Saviez-vous que de jeunes artisans ressuscitent aujourd’hui d'anciennes marques françaises endormies depuis des siècles ?
  • Ou encore, aviez-vous imaginé qu’il puisse exister des fermes floricoles en plein Paris, voire même une ferme urbaine le long des Champs Élysées ?
    ​

Quelques questions parmi tant d’autres, auxquelles nous vous proposons de répondre pour vous montrer l’histoire en mouvement, faite par des personnes passionnées et leur inépuisable énergie créatrice !
 

POURQUOI NOUS AVONS BESOIN DE VOUS ?

Après une année d’essais d’activités, nous souhaiterions récolter 12.600€ pour lancer TheWaysBeyond 2.0, une version étendue de notre offre actuelle. Votre contribution est essentielle pour nous permettre d'élargir notre portfolio, de proposer de nouvelles expériences encore plus authentiques, et de convaincre plus d'entreprises et d'institutions.
Ces 12.600€ seront répartis comme suit :

  • 4000€ / Développement de l'offre : Nous allons creuser les rues de Paris et au-delà  (à ± 2h de trajet de Paris) pour y chercher de nouveaux trésors cachés et vous proposer le meilleur de ce que le territoire a à offrir.
  • 4000€ / Développement de la clientèle : Marketing, foires et expositions internationales ;
  • 4000€ / Amélioration du site web : Optimisation du système de réservation ; S.E.O. compliance…
  • 600€ / Frais Indiegogo

Ces objectifs, c’est grâce à VOUS, chers amis, que nous pourrons les atteindre !
 

CE QUE NOUS VOUS OFFRONS EN RETOUR

En premier lieu, un énorme MERCI à tous nos (futurs) soutiens !
Ensuite, tous les soutiens intégreront automatiquement le TheWaysBeyond Culture Club ! L’adhésion vous permet d'obtenir un code promo de 10% sur toutes nos activités et d'accéder, 3 fois par an, à des événements spéciaux organisés pour le Club ! Nous partagerons également des invitations, des bons plans et nos coups de cœur du mois, allant de la gastronomie aux expositions, en passant par des vernissages.
Enfin, ci-dessous, vous trouverez la liste en français de ce que nous vous proposons en contrepartie de votre soutien (en anglais, on appelle ça perk) :

  • Perk 1 / 10€ : Vous devenez membre du TheWaysBeyond Culture Club et recevez également un e-mail de remerciement personnel.
  • Perk 2 / 20€ : Vous recevez le Perk #1 + un tote-bag TheWaysBeyond.
  • Perk 3 / 50€ : Vous recevez le Perk #1 + notre City Guide de Paris pour amateurs de design.
  • Perk 4 / 100€ : Vous recevez le Perk #3 + 2 tickets pour nos futures activités.
  • Perk 5 / 250€ : Vous recevez le Perk #3 + une balade-découverte de quartier privée (à choisir parmi la liste dans les F.A.Q.) pour max. 15 pers.
  • Perk 6 / 400€ : Vous recevez le Perk #3 + une planification de city-trip personnalisé pour un weekend à Paris (or réservations)
  • Perk 7 / 800€ : Vous recevez le Perk #6 + une visite privée d’un musée parisien (à choisir parmi la liste dans les F.A.Q.) pour max. 15 pers.
  • Perk 8 / 1500€ : Vous recevez le Perk #6 + une journée d’expérience culturelle à Paris avec les fondateurs de TheWaysBeyond
     

D’AUTRES FAÇONS DE NOUS AIDER

Vous pouvez également nous aider en parlant de nous ! Le crowdfunding est un outil puissant pour sensibiliser et générer des fonds pour les jeunes entreprises. Son point de départ, c’est l’idée même de la communication, et ça commence en faisant passer le mot !
Partagez cette campagne sur les réseaux sociaux : Instagram || Facebook || Twitter || LinkedIn
Taggez vos amis
Utilisee le hashtag #TheWaysBeyond

Avec vous, on y arrivera !

THEWAYSBEYOND – UN PROJET QUI NOUS TIENT A CŒUR

TheWaysBeyond, c’est l’histoire de Nikki et Frederic. Nous nous sommes rencontrés à Paris, quelques années après notre arrivée dans la Ville lumière. Nikki vient de Pékin et a toujours travaillé dans la Finance et le secteur privé ; et Frederic vient de Bruxelles, où il a évolué dans diverses institutions culturelles – rien, a priori, ne semblait nous rapprocher, si ce n’est un coup de foudre, notre attachement commun pour Paris et notre curiosité sans fin pour la culture et l’humain.

QUAND LA PRESSE PARLE DE NOUS (en français et en néerlandais)

De Morgen magazine || HEC Stories || Gael || Feeling Wonen || Gael Maison

CONSEILLERS ET AMIS

Nous voudrions remercier spécialement les personnes suivantes, qui nous soutiennent depuis le tout début de l’aventure TheWaysBeyond, qui croient en nous et nous conseillent dès que nous en avons besoin.

Conseillers : Dominique Fleur, Professeure de littérature française || Éric de Rugy, Président de la Fédération JOICE (Jeunes Organisations Innovantes de la Culture et de l'Entertainment) || Claire Hazart, Présidente du HEC Club Culture

Amis : Julien Tang pour la vidéo || Geoffroy Montel et Franck Marguin de Minizza pour la musique pour la vidéo (le morceau s’appelle "Tournée de crêpes" et est tiré de la BO du film "Voyage au Groënland" de Sébastien Betbeder).

Nous voudrions également remercier toutes celles et ceux qui, cette dernière année, nous ont aidés et soutenus de quelque manière que ce soit ! Elles et ils se reconnaîtront ;-)
 

MERCI !
story_txt:
TheWaysBeyond 2.0
>>Version en français en bas de page<<
No matter who you are or where you are from, Culture connects us all.  Whichever boundary life might bring onto our paths, Culture remains a place for exchange and dialogue.For centuries French creation and art-de-vivre have been radiating and influencing the entire world. Today whether with ancestral practices or cutting-edge technology the French Touch perpetuates the tradition of Excellence in the works of women and men dedicated to their passion. TheWaysBeyond was born out of the idea of exploring the backstage of French creation and give you a closer look at it during unique experiences based on Excellence and Exchange.
After one year of selecting and organizing activities for individuals, we decided to launch the first Cultural Learning Expeditions based in Paris – an upgraded version of our service that goes deeper into the discovery of culture and creativity.  This future flagship product is open to corporates, institutions and groups of individuals, to bring positive impact and inspiration to a broader public.
 
The First Cultural Learning Expeditions based in Paris
With Cultural Learning Expeditions you get out of your usual routine and enter the unexpected through meeting, exchange and experience. It is a moment to learn from creative minds, from your friends or your team members and also from yourselves. 
Positivity & Fulfilment: 2 Birds, 1 Stone
By engaging in Culture and Heritage, companies play an essential role in society. Today, facing the increasing phenomenon of "burn-out" or "bore-out", many though are striving to give back meaning to their employees. While some have already understood that Art and Culture can be the surprising element that energizes and inspires their teams. With TheWaysBeyond, you can bring back positivity and fulfilment to your organizations and revitalize your staff with the inherent strength of Art and Culture.
From a refreshing way of celebrating to a team-building, a 1-day city break or a 7-day journey, our ​Cultural Learning Expeditions are both a creative retreat and an open-air school, as we focus on the valuable role Culture can play to surprise, reward and inspire.
 
What We Have Achieved In One Year
Since we launched TheWaysBeyond 12 months ago, our efforts have started to bear fruits: 

We have tested numerous activities in order to select the best, and organize punctual events for individuals and private groups;
Many agencies, platforms, cultural institutions, artists, designers and foundations came to us to integrate our network;

German publisher Travel Colours contacted us to curate their Paris City Guide for Design Lovers, presenting the newest generation of Parisian hospitality;
We were invited to the National Assembly to discuss entrepreneurship in Culture with Parisian deputies, and to the Sorbonne University to exchange with Master students in Tourism. 

All the support and confirmation have only convinced us even more of the meaning and the importance of what we are doing.  Yet, like many other young companies, TheWaysBeyond is still not profitable and this is where you can help. Because with your help, we can ride on the wave and definitely spread Culture towards a larger public! 

 
What More Could Be Said About Paris?
Paris is the most visited city in the world. It is so striking, yet at the same time so invisible. But as we were both born and bred in different countries, we are still discovering Paris with the eyes of outsiders. With TheWaysBeyond, you will confront yourself to French culture from the inside, but also from the outside! Especially as for us, Paris is not only about luxury or romanticism – what we want to show you goes beyond the clichés; it is about the people, the heritage, the future and the things we all seem to know, but sometimes tend to forget.


Did you know for example that a member of the Rothschild family created a foundation in the early 20th cent. that is still active today to support young French artists?
Did you know that young craftsmen were bringing back to life old French brands that have been asleep for centuries?
Or have you ever imagined there could be a flower farm at the very heart of Paris and even an urban farm along the Champs Élysées? 

These are but a few questions we want to answer for you, to show you history in the making, with passionate people and everlasting creative energy. 

 
Why We Need You
After a year trying out our offer, we would like to raise €12,600 to launch TheWaysBeyond 2.0, an upgraded version of our current offer. Your contribution is crucial for us to broaden our portfolio, propose greater experiences, and raise awareness from companies and institutions. 
These €12,600 will be used as follows:


€4000 / Offer Development: We will go hunt for more hidden gems in Paris and beyond  (2 hours away from Paris) to propose you the best this territory can offer. 

€4000 / Client Development:  Marketing, fairs and international exposure.

€4000 / Upgrading our Website: Optimisation of the booking system; Work on the SEO compliance…

€600 / Indiegogo Fee.

All these changes, YOU, dear contributors, can help us achieve! 

 
What We Offer In Return
First of all, a major thanks to all our (future) backers!
Plus, every backer will automatically join TheWaysBeyond Culture Club! Membership allows you to get a 10% discount on all our activities and to access, 3 times per year, very special events organized for TheWaysBeyond Culture Club! We will also share invitations, good plans and our picks of the month, from gastronomy to exhibitions.


Perk 1 / €10: You become a member of TheWaysBeyond Culture Club and receive a personal thank you e-mail.

Perk 2 / €20: You receive Perk #1 + a TheWaysBeyond tote-bag

Perk 3 / €50: You receive Perk #1 + our Paris City Guide for Design Lovers 

Perk 4 / €100: You receive Perk #3 + 2 tickets for any future activity

Perk 5 / €250: You receive Perk #3 + a private discovery walk of a Paris district (to choose in the list in the F.A.Q.) for max. 15 pax.

Perk 6 / €400: You receive Perk #3 + a personalized weekend city trip planning to Paris (without bookings).

Perk 7 / €800: You receive Perk #6 + a private museum visit (to choose in the list in the F.A.Q.) for max. 15 pax. 

Perk 8 / €1500: You receive Perk #6 + a 1-day personal cultural experience in Paris with TheWaysBeyond. 


Other Ways You Can Help
You can help by spreading the word.  Crowdfunding has proven over and over to be a powerful tool to build awareness and generate seed money for start-ups; at its core is the essence of the crowd and THAT starts with spreading the word.  

Share our campaign on Social Media: Instagram || Facebook || Twitter || LinkedIn

Tag your friends 
Use the #TheWaysBeyond 

We can't do this without you!

(And now this is the part where you can laugh at us feeling awkward for our first "official portrait" in our apartment…)

De Morgen magazine || HEC Stories || Gael || Feeling Wonen || Gael Maison

Advisers
 

 

Friends:


Julien Tang, for the video;

Geoffroy Montel and Franck Marguin of Minizza, for the music on the video – "Tournée de crêpes", taken from the soundtrack of "Voyage au Groënland" by Sébastien Betbeder. 

We also want to thank everyone who in the last year have helped us and supported us in a way or another! They will recognize themselves ;-)

4000€ / Développement de l'offre : Nous allons creuser les rues de Paris et au-delà  (à ± 2h de trajet de Paris) pour y chercher de nouveaux trésors cachés et vous proposer le meilleur de ce que le territoire a à offrir.

4000€ / Développement de la clientèle : Marketing, foires et expositions internationales ;

4000€ / Amélioration du site web : Optimisation du système de réservation ; S.E.O. compliance…
600€ / Frais Indiegogo

Ces objectifs, c’est grâce à VOUS, chers amis, que nous pourrons les atteindre ! 
CE QUE NOUS VOUS OFFRONS EN RETOUR
En premier lieu, un énorme MERCI à tous nos (futurs) soutiens !Ensuite, tous les soutiens intégreront automatiquement le TheWaysBeyond Culture Club ! L’adhésion vous permet d'obtenir un code promo de 10% sur toutes nos activités et d'accéder, 3 fois par an, à des événements spéciaux organisés pour le Club ! Nous partagerons également des invitations, des bons plans et nos coups de cœur du mois, allant de la gastronomie aux expositions, en passant par des vernissages.Enfin, ci-dessous, vous trouverez la liste en français de ce que nous vous proposons en contrepartie de votre soutien (en anglais, on appelle ça perk) :


Perk 1 / 10€ : Vous devenez membre du TheWaysBeyond Culture Club et recevez également un e-mail de remerciement personnel.

Perk 2 / 20€ : Vous recevez le Perk #1 + un tote-bag TheWaysBeyond.

Perk 3 / 50€ : Vous recevez le Perk #1 + notre City Guide de Paris pour amateurs de design.

Perk 4 / 100€ : Vous recevez le Perk #3 + 2 tickets pour nos futures activités.

Perk 5 / 250€ : Vous recevez le Perk #3 + une balade-découverte de quartier privée (à choisir parmi la liste dans les F.A.Q.) pour max. 15 pers.

Perk 6 / 400€ : Vous recevez le Perk #3 + une planification de city-trip personnalisé pour un weekend à Paris (or réservations)

Perk 7 / 800€ : Vous recevez le Perk #6 + une visite privée d’un musée parisien (à choisir parmi la liste dans les F.A.Q.) pour max. 15 pers.

Perk 8 / 1500€ : Vous recevez le Perk #6 + une journée d’expérience culturelle à Paris avec les fondateurs de TheWaysBeyond 

D’AUTRES FAÇONS DE NOUS AIDER
Vous pouvez également nous aider en parlant de nous ! Le crowdfunding est un outil puissant pour sensibiliser et générer des fonds pour les jeunes entreprises. Son point de départ, c’est l’idée même de la communication, et ça commence en faisant passer le mot !Partagez cette campagne sur les réseaux sociaux : Instagram || Facebook || Twitter || LinkedInTaggez vos amisUtilisee le hashtag #TheWaysBeyond
Avec vous, on y arrivera !
THEWAYSBEYOND – UN PROJET QUI NOUS TIENT A CŒUR
TheWaysBeyond, c’est l’histoire de Nikki et Frederic. Nous nous sommes rencontrés à Paris, quelques années après notre arrivée dans la Ville lumière. Nikki vient de Pékin et a toujours travaillé dans la Finance et le secteur privé ; et Frederic vient de Bruxelles, où il a évolué dans diverses institutions culturelles – rien, a priori, ne semblait nous rapprocher, si ce n’est un coup de foudre, notre attachement commun pour Paris et notre curiosité sans fin pour la culture et l’humain.
QUAND LA PRESSE PARLE DE NOUS (en français et en néerlandais)
De Morgen magazine || HEC Stories || Gael || Feeling Wonen || Gael Maison
CONSEILLERS ET AMIS
Nous voudrions remercier spécialement les personnes suivantes, qui nous soutiennent depuis le tout début de l’aventure TheWaysBeyond, qui croient en nous et nous conseillent dès que nous en avons besoin.
Conseillers : Dominique Fleur, Professeure de littérature française || Éric de Rugy, Président de la Fédération JOICE (Jeunes Organisations Innovantes de la Culture et de l'Entertainment) || Claire Hazart, Présidente du HEC Club Culture
Amis : Julien Tang pour la vidéo || Geoffroy Montel et Franck Marguin de Minizza pour la musique pour la vidéo (le morceau s’appelle "Tournée de crêpes" et est tiré de la BO du film "Voyage au Groënland" de Sébastien Betbeder).
Nous voudrions également remercier toutes celles et ceux qui, cette dernière année, nous ont aidés et soutenus de quelque manière que ce soit ! Elles et ils se reconnaîtront ;-) 
MERCI !

story:
Help Kids Live a Positive Life

“OcYM globally inspires confidence, optimism, creativity, and peace through words, arts, and fashion to enhance a positive mindset towards life.”

-Stress Less, Embrace More

  • BACKGROUND

Overcome Your Mental (OcYM) was founded in January of 2020 by E. Victor Nickerson. He is the first male in his family to receive a college degree and even continued to get his Master's Degree from Valparaiso University. The inspiration behind OcYM is the belief in a positive mentality strong enough to embrace any situation, no matter how stressful it may seem to be. We believe there is at least one positive in every experience. The key is finding the positives and focusing on them.

With the help of Nicola Scepanovic, an idea and plan were developed to help better the youth. Mr. Scepanovic, who is a basketball enthusiast and the manager of OcYM Basketball, has family throughout Europe. He has always wanted to help people in any way possible. Nicola's family also loves to give back and are interested in sports, especially basketball. His family was more than willing to help set up this great opportunity for the youth kids when they heard about the project. Continue reading for more details about the OcYM youth project.

____________________

 

____________________

  • DREAMS AND EDUCATION

Overcome Your Mental (OcYM) is creating the "OcYM Youth Culture Cup (OYCC)" for American youth basketball teams. This is an opportunity for players to showcase their skills against European club teams internationally. The OYCC will have a tournament style format. Players will have a chance to learn about the European culture and see what life really is like in other places of the world. Some of these children have never left the country and may never get another chance. OcYM believes providing early opportunities like the OYCC can help keep our youth motivated to stay on a positive pathway to achieve greatness in life. We are huge believers in creating the opportunities for others that we wish we had. It is an amazing way to show our gratitude and how much we truly care for younger generations.

  • THE YOUTH NEEDS YOU

Get in the game and join us to create a special moment for these players. Your contribution is one play closer to inspiring kids to embrace their dreams, while enhancing their knowledge of the world through basketball. Help us create a better start to life for the next generation. Together anything is possible! 

____________________

 

 

____________________
 

Overcome Your Mental (OcYM) welcomes you to the team. 

TEAM on 3 -  1..2..3.... TEAM!!!

 

CONTRIBUTION AND PROJECT DETAILS

 

  • FUNDING FOR A BETTER FUTURE

Our ultimate goal with "OcYM Youth Culture Cup (OYCC)" is creating an annual opportunity for kids to be able to enjoy what they love to do and embrace different cultures in person. We believe this is an amazing way for kids to have a "hands-on" educational experience and help improve their appreciation for life. With your contributions together we will be able to give these kids an experience of a life time.

____________________

 

 

____________________

As of now, we have 3 teams from America who are excited about the project and want to participate. These youth teams are located in Georgia (2) and Tennessee (1). One of the teams from Georgia, "The Wilson Academy", has already committed to participating. The cost per team is $16,000 to be able to enjoy a unique culture experience and play the game these kids love, in a country that they have never been to. After covering the event expenses, we will use the rest of the money to complete the project stretch goals and to help teams cover their expenses. This will be very beneficial for families especially if a family is not is the best economic situation. Since these kids have no sponsor, we invite you to join us to be their sponsor. You are the key for future success.

____________________

____________________

  • LOCATION: Kolašin Sports Hall
  • HOST TEAM: Gorštak Basketball Club
  • HOUSING: Tango Apartments
  • FOOD: Planinar Restaurant (High School “Braća Selić” facility)
  • CULTURE & EDUCATION: Kolašin, Montenegro

____________________

 

 

____________________

  • AMAZING SECRET PERKS

Perks are cool but secret perks are AMAZING! If you were not able to catch the early bird sign up, do not worry. You can still get access to some unique perks, just make sure you click the add-on perk, "Exclusive Perks and Updates!". Do not miss out!

  • COOL PERKS

____________________

 

And More!!

 

____________________

  • GOALS

____________________

 

____________________

 

BE THE CHANGE

 

  • HELP LEAD OUR YOUTH

"Support Kids: Dreams and Education with OcYM" can inspire our youth generation which will impact the direction of their mindset in society. We want to help educate our youth with real life experiences. Sometimes these kinds of experiences are the best tools for education. Creating these positive opportunities for our youth culture can help bring positive changes and experiences to the world. Some of these kids have always dreamed of a chance to see life outside of their own environment. This is a great opportunity to contribute as some may never get another chance to explore another country. We love for you to help us bridge the culture gap and give these kids an opportunity not only to play the sport they love but also to embrace amazing cultures.

____________________

 

 

____________________

Now that we have more experience in life, I am sure that we all had that moment when we wished we could have did something but just was not able to. Maybe even had a chance to do something and just wished we could do it once more. This is an once in a lifetime opportunity to be able to be learn about a different culture in person. Help us create "OcYM Youth Culture Cup (OYCC)", the event will be held in Montenegro. A life changing experience that will never be forgotten. These are the opportunities for our youth that can help them truly appreciate life and will inspire them to be great and do great. 

Everyone can talk but it is time we take the next step. Let us think beyond ourselves and give these kids a reason to live positively. Together, we will motivate them to give back when it. The youth needs us to lead, not just talk and watch them.

Overcome Your Mental (OcYM) wants to lead with you.

LEAD on 3 -  1..2..3... LEAD!!

 

NO FUNDING, NO PROJECT

 

  • CONNECT WITH THE KIDS

Although the idea of our project was not too complicated to develop, there were and are some challenges. One challenge that we dealt with was scheduling travel, especially during COVID-19 this can be tricky. We were able to partner with a travel agency and reached out to the President of the Kolašin Municipality to be able to coordinate safe travel for the "OcYM Youth Challenge Cup (OYCC)".

Now we find ourselves at the most important stage to start this project, funding and contributions. Without enough support, this project's possibility to not happen significantly increases. If we are not able to receive the proper funding to cover the event expenses, it will be difficult to properly host this amazing event for the kids. We do not want to fail our youth, as they are excited about this opportunity. Our team is dedicating everything to this amazing opportunity for these kids. We are waking up early, staying up late, even working double shifts and doing ride service (UBER/LYFT) whenever possible. Your contributions will tremendously help. The event expenses are listed above.

____________________

 

 

____________________

Also, we have communicated with the American youth teams about cost and they are doing all they can to make this wonderful experience to happen. There are no guarantees that each team will be able to cover all of the expenses. The cost will be more for The Wilson Academy, they will also be going to 1 or 2 more countries to make the most of their educational European trip. Over 40 colleges have accepted students from The Wilson Academy, some even receiving full scholarships. While they have a strong educational foundation and being association with the Duke TIP program, they were also able to win the state championship this year in basketball. If you would like to directly help The Wilson Academy: Click Here

We can work together and be a part of the youth success. We have a chance to positively impact and influence kids' outlooks on life. We are in this together for the kids and our youth generation. Will you join us? 

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

 

  • BE THE CHANGE, SHARE THE CHANGE

We understand everyone may not be able to contribute financial. Here are other ways you are able to contribute this project and the youth generation. Every contribution is important and very appreciated. SUPPORT KIDS: DREAMS AND EDUCATION WITH OcYM!

  • Use Indiegogo share tools

  • Share this campaign with family, friends, colleagues, and others

  • Share this campaign on your social media platforms

  • Share "Overcome Your Mental (OcYM)": Click Here

  • For more information email us: overcomeyourmental@gmail.com

story:
My name is Daniel Anderson. I'm a 34-year-old native of Montana and founder of The Common Ground Project. I grew up in one of the most beautiful landscapes in North America.  Tom Miner Basin is located on the Northwest boarder of Yellowstone National Park and boasts some of the most spectacular viewsheds in the world. This place is home to a community of ranches, diverse wildlife, and is the inspiration of a compelling, immersive, and genuinely unique experience that I invite you to be a part of.

 

Welcome to The Common Ground Project.

 

Please join us by helping to build, promote, and take part in a retreat experience that bridges ecological and cultural education with the great outdoors.  

With your help, we are going to create an experience in a class of its own!  Our venue will provide:

  • Overnight tipi camping for groups of up to 14 participants
  • Guided hiking adventures on the outskirts of Yellowstone National Park
  • Multi-day educational workshops
  • Equine-assisted therapy workshops
  • Wildlife watching & lessons in wildlife biology
  • Facilitated campfire discussions
  • Great food... and more!

Our campaign also aims to launch a scholarship fund that will give future students access to this co-creative, educational, and empowering experience.

May the element of fire bring out the storyteller in each of us!

A campfire gathering at the Anderson Ranch. Photo Credit: Louise Johns

 

What We're Building & Offering

The Common Ground Project successfully introduced guided hiking and overnight camping on the Anderson Ranch in summer of 2018. Now we're setting our sights on a more robust experience, aiming to build out a tipi camp facility that will be the venue for our future retreats.

Our facilities will include:

  • (9) 14' diameter tipis for participants and guides to sleep in 
  • (1) 24' diameter council tipi for group gatherings 
  • A state-of-the-art bathhouse, and
  • A large stone fire pit for story-telling and facilitated discussions

Sleeping quarter tipis will be outfitted to comfortably sleep our guests, guides, and facilitators. Picture cots, sheepskin rugs, and warm interior lighting to welcome you after a long day. Our council tipi will be a large, fully equipped 24' diameter tipi with functional and artistic design details that'll pull on all of the senses. We’re designing a space that feels removed from everyday life, yet comfortable, safe, and welcoming of a truly co-creative experience.

Our mobile bathhouse will be complete with his/hers bathrooms, showers, and a central hand-washing station.  The bathhouse is designed with rustic and tasteful aesthetics that prioritize both comfort and functionality.

 

Where Our Funding Is Going

Our target for facilities? $70,000. This number rounds just slightly higher than what we have estimated as the cost to purchase and build the facilities.  $70,000 covers all the bases: from the ground up in materials, professional services & shipping costs required to turn this idea into reality!

Our target for hosting the first two retreats? $70,000.  We are offering the first two retreats to individuals at a significantly discounted price - check it out in our perks! With (14) participants per retreat and a cost of $2500 per person, this will cover our second tier of fundraising needs!  Spaces will be offered to the first who sign up through our perk! 

2 five-day retreats | 14 participants per retreat | summer 2019

Please explore our website to learn more about our Summer 2019 Retreats!  They will be adventures unlike any others simply because participants will be the first to attend The Common Ground Project's immersive tipi camping retreats. Contact us for details!

With $70,000 for facilities and $70,000 for the first two retreats, that puts us at $140,000.  Lastly, we're adding another $10,000 to cover all of the outside services from accountants to administrative and fundraising fees.  This brings our total target to $150,000.

 

 

Last but not least...  we are calling on the global community to help us spread the word and support our vision.  Any contributions surpassing our target will go directly into forming a scholarship fund for future students to come share this special place together.  Our student programs are designed to be cross-cultural, educational, inspiring, and adventurous!  There is no better time than now to invite young, thriving minds, to explore wild places together, share campfires, and foster meaningful connections with one another.  Through the weaving of our stories may we find common ground.

 

Daniel and students flying a drone on the Anderson Ranch. Photo Credit: Louise Johns

 

A presentation in the barn at the Anderson Ranch. Photo Credit: Louise Johns

 

For social innovators and corporate retreats we have a highly advanced program offering both recreational and interactive learning opportunities for participants! This is cross-pollinating at a whole new level; bringing together a global network of highly motivated and influential people. Retreats will be guided by world renowned educators, facilitators, and people who work in conservation.

 

How can you help?  

Great question! We have a myriad of options for those of you who are inspired to support our campaign.  To begin, let's just say that we are MORE than excited to offer you a host of special perks from tangible goodies, to artwork, and experiences both at and away from our campfire.  

As outlined above, there are 28 open vacancies for those who want to be the first to experience The Common Ground Project's retreats during the summer of 2019. These will go fast! Please contact us if you have questions!  

We are also offering:

  • A guided fishing trip outfitted with fly rods (that you take home with you!) and lodging at the spectacular Sage Lodge in Paradise Valley, Montana.
  • Cozy wool beanies with The Common Ground Project's custom embroidered logo.
  • Our special "Old Man" hat!  
  • "From-the-ranch" Skype sessions to classrooms, board rooms, and living rooms all around the world.
  • And signed photographs from a handful of our favorite and worldly photographers:

      

What happens if we don't reach our goal of $150,000?  To begin, our goal is divided into sections as detailed above, so the first target is actually $70,000 (used to build out our camping facilities). From here, it's the next $70,000 to bring in our first two retreats for summer, 2019! A breeze, right? Not quite. We understand the very real constraints we're up against and are prepared to manage any level of support, even if small compared to that of our target.  Anything helps! The priority will be in buying tipis and building our facility!

Here's another point worth sharing: In trying to offer options for folks who really love what we're trying to create but can't afford to participate in a retreat, we are offering unique and meaningful perks that are VERY important to meeting and surpassing our target.  Our friends in social media will have access to almost 1.2 MILLION sets of eyes from all around the world!  But let's see how much farther we can take it!!

Calling all heavy hitters on Instagram!  

We're asking for you to help us spread the word! 

 

As with any new venture (and adventure!) there are inherent risks.  Truth be told, we will be challenged to make The Common Ground Project what we envision it to be without the appropriate financial foundation.  This is something we take very seriously and - if need be - we will step back and re-establish how we bring The Common Ground Project to life.  So what’s the risk aside from a thorough revamp of our strategy? What’s the real risk? The risk is witnessing a national and global community that doesn’t value meaningful connections between people of all walks of life; it is in observing a larger community that doesn’t feel the elemental pull of fire and the sense of adventurous spirit brought out in wild places; The risk is exposing ourselves, our values, and philosophies and finding that the world simply doesn’t resonate.  

Aside from these risks, we don’t fear the obstacles that have yet to come.  We have a highly motivated team, and one with a myriad of experiences culminating into a what one friend quoted as “The Perfect Storm.”  It is in this perfect storm that we’ll sharpen our focus, pivot as needed, and continue to espouse the values we stand for: Inclusivity, adventure, learning, sharing, co-creating, giving back, and caring for each other and the planet.

 

THE IMPACT

Without question, the world - as we know it now - is swiftly becoming more complex. We’re losing touch with our sense of community, our sense of place, and even our sense of Self.  

At The Common Ground Project, we understand that healthy human/landscape relationships are essential to not only our mutual well-being and, ultimately, survival, but also to our reaching higher potentials of being fully human.  Here, we leave behind the pressures of the urban world and reconnect with nature; We’re drawing strength from wild places while honoring those who lived here before us; Building a community that stands for inclusivity, adventure, learning, and sharing our stories… one campfire at a time.

The impact? It is what we make of it. May our fire be an invitation to learn and grow, together.  If only to be open to the potential, and if only to firmly believe in this:

"We are more connected than we are divided."

 

Here's a testimonial from one of our participants from summer, 2018:

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

OK! If you've read this far we are more than grateful!  Please consider the many options for contributing to this campaign, proudly wear a beanie or hat this winter, decorate your home with a signed photograph from one of our friends, and come see us in Montana at one of our opening retreats this summer! 

If none of these are an option for you, that's OK!  You can still help by spreading the word.  Crowd-funding has proven over and over to be a powerful tool for building awareness and generating seed money for start-ups; at it's core is the essence of the crowd and THAT starts with spreading the word.  Please, help us by sharing our story.  The big world of social media is a great starting point and IndieGoGo also has its own sharing tools. 

If you're really into it, call a friend and email your colleagues, fellow students, peers, and family members.  We can't do this without you! 

 

Questions?  Please don't hesitate to contact us!

www.thecommongroundproject.us 

And feel free to email Daniel directly at: daniel@thecommongroundproject.us

Thank you for supporting our vision!
story_txt:
My name is Daniel Anderson. I'm a 34-year-old native of Montana and founder of The Common Ground Project. I grew up in one of the most beautiful landscapes in North America.  Tom Miner Basin is located on the Northwest boarder of Yellowstone National Park and boasts some of the most spectacular viewsheds in the world. This place is home to a community of ranches, diverse wildlife, and is the inspiration of a compelling, immersive, and genuinely unique experience that I invite you to be a part of. Welcome to The Common Ground Project. Please join us by helping to build, promote, and take part in a retreat experience that bridges ecological and cultural education with the great outdoors.  With your help, we are going to create an experience in a class of its own!  Our venue will provide:
Overnight tipi camping for groups of up to 14 participants
Guided hiking adventures on the outskirts of Yellowstone National Park
Multi-day educational workshops
Equine-assisted therapy workshops
Wildlife watching & lessons in wildlife biology
Facilitated campfire discussions
Great food... and more!
Our campaign also aims to launch a scholarship fund that will give future students access to this co-creative, educational, and empowering experience.May the element of fire bring out the storyteller in each of us!A campfire gathering at the Anderson Ranch. Photo Credit: Louise Johns What We're Building & OfferingThe Common Ground Project successfully introduced guided hiking and overnight camping on the Anderson Ranch in summer of 2018. Now we're setting our sights on a more robust experience, aiming to build out a tipi camp facility that will be the venue for our future retreats.Our facilities will include:
(9) 14' diameter tipis for participants and guides to sleep in 
(1) 24' diameter council tipi for group gatherings 
A state-of-the-art bathhouse, and
A large stone fire pit for story-telling and facilitated discussions
Sleeping quarter tipis will be outfitted to comfortably sleep our guests, guides, and facilitators. Picture cots, sheepskin rugs, and warm interior lighting to welcome you after a long day. Our council tipi will be a large, fully equipped 24' diameter tipi with functional and artistic design details that'll pull on all of the senses. We’re designing a space that feels removed from everyday life, yet comfortable, safe, and welcoming of a truly co-creative experience.Our mobile bathhouse will be complete with his/hers bathrooms, showers, and a central hand-washing station.  The bathhouse is designed with rustic and tasteful aesthetics that prioritize both comfort and functionality. Where Our Funding Is GoingOur target for facilities? $70,000. This number rounds just slightly higher than what we have estimated as the cost to purchase and build the facilities.  $70,000 covers all the bases: from the ground up in materials, professional services & shipping costs required to turn this idea into reality!Our target for hosting the first two retreats? $70,000.  We are offering the first two retreats to individuals at a significantly discounted price - check it out in our perks! With (14) participants per retreat and a cost of $2500 per person, this will cover our second tier of fundraising needs!  Spaces will be offered to the first who sign up through our perk! 2 five-day retreats | 14 participants per retreat | summer 2019Please explore our website to learn more about our Summer 2019 Retreats!  They will be adventures unlike any others simply because participants will be the first to attend The Common Ground Project's immersive tipi camping retreats. Contact us for details!With $70,000 for facilities and $70,000 for the first two retreats, that puts us at $140,000.  Lastly, we're adding another $10,000 to cover all of the outside services from accountants to administrative and fundraising fees.  This brings our total target to $150,000.  Last but not least...  we are calling on the global community to help us spread the word and support our vision.  Any contributions surpassing our target will go directly into forming a scholarship fund for future students to come share this special place together.  Our student programs are designed to be cross-cultural, educational, inspiring, and adventurous!  There is no better time than now to invite young, thriving minds, to explore wild places together, share campfires, and foster meaningful connections with one another.  Through the weaving of our stories may we find common ground. Daniel and students flying a drone on the Anderson Ranch. Photo Credit: Louise Johns A presentation in the barn at the Anderson Ranch. Photo Credit: Louise Johns For social innovators and corporate retreats we have a highly advanced program offering both recreational and interactive learning opportunities for participants! This is cross-pollinating at a whole new level; bringing together a global network of highly motivated and influential people. Retreats will be guided by world renowned educators, facilitators, and people who work in conservation. How can you help?  Great question! We have a myriad of options for those of you who are inspired to support our campaign.  To begin, let's just say that we are MORE than excited to offer you a host of special perks from tangible goodies, to artwork, and experiences both at and away from our campfire.  As outlined above, there are 28 open vacancies for those who want to be the first to experience The Common Ground Project's retreats during the summer of 2019. These will go fast! Please contact us if you have questions!  We are also offering:
A guided fishing trip outfitted with fly rods (that you take home with you!) and lodging at the spectacular Sage Lodge in Paradise Valley, Montana.
Cozy wool beanies with The Common Ground Project's custom embroidered logo.
Our special "Old Man" hat!  
"From-the-ranch" Skype sessions to classrooms, board rooms, and living rooms all around the world.
And signed photographs from a handful of our favorite and worldly photographers:
      What happens if we don't reach our goal of $150,000?  To begin, our goal is divided into sections as detailed above, so the first target is actually $70,000 (used to build out our camping facilities). From here, it's the next $70,000 to bring in our first two retreats for summer, 2019! A breeze, right? Not quite. We understand the very real constraints we're up against and are prepared to manage any level of support, even if small compared to that of our target.  Anything helps! The priority will be in buying tipis and building our facility!Here's another point worth sharing: In trying to offer options for folks who really love what we're trying to create but can't afford to participate in a retreat, we are offering unique and meaningful perks that are VERY important to meeting and surpassing our target.  Our friends in social media will have access to almost 1.2 MILLION sets of eyes from all around the world!  But let's see how much farther we can take it!!Calling all heavy hitters on Instagram!  We're asking for you to help us spread the word!  As with any new venture (and adventure!) there are inherent risks.  Truth be told, we will be challenged to make The Common Ground Project what we envision it to be without the appropriate financial foundation.  This is something we take very seriously and - if need be - we will step back and re-establish how we bring The Common Ground Project to life.  So what’s the risk aside from a thorough revamp of our strategy? What’s the real risk? The risk is witnessing a national and global community that doesn’t value meaningful connections between people of all walks of life; it is in observing a larger community that doesn’t feel the elemental pull of fire and the sense of adventurous spirit brought out in wild places; The risk is exposing ourselves, our values, and philosophies and finding that the world simply doesn’t resonate.  Aside from these risks, we don’t fear the obstacles that have yet to come.  We have a highly motivated team, and one with a myriad of experiences culminating into a what one friend quoted as “The Perfect Storm.”  It is in this perfect storm that we’ll sharpen our focus, pivot as needed, and continue to espouse the values we stand for: Inclusivity, adventure, learning, sharing, co-creating, giving back, and caring for each other and the planet. THE IMPACTWithout question, the world - as we know it now - is swiftly becoming more complex. We’re losing touch with our sense of community, our sense of place, and even our sense of Self.  At The Common Ground Project, we understand that healthy human/landscape relationships are essential to not only our mutual well-being and, ultimately, survival, but also to our reaching higher potentials of being fully human.  Here, we leave behind the pressures of the urban world and reconnect with nature; We’re drawing strength from wild places while honoring those who lived here before us; Building a community that stands for inclusivity, adventure, learning, and sharing our stories… one campfire at a time.The impact? It is what we make of it. May our fire be an invitation to learn and grow, together.  If only to be open to the potential, and if only to firmly believe in this:"We are more connected than we are divided." Here's a testimonial from one of our participants from summer, 2018: OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELPOK! If you've read this far we are more than grateful!  Please consider the many options for contributing to this campaign, proudly wear a beanie or hat this winter, decorate your home with a signed photograph from one of our friends, and come see us in Montana at one of our opening retreats this summer! If none of these are an option for you, that's OK!  You can still help by spreading the word.  Crowd-funding has proven over and over to be a powerful tool for building awareness and generating seed money for start-ups; at it's core is the essence of the crowd and THAT starts with spreading the word.  Please, help us by sharing our story.  The big world of social media is a great starting point and IndieGoGo also has its own sharing tools. If you're really into it, call a friend and email your colleagues, fellow students, peers, and family members.  We can't do this without you!  Questions?  Please don't hesitate to contact us!
www.thecommongroundproject.us And feel free to email Daniel directly at: daniel@thecommongroundproject.usThank you for supporting our vision!

story:
La voix des femmes, en art comme en politique, se fait de plus en plus forte au fil des décennies. Or, il reste encore du travail à faire. Pour désamorcer les réflexes, pour changer l'imaginaire. Et nous croyons que chacun.e peut mettre la main à la pâte!

Le Festival international du Cinéma des Femmes de Fort-Coulonge, c'est…

  • Un espace-temps dédié entièrement au travail des réalisatrices;
  • Une occasion d’échanges et de découvertes;
  • Un événement convivial et décontracté;
  • Une offre culturelle enrichie pour la région du Pontiac en Outaouais.

Ce n’est pas…

  • Un festival de films qui s’adressent seulement aux femmes;
  • Un événement réservé aux femmes;
  • Un événement qui analyse le «cinéma féminin»;

L'équipe d'organisation du festival ne considère pas que le cinéma fait par des femmes est automatiquement, ou même généralement, «plus sensible» ou «différent» du cinéma fait par des hommes. Nous considérons que chaque artiste, sans égard à son genre, a une voix, une parole qui lui est propre, et nous laissons le soin aux artistes elles-mêmes de se définir

Un festival, ce n'est pas une mince affaire à organiser! Comme toutes nos projections sont gratuites, nous avons besoin de votre soutien pour faire de cet événement un succès!

Nous devons payer, entre autres, les droits de diffusion des films, les cachets de réalisatrices, les frais de transport et d'hébergement de nos invitées de marque, la location des salles de projection, la location du matériel technique, la publicité, et les différents permis et autorisations devant être obtenus pour la tenue d'un tel événement. 

Tout l'argent récolté va directement au financement des activités du festival. En effet, l'équipe d'organisation qui travaille depuis un an et demi réalise tout ce travail de façon bénévole. Votre don est donc également une façon d'encourager l'engagement bénévole qui façonne de manière particulière les régions rurales comme la nôtre.

 

POURQUOI NOUS SOUTENIR?

Parce que nous nous engageons à créer un événement convivial, qui créera la rencontre, encouragera les découvertes, et ouvrira nos horizons. Nous offrons:

  • Quatre jours de projections gratuites
  • Des cinéastes invitées
  • Des soupers communautaires
  • Une soirée "Cinéma sous les étoiles"
  • Des feux de camp pour se retrouver le soir autour d'une guitare
  • Un gala de clôture sous forme de brunch
  • Un impact écologique réduit grâce à notre approche de réduction des déchets
  • Et pour ceux qui viennent de loin, une occasion en or de découvrir une région méconnue!

Mais ce n'est pas tout! En plus de sa programmation de base, le Festival international du Cinéma des Femmes de Fort-Coulonge offrira également deux activités hors de l'ordinaire: les festival de "cannes" et le stage en cinéma!

 

Le festival se déroulant en pleine moisson, nous dédions la majorité de la première journée à un «Festival de cannes», où tout le monde est invité à participer à un canning party! Une rencontre intergénérationnelle où la bouffe santé et les produits locaux sont à l'honneur!

En groupe, nous ferons des conserves  maisons de tomates et autres, selon les  recettes du village! 
Ce sera l'occasion de casser la glace, de se  dégêner autour d'un autoclave et d'une  montagne de légumes!

N'oubliez pas votre tablier!

Les conserves de surplus seront disponibles pour la vente pendant tout le festival.

 

Les adolescents de 12 à 17 ans de Fort-Coulonge et des environs auront l'occasion de participer à un stage de trois jours afin d'apprendre les rudiments du tournage cinématographique.

L'atelier, donné par Mélanie O'Bomsawin, sera l'occasion pour nos jeunes de s'initier aux techniques du 7e art.  

Mélanie O'Bomsawin est vidéaste et artiste en nouveaux médias. Elle donne également des formations en captation vidéo et en montage audiovisuel à des groupes de différents âges. Son implication avec le Wapikoni Mobile l'a amenée à donner des ateliers de vidéo aux populations autochtones du Chili et du Québec. Son travail de vidéaste l'a également amenée à travailler au Vietnam, au Sénégal, en Colombie et au Pérou. Passionnée par les nouvelles technologies, elle cherche sans cesse de nouveaux moyens lui permettant de raconter des histoires, réelles ou inventées, afin de transformer le regard du spectateur sur le monde qui l'entoure. Mélanie O'Bomsawin travaille actuellement à l'ONF, l'Office National du Film du Canada.

 

Don de 10$

  • Vous recevrez une superbe carte virtuelle de remerciement

Don de 18$ 

  • Vous recevrez une superbe carte virtuelle de remerciement
  • De plus, lors du festival, le pop-corn sera gratuit pour vous

Don de 30$

  • Vous recevrez une superbe carte virtuelle de remerciement
  • Lors du festival, le pop-corn sera gratuit pour vous
  • De plus, votre nom sera inscrit au "Tableau des Fondatrices et Fondateurs", installé au QG du Festival. Ce tableau nous suivra à chacune des éditions du Festival

Don de 50$

  • Vous recevrez une superbe carte virtuelle de remerciement
  • Lors du festival, le pop-corn sera gratuit pour vous
  • Votre nom sera inscrit au "Tableau des Fondatrices et Fondateurs", installé au QG du Festival. Ce tableau nous suivra à chacune des éditions du Festival
  • De plus, vous recevrez un sac écologique à l'effigie du Festival

Don de 100$

  • Vous recevrez une superbe carte virtuelle de remerciement
  • Lors du festival, le pop-corn sera gratuit pour vous
  • Votre nom sera inscrit au "Tableau des Fondatrices et Fondateurs", installé au QG du Festival. Ce tableau nous suivra à chacune des éditions du Festival
  • Vous recevrez un sac écologique à l'effigie du Festival
  • De plus, vous aurez droit à une tournée historique du village de Fort-Coulonge, le samedi matin

story:
Video transcript is located here for viewing and downloading.

Their Kids! Queering the concept of “it takes a village.”

My name is Connor Banayad and I am the founder and CEO of Their Kids. I am a queer, gender nonconforming veteran caregiver with over a decade of childcare experience working with a diverse range of families and children. 

Their Kids is my brain baby. I am passionate about fostering the growth and development of children, supporting families in holistic capacities, and creating gender inclusive environments for all people.

Their Kids merges these passions and provides caregiver referrals, gender open playgroups, and workshops to cultivate community and relationships that emphasize diversity, empathy, and inclusion. 

To officially launch Their Kids, I have set up this crowdfunding campaign because it takes a village to create an inclusive childcare agency for kids, families, and caregivers! Please watch the video to learn more about Their Kids and then give to this campaign! 

What Their Kids Needs & What You Get

Their Kids is raising $50,000! Please give $5, $50, $500 — or any amount that feels good to you! Your generous donation will support the following:  

  • Launch platforms for matching gender inclusive caregivers with families who hold shared values and approaches to diversity, equity, and inclusion.
  • Provide sliding scale and scholarship programs for families for caregiver placements and playgroups. 
  • Host FREE gender workshops and social events -- all designed to create visibility, empower, and affirm marginalized identities!

To sweeten the deal, Their Kids is offering generous perks from Strand, Moxy, gc2b, and Calexico for anyone who gives to help meet the $50,000 goal. 

Every person who gives to Their Kids will be thanked and thanked again! If you give $500 or more, you will be named as a Founding Funder on Their Kids' website. 

Why Their Kids Matters 

Children are the future. And they deserve a future where they can grow and thrive that is wholly inclusive to and appreciative of all identities and bodies regardless of gender, sexuality, race, ethnicity, skin tone, ability, nationality, and size.

  • Their Kids is a facilitator calling caregivers, kids, and families into a gender inclusive community that puts empathy, compassion, acceptance, and self-love at the forefront.
  • Their Kids cultivates community and relationships that emphasize diversity, empathy, and inclusion.
  • Their Kids creates visibility, space, and validation for queer, trans, and gender nonconforming people.
  • There Kids advocates for empathetic care as a vehicle for social change and empowerment of marginalized people. 
  • Their Kids values all gender identities, expressions, and presentations. 

Other Ways You Can Support Their Kids 

I appreciate all of the ways you can support Their Kids, whether that's with your dollars or through the following avenues: 

  • Spread the word and share this Indiegogo campaign with your friends, families, neighbors, and colleagues! 
  • Follow Their Kids on Facebook and Instagram! 
  • Check out Their Kids' website and stay tuned for updates when programs launch in September! 

Thank You!

I am so grateful for everyone's support in this ambitious, but super important, endeavor! Thank you SO MUCH for helping to bring Their Kids to life and propel gender inclusivity for kids, families, caregivers, and communities!

Follow Their Kids on Facebook and Instagram! 
Check out Their Kids' website and stay tuned for updates when programs launch in September! 

Thank You!I am so grateful for everyone's support in this ambitious, but super important, endeavor! Thank you SO MUCH for helping to bring Their Kids to life and propel gender inclusivity for kids, families, caregivers, and communities!

story:
What We Need & What You Get

We're looking to raise at least $10,000 this year for the operations cost of Whiteaker Block Party. Remember, this is a completely free event and 100% volunteer driven! Not a single cent goes toward the organizers of WBP.

Our operational budget last year was close to $42,000. All of that money went in to giving you and all who visit us access to multiple stages, over 30 musicians and bands, wild entertainment, and free fun! Even $5 from all of you that come to enjoy the event would get us to our goal and beyond!

 

What will your contributions go to?

  • Infrastructure costs including rentals for stages and lighting
  • Permit and city fees
  • Insurance
  • Security

All of the above are some of the necessary items that we are required to have for the WBP to have it's event. They're also the most expensive and cost far over the $10,000 we're looking to raise here!

If we don't reach our goal, any funds raised through this campaign will still go toward all the above listed areas.

Perks listed will be available for pick-up at the info booth day of event unless otherwise requested.

As the Whiteaker Block Party has grown over the past 10 years, so has the cost and the demand on resources. 

As the late and great Brad Coffey said, the Whiteaker Block Party is "Seeking to preserve and enhance the social fabric of the Whiteaker Neighborhood. Engaging it in merriment, and exploring within it the pathways winding across the moral spectrum. We seek to foster communities through our libations, our celebrations, and our pop-up driveway dance parties by partnering with and promoting the creative pulse in our neighborhood."

Your contribution will help make the 2017 Whiteaker Block Party better than ever and aid in keeping this annual event free for you and anyone that attends!

story:
I’m a capoeira teacher, writer, and community improver, most of all an educator. I’ve been promoting Latin American Culture around the world and especially in Japan for almost 20 years. In 2011 I received my Master’s degree from Waseda University here in Tokyo and have been doing my best to make my community internationally and culturally aware through my Capoeira Zoador Academy. The best part of being here has been the amazing opportunity to connect with like-minded people who feel the way I do about cultural education. Takeshi (Contramestre of Capoeira/Super Chef) and Bobby (Language Teacher Extraordinaire): this team is my inspiration and support, as is each and every student I have taught throughout my life.

My Capoeira Zoador Academy has been a cornerstone of Brazilian culture in Tokyo and Asia for 15 years, but now it is time to evolve and do even more positive projects. It is our goal to open Tokyo's first Latin American cultural center near Hatanodai station in Tokyo.
    
Our mission is to create a Latin American (Americas) “third space” for international cultural exchange, language learning, cuisine, music, art and dance all in a centralized and convenient location in the same space or within a few minutes of each other. A third space is a place people identify with on a personal level, after the home and work-space.

Our philosophy and vision is simple. We believe that the positive promotion and exchange of Latin American culture, music, art, dance, and cuisine will improve our community, and our city. It will bring a much-needed energetic spark to Japan. This idea was born from my love of culture and education. Cultural Education is the one thing I have seen in my life that brings people together, be it through music, dance, language, or cuisine.

In the area we are planning to locate, there is nothing comparable to what we will do. By locating the cultural center in the same area, it will save people travel time and money. It will be in a sense a holistic center to promote a better lifestyle, which is crucially needed in Japan that ranks second highest in developed nations in suicide rates. All of these aspects will be linked together by the Café/Restaurant as a meeting space for food, and social and cultural interaction. Although other small schools, or café/restaurants exist in Tokyo, no one has brought it all together.

We have decided to open up the cultural center near Hatanodai station because this is still the same area as our long time Capoeira Zoador Academy. We also have a fan base in the area that we have built over the last 15 years (19 years in Japan total). This we will carry over to the café/restaurant and language school, as well as the new Capoeira Zoador academy school. This station is also the location of one of the biggest medical schools in Japan. Medical students have a strong need of language courses, especially English education. It is still an area with a growing population. It is situated between a junction between the Ikegami line and the Oimachi Line. Census reports 40 thousand people a day pass through the station gates.  

The location will be opened within 3-6 months upon finding a proper space. We already have our eyes on several locations and we are just waiting for the crowdfunding project to end to move forward. This will get us up and running right before the summer rush of 2019.

Budget:
Academy space 80 square meters. café/restaurant space 80 square meters but separated by a removable wall for use during events. Language School space 25 square meters. In total 185 square meters. In this location, rent is about $130 for a measurement (3.30 square meters). We are looking for about 56 Tsubo, which will come to $7,280 per month rent. Of course this depends on many factors. It is common for a landlord to ask for 6 months of rent and deposit. So a safe estimate is $40,000.

Our biggest savings will come from volunteer labor for remodeling because remodeling costs will be kept under $30,000 for cafe/restaurant. The academy will cost $5,000, as we have most of what we need. The language school will also cost $5,000. We can keep our remodeling/construction costs to $50,000 total for all three projects.

We are confident we can raise half of the necessary $90,000, but we really need help with the other half. So our hope is to raise $50,000 to help and cover the Indiegogo fees.

story:
Partnered with P.T Pacific Aviation (http://www.p-aviation.com)

 

 

 

Introducing Myself & Bali Air Adventure

 

Hi, I'm Michael and I've traveled to and from Bali for many years for both tourist and business purposes. I love Bali and can confirm it's one of my favourite places in the world. What I soon realized after travelling in-between this beautiful country is how difficult it is to reach Gili Islands! After talking to locals and doing research, I introduce to you - Bali Air Adventure (BAA).

BAA in partnership with Pacific Aviation is founded on the foundation of helping the local community and tourism to being people to the islands quicker with a regular air service. We will also run scenic morning and afternoon tours as a tourist attraction.

We're in the process of raising funds towards necessary Marketing Tactics ( Social Media, Print & Online Advertising) to kick off this project to another level. We believe BAA's business strategy is right and financially sound. We will provide efficient air transportation, offering excellent service to our guest at fares that is competitive, allowing BAA to be a long term success in the business.

What We Need

Our goal is to raise $20,000 USD for assistance in our marketing campaign to get the word out about our project. This involves a complete  Social Media Advertising Budget, Online Advertising through Google, Print Advertising such as relevant publications and hard copy project information . We really need your help in bringing this Seaplane service to the community & Tourism industry of Bali , Lombok and the Gili group of islands

If you like what you see, we please ask for a small backing through our "Support Bali Air Adventure" perk. You will be acknowledged through our Facebook page.

If you love what you see, we please ask for a small backing through our "Believe In Bali Air Adventure" perk. You will be acknowledged through our web site.

The Team

Our management team is prepared to perform and to contribute to the success of this project. The Bali Air Adventure team will be compromised of people who have many years of experience in the airline, travel and aviation industry - including myself.

With a passion for the travel industry, we require an extra push to get this project off the ground!

Mr Fashal Hambali - Managing Partner - Indonesia

                                         Managing Partner - PT Pacific Avaition

 

Mr Michael Johnston - Managing Partner - Australia

 

The Plane

Our Product is a Twin Otter Seaplane aircraft with 19 seats. The seats will be exclusive in luxury leather. All seats will be equipped with multi language audio so that our guest will be able to listen to guided tours while enjoying the scenic flight. The audio will be in twelve languages, English, Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Russian, French, Spanish, Germany, Indian, Arabian, and Netherlands and certainly in Indonesian language. The audio guide will provide our guest with information on Indonesia, Bali and also explanation on special places that we fly through. The service on board will include exclusive meal boxes which contain main meals, light snacks, refreshments, water and tropical juice.

Share This Campaign

If you've stumbled across our campaign and don't have the funds to back us, that's fine too! If you could spare 5 minutes of your time to Share it through Indiegogo's share tools whether that be through Facebook, Twitter, Email or just sending the link around to your friends!

A simple share can go a long way.https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/bali-air-adv...
