story:
Insert the Tibetan flag emoji - because representation matters

Whether you use them or not, emoji are now a part of daily life, featuring on every smartphone and social media platform in the world. Emoji have been referred to as  "the fastest growing form of language in history" and for many they now form a vital part of online communication. Because of this, the decisions made on which emoji do and do not appear in this new language are extremely important and can have far-reaching effects.

For the most part, the people in charge of emoji have done a good job of making sure everyone is represented in this new digital language - from recent updates which have allowed users to customise hair colour and skin-tones, to ensuring that males and females are equally depicted.

Perhaps the most important area of the emoji lexicon when it comes to representation is the flags section. Flags represent the most comprehensive and universally recognised symbols through which communities around the world communicate their identity and a sense of belonging - yet the Tibetan flag is nowhere to be seen. Representation matters. We must remedy this.

 

How will we get the Tibetan flag emoji?

The selection of emoji is decided by a group called the Unicode Consortium, made up mostly of representatives from the big tech companies like Google and Apple. They meet several times a year to decide which emoji should be added to the official list.

It should come as no surprise that a committee made up mostly of white, wealthy, men isn't always up to the task of deciding on the communication needs of the entire world. So, to their credit, they accept proposals for new emoji from the public.

The submission process is incredibly long and complex - taking up to two years and requiring some pretty major technical expertise. However, with your help, we will have the resources to see the entire process through to the end - and hopefully end up with a new Tibetan flag emoji on all our phones!

As well as the proposal, we will be running an awareness campaign. A major part of the approval process involves being able to show mass public support for the inclusion of the proposed emoji. Our campaign will help raise awareness of the lack of a Tibetan flag emoji, and encourage the public to show their support for its inclusion. Along the way we will also be introducing the flag to a whole new audience of people who may never have heard about Tibetan culture before.

 

What will we use the money for?

First and foremost, the money will go towards submitting the best possible proposal. Without the proposal, there can be no Tibetan flag emoji so this is the most important element. The money will be spent on things like external consultants to help us with the technical details and graphic design work to help us make the emoji look perfect. We will also be working with  Tibet-support organisations on both the proposal and the campaign.

The remaining funds will go towards running the best campaign we can to raise awareness with the public. This may include things like:

   Promotional videos and graphics

   Merchandise like shirts, hats and bags with campaign logos and hashtags

   A professional media pack for journalists

   Advertising and PR budget

  Travelling to events to promote the campaign (such as the yearly EmojiCon in New York)

   Hosting our own events and promotional days

Together, we can make sure the Tibetan flag, and Tibetan culture, gets the recognition it deserves.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

For those looking to do more, there are a few other things you can do to help the campaign.

  • Share this page on social media and with friends.
  • Follow the campaign on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram - @tibetflagemoji
  • Tweet the hashtag #InsertTibetanFlag to show your support - feel free to tag in @Unicode and @Emojipedia so they can see how important this emoji is to us all.

story:
We are proud and honored to be bringing you the THIRD annual Multiflora music festival.

The origin of Multiflora Productions began 7 years ago with a belief that live music concerts are a profound unifying social force during divisive times and provide an opportunity for people to gather together regardless of their differences to have uplifting and soul-affirming experiences.

Multiflora Productions was started as an arts agency for expanding the reach of traditional and genre-bending roots musicians through artist management, event marketing, and tour booking. We remain particularly interested in presenting traditional folkloric music as well as working with artists who explore and experiment with traditional music styles to create something that is at once connected to the past, expressed in the present, and imagined positively in the future.

For a sprawling global region that holds more than 6 million people, the city still lacks music programming that reflects the long-storied multicultural and international flavor of the city. You wouldn't believe the level of world-class global music acts that have a hard time finding shows in DC and end up bypassing us altogether.

We need your help because the costs of running a festival are staggering, especially involving multiple venues and international travel expenses.  Additionally, several groups based in the US will be traveling to here from across the country all the while still highlighting our incredible local groups based in the DC area. We cover some of the performance fees by charging admission but there are still many costs involved like lodging, transportation and basic hospitality. We keep ticket prices extremely low to keep the concerts accessible and your perk purchases help us pay the musicians a fair wage as well as cover productions costs like venue fees, paying for equipment and sound engineers as well as advertising so we can reach as many people in the region as possible. This year we are also be showing three films with post-screening discussions so we need to pay for screening fees and provide honorariums to the filmmakers and guest speakers.

Beyond helping us with the festival budget, your contribution is essential to making the festival a reality for the city, the artists, and the community. Currently we have no institutional support or endowments so the festival is completely independent and reliant upon public support.

Your support both financial and with spreading awareness. It costs nothing but time to forward this campaign out, do it! : )

Your continued support this year will help us get the attention and support of the city, local businesses, and arts organizations so the festival will continue to grow year after year. We humbly ask you to continue to help this be an annual city tradition.


For the full schedule of the festival visit this link HERE

Below is a list of some of our confirmed groups for this year's festival. Just click on the name to learn more.

Sihasin (Navajo)

Filles de Illighadad  (Niger)

Che Apalache (Argentina)

Los Wemblers de Iquitos (Peru)

La Inedita (Peru)

The Good Ones (Rwanda)

47soul (Jordan)

RAM (Haiti)

ASA-CHANG &Junray (Japan)

W.I.T.C.H. (Zambia)


Our venue partners this year:

Rhizome, 6950 Maple St NW, Washington, District of Columbia 20012

Suns Cinema 3107 Mount Pleasant St. NW Washington DC 20010

Bossa Bistro, 2463 18th St NW Washington, District of Columbia 20009

Tropicalia, 2001 14th St, NW, Lower Level – Corner of U & 14th (Enter From U St, downstairs)

Millennium Stage at the Kennedy Center 2700 F St NW, Washington, District of Columbia 20566

Hill Center 921 Pennsylvania Avenue, SE Washington, DC 20003 United States

Market SW 425 M St SW, Washington DC

The Green Zone 2226 18th St NW Washington, District of Columbia 20009

Bladensburg Waterfront Park 4601 Annapolis Road, Bladensburg, MD 20710

Thomas Jefferson Building – Coolidge Auditorium 10 1st Street SE, Washington, DC 20540

story:
The 1920s Picnic

All around the world people throw 1920s events, Gatsby parties, and Jazz picnics, but none of these take place in the birth place of Jazz! Annees Follies wants to change all that, and bring the excitement of the 1920s back to the people of New Orleans! 

Annees Follies is made up of a group of ladies interested in history and vintage clothing. The ladies at Annees Follies wanted to create a picnic for them and their friends, and nearly overnight the picnic event page jumper to over 1k in interested New Orleanians! Excited and intrigued Annees Follies hosted the first picnic in June, and is excited to host the 2nd picnic on October 1st. 

 For the second 1920s Picnic in Audubon park Annees Follies wants to make this picnic even better than the last, and needs your help! We would love to book a band for this picnic, as well as cover some of the expenses that come with hosting the picnic. We need your help to continue to host picnics in the future! Annees Follies would also love to throw additional events around the city as well. So, stay tuned!

We have many amazing perks available for donors including local art and fun picnic items! If you are unable to donate at this time sharing our indigogo and our event page is always appreciated and helpful!

Thank you, and we hope to see you at the next picnic!

story:
Pokhara's first outdoor film festival

Film screenings in three different outdoor settings throughout Pokhara, Nepal; locations selected based on proximity to educational institutions and feasibility for stage and production design.

Our Goals

  • Inspire creativity and imaginative thinking
  • Promote community among locals and visitors 
  • Encourage language learning and cultural awareness through film

    The Plan

    Step 1. Finalize financial backing and partnerships

    Step 2. Complete stage set-up and design

    Step 3. Plan necessary PR and promotional activities

    Step 4. Outreach and community advertising campaigns

    Step 5. Produce film screenings

    Proposed Locations

    • Lamachaur - near Gandaki Boarding School, Saraswati Boarding School, Alfa, and Indra Rajya Laxmi School
    • Bhadrakali - near Bhadrakali School, Balkalyan School, Pokhara United School, Eden's Academy, and Hill Point
    • Lakeside - Fewa Secondary, Shining Star Secondary, Little Step, Tal Barahi, National Inventive Boarding, and Motherland
    • Ram Bazar - near Kalika, Golden Future School, Amarsingh School, Social Public, Navadeep English, St. Three Angels, Kells Academy, SOS, and Marigold

    What We Need 

    Anticipated expenses for three days of movie screenings: 

    • Screen and projector rental - $170 per day
    • Stage and sound - $250 per day
    • 150 chairs plus transport and setup - $60 per day
    • Lights and generator - $75 per day
    • Tickets, banners, and flyers - $150 total
    • Advertisement and design - $130 total
    • Volunteer water and snacks - $100 per day
    • Event staff and personnel - $150 per day
    • Permits and necessary government approval

    How You Can Help

    This is the first multi-day outdoor film festival in Kaski District. The event will require planning, teamwork, and community support. Your support of our work and the social initiatives of Khata Life helps us create unique experiences for the people of Pokhara, Nepal.

    We need to reach this fundraising goal in order to make this event happen. Please share our campaign and follow for updates.

    About Our Team

    Learning House encourages education and leadership in Pokhara, Nepal. Combining the comfort of a community space with offerings of an educational facility, Learning House promotes learning and development through classes, seminars, and workshops. We are grateful to our teachers, students, staff, and volunteers for their hard work and dedication.

    To learn more, visit www.learninghousenepal.com. 

    Thank you, thank you, thank you!

story:
Who We Are

The Center for Art and Thought  (CA+T) is a web-based arts and education 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization: https://centerforartandthought.org/. On our award-winning website, we curate and juxtapose works by artists and thinkers in a uniquely Philippine-centric way. We take the Philippines and Filipinos as a point of departure for thinking about culture globally.  Colonialism, migration, and globalization--the Philippines is an ideal starting point for understanding these transnational processes. And CA+T has become an excellent and, crucially, free resource for teaching and learning about pressing contemporary issues, from labor migration to environmental crises. CA+T’s virtual platform presents creative and scholarly works through four programs: 1) Curated Exhibitions, 2) Commissioned Works , 3) a DIALOGUES series of moderated, thematically-driven conversations, and 4) a one-of-a-kind Artist-in-Residence Virtual Residency  program. Together with you, we are a community: of Filipino and Filipino diaspora people, of artists and thinkers.

This Is Where You Come In

CA+T needs your help to pay our ordinary bills that granting organizations typically won't cover. We need your donation so that we can keep bringing you curated exhibitions like Empire's Eyes, which connects the history of colonial stereographs to contemporary practices of racialized documentation and surveillance. Especially now, when funding for arts and education is under threat, we need the critical literacies CA+T nurtures and sustains more than ever.

What Your Donation Covers

Operational costs, the services that keep CA+T up and running and that granting organizations typically won't cover:

  • Subscription fees for Vimeo Pro, ISSUU, Soundcloud, Dropbox, and web hosting
  • Editorial, IT, and curatorial consultant fees & internship stipends
  • Online and print advertising and publicity
  • Legal and accounting fees
  • Bookkeeping and fax services
  • Printing, shipping, and postage costs

And check out the perks! Thanks to our amazing community, we have some awesome tokens of our appreciation. You can also share the love the old fashioned way. Cash money. Every dollar counts, and the more donors we have the better we look to funding agencies.

story:
Several years ago members of 3 Buffalo Hall of Fame Boards got together and talked about how they didn’t have a place to honor their members and share the wealth of memorabilia they had from great moments in Buffalo’s sports, music and broadcasting.

Some wise soul in the group said – “well, why don’t we team up and build one full Buffalo Experience?”

Another said, “that’s a great idea – especially since music, sports and broadcasting all intersect in so many ways”

A third person chimed in, “and everyone who has lived in Buffalo or loves this town has been touched by one, if not all three”

All three said, “Hey!  Let’s Just Build It!”

Okay, maybe that dialogue is a little bit fiction, but not entirely.  If you love Buffalo you know we have some of the greats – Jim Kelly and Thurman Thomas, Rick James and the Goo Goo Dolls, and media that has covered it all and kept us informed throughout our lives here in the Queen City.                       

The three boards collaborated and formed the BFLO Hall of Fame Experience to let you, your friends and family relive the great moments, share your own memories and be a star on the stage, set or field. It will also be a place to celebrate "the Buffalo Fans" where there will be a Wall of Fame honoring the best fans in the world. Without fans, there would be no sports, music or broadcasting Hall of Fame!

                           

So the first steps have been taken.  Hadley Exhibits has created renderings of some of the interactive exhibits where you can make the play in the broadcast booth or jam onstage. Foit-Albert architects have been laying out a floor plan that includes event space and a theater as well as the exhibits and the Halls of Fame.  They even created a place where your name might be found on the wall!

We are in discussions about a location somewhere among the other exciting new things that are developing in Buffalo.  

And now we need to start fundraising and letting you, the Buffalo fans, get involved!  The Bills Backers and Bills Mafia are already excited about this project and they will be kicking it off for us at bars and locations on game days throughout the country.  We are reaching out to music fans at concerts and events. 

But no matter where you are you can be a part of the action.  This crowdfunding campaign will allow us to start the next phase of getting it built, hiring staff and it gives you the chance to become a founding member!  Each and every donation to this campaign will get your name listed on the website and eventually when the doors open in the actual BFLO Hall of Fame Experience!

This is the first step on what will be an exciting journey towards throwing open the doors.  And we welcome you as the first hard core Buffalo fans to lead the way! 

  • Purchase a perk so you know you will find your name in the Hall of Fame
  • Share the campaign on your social media with your friends and family
  • Like our pages and stay up to date on our progress
  • Look for activities and contests that will bring your prizes or put you in touch with some of our amazing Hall of Fame members from Sports, Music and Broadcasting.

Thank you Buffalo Fans!  Now, Let’s Just Build It!

story:
Human Library: York organizer, Katie Hartman, is a believer in the power of words and stories to connect individuals to themselves, others, and the world around them. She enjoys pursuing ideas and collaborations that speak to her heart, such as her project with elementary readers that brought a Little Free Library to John Rudy Park, or her organization of York's first Human Library. She strives to bring others together and build understanding through the universal power of our human experiences.

Last year Katie organized a successful inaugural Human Library: York event at the York College Center for Community Engagement. She curated a collection of 35 titles to share with an audience of 60 readers. The response participants had to the experience was overwhelming. People who shared their stories as books used words to describe the event such as inclusive, powerful, liberating, and healing. Readers who were able to attend and share in a conversation with someone whose life experience was different from their own left with hope, inspiration, and understanding. They gained empathy for others, reached out to community organizations to become more involved, and learned more about themselves and their own struggles in the process.

During the event, some human books volunteered to share their experiences with our video production company and these stories were then able to be shared with a wider audience, connecting people to the event and to one another.

Currently plans are in the works to bring a second Human Library to life this spring. On March 25th, we will be hosting another event expanding our collection to include 40 books and reach 80 readers.

In order to host another successful event we are now reaching out to the community to provide you with the opportunity to support this impactful experience and continue to share the stories of the people of York.

To preserve the spirit of the program and ensure equal access to participants, we do not charge admission to attend or participate in this event. Our March Human Library will be held as scheduled, regardless of if we reach our targeted goal, however the more we can raise, the higher quality of materials and experiences we can provide. Donations towards this project will help to provide a safe, comfortable space for both books and readers to engage in these honest, vulnerable conversations. Contributions will also help to cover the costs of the professionals we hire to join us for the event capturing individuals’ stories on film to breathe a second life into them by being able to increase the stories’ reach. Many of these professionals are already working at a discounted rate because they believe in the project and these partnerships allow us to keep these expenses as low as possible. Any additional funds raised during this campaign will be put toward future Human Library: York events.

Even if you are not able to contribute financially, your support and sharing of this project can help us to spread the word. Please spread the word and share this campaign with your community!

About the Human Library

A Human Library is a library of human beings, individuals, that each represent a group in the community that may be somehow exposed to stigma, prejudice, and/or discrimination. It aims to establish a safe conversational space where difficult questions are expected, appreciated, and answered.

Patrons are invited to become readers by taking a person out on loan for a conversation on the topic/issue that they represent. Conversations are offered to a duration of thirty minutes. This is not a storytelling session, but rather an experience sharing with built in Q & A. The outcome of the session and direction of the talk is dependent on what the reader(s) ask about.

story:
Of course we all know it is OUR responsibility to be prepared for emergencies. Our governments tell us, non-government organizations tell us, we even tell each other... So why aren’t we? 

  1. It’s not something we prioritize. We are busy and honestly it’s a little overwhelming.
  2. We have a hard time knowing what we need and what we don't need.
  3. It is expensive to buy good equipment and the cheap stuff is useless in a real emergency. 

FLASHOVER has the solution: We not only created the most effective emergency bag in the world, we created an entire membership system to provide you with the information and support you need to help others. 


FlashKit Includes:

The FlashKit includes the following and comes complete with information regarding what to add (eg: clothing & work-gloves that fit you just right, etc.) to optimize the kit for your needs. Giving you generic sized items is in-efficient and can be dangerous in an emergency. 
 
  1. Crank and Solar Power Pack to charge USB devices including your cell phone.
  2. If reception is down the UHF Communication Radio has NOAA weather channel and can communicate to other members and even emergency services.
  3. The 950lumens Waterproof Tactical Flashlight with SOS and Strobe function is USB chargeable and is strong enough to literally turn night into day. 
  4. A Quick Connect Water Filtration Straw will keep you confident in your water supply
  5. The 32gig USB Stick holds important files, photos, etc. so you won't be scrambling to protect your documentation and memories.
  6. Top of the line 1st Aid & Rescue Gear will allow you to help yourself and those around you in case of injury. 
  7. Thermal space blanket to keep you warm. 
  8. Emergency Food is long lasting (5 years +) and will give you crucial energy to keep moving and helping.
  9. The Arc Lighter is state of the art USB chargeable, wind, cold and rain resistant and will let you ignite kindling, candles and more. 
  10. Personal Protection Equipment such as breathing masks and safety glasses are top of the line and ready to keep you safe so you can help others.
  11. The Flashover multitool will give you a trusted knife, can opener, and other tools at your fingertips.
  12. Multiple (3)  illumination & Sound Detection Tools will allow you to signal for help and light your way. 
  13. A super hook so you can hang your FlashKit anywhere.. 


Because we have carefully sourced our products and already agreed to bulk orders with our suppliers, FLASHOVER can provide this system to you at a fraction of that cost.




Although we have already purchased elements of the Kit, built our website, assembled our team, and coded a ground-breaking neighbourhood mapping system… We need your support to take FLASHOVER to the next level! 

Help FLASHOVER empower communities by purchasing one of the FlashKit PERKS today! Or help support our launch by picking up any of our smaller perks featured in this important campaign.

The advance orders will allow us to purchase crucial inventory to get FLASHOVER operational so that we can make real social impacts in disaster relief around the world.

story:
Short Summary

"Destination Lithuanian America 2018" is two large things in one.

The main one of them is the free interactive map, where each of America's Lithuanian sites will be marked, have its photographs and story added.

This map, however, would be impossible without a painstaking expedition which we will launch in 2018 August. During this expedition, we'll visit 200-400 Lithuanian heritage sites in the US Mid-West, we'll drive 3500+ miles between them, we'll meet more than 100 people who will tell us the stories of the Lithuanian heritage, we'll take pictures for the map. The expedition will be covered in published diaries and you will be able to follow it on the social media.

Impact

We have already completed the first leg of this project, mapping 330 Lithuanian sites in the 11 states of New England and Mid-Atlantic, taking 8500 photos and meeting almost 200 people. The map is available on http://map.truelithuania.com , and it is this same map that will be expanded with new information. After the 2018 expansion, it will cover the areas where 70% of Lithuanian-Americans live and 90% of Lithuanian-American heritage.

Furthermore, since 2012, I (project leader Augustinas Žemaitis) am doing the http://global.truelithuania.com website on the Lithuanian sites abroad. I became interested in it after I witnessed what major Lithuanian sites exist beyond Lithuania and how little they are known. I dug for the information in libraries and archives, I checked it on satellite images and "Google street view" and, eventually, in person. Currently, 30 countries are included on the website.

We already researched the preliminary information about many of the Lithuanian sites in Mid-West, so we will be able to concentrate the expedition on things that could be only done on-site (exploration, picture-taking, coordinate-marking, live interviews) and not waste time on doing what could be also done elsewhere.

All our projects:

  • Help the Lithuanian diaspora discover their roots by visiting and learning about the Lithuanian sites worldwide.
  • Help Lithuanians from Lithuania to understand the importance of Lithuanian-American ties and encourages them to visit these sites when travelling to America.
  • Help non-Lithuanian Americans to learn about yet another important-yet-forgotten minority that helped to construct the modern USA.
  • Help neighbours of the Lithuanian sites to learn more about what is next to them.
  • Help to protect the Lithuanian heritage by drawing attention towards it.

I addition to the websites, my articles on Lithuanian heritage and interviews with me have been published in Lithuanian, Lithuanian-American and non-Lithuanian media. More articles are going to appear after the "Destination Lithuanian America 2018" mission.

What We Need & What You Get

The first part of "Destination Lithuanian America 2018" is an expedition to map and photograph the heritage on-site, as well as to hear its stories. In order for the mission to be successful, we need to cover large distances in short time and be able to reach remote sites. For that, the only viable option is car rental, which will also bring in the fuel costs, parking costs, and road tolls.

During the expedition, we will also incur significant expenses on accommodation and food.

Getting to Chicago, where the expedition begins, and back will also cost money.

In order to successfully agree on meetings with Lithuanian-Americans, as well as manage the social media, we'll need telephone and internet access throughout the expedition.

Some Lithuanian-related heritage objects we plan to visit and map charge entrance fees.

After returning from "Destination - America 2018", we will expand the interactive map with new information. This will also have its costs.

Furthermore, such a map is useful only if it is used widely, therefore, we will aim to popularize it through marketing.

Without all this, the project would not be possible.

In return for support, we offer (in addition to the map itself, which is free of charge):

  • Being mentioned as a sponsor on the map website. Depending on the amount, you will get your name and photo included, whereas the major supporters will also have their brief life story published, including their previous work for Lithuanian heritage, minority heritage, or other similar fields. It is possible to opt-out if you want to stay anonymous.
  • Memorabilia of the project, such as postcards and t-shirts made and dedicated especially for you.
  • For those who will pledge the most, we offer a personal lecture on the Lithuanian-American heritage by us, or even the possibility to change the plan of the project by visiting your area and marking the Lithuanian heritage there as well. These sponsorship options may be great not only for a single person but also for a group of people or organizations.

Risks & Challenges

The project is sound, as its creators have an experience in running a very similar first leg of the project, with Augustinas Žemaitis researching the Lithuanian heritage abroad extensively since 2012.

The only risk could be the project's dependence on the experience and knowledge of Augustinas Žemaitis, which could cause problems if something would happen to him. However, Augustinas, having worked on the popularisation of Lithuanian-American heritage for a long time, has no intention of quitting and is the major driving force under this Indiegogo campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like the project, please follow us on Facebook on https://www.facebook.com/truelithuania/ 

If you like the project very much, please share it with your friends. Don't forget to give the link to the already existing map ( http://map.truelithuania.com ) - especially if they live in New England or Mid-Atlantic regions that are mapped already or in the Mid-West.

If you are a Lithuanian-American or know stories about the Lithuanian-American heritage (buildings, monuments, cemeteries, etc.) in your area - please contact us and meet to talk to us, we will write that down! This does not cost anything - only your time. Only because of people such as you, we are able to make this project great!

If you want to help us even more and you live along the expedition route - you may offer two of us to spend a single night at your home (that way we would save on the accommodation that night).

The main one of them is the free interactive map, where each of America's Lithuanian sites will be marked, have its photographs and story added.

During this expedition, we'll visit 200-400 Lithuanian heritage sites in the US Mid-West, we'll drive 3500+ miles between them, we'll meet more than 100 people who will tell us the stories of the Lithuanian heritage, we'll take pictures for the map. The expedition will be covered in published diaries and you will be able to follow it on the social media.
Impact

story:
What is a Makoa Quest?

These unique Hawaiian tours or "Quests" immerse our guests in authentic Hawaiian culture and service, ​led by Hawaiian cultural practitioners. These tours are unique, allowing guests to walk in the footsteps of​ Hawaiian ancestors. In Hawaiian, ‘makoa’ means courage.  Makoa Quest seeks to ignite each guest's journey into self and to meet this journey with courage.  We accomplish this by providing interactive, fun filled experiences. 

Our Quest

​Over two million people visit Maui yearly, and many return numerous times to experience all that Maui offers. Many are seeking true cultural experiences. Our ultimate mission is that Makoa Quest tours catalyze a shift in consciousness by providing meaningful connection with Hawaiian values and indigenous wisdom throughout the global family.​ ​Through Makoa Quest's promotion and success as a culturally-rooted tour company​​, we will be able to accomplish this with visitors from around the world. The best part is that this business model is scale-able, so as we grow, our ultimate vision is to replicate this to other Hawaiian Islands and places to perpetuate native cultures worldwide. 
 

Beyond Sightseeing, Beyond Eco Tourism 

This is not your typical tour (there is nothing like this being offered on Maui) so most people will need to see a video to truly understand the mana (spiritual power) of Makoa Quests!
 
Join The Quest
 
We are a registered business in the State of Hawaii and have our logo.  We have all the insurance, permits, and licenses that are needed. We are also members of The Maui Native Hawaiian Chamber of Commerce. We are now at a place, that with your help, the company and it's mission will move forward.  

All crowdfunding will directly fund the following: We are ready to shoot three promotional videos, that look pro, which will beautifully showcase our unique tours which we’ll offer our first year. These videos will be gorgeous~ on the beach during sunset with a campfire, at a taro patch on ancestral lands and finally, in a rain forest of tropical fruits ready for the picking. We also need all tour setup materials. Since marketing for this type of company is essential, funding will go towards a great website, a marketing strategy and materials, 
 
We have worked for several years on building relationships, funding initial groundwork and learning how to make this happen in a very authentic and meaningful way. We now need you! We have selected perks to get you "beach or adventure" ready all while feeling the spirit of Aloha.  
 
Our Quest to Serve
 
A percentage of every tour booked will go directly to serve at-risk youth on Maui and create meaningful and culturally rooted experiences for them. For us, the non profit has been our original motivation for Makoa Quest.  So as visitors experience the culture in a fun and meaningful way, they are also making a big impact on Maui.
 

Spreading The Quest

Another way you can help, is by spreading the word!  Please use the Indiegogo share tools to spread this opportunity with ​your friends and family.

story:
The Firebird Festival is an annual celebration of arts and culture that is held in Phoenixville, Pennsylvania.

This year marks the 14th year of the festival, as it returns to Friendship Field on December 9th, 2017.

http://firebirdfestival.com

The Firebird Festival mission is to provide an annual celebration of the borough of Phoenixville's namesake - the Phoenix. Just as the Phoenix rose from its own ashes, the town of Phoenixville has risen, and continues to rebuild and improve the local community, after the loss of its principle industry in the early 1980's.
The festival is designed to foster a collaboration of local artistic and creative talent, and to enhance the overall cultural life of Phoenixville.

100+ performers, an expansive craft vendor area, and gourmet food trucks and vendors from the Philadelphia and the surrounding suburbs will be on site to welcome the thousands of participants who flock to Phoenixville for the festival. 

There will also be a parade from downtown Phoenixville, leading its way up to Friendship Field. The community is encouraged to join in the parade, which will feature paper lanterns, peace birds, puppets, dancers, drummers and more.

There will be continuous shuttle buses connecting downtown to the bird site at Friendship Field.

Our Goal

We are trying to raise $6,000 through this campaign - by December 8th, 2017. If we can raise that amount in our campaign this year, it will give us the ability to do the great things that are planned for the festival this year - and to plan ahead for next year!

How You Can Help

There are many elements that go into the festival, ranging from building the bird and providing a safe and comfortable festival experience for the community, to providing entertainment, obtaining insurance, and promoting the festival.

Below is a breakdown of some of the annual expenses that we incur when putting on the festival:

Portable Restrooms - $2,100
Stage & Sound System for Musicians and Performers - $2,500
Compensation for Musicians and Performers - $1,500
Insurance for the Festival - $3,000
Posters, Flyers and Printing for Promotional Material and Programs - $1,000
Wood and Materials for Construction of the Phoenix - $1,000

We all have a part to play in this wonderful celebration, and we look to each of you, the community, friends and families who have enjoyed this wonderful celebration in the past, to help us achieve 100% of our fundraising goal.

We have been very successful in raising funds in the past, thanks in part to the support of people who gave gifts through our previous Indiegogo campaigns. Let's keep the fire burning and do it again!

Please join in support of the Firebird Festival by making a gift through this campaign, and by asking family and friends to join you in making a gift.

You can also help by using the social media tools on this page to share this campaign with your friends and family who embrace what the Firebird Festival is doing for the community.

All funds that are raised through this campaign will go to support the purchase of construction materials and goods and services listed above, in order to ensure a safe and exciting Firebird Festival for 2017!

Gift Recognitions and Perks

Every gift is important - from $1 and $5 gifts, to gifts of $500 and beyond. Every donation to the campaign is greatly appreciated and put to use.

Please see the list of "perks" for donors along the right side of this page, for what we are able to offer to donors as "thank you" recognitions for continued support.

We are offering photographs, T-shirts, mugs, and even 5 chances to be "torchbearers" and pass the torch into the Phoenix, lighting it on fire on December 9th, 2017!

With your help, the Phoenix will always rise from its ashes at the Firebird Festival!

story:
The play 

Set in the heyday of glam rock and science fiction, Rocket Man is a play about family and friends bearing the brunt of a little-understood mental illness. Velvet Goldmine and Withnail & I collide in a small suburb of Cambridge in 1976. This is the latest play from multi-award-winning playwright Tess Humphrey.

The pitch

In 2018 we are raising money and awareness so we can take this play to Edinburgh Fringe in August. Despite having some strong glam rock and sci-fi roots, this play is based on a true story and it’s a story that’s happening to millions of people: it’s a story about the humiliation and isolation a young man faces after a failed suicide attempt. Right now in the UK, suicide is the biggest killer of young men, and while campaigns like TimeToTalk are picking up steam, people still face huge social stigma when their mental illnesses become known. 

In this play we and we aim to fight the stigma around bipolar disorder, and around men seeking help for their mental health. While our story is based on real suffering, we hope it leaves you feeling hopeful, uplifted and ready to fight for a society where mental illness is treated with openness and compassion.

We are looking to raise £1300 so that we can perform our show for two weeks at Edinburgh Fringe, the largest theatre platform in the world, to spread our message to hundreds of people.  Updates to follow soon!

story:
Update 5/9/2017: NYC Holi Hai Festival 2017 was a huge success!! We've received tremendous love and support from people who attended. We had a great time creating this experience for thousands of New Yorkers and people who came from near and far to attend this festival love, happiness and spring.


It takes a lot to put up a festival at this scale, emotionally and financially. If you attended the festival or think that this tradition of New York should continue, support us on this page. Help us pay the bills and plan on making the next one even better.

​

Update 4/9/2017: Thank You to everyone who has contributed to making NYC Holi Hai a success so far! We continue to move towards our goal steadily. Don't forget that there are exciting perks coming your way!! 

 

“Holi is the day to express love with colors. All the colors that are on you are of love.” ~ Anonymous

Our Story

Hi there! My name is Megha Kalia and I am the founder of the NYC Holi Hai festival. I’m a dance artist and a proponent of the celebratory Bhangra dance. I created this festival - free admission and open for everyone - out of a passion to bring diverse communities together to celebrate life.

As an immigrant in the US, I realized the importance of having a platform where artists and communities can come together under one roof in an exchange of culture and festivities.

The traditional Hindu festival of Holi symbolizes inclusivity and became the inspiration to create a multi-cultural stage of rejoicing and welcoming spring. If we can continue this tradition in New York City, it will become an exemplary model for others to emulate.

I want to thank you in advance for believing in the cause. Because of your support we will be able to bring a confluence of diverse communities and tackle hate by challenging the ignorance around us.

“Festivals promote diversity, they bring neighbors into dialogue, they increase creativity, they offer opportunities for civic pride, they improve our general psychological well-being. In short, they make cities better places to live.”
~ David Binder

What We Need

We are raising $25,000 to meet the essential minimum production cost to make this festival happen. 

Permits & Legal Fee

  • Event Permits $11,000
  • Safety Permits $500
  • Sound & Power Permits $500
  • Insurance $1,000

Production

  • Cleanup Crew & Equipment $5,200
  • Porta Sans $1,800
  • Security Personnel $5,000

TOTAL 

  • Permits, Insurance, Security, Cleanup $25,000

"America is grappling with cultural diversity, and I just want to put a show on that represents the world in which I live." ~ David Alan Grier

Our Impact

  • Since beginning in 2010, NYC Holi Hai has hosted on stage over 110 groups and 600 artists from different genres of dance - Indian, Modern & Contemporary, Hip-hop, Latin, Arabian, Korean, Spanish, Native American and others.
  • Attendees come from over 750 cities and 36 states of the US, and represent more than 40 countries of the world.
  • The festival has been free admission since 2010 and allowed people from all communities to come together in a joyous way to forgive-and-forget.

“If we cannot now end our differences, at least we can help make the world safe for diversity.” ~ John F. Kennedy

The Move

  • We started the festival in a park by the UN Plaza in 2010 with three hundred people who came to celebrate a joyous day of Holi. Over the years, the message of inclusive diversity and interchange of cultures became a movement.
  • In 2017, we're moving to the Governors Island, with more space and sunshine.

"Diversity of thought and culture and religion and ideas has been the strength of America." ~ Gary Locke

Media & Press for NYC Holi Hai

  • NYC Holi Hai has received love and adulation from many bloggers and journalists for its mission.
  • New York Times, Timeout, Villagevoice, The Gothamist, I Love NY, News NY1, New York International, Mommy Poppins, India Abroad, Pulsd

“Diversity: the art of thinking independently together.” ~ Malcolm Forbes

Challenges

For a dance organization to put this event together is a huge task. The event is open and accessible to anyone and everyone who'd like to be a part of it. We are proud of the support received from past generous donors & helpful volunteers. Without your logistical and financial support it would be impossible for us to organize this event in the most expensive city of the world!

“Diversity may be hardest thing for a society to live with, and perhaps the most dangerous thing for a society to be without.” ~ David Binder

Ways You Can Help

  • Help us spread the word via social media by inviting your friends and family to be part of the celebration of diversity.
  • Want to help out with the field work? We are looking for volunteers to help spread the word and manage operations on the day-of. Please contact volunteer@nycbhangra.com.
  • Attend our fundraiser and toast a night of the meeting of two cultures.
  • Share a photo to video with us on social media on what diversity means to you on Facebook, Instagram or Twitter with the hashtag #ColorsOfDiversity.

THANK YOU SO MUCH!

NYC Bhangra Dance Company - Promoting Indian Dance & Festivals is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-­profit arts service organization. Contributions made in checks for the charitable purposes of NYC Bhangra must be made payable to “Fractured Atlas” only. Any contribution above the value of the goods and services received by the donor is tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

All the colors that are on you are of love.” ~ AnonymousOur StoryHi there! My name is Megha Kalia and I am the founder of the NYC Holi Hai festival. I’m a dance artist and a proponent of the celebratory Bhangra dance. I created this festival - free admission and open for everyone - out of a passion to bring diverse communities together to celebrate life.As an immigrant in the US, I realized the importance of having a platform where artists and communities can come together under one roof in an exchange of culture and festivities.The traditional Hindu festival of Holi symbolizes inclusivity and became the inspiration to create a multi-cultural stage of rejoicing and welcoming spring. If we can continue this tradition in New York City, it will become an exemplary model for others to emulate.I want to thank you in advance for believing in the cause. Because of your support we will be able to bring a confluence of diverse communities and tackle hate by challenging the ignorance around us.“Festivals promote diversity, they bring neighbors into dialogue, they increase creativity, they offer opportunities for civic pride, they improve our general psychological well-being. In short, they make cities better places to live.”~ David BinderWhat We NeedWe are raising $25,000 to meet the essential minimum production cost to make this festival happen. Permits & Legal Fee
Event Permits $11,000
Safety Permits $500
Sound & Power Permits $500
Insurance $1,000
Production
Cleanup Crew & Equipment $5,200
Porta Sans $1,800
Security Personnel $5,000
TOTAL Permits, Insurance, Security, Cleanup $25,000
"America is grappling with cultural diversity, and I just want to put a show on that represents the world in which I live." ~ David Alan GrierOur Impact
Since beginning in 2010, NYC Holi Hai has hosted on stage over 110 groups and 600 artists from different genres of dance - Indian, Modern & Contemporary, Hip-hop, Latin, Arabian, Korean, Spanish, Native American and others.
Attendees come from over 750 cities and 36 states of the US, and represent more than 40 countries of the world.
The festival has been free admission since 2010 and allowed people from all communities to come together in a joyous way to forgive-and-forget.
“If we cannot now end our differences, at least we can help make the world safe for diversity.” ~ John F. KennedyThe Move
We started the festival in a park by the UN Plaza in 2010 with three hundred people who came to celebrate a joyous day of Holi. Over the years, the message of inclusive diversity and interchange of cultures became a movement.
In 2017, we're moving to the Governors Island, with more space and sunshine.
"Diversity of thought and culture and religion and ideas has been the strength of America." ~ Gary LockeMedia & Press for NYC Holi Hai
NYC Holi Hai has received love and adulation from many bloggers and journalists for its mission.

New York Times, Timeout, Villagevoice, The Gothamist, I Love NY, News NY1, New York International, Mommy Poppins, India Abroad, Pulsd

“Diversity: the art of thinking independently together.” ~ Malcolm ForbesChallengesFor a dance organization to put this event together is a huge task. The event is open and accessible to anyone and everyone who'd like to be a part of it. We are proud of the support received from past generous donors & helpful volunteers. Without your logistical and financial support it would be impossible for us to organize this event in the most expensive city of the world!“Diversity may be hardest thing for a society to live with, and perhaps the most dangerous thing for a society to be without.” ~ David BinderWays You Can Help
Help us spread the word via social media by inviting your friends and family to be part of the celebration of diversity.
Want to help out with the field work? We are looking for volunteers to help spread the word and manage operations on the day-of. Please contact volunteer@nycbhangra.com.
Attend our fundraiser and toast a night of the meeting of two cultures.
Share a photo to video with us on social media on what diversity means to you on Facebook, Instagram or Twitter with the hashtag #ColorsOfDiversity.
THANK YOU SO MUCH!NYC Bhangra Dance Company - Promoting Indian Dance & Festivals is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-­profit arts service organization. Contributions made in checks for the charitable purposes of NYC Bhangra must be made payable to “Fractured Atlas” only. Any contribution above the value of the goods and services received by the donor is tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
Sarab - Strings of Change is one of A New Dawn in the Negev’s most successful and heart-warming programs. Sarab, which means oasis, strives to change the social reality of the Bedouins of the Negev by providing quality music education, starting with children in elementary schools.  Music develops creativity, attentiveness, and appreciation of beauty; it provides a feeling of identity and belonging, and brings people together in the aim of achieving a common goal. Music education teaches perseverance, concentration, and focus; it affects students' general academic performance and endows them with valuable skills that serve them later in life. Moreover, learning to play an instrument is a time consuming task, keeping children out of trouble. Music can be the start of a different, better life for the Bedouin community, and a new basis for establishing fruitful cooperation and communication between the Bedouin and the Jewish communities.

With your generous support we are seeking to purchase ten new instruments including a cello for use in 2016.

A New Dawn in the Negev is a Bedouin-Jewish, grassroots community-based organization. We work tirelessly to strengthen the next generation of Bedouin youth and young adults, in the Negev region of Southern Israel. We provide them with practical tools and global ambitions to ensure they can thrive in the 21st century. We achieve our goals through providing formal and non-formal education, promoting a shared society and providing leadership and skills-based training to Bedouin boys and girls. We also serve as a network, connecting Israeli and international organizations and initiatives. Through these programs, we further connect the Bedouin youth to the greater society within Israel and globally. Ultimately, A New Dawn sows the seeds for future spirited, moral and ambitious Bedouin leaders.

Impact
The purchase of ten new violins for our program will not only change the lives of over 50 children who will directly play on them, but also the broader community in facilitating exchange and supporting Bedouin talent.

How you can help?
Whether or not you can make a donation, please help to be an ambassador by sharing this link with others who might be interested in supporting our project.

 

For more information on A New Dawn, please visit: https://anewdawninthenegev.org.

story:
Short Summary

The most significant part of this production is the director's intention. As an artist, director Taka Tsubota strongly believes that it is important to talk about the untouchable subjects in his films. Observing the Japanese film industry from an outside perspective (raised in Japan, educated in the US) he grew concerns towards the major networks that tend to reject development of politically and historically challenging material.

His film Stolen is a political drama that discusses the outcome of a very serious international crime that has affected the lives of many Japanese civilians. In the past, North Korea has intended a series of abduction of ordinary citizens with no explanation or returns. In light of such crimes, the Japanese government has been tied to complicated diplomatic issues that prevented them from helping their people. The popular tendency we see in people who are forced into helpless situations such as this is to internally blame each other; i.e the culture of “victim-shaming”. Stolen challenges the sugarcoated Japanese film industry that shies away from sensitive subjects and openly discuss unspoken matters while exposing the unfiltered culture as it is to the world.

In previous years the chances of a film like this succeeding commercially in Japan was slim, but in recent years the evolution of video on demand and online tv networks has made the distribution of independent works much easier. Our aim is to distribute our film to a fitting network, and here's how you can help!

What We Need & What You Get

Hey everyone, the producer here:) Thank you so much for visiting our page! Let me explain what's going on here. It says the goal is $2,500, but we are actually trying to raise $5,000. We're using two separate funding systems in America and Japan, split in the middle.

Allow me to break this down for you:

Believe it or not, out of that sum, $3,900 is festival money. Submitting a feature length movie costs about $60~$110 each, and so far, we have about 40 film festivals we want to submit to. Why must we submit to so many festivals, you ask? Well the truth is, festival submission is very similar to dating. It can't be a one way interest. Our film has to match with the prospective film festival. The story must meet the theme of the chosen festival and flow well with the other showing films too. Don't worry! Our quality is up to par-it'll find it's match somewhere, but as you know dating cost money, and so do submissions.

$600 will be used to throw a private screening/small party for you! For our amazing fans, friends and family. Raise $600 first and we'll get a theater, reception space and food. Entry will be free, and you're more than welcome to bring friends!

And lastly, $500 is to cover the indiegogo crowdfunding fee.

Thanks for reading!

~Yuka

Risks & Challenges

Time to be transparent.

The director and the producer, Taka Tsubota and Yuka Taga, do not have backers for this project. These guys are just two, very hot headed, ambitious, over achieving film students.

WHY DON'T YOU MEET THEM:

TAKA TSUBOTA (Director)

YUKA TAGA (Producer)

AND THEIR GENEROUS JAPANESE PRODUCER, YUI TAKAGI, ***holding them down from Tokyo

They are way over their heads with this production and they didn't do it through their university curriculum. These two excited kids (and Yui) just made a movie (a damn good movie!) and their plan is to nervously go around knocking on doors trying to get people to buy it. You, who are giving a dollar to this production is supporting a rebellious student film.

**Yes, student film, but no mommy and daddy money went into the making of this film. All costs were accommodated via loans and work. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Money isn't everything! Please like and share our facebook page and this campaign to your friends, colleagues and more. Do you know anyone who is a producer or in the acquisitions department of a media platform? Share our trailer with them! And definitely, definitely RSVP to our private crowdfunding event happening in New York, where we will screen the film as we have it for you. Bring your friends!

story:
En cette période difficile, plusieurs artistes de nos communautés ne peuvent exercer leur métier.

Nous comprenons et respectons cette nécessité imposée par notre gouvernement et sommes de tout coeur avec les victimes et l'entourage des personnes touchées directement par le COVID19.

Cette collecte de fonds a pour but de soutenir les artistes drags de Montréal qui doivent faire face a la fermeture de leurs lieux de travail. 

Une partie importante de la communauté drag n'a pas d'emploi de jour et est confrontée de façon soudaine a cette réalité.

Nous vous proposons donc un spectacle virtuel ce mardi 20H sur facebook et possiblement, d'autres événements.  Nous ne manquons pas d'imagination!

Les artistes se sépareront les recettes de cette collecte de fonds. 

L'animation et la technique se feront de manière bénévole.

Merci de votre support! C'est grandement apprécié.

 

****

 

Most self-employed queer artists are facing a difficult road ahead.

Our drag community is already hurting financially from the current situation. We therefore invite you to virtually attend our show this Tuesday at 8 p.m on Facebook Live.

Rita Baga will be volunteering to host this special event which will hopefully provide financial support to many of our colleagues. Peggy Sue will be on tech and all of the artists are performing for free.

IndieGogo link here: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/soutien-aux-...

Now is the time to volunteer to help your local drag performers, so tip generously!

story:
Barev! We are Esteban, Ezequiel and Eva and we all live and volunteer in Armenia more than a year. Now we started our dream, to bring more laughter and smile to different parts of this mountainous country with our nomadic juggling school.

Every week we put our juggling balls, clubs and other things and we travel from city to village to meet local kids. We are sharing our love for arts, circus and music with children.

 

Hatsik - Armavir Province
 

Gyumri

We need your support to help us raise funds for juggling equipment for the children we work with, so they could train independently without us.

 

 

Now they have to wait a week before we come again with our own juggling clubs, balls and rings. 

 

 

What We Need 

We need to raise money to buy juggling props for kids.

We would like to leave at least 15 juggling clubs and 15 juggling balls in each place where we work.

*60 clubs

*10 diabolos

*60 balls

*30 rings

+ shipping costs

 

 

Why is juggling important?

 

The art of juggling has existed in various cultures throughout history. It was practiced in ancient Egypt, China, Greece, and Rome, as well as medieval and modern societies.

One of the reasons of the popularity of juggling surely resides in the fact that to juggle is a ludic activity. In order to juggle is necessary to learn how to control the body, and to develop the concentration, self perception and balance.

Juggling develops our body coordination, motoric  and allow us to break our mental barriers.

Juggling is a non competitive activity that stimulates our brains and improve our imagination and creativity.

And there are studies which point out that juggling is improving learning skills.

It is said that one hour of juggling training equals a session of meditation.

 

 

 

Share with friends or ask your local juggling store to contribute and send us some juggling props

story:
UPDATE (May 25th)

Due to production needs taking precedence these last 2 weeks, we’ve adjusted the goal of our crowdfunding to $5,000 and switched to a private campaign on our website. Please visit us there. All previous perks still apply.

 

 

Imagine a movement inspired by a wide array of culture changers (like YOU!) building relationships, creating art, reviving celebration, and bringing communities together around social and environmental causes that can only be addressed at the bioregional level.

Imagine a world of joy, connection, and action catalyzed by bards, artists, and facilitators, who help bring out the very best in those around them through tried & true social practices. Where children dance, adults consult with each other, teens express themselves, and elders are honored for their wisdom sharing... 

Imagine a gathering that stands for the integration of our pain and desires for the world, through artful engagement with our communities, government, and society at large. We are reimagining social change in a way that creatively engages, inspires, unites, and empowers people to impact the world through the artful expression of their truth?

 

Revival Gathering Specifics:       

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

This groundbreaking 3 day gathering is bringing together 250 powerful social change artists over the Summer Solstice (June 21-24), to form coalitions of mutual support & empowerment. A dynamic mix between conference, festival, and activist incubator, this gathering is designed to be one of the most unique (and transformative) dives into cultural activism we've come across.

We'll be creating physical art, intellectual art, musical art, and experimenting with the art of social convening. Imagine a robust team of facilitators, filmmakers, first nations activists, mindfulness practitioners, economics scholars, therapists, youth, musicians, permaculturalists, painters; all offering their experience together in the same workshops, singing from the same stages, eating at the same tables, cross-pollinating the space with emergent potentiality, and bringing their gifts out into the world!

 

--------------------------------------

Because we intentionally capped this 1st year event at 250 participants; because we're giving out 50 SCHOLARSHIPS to people of marginalized communities; because we have a 57 PERSON STAFF/Artist/Volunteer Team; and because we made our standard ticket prices RADICALLY-ACCESSIBLE to those of lower income:  

We planned to implement this Crowdfund Campaign from the beginning, knowing that our radical demonstration of the "gifting economy" would be reciprocated by those who care!

The 2019 Revival will be hosted at a larger venue and pay for itself through ticket costs, but for this inaugural pilot program, WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT TO MAKE IT POSSIBLE! ---DONATE AND PICK A PERK ON THE RIGHT--->>>

-----------------------------------------

 

Our Credentials:

The Revival Team is composed of many highly-accomplished people, each an artist and activist in their own right. Though we’ve come together under the same banner for this Gathering, as individuals we are: trained facilitators, touring musicians, large-scale event coordinators, youth advocates, experienced activists, counselors, and much more... You're in good hands with us!

Artists & Presenters:    There are so many social & environmental justice-oriented experts coming to the Gathering, we are pinching ourselves! Internationally-acclaimed spoken word duo Climbing Poetree. Elder song carrier Laurence Cole. Coast Salish activist Paul Cheoketen Wagner. The 8 piece Anzanga Marimba Band. The Persian/gospel/protest-style Lydia Violet Band, and so many more!

Partnering Organizations:   From across the region/nation, these friends are assisting the Gathering through mentorship, infrastructure, educational exhibits, artwork, and more!  (Please look into these beautiful efforts!)  NewStories, Re/Culture Media, Backbone Campaign, Students for the Salish Sea, Music as Medicine, The Thriving Communities Conference, Imagine Music Festival, Journeymen Project, and many others...

Last year's "Salish Sea Revival Tour," spanning 10 coastal cities of the Salish Sea, brought together hundreds of people in urban and rural venues. We communed deeply with a huge array of people through teaching Joanna Macy's Work That Reconnects, facilitating intentional dialogue, and sharing social/environmental justice music & poetry. After the tour many people asked us to continue this work, and it's beautifully emerged as THIS VERY GATHERING! 

 

Your Campaign Contribution:

Your donation to this (now $5,000) campaign directly supports:

1.  A scholarship fund to convene a diversity of participants (50+ recipients)

2.  A fair living wage for the 6 incredible women/POC on our Facilitation Team.

3.  A "Resource Hub" to foster education & networking among participants.

4.  Honorariums for presenters, activists, elders, & our indigenous relations.

5.  Art/Office supplies for collective graphic facilitation & participatory art creation.

 

Larger Tax Deductible Donations:

Revival is a 501(c)3 fiscally-sponsored project of NewStories. If you'd like to make a larger tax-deductible donation to our project, please visit NewStories' Donate Page, and write "Revival" (or anything more specific you'd like to fund) in the PayPal memo field. 

Please contact Ben Browner about any of the above… We sincerely look forward to partnering with you in fostering cultural change throughout our bioregion!!! 

 

Want to Attend? Tickets Still Available!

There’s still room to join us in person for this powerful event. Register here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/revival-gathering-...

 

***Not all people are able or inspired to contribute financially. Luckily there are MANY forms of capital! You can give however you feel most aligned:

-- send this campaign through email/social media.
-- lend infrastructure: ez-ups, folding tables, big rugs, artwork, etc.
-- provide urban venues for programmatic offerings in the seasons ahead.
-- connect potential donors to the project's mission, and/or with us directly.
-- donate surplus garden food to the kitchen at this years revival gathering.
-- what else do you feel inspired to help with? : ) nothing's too small or large.

 

In Closing: 

We DEEPLY appreciate your support! This Inaugural Revival Gathering is sure to be connective, art-filled, and radically-transformational!!! Your contributions, your shares, and your confidence in us brings our best selves forward in service of social & environmental justice, community, and Life!!!  

Many blessings to each and every one of you, and thank you from the bottom of our hearts. ~ Jessica, Stellar, Lydia, Tannur, Hazel, Bridgett, Sydney, Anne, Ben, and the rest of the Revival Team

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Opening song in video by Osprey Huffsmith:  www.ospreyfliesthenest.com

All previous perks still apply.  Imagine a movement inspired by a wide array of culture changers (like YOU!) building relationships, creating art, reviving celebration, and bringing communities together around social and environmental causes that can only be addressed at the bioregional level.Imagine a world of joy, connection, and action catalyzed by bards, artists, and facilitators, who help bring out the very best in those around them through tried & true social practices. Where children dance, adults consult with each other, teens express themselves, and elders are honored for their wisdom sharing... Imagine a gathering that stands for the integration of our pain and desires for the world, through artful engagement with our communities, government, and society at large. We are reimagining social change in a way that creatively engages, inspires, unites, and empowers people to impact the world through the artful expression of their truth? Revival Gathering Specifics:                        This groundbreaking 3 day gathering is bringing together 250 powerful social change artists over the Summer Solstice (June 21-24), to form coalitions of mutual support & empowerment. A dynamic mix between conference, festival, and activist incubator, this gathering is designed to be one of the most unique (and transformative) dives into cultural activism we've come across.We'll be creating physical art, intellectual art, musical art, and experimenting with the art of social convening. Imagine a robust team of facilitators, filmmakers, first nations activists, mindfulness practitioners, economics scholars, therapists, youth, musicians, permaculturalists, painters; all offering their experience together in the same workshops, singing from the same stages, eating at the same tables, cross-pollinating the space with emergent potentiality, and bringing their gifts out into the world! --------------------------------------Because we intentionally capped this 1st year event at 250 participants; because we're giving out 50 SCHOLARSHIPS to people of marginalized communities; because we have a 57 PERSON STAFF/Artist/Volunteer Team; and because we made our standard ticket prices RADICALLY-ACCESSIBLE to those of lower income:  We planned to implement this Crowdfund Campaign from the beginning, knowing that our radical demonstration of the "gifting economy" would be reciprocated by those who care!The 2019 Revival will be hosted at a larger venue and pay for itself through ticket costs, but for this inaugural pilot program, WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT TO MAKE IT POSSIBLE! ---DONATE AND PICK A PERK ON THE RIGHT--->>>----------------------------------------- Our Credentials:The Revival Team is composed of many highly-accomplished people, each an artist and activist in their own right. Though we’ve come together under the same banner for this Gathering, as individuals we are: trained facilitators, touring musicians, large-scale event coordinators, youth advocates, experienced activists, counselors, and much more... You're in good hands with us!Artists & Presenters:    There are so many social & environmental justice-oriented experts coming to the Gathering, we are pinching ourselves! Internationally-acclaimed spoken word duo Climbing Poetree. Elder song carrier Laurence Cole. Coast Salish activist Paul Cheoketen Wagner. The 8 piece Anzanga Marimba Band. The Persian/gospel/protest-style Lydia Violet Band, and so many more!Partnering Organizations:   From across the region/nation, these friends are assisting the Gathering through mentorship, infrastructure, educational exhibits, artwork, and more!  (Please look into these beautiful efforts!)  NewStories, Re/Culture Media, Backbone Campaign, Students for the Salish Sea, Music as Medicine, The Thriving Communities Conference, Imagine Music Festival, Journeymen Project, and many others...Last year's "Salish Sea Revival Tour," spanning 10 coastal cities of the Salish Sea, brought together hundreds of people in urban and rural venues. We communed deeply with a huge array of people through teaching Joanna Macy's Work That Reconnects, facilitating intentional dialogue, and sharing social/environmental justice music & poetry. After the tour many people asked us to continue this work, and it's beautifully emerged as THIS VERY GATHERING!  Your Campaign Contribution:Your donation to this (now $5,000) campaign directly supports:1.  A scholarship fund to convene a diversity of participants (50+ recipients)2.  A fair living wage for the 6 incredible women/POC on our Facilitation Team.3.  A "Resource Hub" to foster education & networking among participants.4.  Honorariums for presenters, activists, elders, & our indigenous relations.5.  Art/Office supplies for collective graphic facilitation & participatory art creation. Larger Tax Deductible Donations:Revival is a 501(c)3 fiscally-sponsored project of NewStories. If you'd like to make a larger tax-deductible donation to our project, please visit NewStories' Donate Page, and write "Revival" (or anything more specific you'd like to fund) in the PayPal memo field. Please contact Ben Browner about any of the above… We sincerely look forward to partnering with you in fostering cultural change throughout our bioregion!!!  Want to Attend? Tickets Still Available!There’s still room to join us in person for this powerful event. Register here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/revival-gathering-... ***Not all people are able or inspired to contribute financially. Luckily there are MANY forms of capital! You can give however you feel most aligned:-- send this campaign through email/social media.-- lend infrastructure: ez-ups, folding tables, big rugs, artwork, etc.-- provide urban venues for programmatic offerings in the seasons ahead.-- connect potential donors to the project's mission, and/or with us directly.-- donate surplus garden food to the kitchen at this years revival gathering.-- what else do you feel inspired to help with? : ) nothing's too small or large. In Closing: We DEEPLY appreciate your support! This Inaugural Revival Gathering is sure to be connective, art-filled, and radically-transformational!!! Your contributions, your shares, and your confidence in us brings our best selves forward in service of social & environmental justice, community, and Life!!!  Many blessings to each and every one of you, and thank you from the bottom of our hearts. ~ Jessica, Stellar, Lydia, Tannur, Hazel, Bridgett, Sydney, Anne, Ben, and the rest of the Revival Team~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Opening song in video by Osprey Huffsmith:  www.ospreyfliesthenest.com

story:
NEW DELIVERY DATE: April 2018

 

We did it!

We reached our initial goal of  €15,000 and our stretch goal of €25,000, and we have YOU to thank! To all the backers, the early adopters, the believers, the likers, the friends and support system... To all of you that took part in this journey in any possible way, thank you! 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

In the next 3 months, the team will be working hard on bringing you (and your loved ones) the warmest, most exciting box you could ask for, all the way from Lebanon. Oh, and of course, we will be planting 336 trees in Lebanon, one in the name of each of our backers :)   

To stay updated on what we're up to, sign up for our newsletter on our website 

You can still purchase a box on this campaign and we will follow up with more details concerning shipping and gifting! 

Much love, 

The Koullouna team

 

Koullouna is a monthly subscription box keeping Lebanese expats and Lebanon-lovers connected to the country. It's the perfect balance between getting a piece of home at your doorstep and sending back a piece of you to Lebanon.

So every month, you would get a box (a package) at your doorstep. Each box will follow a different theme and will be a surprise. And who doesn't love a good surprise? :)

Koullouna will offer you the chance to:

 

Here's what happens from the moment you order your box to the moment you open it:

The first Koullouna box was around the ‘Coffee’ theme. It traveled all the way from Beirut to New York, Dubai, Paris and Marseille! 

Keep in mind that this is a prototype box.

 

A box with handpicked products

Koullouna's coffee box has all the things that remind you of Sundays at grandma’s : black coffee, orange blossom water, the flowery coffee cups, the rakwé… Basically all you need to feel at home. 

The funds raised with this campaign will allow us to develop higher quality and more beautifully crafted boxes. 

A box with a story

Koullouna also comes with a booklet full of curated content related to the theme of the box.

 

A box with an impact

The best part of all: each Koullouna box will be supporting a local initiative to which a part of your subscription will be donated.

For example, the coffee box supported the Nawaya Network, an organisation that develops local talents. Koullouna contributed to finance the basketball classes of Ahmad, a member of the Nawaya Network.

 

 

Koullouna is a box for anyone who loves Lebanon and wants to make a difference!

At the end of the campaign, we will send you a personalised gift card (like the below) that you can offer to your loved one for Christmas :)

After a year of experimenting, testing, measuring and developing the Koullouna box, we are now ready to go big, and we want this piece of Lebanese goodness to be available to everyone and start having an impact on the country! 

The funds raised with your help will allow us to:

  • Develop the design of the box and quality of our product
  • Ship and deliver your boxes
  • Launch our online shop
  • Give the project all it needs to kick-off with a bang!

Here's where we're at:

 

    Marielle Khayat, Founder & CEO

    Marielle has been in the innovation and entrepreneurship field for 5 years now. After her studies in Management, she left Lebanon and moved around China and the US  before settling in Paris. Throughout her travels, she stayed passionate about highlighting the good things happening in Lebanon. In 2012, she co-wrote "Losing Touch", a book about the disappearing Lebanese trades, that depicted the lives of the trade workers of Beirut. The success of this experience was yet another proof of how much power the Lebanese can draw from their love of the country. Today, she's still convinced that being far doesn't mean being disconnected, and so Koullouna was born! 

    Pascale Comaty, Marketing 

    Pascale worked 5 years at LinkedIn in B2B marketing. She joined them in London and witnessed their rapid growth. She went on to head marketing for LinkedIn's largest business line in Dubai, developing the strategy and deploying it in MENA. Since January 2017, she’s been travelling around South-East Asia, looking for the next mountain to hike or rock to climb. After moving around so often, she strongly believes that 'Home is not a place, it's a feeling'. So she joined the team in April 2017 and has been in charge of making Koullouna known in the world.

    Joseph Sayegh, Operational 

    Joseph is currently finishing his studies in Computer Engineering and Entrepreneurship. He did an internship in transportation analysis at Amazon and traveled around South America and South East Asia. His departure from Lebanon at 17 years old estranged him physically but he kept a strong relation with his motherland especially through his involvement with the Lebanese diaspora in France and all over the world. He's in charge of the operational and logistics for Koullouna. 

    During the crowdfunding campaign, the boxes are available at a discounted price (happiness)! 
    You can pick and choose from the different perks we offer.

    Don't forget: Koullouna can also be a gift to a loved one :)

    Shipping costs will be added depending on the destination country. After the campaign, we will send you a form to get your detailed delivery address (or your friend's address if it's a gift).

    If you prefer to choose the amount  of your contribution, you just need to click on the pink button on the right of the video :) 

    FOR MORE INFORMATION

    Check out our FAQs: http://www.koullounabox.com/faq 

    A BIG THANK YOU...

    ... To all of those who made it possible for this campaign to happen, including: 
    Quentin Chevrier for the video, Lama Zouein for the visuals, Sarah, Camille, Ralph, Youssef, Steph, Diane, Eliane, Myriam, Mia, Dima, Laurianne, Lynn, Anna, Michelle, Cyrielle, Gauthier, Zdenko, Cherine, Davey, Hind, Leena, Nada, Mayssa and so many more.
