$100+ contributed and receive your first TWO books FREE! + be entered into a contest to win a free LIFETIME subscription.



The Impact
By contributing to the Required Reading campaign, you will be helping to fuel a project that will support many struggling artists in the literary world.  You won't often find books from small & independent publishers in the big box bookstores, and many of those who author these beautiful books are women, people of color, part of the LGBTQIA community, or disabled. Your support to this campaign means more funds being allocated to the literary art community and the wonderful people who are struggling to keep it alive.
Your support goes beyond the literary world, as well: when Required Reading launches, every new subscription purchased will allocate 10% of its funds to nonprofits and organizations that protect the rights of marginalized voices, such as the ACLU, Stand With Standing Rock, and Planned Parenthood.

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that not everyone can contribute monetarily. Heck, that's why we ourselves needed to launch this campaign! There are other ways that you can help us out.

Make some noise about our campaign. Post this page to social media channels, email it to friends and family members or any bibliophile you know who might be interested in our service. We appreciate the old-fashioned ways of generating hype, too: word of mouth!
You can use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Il viaggio del Drago - The journey of the Dragon

 

Chi siamo (English version below)

Siamo l’AIST, un’associazione culturale dedita agli studi delle opere letterarie degli Inklings e alla loro divulgazione. Le nostre radici affondano nel lontano 2005, quando un gruppo di amici si riunì per la prima volta in quel di Roma per parlare delle opere del Professore oxoniense. Da allora siamo cresciuti, animati dalla comune passione per il Fantasy (e per il cibo, come insegna ogni creatura fantastica) e oggi abbiamo soci e amici sparsi in tutta Italia.

L’amore per i libri del Professore ci ha portato ad occuparci anche delle opere secondarie da questi derivati: ci occupiamo di critica letteraria, film, fumetti, ma adoriamo anche giochi da tavolo e videogiochi, musica e arte. Tra di noi ci sono studiosi, scrittori, critici e artisti, ma anche semplici appassionati legati dalla volontà di condividere la nostra passione con tutti coloro che ne sono attratti.

Scriviamo e traduciamo libri, teniamo corsi e presentazioni; organizziamo convegni nelle Università (tra gli ospiti dell’ultimo convegno, tenutosi all’Università di Trento nel dicembre 2018, annoveriamo con orgoglio Tom Shippey, il massimo studioso di sempre) e partecipiamo ad eventi ludici e a manifestazioni culturali dedicate al mondo della letteratura. Tra i progetti che più ci stanno a cuore potete trovare collane di saggistica, un’innovativa collana dedicata alle lingue di Elfi e Nani e un calendario artistico realizzato dai maestri del fantasy italiano.

Ora è giunto il momento di realizzare un sogno: costruire un luogo dove tutti coloro che amano il Fantasy possano sentirsi a casa e toccarla con mano, radunandosi da ogni parte del mondo! Umani, Nani, Elfi e Stregoni potranno così riunirsi insieme sotto le ali del Drago, per scoprire insieme tutte le strade che la Fantasia apre.

 

La Tana del Drago

DOVE: Dozza, in provincia di Bologna.
Un affascinante borgo medievale posto su una collina e dominato da un’imponente Rocca sforzesca, a pochi passi dalla città universitaria di Bologna. Qui organizziamo ogni due anni FantastikA, un evento tutto dedicato all’arte e alla cultura del fantastico.

COSA: La Tana del Drago è un progetto no-profit e sarà una casa per tutti coloro che sono attratti dal mondo creato dalla penna degli Inklings, una fucina di idee inesauribile e pronta all’accoglienza. 

La Tana del Drago non è autorizzato dalla Tolkien Estate e non ha alcuna associazione con la Tolkien Estate o la famiglia Tolkien.

Abbiamo scelto questo nome perché il drago rappresenta da sempre il genere fantasy, perché a pochi metri dal centro studi, all’interno della bellissima rocca di Dozza c’è un vero drago che riposa, rannicchiato tra le sue immense ali, e perché La tana del Drago deve diventare un luogo accogliente dove ritrovare gli amici e sentirsi al sicuro!

  • Museo: il primo museo dedicato al fantastico in Italia. Ci sarà uno spazio dedicato ad un’esposizione permanente, e uno alle mostre temporanee, dove potremo invitare artisti provenienti da tutto il mondo
  • Centro Studi: un luogo pensato per stimolare e incoraggiare la ricerca e gli studi sul fantastico, mettendo a disposizione degli studiosi tutto ciò di cui avranno bisogno, grazie anche alla biblioteca che vogliamo allestire. Organizzeremo convegni con studiosi, sia invitando chi già si è affermato in campo internazionale, sia mantenendo un occhio di riguardo verso i giovani che si affacciano in questo mondo
  • Laboratorio: uno spazio dedicato a corsi e workshop, partendo da un livello base pensato per chi ha da poco messo piede nella letteratura fantastica, per arrivare a un livello specialistico per chi vuole approfondire le proprie conoscenze
  • Bookshop: tutto a tema fantastico, vi si potranno trovare libri, opere d’arte, oggetti di artigianato unici e pezzi da collezione. Vogliamo che chiunque passi a trovarci possa trovare gemme naniche nate dalla cura e dalla passione.

PERCHÉ: Crediamo che l’Immaginazione, l’Arte e la Letteratura abbiano un potere tanto grande da smuovere le montagne, e che l’Amicizia sia ancora più forte: è questa che permette ai nostri sogni di diventare realtà. D’altronde, per brindare bisogna essere in due, ma più si è e più bella sarà la festa. La Tana del Drago sarà insieme biblioteca, scrigno di tesori e taverna dove riunirsi la sera per narrare storie intorno al fuoco!

 

Ci serve il vostro aiuto!

COM’È/COME SARA’

Grazie al Comune di Dozza abbiamo trovato l’edificio adatto, una palazzina disabitata da qualche anno. Sono richiesti diversi lavori di ristrutturazione e interventi di messa a norma necessari per poter aprire al pubblico. I nostri soci volontari si sono già dati disponibili per eseguire i lavori più semplici, ma occorre un intervento da parte di professionisti specializzati. Infatti lo Studio Sossai di San Lazzaro di Savena si è già messo al lavoro per ristrutturare gli infissi, la pavimentazione, imbiancare le pareti, rifare la balaustra delle scale e via dicendo.

Nb: i concept sono indicativi e che il risultato finale potrebbe essere diverso da quello proposto. 

 

IL PROGETTO

Per poter toccare un sogno, servono menti creative e abili mani per realizzarlo. Per questo motivo ci affidiamo all’artista Ivan Cavini (illustratore, già creative director del Greisinger Museum e direttore artistico di FantastikA), che abbiamo l’onore di annoverare tra i nostri soci fondatori, oltre allo Studio Sossai di cui conosciamo la professionalità e l’esperienza nel settore scenografico.

Il centro studi si articolerà su tre piani: al piano interrato ci saranno la biblioteca, e la sala conferenze, che sarà anche lo spazio dedicato ai workshop. Al piano terra, si troveranno il bookshop e l’ingresso del museo. Al primo piano infine ci saranno le sale espositivo/museali e i servizi.

La Tana del Drago sarà allestita in modo da dare l’idea ai visitatori di aprire la porta e trovarsi catapultati nella letteratura fantastica: ci saranno arredamenti che andranno da un rustico stile Fantasy, a uno gotico-medievale. Sculture di personaggi fantastici animeranno le stanze e, naturalmente, all’entrata troverete una porta tonda.

Siccome vogliamo che la Tana del Drago sia la casa di tutti noi, anche voi dovrete farne parte! Come scoprirete leggendo in cosa consistono i vari perk, potrete diventare parte della casa sostenendoci durante il crowdfunding: a seconda della vostra scelta, il vostro nome, o, a seconda dei casi, la vostra foto o il vostro ritratto verranno appesi permanentemente alle pareti della Tana del Drago.

Se, grazie a voi, questo progetto andrà a buon fine, il 21 settembre durante la quarta edizione di Fantastika, la biennale d’arte del fantastico di Dozza, ci sarà l’apertura ufficiosa e l’inizio delle attività. Nei prossimi mesi vi daremo diverse anticipazioni sul programma della manifestazione e delle attività della Tana del Drago. Anche il fattore tempo è importante: l’obiettivo per settembre 2018 è quello di aprire gran parte del centro studi e con il vostro aiuto, dopo alcuni mesi potreste già veder nascere gli allestimenti scenografici a tema e le creature fantastiche!

Tutto dipende da voi: più riusciremo a raccogliere insieme, più elaborate saranno le ambientazioni e le creature che animeranno la Tana del drago.

I COSTI

Per realizzare un simile sogno, i costi sono molto alti: come abbiamo accennato, abbiamo già iniziato la messa a norma dell’edificio ma avremo bisogno di arredamenti e allestimenti scenografico/espositivi, tutti in legno e in grado di creare suggestioni fantastiche. Serviranno sedie e tavoli per la sala conferenze, teche di vetro per la galleria espositiva, un bancone in stile fantasy per il bookshop, librerie per la biblioteca e cornici per esporre le opere d’arte. Infine, per meglio immergerci nell’atmosfera fantastica, vorremmo realizzare almeno tre sculture: una creatura negativa che si aggirerà tra le teche, un Pastore di alberi che osserverà le scale e un demone che sorvegli la galleria. Inoltre, anche se tra noi abbiamo moltissimi soci volenterosi, ci servirà comunque l’aiuto di alcuni professionisti per curare il settore comunicazione: teniamo così tanto a questo progetto che vogliamo realizzarlo al meglio in ogni sua parte!

 

Stretch Goal: il viaggio del Drago!

La strada per la vetta è lunga: per questo abbiamo stabilito diversi obiettivi per il viaggio del nostro Drago. Più ci aiuterete, più la Tana del Drago potrà essere un luogo magico e unico al mondo!

  • 5000 €: si apre la porta! (ristrutturazione scale, ricostruzione scenografica ingresso casa hobbit) - RAGGIUNTO!
  • 8000 €: bookshop aperto! (bancone e accessori in stile fantasy)
  • 10.000 €: sala conferenze aperta! (sedie, tavolo per i relatori, impianto audio e video)
  • 13.000 €: art gallery aperta! (predisposizione per mostre d’arte a tema fantasy)
  • 15.000 €: bookshop completo! (arredamenti e rivestimenti in legno in stile fantasy)
  • 18.000 €:  Centro studi aperto! (tavolo per riunioni e workshop, arredi in stile inglese di inizio '900)
  • 24.000 €:  art gallery completa! (arredamenti in stile gotico-medievale, oggetti e materiale espositivo)
  • 30.000 €: biblioteca completa! (angolo camino, libreria in stile inglese di inizio '900)
  • 35.000 €: scultura di un Nano in scala originale
  • 40.000 €: scultura di un Pastore di alberi in scala 1:1
  • 45.000 €: scultura di un Demone in scala

Perk

Come potete vedere nella colonna a destra, abbiamo pensato a delle ricompense speciali per ringraziarvi per il vostro preziosissimo aiuto. I nomi di tutti i sostenitori verranno scritti su uno speciale wall celebrativo che verrà appeso nell’ingresso.

Molto importante sarà la tessera del nostro centro studi: sarà nominativa, numerata progressivamente e vi darà diritto ad uno sconto del 5% al bookshop della Tana del Drago. Se il perk che sceglierete non dovesse prevedere la spedizione, la tessera sarà ritirabile gratuitamente nel bookshop negli orari di apertura.

Realizzeremo dei premi speciali, come la tshirt e la shopper in edizione esclusiva per questo crowdfunding.

STAMPE E DISEGNI ORIGINALI

Sono disponibili numerosi sketch originali degli artisti che hanno deciso di supportare il nostro progetto; per sceglierli, basta sfogliare il relativo album sulla nostra pagina facebook, procedere con il pagamento e scriverci (a questa mail) per prenotare il vostro disegno.

Per le stampe funziona allo stesso modo.

Questo l'elenco completo:

Per prenotarli, scriveteci un mail a questo indirizzo; noi aggiorneremo l'elenco con segnalando quelli già prenotati.

SPEDIZIONI

Tutto ciò che prevede una spedizione verrà spedito a partire da settembre 2018, dopo lo svolgimento di FantastikA. Qualsiasi perk sarà in ogni caso ritirabile gratuitamente a FantastikA; in quel caso, le spese di spedizione vi verranno rimborsate con un buono spendibile nel bookshop della Tana del Drago o sul sito dell’AIST (in fase di ultimazione)

 

I rischi e la sfida

Le nostre braccia e il nostro cuore sono al servizio di questo sogno: ci manca soltanto il vostro aiuto! Se non dovessimo raggiungere il nostro obiettivo, voi riceverete comunque la ricompensa prevista per il perk scelto. La Tana del Drago però non vedrebbe la luce così come l’abbiamo sognata: senza i fondi, non ci sarà sicuramente possibile aprire nei tempi previsti. Tutto ciò che raccoglieremo andrà comunque destinato ai lavori di ristrutturazione, anche se significherebbe rallentarli fino a fermarli in attesa di qualche finanziamento.

 

English version

Who are we

We are AIST a cultural association devoted to the study and the diffusion of the works of Inklings. Our roots date back to 2005, when, for the first time, a group of friends met in Rome to talk about fantasy literature. Since then we have grown, inspired by the common passion for English writers – not to mention the food, as it is only natural for the fan inside us – and today we have members and friends all over Italy.

The love for the Professor’s books has led us to delve also into the secondary literature works centred on Inklings' works: we are interested in literary criticism, movies and comics, but we also love board and video games, music and art. Among us there are scholars, writers, critics and artists, but also simple enthusiasts brought together by a genuine desire to share a common passion.

We write and translate books, we hold courses and presentations; we organise conferences in universities (among the guests of the last one, held at the University of Trento in December 2018, we are proud to mention Tom Shippey, the most important Tolkienian scholar of all time) and participate in leisure and cultural events dedicated to literature. Among the projects closest to our heart you can find several series of essays, an innovative series of little books focused on Inklings, a calendar created by masters of Italian fantasy art.

Now the time has arrived to make a dream come true: to build a place where all those who love Middle-earth can feel at home and touch that world with their hands, gathering from every part of the world! Dwarves, Elves and Wizards will be able to meet under the wings of the Dragon, to explore together all the paths that Fantasy discloses.

 

The Dragon’s Lair

WHERE: Dozza, near Bologna.

A charming medieval village built on a hill and dominated by an imposing fortress of the House Sforza, a few miles away from the university town of Bologna. Here we organize FantastikA every two years, a festival entirely dedicated to fantasy culture and art.

 

WHAT: “La Tana del Drago” (The Dragon’s Lair) is a no-profit project and will be a home for all those who love the world created by Inklings: at the same time a welcoming place for guests and a forge of countless ideas and projects. 

LA TANA DEL DRAGO/THE DRAGON’S LAIR is not licensed or authorised by the Tolkien Estate and has no association with the Tolkien Estate or the Tolkien family.

We have chosen this name because the dragon has always represented the fantasy genre, because a few steps away from the study centre, just inside the beautiful castle of Dozza, there is a real dragon resting, huddled under its own huge wings, and because La Tana del Drago must become a welcoming haven where to find friends and feel safe!

  • Museum: the first museum devoted to Fantasy in Italy. There will be a space dedicated to a permanent exhibition and another for temporary exhibitions by guest artists from all around the world;
  • Study Centre: a place designed to stimulate and encourage research and studies about the Professor, providing the scholars with everything they need, also thanks to the library we want to create. We will organise conferences, inviting scholars of already established international fame, but also keeping an attentive eye on young people entering this world for the first time;
  • Laboratory: a space dedicated to courses and workshops, from basic levels designed for those who have just recently set foot in fantasy literature to advanced levels for those who want to improve their knowledge;
  • Bookshop: everything about english fantasy writers: books, works of art, unique handcrafted items and collectibles. We like to think that anyone coming to visit our Centre will find there Dwarvish gems born of care and passion!

WHY: Inspired mainly by reading Inklings' works, we do believe that Imagination, Art and Literature have the power to move mountains, and that Friendship is even stronger, being what really makes our dreams come true. Two is enough to make a toast, but the more we are the more exciting the party will be. The Dragon’s Lair will be a library, a treasure chest, and a tavern where to meet in the evening and tell stories sitting by the fireplace​!

 

We need your help!

 

HOW IT IS/HOW IT WILL BECOME

Thanks to the municipal corporation of Dozza we have found a suitable building: a period house uninhabited for some years which therefore needs refurbishment and safety works to comply with the regulations before opening to the public. Our volunteers, mostly members of the Association, have already started performing the most basic works, but we need intervention by specialised professionals. In fact, the Studio Sossai of San Lazzaro di Savena has already started working to renovate the fixtures, the flooring, to paint the walls, to redo the stairs banisters and so on.

Nb: the concepts are indicative and that the final result could be different from the one proposed.

 

THE PROJECT

In order to touch a dream, you need creative minds and capable hands to make it come true. For this reason we rely on artist Ivan Cavini (illustrator, former creative director of Greisinger Museum and artistic director of FantastikA), whom we are honoured to count among our founding members, and on Studio Sossai, whose professionalism and experience in the theatrical field are very well known.

The study centre will consist of three floors: in the basement there will be the library and the conference room, which will also hosts the workshops. On the ground floor you will find the bookshop and the museum entrance and finally, on the first floor, there will be the exhibition/museum rooms and the restrooms.

The Dragon’s Lair will be decorated in such a way as to give the visitors the idea to open a door and be drawn into Fairyland.  Furniture will range from rustic style to medieval-Gothic, sculptures of fantastic characters will enliven the rooms, and of course you will find a round door at the entrance.

Since we want the Dragon’s Lair to be the home of us all, you too must be part of it! As you will discover reading what the various perks are, you can become part of the project by supporting us during the crowdfunding. Depending on your choice, your name, your photo or your portrait will be permanently displayed on the walls of The Dragon’s Lair.

If, thanks to your help, this project will be successful, on September 21st, during the fourth edition of FantastikA, the fantasy art festival taking place in Dozza every two years, there will be the “unofficial” opening of the Centre and the beginning of its activities. In the next few months we will give you several updates about the program of the event and the activities of the Dragon’s Lair. Timing is quite crucial: the goal for September 2018 is to open a large part of the study centre and, with your help, after a few months you will see artistic set-ups and fantastic creatures come into being!

It all depends on you: the more we can collect together, the more elaborate the settings and the creatures that will animate The Dragon’s Lair will be.

COSTS

To make such a dream come true, costs are very high. As we mentioned, we have already begun the safety works in the building, but we will need furniture and scenic/display installations, all in wood in order to suggest a fantasy environment. Chairs and tables are needed for the conference room, glass cases for exhibition gallery, a Hobbit-style counter for the bookshop, shelves for the library and frames to exhibit works of art. Finally, to enhance the ‘Fantasy immersion factor’, we would like to create at least three sculptures: evil creature that wanders between the display cases, an Trees' Shepard that watches the stairs and a demon guarding the gallery. Moreover, although we do have many willing partners among us, we will still need the help of some professionals to take care of the communication sector: we care so much about this project that we want to make it the best in each and every part!

 

Stretch Goals: the journey of the Dragon!

The road to the top is long: this is why we have set progressive goals for the journey of our Dragon. The more you help us, the more the Dragon’s Lair can become a magical and unique place worldwide!

  • 5,000 €: the door opens! (stairs renovation, scenographic reconstruction of fantasy dwelling entrance) - REACHED!
  • 8,000 €: bookshop opens! (fantasy style counter and accessories);
  • 10,000 €: conference room opens! (chairs, speakers’ table, audio and video system);
  • 13,000 €: art gallery opens! (preparations for fantasy-themed art exhibitions);
  • 15,000 €: bookshop completed! (fantasy style furnishings and coverings);
  • 18,000 €: Study Centre opens! (Meetings’ and workshops’ table, early ‘900 English-style furniture);
  • 24,000 €: art gallery completed! (furniture in Gothic-medieval style, items and exhibition material);
  • 30,000 €: library completed! (corner fireplace, early ‘900 English-style library);
  • 35,000 €: sculpture of a Dwarf in original scale;
  • 40,000 €: sculpture of an Trees' Shepard in scale 1:1;
  • 45,000 €: Demon’s sculpture in scale.

 

Perks

As you can see in the right-hand column, we have thought of special rewards to thank you for your invaluable help. The names of all the supporters will be engraved on a special celebrative plaque that will be displayed in the entrance hall.

We will provide a card for our studies center: it will be nominative, progressively numbered and will entitle you to a 5% discount at The Dragon’s Lair’s bookshop. If the perk you choose does not include shipping, the card will be available to collect for free in the bookshop during opening hours.

We will create special prizes for this crowdfunding, like an exclusive t-shirt and a shopping bag.

 

ORIGINAL PRINTS AND DRAWINGS

Several original sketches by artists who decided to support our project will be available. In order to choose among them, just browse the relevant album on our Facebook page, proceed with payment and write us (to this email) to reserve your picture.

For the signed prints it works the same way.

Here the complete list:

  22. Namarie by Roberto Fontana, handwritten calligraph - ASSIGNED

Men Treasure - Original sketches 

  1.  Il re stregone by Andrea Piparo (23x30,5cm) - ASSIGNED
  2.  Dite amici ed entrate by Andrea Piparo (23x30,5cm) - ASSIGNED
  3.  Eowyn si rivela by Andrea Piparo (23x30,5cm)
  4.  Saruman e il palantir by Andrea Piparo (23x30,5cm)
  5.  Thranduil by Denis Medri (30x21cm)
  6.  Drago by Livia De Simone (42x29,5cm) - ASSIGNED
  7.  La creatura del bosco by Livia De Simone (42x29,5cm) - ASSIGNED

  9.  Gimli by Riccardo Rullo (24 cm x 33 cm)

Elves Treasure - Original artworks 

  1. “Nazgul” by Riccardo Rullo (matita su carta 220 gr. 33x48cm)
  2. "I Tarocchi perduti - gli Arcani Maggiori -la Stella" acquerello, chine, pastello, gessetti, acrilico (15x26cm) by Maria Distefano
  3.  “Eowyn, Merry e il Witchking” by Michele Rubini (china su cartoncino 21x29,5cm)
  4. “La caduta di Glaurung” by Andrea Piparo (30x45cm) - ASSIGNED

To book them, write us an email to this address, we will update the list with reporting those already booked.

SHIPMENTS

Shipments will start in September 2018, after the conclusion of FantastikA. Any perk chosen will be  however available for picking up free of charge at FantastikA: in that case the shipping costs will be reimbursed with a voucher to spend at the Dragon’s Lair’s bookshop or on the website of Associazione Italiana Studi Tolkieniani (coming soon!).

 

Risks & Challenges

We are very committed to this project, body and soul: we only need your help! Should we not achieve our goal, you will still receive your reward for the chosen perk, but The Dragon’s Lair will not see the light as we have dreamed it. Without sufficient funds, it will not be possible to open on schedule. In that case everything we collect will go to the renovation works, even if that means to slow them down while waiting for further funding.
story_txt:
Il viaggio del Drago - The journey of the Dragon Chi siamo (English version below)Siamo l’AIST, un’associazione culturale dedita agli studi delle opere letterarie degli Inklings e alla loro divulgazione. Le nostre radici affondano nel lontano 2005, quando un gruppo di amici si riunì per la prima volta in quel di Roma per parlare delle opere del Professore oxoniense. Da allora siamo cresciuti, animati dalla comune passione per il Fantasy (e per il cibo, come insegna ogni creatura fantastica) e oggi abbiamo soci e amici sparsi in tutta Italia.L’amore per i libri del Professore ci ha portato ad occuparci anche delle opere secondarie da questi derivati: ci occupiamo di critica letteraria, film, fumetti, ma adoriamo anche giochi da tavolo e videogiochi, musica e arte. Tra di noi ci sono studiosi, scrittori, critici e artisti, ma anche semplici appassionati legati dalla volontà di condividere la nostra passione con tutti coloro che ne sono attratti.Scriviamo e traduciamo libri, teniamo corsi e presentazioni; organizziamo convegni nelle Università (tra gli ospiti dell’ultimo convegno, tenutosi all’Università di Trento nel dicembre 2018, annoveriamo con orgoglio Tom Shippey, il massimo studioso di sempre) e partecipiamo ad eventi ludici e a manifestazioni culturali dedicate al mondo della letteratura. Tra i progetti che più ci stanno a cuore potete trovare collane di saggistica, un’innovativa collana dedicata alle lingue di Elfi e Nani e un calendario artistico realizzato dai maestri del fantasy italiano.Ora è giunto il momento di realizzare un sogno: costruire un luogo dove tutti coloro che amano il Fantasy possano sentirsi a casa e toccarla con mano, radunandosi da ogni parte del mondo! Umani, Nani, Elfi e Stregoni potranno così riunirsi insieme sotto le ali del Drago, per scoprire insieme tutte le strade che la Fantasia apre. La Tana del DragoDOVE: Dozza, in provincia di Bologna.Un affascinante borgo medievale posto su una collina e dominato da un’imponente Rocca sforzesca, a pochi passi dalla città universitaria di Bologna. Qui organizziamo ogni due anni FantastikA, un evento tutto dedicato all’arte e alla cultura del fantastico.COSA: La Tana del Drago è un progetto no-profit e sarà una casa per tutti coloro che sono attratti dal mondo creato dalla penna degli Inklings, una fucina di idee inesauribile e pronta all’accoglienza. La Tana del Drago non è autorizzato dalla Tolkien Estate e non ha alcuna associazione con la Tolkien Estate o la famiglia Tolkien.Abbiamo scelto questo nome perché il drago rappresenta da sempre il genere fantasy, perché a pochi metri dal centro studi, all’interno della bellissima rocca di Dozza c’è un vero drago che riposa, rannicchiato tra le sue immense ali, e perché La tana del Drago deve diventare un luogo accogliente dove ritrovare gli amici e sentirsi al sicuro!

Museo: il primo museo dedicato al fantastico in Italia. Ci sarà uno spazio dedicato ad un’esposizione permanente, e uno alle mostre temporanee, dove potremo invitare artisti provenienti da tutto il mondo

Centro Studi: un luogo pensato per stimolare e incoraggiare la ricerca e gli studi sul fantastico, mettendo a disposizione degli studiosi tutto ciò di cui avranno bisogno, grazie anche alla biblioteca che vogliamo allestire. Organizzeremo convegni con studiosi, sia invitando chi già si è affermato in campo internazionale, sia mantenendo un occhio di riguardo verso i giovani che si affacciano in questo mondo

Laboratorio: uno spazio dedicato a corsi e workshop, partendo da un livello base pensato per chi ha da poco messo piede nella letteratura fantastica, per arrivare a un livello specialistico per chi vuole approfondire le proprie conoscenze

Bookshop: tutto a tema fantastico, vi si potranno trovare libri, opere d’arte, oggetti di artigianato unici e pezzi da collezione. Vogliamo che chiunque passi a trovarci possa trovare gemme naniche nate dalla cura e dalla passione.
PERCHÉ: Crediamo che l’Immaginazione, l’Arte e la Letteratura abbiano un potere tanto grande da smuovere le montagne, e che l’Amicizia sia ancora più forte: è questa che permette ai nostri sogni di diventare realtà. D’altronde, per brindare bisogna essere in due, ma più si è e più bella sarà la festa. La Tana del Drago sarà insieme biblioteca, scrigno di tesori e taverna dove riunirsi la sera per narrare storie intorno al fuoco! Ci serve il vostro aiuto!COM’È/COME SARA’Grazie al Comune di Dozza abbiamo trovato l’edificio adatto, una palazzina disabitata da qualche anno. Sono richiesti diversi lavori di ristrutturazione e interventi di messa a norma necessari per poter aprire al pubblico. I nostri soci volontari si sono già dati disponibili per eseguire i lavori più semplici, ma occorre un intervento da parte di professionisti specializzati. Infatti lo Studio Sossai di San Lazzaro di Savena si è già messo al lavoro per ristrutturare gli infissi, la pavimentazione, imbiancare le pareti, rifare la balaustra delle scale e via dicendo.Nb: i concept sono indicativi e che il risultato finale potrebbe essere diverso da quello proposto.  IL PROGETTOPer poter toccare un sogno, servono menti creative e abili mani per realizzarlo. Per questo motivo ci affidiamo all’artista Ivan Cavini (illustratore, già creative director del Greisinger Museum e direttore artistico di FantastikA), che abbiamo l’onore di annoverare tra i nostri soci fondatori, oltre allo Studio Sossai di cui conosciamo la professionalità e l’esperienza nel settore scenografico.Il centro studi si articolerà su tre piani: al piano interrato ci saranno la biblioteca, e la sala conferenze, che sarà anche lo spazio dedicato ai workshop. Al piano terra, si troveranno il bookshop e l’ingresso del museo. Al primo piano infine ci saranno le sale espositivo/museali e i servizi.La Tana del Drago sarà allestita in modo da dare l’idea ai visitatori di aprire la porta e trovarsi catapultati nella letteratura fantastica: ci saranno arredamenti che andranno da un rustico stile Fantasy, a uno gotico-medievale. Sculture di personaggi fantastici animeranno le stanze e, naturalmente, all’entrata troverete una porta tonda.Siccome vogliamo che la Tana del Drago sia la casa di tutti noi, anche voi dovrete farne parte! Come scoprirete leggendo in cosa consistono i vari perk, potrete diventare parte della casa sostenendoci durante il crowdfunding: a seconda della vostra scelta, il vostro nome, o, a seconda dei casi, la vostra foto o il vostro ritratto verranno appesi permanentemente alle pareti della Tana del Drago.Se, grazie a voi, questo progetto andrà a buon fine, il 21 settembre durante la quarta edizione di Fantastika, la biennale d’arte del fantastico di Dozza, ci sarà l’apertura ufficiosa e l’inizio delle attività. Nei prossimi mesi vi daremo diverse anticipazioni sul programma della manifestazione e delle attività della Tana del Drago. Anche il fattore tempo è importante: l’obiettivo per settembre 2018 è quello di aprire gran parte del centro studi e con il vostro aiuto, dopo alcuni mesi potreste già veder nascere gli allestimenti scenografici a tema e le creature fantastiche!Tutto dipende da voi: più riusciremo a raccogliere insieme, più elaborate saranno le ambientazioni e le creature che animeranno la Tana del drago.I COSTIPer realizzare un simile sogno, i costi sono molto alti: come abbiamo accennato, abbiamo già iniziato la messa a norma dell’edificio ma avremo bisogno di arredamenti e allestimenti scenografico/espositivi, tutti in legno e in grado di creare suggestioni fantastiche. Serviranno sedie e tavoli per la sala conferenze, teche di vetro per la galleria espositiva, un bancone in stile fantasy per il bookshop, librerie per la biblioteca e cornici per esporre le opere d’arte. Infine, per meglio immergerci nell’atmosfera fantastica, vorremmo realizzare almeno tre sculture: una creatura negativa che si aggirerà tra le teche, un Pastore di alberi che osserverà le scale e un demone che sorvegli la galleria. Inoltre, anche se tra noi abbiamo moltissimi soci volenterosi, ci servirà comunque l’aiuto di alcuni professionisti per curare il settore comunicazione: teniamo così tanto a questo progetto che vogliamo realizzarlo al meglio in ogni sua parte! Stretch Goal: il viaggio del Drago!La strada per la vetta è lunga: per questo abbiamo stabilito diversi obiettivi per il viaggio del nostro Drago. Più ci aiuterete, più la Tana del Drago potrà essere un luogo magico e unico al mondo!
5000 €: si apre la porta! (ristrutturazione scale, ricostruzione scenografica ingresso casa hobbit) - RAGGIUNTO!
8000 €: bookshop aperto! (bancone e accessori in stile fantasy)
10.000 €: sala conferenze aperta! (sedie, tavolo per i relatori, impianto audio e video)
13.000 €: art gallery aperta! (predisposizione per mostre d’arte a tema fantasy)
15.000 €: bookshop completo! (arredamenti e rivestimenti in legno in stile fantasy)
18.000 €:  Centro studi aperto! (tavolo per riunioni e workshop, arredi in stile inglese di inizio '900)
24.000 €:  art gallery completa! (arredamenti in stile gotico-medievale, oggetti e materiale espositivo)
30.000 €: biblioteca completa! (angolo camino, libreria in stile inglese di inizio '900)
35.000 €: scultura di un Nano in scala originale
40.000 €: scultura di un Pastore di alberi in scala 1:1
45.000 €: scultura di un Demone in scala
PerkCome potete vedere nella colonna a destra, abbiamo pensato a delle ricompense speciali per ringraziarvi per il vostro preziosissimo aiuto. I nomi di tutti i sostenitori verranno scritti su uno speciale wall celebrativo che verrà appeso nell’ingresso.Molto importante sarà la tessera del nostro centro studi: sarà nominativa, numerata progressivamente e vi darà diritto ad uno sconto del 5% al bookshop della Tana del Drago. Se il perk che sceglierete non dovesse prevedere la spedizione, la tessera sarà ritirabile gratuitamente nel bookshop negli orari di apertura.Realizzeremo dei premi speciali, come la tshirt e la shopper in edizione esclusiva per questo crowdfunding.STAMPE E DISEGNI ORIGINALISono disponibili numerosi sketch originali degli artisti che hanno deciso di supportare il nostro progetto; per sceglierli, basta sfogliare il relativo album sulla nostra pagina facebook, procedere con il pagamento e scriverci (a questa mail) per prenotare il vostro disegno.Per le stampe funziona allo stesso modo.Questo l'elenco completo: Half-ElvesTreasure - Stampe

Per prenotarli, scriveteci un mail a questo indirizzo; noi aggiorneremo l'elenco con segnalando quelli già prenotati.SPEDIZIONITutto ciò che prevede una spedizione verrà spedito a partire da settembre 2018, dopo lo svolgimento di FantastikA. Qualsiasi perk sarà in ogni caso ritirabile gratuitamente a FantastikA; in quel caso, le spese di spedizione vi verranno rimborsate con un buono spendibile nel bookshop della Tana del Drago o sul sito dell’AIST (in fase di ultimazione) I rischi e la sfidaLe nostre braccia e il nostro cuore sono al servizio di questo sogno: ci manca soltanto il vostro aiuto! Se non dovessimo raggiungere il nostro obiettivo, voi riceverete comunque la ricompensa prevista per il perk scelto. La Tana del Drago però non vedrebbe la luce così come l’abbiamo sognata: senza i fondi, non ci sarà sicuramente possibile aprire nei tempi previsti. Tutto ciò che raccoglieremo andrà comunque destinato ai lavori di ristrutturazione, anche se significherebbe rallentarli fino a fermarli in attesa di qualche finanziamento. English version
Who are we
We are AIST a cultural association devoted to the study and the diffusion of the works of Inklings. Our roots date back to 2005, when, for the first time, a group of friends met in Rome to talk about fantasy literature. Since then we have grown, inspired by the common passion for English writers – not to mention the food, as it is only natural for the fan inside us – and today we have members and friends all over Italy.The love for the Professor’s books has led us to delve also into the secondary literature works centred on Inklings' works: we are interested in literary criticism, movies and comics, but we also love board and video games, music and art. Among us there are scholars, writers, critics and artists, but also simple enthusiasts brought together by a genuine desire to share a common passion.We write and translate books, we hold courses and presentations; we organise conferences in universities (among the guests of the last one, held at the University of Trento in December 2018, we are proud to mention Tom Shippey, the most important Tolkienian scholar of all time) and participate in leisure and cultural events dedicated to literature. Among the projects closest to our heart you can find several series of essays, an innovative series of little books focused on Inklings, a calendar created by masters of Italian fantasy art.Now the time has arrived to make a dream come true: to build a place where all those who love Middle-earth can feel at home and touch that world with their hands, gathering from every part of the world! Dwarves, Elves and Wizards will be able to meet under the wings of the Dragon, to explore together all the paths that Fantasy discloses. 
The Dragon’s Lair
WHERE: Dozza, near Bologna.A charming medieval village built on a hill and dominated by an imposing fortress of the House Sforza, a few miles away from the university town of Bologna. Here we organize FantastikA every two years, a festival entirely dedicated to fantasy culture and art. WHAT: “La Tana del Drago” (The Dragon’s Lair) is a no-profit project and will be a home for all those who love the world created by Inklings: at the same time a welcoming place for guests and a forge of countless ideas and projects. LA TANA DEL DRAGO/THE DRAGON’S LAIR is not licensed or authorised by the Tolkien Estate and has no association with the Tolkien Estate or the Tolkien family.We have chosen this name because the dragon has always represented the fantasy genre, because a few steps away from the study centre, just inside the beautiful castle of Dozza, there is a real dragon resting, huddled under its own huge wings, and because La Tana del Drago must become a welcoming haven where to find friends and feel safe!

Museum: the first museum devoted to Fantasy in Italy. There will be a space dedicated to a permanent exhibition and another for temporary exhibitions by guest artists from all around the world;

Study Centre: a place designed to stimulate and encourage research and studies about the Professor, providing the scholars with everything they need, also thanks to the library we want to create. We will organise conferences, inviting scholars of already established international fame, but also keeping an attentive eye on young people entering this world for the first time;

Laboratory: a space dedicated to courses and workshops, from basic levels designed for those who have just recently set foot in fantasy literature to advanced levels for those who want to improve their knowledge;

Bookshop: everything about english fantasy writers: books, works of art, unique handcrafted items and collectibles. We like to think that anyone coming to visit our Centre will find there Dwarvish gems born of care and passion!
WHY: Inspired mainly by reading Inklings' works, we do believe that Imagination, Art and Literature have the power to move mountains, and that Friendship is even stronger, being what really makes our dreams come true. Two is enough to make a toast, but the more we are the more exciting the party will be. The Dragon’s Lair will be a library, a treasure chest, and a tavern where to meet in the evening and tell stories sitting by the fireplace​! 
We need your help!
 HOW IT IS/HOW IT WILL BECOMEThanks to the municipal corporation of Dozza we have found a suitable building: a period house uninhabited for some years which therefore needs refurbishment and safety works to comply with the regulations before opening to the public. Our volunteers, mostly members of the Association, have already started performing the most basic works, but we need intervention by specialised professionals. In fact, the Studio Sossai of San Lazzaro di Savena has already started working to renovate the fixtures, the flooring, to paint the walls, to redo the stairs banisters and so on.Nb: the concepts are indicative and that the final result could be different from the one proposed. THE PROJECTIn order to touch a dream, you need creative minds and capable hands to make it come true. For this reason we rely on artist Ivan Cavini (illustrator, former creative director of Greisinger Museum and artistic director of FantastikA), whom we are honoured to count among our founding members, and on Studio Sossai, whose professionalism and experience in the theatrical field are very well known.The study centre will consist of three floors: in the basement there will be the library and the conference room, which will also hosts the workshops. On the ground floor you will find the bookshop and the museum entrance and finally, on the first floor, there will be the exhibition/museum rooms and the restrooms.The Dragon’s Lair will be decorated in such a way as to give the visitors the idea to open a door and be drawn into Fairyland.  Furniture will range from rustic style to medieval-Gothic, sculptures of fantastic characters will enliven the rooms, and of course you will find a round door at the entrance.Since we want the Dragon’s Lair to be the home of us all, you too must be part of it! As you will discover reading what the various perks are, you can become part of the project by supporting us during the crowdfunding. Depending on your choice, your name, your photo or your portrait will be permanently displayed on the walls of The Dragon’s Lair.If, thanks to your help, this project will be successful, on September 21st, during the fourth edition of FantastikA, the fantasy art festival taking place in Dozza every two years, there will be the “unofficial” opening of the Centre and the beginning of its activities. In the next few months we will give you several updates about the program of the event and the activities of the Dragon’s Lair. Timing is quite crucial: the goal for September 2018 is to open a large part of the study centre and, with your help, after a few months you will see artistic set-ups and fantastic creatures come into being!It all depends on you: the more we can collect together, the more elaborate the settings and the creatures that will animate The Dragon’s Lair will be.COSTSTo make such a dream come true, costs are very high. As we mentioned, we have already begun the safety works in the building, but we will need furniture and scenic/display installations, all in wood in order to suggest a fantasy environment. Chairs and tables are needed for the conference room, glass cases for exhibition gallery, a Hobbit-style counter for the bookshop, shelves for the library and frames to exhibit works of art. Finally, to enhance the ‘Fantasy immersion factor’, we would like to create at least three sculptures: evil creature that wanders between the display cases, an Trees' Shepard that watches the stairs and a demon guarding the gallery. Moreover, although we do have many willing partners among us, we will still need the help of some professionals to take care of the communication sector: we care so much about this project that we want to make it the best in each and every part! 
Stretch Goals: the journey of the Dragon!
The road to the top is long: this is why we have set progressive goals for the journey of our Dragon. The more you help us, the more the Dragon’s Lair can become a magical and unique place worldwide!
5,000 €: the door opens! (stairs renovation, scenographic reconstruction of fantasy dwelling entrance) - REACHED!
8,000 €: bookshop opens! (fantasy style counter and accessories);
10,000 €: conference room opens! (chairs, speakers’ table, audio and video system);
13,000 €: art gallery opens! (preparations for fantasy-themed art exhibitions);
15,000 €: bookshop completed! (fantasy style furnishings and coverings);
18,000 €: Study Centre opens! (Meetings’ and workshops’ table, early ‘900 English-style furniture);
24,000 €: art gallery completed! (furniture in Gothic-medieval style, items and exhibition material);
30,000 €: library completed! (corner fireplace, early ‘900 English-style library);
35,000 €: sculpture of a Dwarf in original scale;
40,000 €: sculpture of an Trees' Shepard in scale 1:1;
45,000 €: Demon’s sculpture in scale.
 PerksAs you can see in the right-hand column, we have thought of special rewards to thank you for your invaluable help. The names of all the supporters will be engraved on a special celebrative plaque that will be displayed in the entrance hall.We will provide a card for our studies center: it will be nominative, progressively numbered and will entitle you to a 5% discount at The Dragon’s Lair’s bookshop. If the perk you choose does not include shipping, the card will be available to collect for free in the bookshop during opening hours.We will create special prizes for this crowdfunding, like an exclusive t-shirt and a shopping bag. ORIGINAL PRINTS AND DRAWINGSSeveral original sketches by artists who decided to support our project will be available. In order to choose among them, just browse the relevant album on our Facebook page, proceed with payment and write us (to this email) to reserve your picture.For the signed prints it works the same way.Here the complete list:Half-Elves Treasure - Signed print

To book them, write us an email to this address, we will update the list with reporting those already booked.SHIPMENTSShipments will start in September 2018, after the conclusion of FantastikA. Any perk chosen will be  however available for picking up free of charge at FantastikA: in that case the shipping costs will be reimbursed with a voucher to spend at the Dragon’s Lair’s bookshop or on the website of Associazione Italiana Studi Tolkieniani (coming soon!). 
Risks & Challenges
We are very committed to this project, body and soul: we only need your help! Should we not achieve our goal, you will still receive your reward for the chosen perk, but The Dragon’s Lair will not see the light as we have dreamed it. Without sufficient funds, it will not be possible to open on schedule. In that case everything we collect will go to the renovation works, even if that means to slow them down while waiting for further funding.

story:
Who We are & What We Are Doing

In times like these, nothing soothes the soul and lifts the spirit more than music of the people. Music, dance, laughter, and sharing good times and good food with old friends and new, these are the joyful bonds that have always kept folks around the world together when it looked like everything else was falling apart. This is the “folk power” celebrated and perpetuated by FolkWorks.

FolkWorks is presenting a day long Folk/Roots Festival, an opportunity to experience the culture of other countries…and our own; an opportunity to experience the healing power of music…and learn the pleasure of playing and dancing and eating together.

● 70+ artists - Sausage Grinder, Yuval Ron Trio, Complicated Animals, Baklava Ensemble, Cambalache, Susie Glaze New Folk Ensemble, Echo Mountain, Amaro Lumiyo, TheZband, TBA

● Concerts, workshops, a square dance, jam sessions, folk films & more

● Cross cultural celebration of traditional music from the Middle East, Persia, Peru, Brazil, the United States, Eastern Europe, and Mexico

What We Need & What You Get

But a festival cannot exist in a vacuum. To survive and thrive it needs nurturing and support. And that’s where you come in. To successfully produce this Festival, FolkWorks depends on your generosity. 100% of the money we raise in this campaign will go to pay talented performers and teachers. Please donate what you can to allow us to present the best diverse musical traditions for this amazing event.

Of course, there are perks such as recognition in the program, free tickets to the Festival for example.  But more than that, you will have the satisfaction of being a part of something bigger than one concert or one genre or one artist. You will be a part of a world community of music and dance ... part of the FolkWorks family.

What Else You Can Do?

In addition to giving what you can, the most important thing you can do is get the word out ... to all your friends via email, Facebook and whatever other social platform you use.  And please do it repeatedly. People often do not notice messages or events the first few times.  A personal note about the importance of the Festival would also be great. With all the disasters demanding our attention, we sometimes forget the importance of music and dance ... to create a healing connection with each other.

story:
https://www.facebook.com/Dinamalardaily/posts/2227713880594510?__tn__=C-R

https://www.facebook.com/SuryanFM/posts/1651732...

We have recently received immense exposure through TV stations, Facebook pages and Youtube channels. This message of valuing our cultural identity through local food has really touched a nerve in the Tamil psyche. Peoples’ love for farming, their traditions and foods are relevant to their culture, and it is this love that has created intense interest in what we do. 

It feels as though everyone is ready to listen, and more importantly, they are ready to act. Simply by showing people the importance of eating foods that grow locally could bring about a huge change in our society; a change that is in our hands.

I invite you to join as one my friends, supporters and fellow children of Mother Nature.

The above amount helps re-build, improve and develop the infrastructure of Solitude Farm. Thatched dorms, a new bathroom, compost toilets, café re-structuring and improvements to the pathing and flooring throughout the farm will be conducted from the funds.

Not only will your support help us make this our best festival, a festival that culminates years of experience together into a focused event about local food, it also helps create the fertile ground for all future activities to spring from.

Your contribution goes towards supporting learning, happiness, healthy food, and sustainability.

We are eternally grateful for your support.

The truth is there is no tomorrow, no time to wait. Let’s make a change, act now.

Initiating, maintaining and educating through community projects such as a 2 - year garden project at the Auroville Town Hall, assisting six local schools to develop their own gardens, a children’s garden project at Periyamudlaiarshavdi village and a weekly circle garden at different communities to promote eating local food.

 

Communicating the value of local foods and provide the three simple steps on the road back to Nature by having free farm tours every week for the last several years (more than 70 a year), regularly hosting schools / farmers / womens groups for workshops, and speaking at two Tedx events.

 

Sharing the nutritional and medicinal naturally grown food from the farm through Community Supported Agriculture (CSA) Baskets for the last eight years and by offering free lunches for a period of 5 months to a local school of 40 children and teachers.

 

Assisting the development of people’s own farming initiatives by implementing a seedbank and nursery, creating informational / educational videos on permaculture and natural farming, hosting permaculture and cooking workshops and volunteers at the farm.

 

Running 6 eco-music community festivals and hosting numerous concerts and open – mics, recognizing the value of celebration through music and culture in permaculture.

Also, Check out our past projects in PDF format!

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1YeMYgl6...

Other press -

https://www.thebetterindia.com/167209/auroville...

https://www.timesnownews.com/mirror-now/society...

https://newstn.in/articles/solitude-farm-auroville

http://www.puthiyathalaimurai.com/news/tamilnad...

https://www.facebook.com/NattuNaaiofficial/post...

story:
WHO ARE WE?

We are Darrell Shines (production, stage manager, logistics of large scale events and tours). Darrell has worked on the tours for Michael Jackson, David Bowie, Metallica, N’SYNC, Backstreet Boyz, Brittney Spears, Mary J. Blige, Erykah Badu and has worked for Comedy Central, MTV, VH1, Central Park Summerstage, Rock-it Cargo, The World Wrestling Federation (Now WWE  and more)

and  Stefania Galegati-Shines (Internationally acclaimed visual artist and professor at Accademia di Belle Arti di Lecce IT).

We are the owners/operators of Caffè Internazionale in the heart of Palermo Italy’s Centro Storico. 

Neither of us are from Palermo but we fell deeply in love with the city.

After living here for 8 years and coming to understand how we best fit into the city as collaborators, we decided to open Caffè Internazionale! It has been one of the most beautiful yet difficult things we have ever done!

We opened Caffè Internazionale 2 years ago with the purpose of developing a space to collaborate with local artist and to use our contacts from around the world to bring artists and musicians to Palermo to perform, collaborate and conduct workshops in order to properly nurture the wonderfully creative community here in Palermo.

We have managed to  build an incredibly responsive community of local artists and musicians and international artist are now beginning to understand something unique and special is happening here in Palermo ala CBGBs or 0930 club where Darrell worked as a doorman in the late 90s..  We would like to expand upon this basic concept, improve and upgrade programming and our production facility to allow for booking of more international artist and to build in audio and video recording capabilities, a digital boutique record label and a more specific educational programming. 

Your contributions will allow us to move in a more self-sustainable mode. As we stated previously, Palermo is a difficult place to get things off the ground .

IN THESE LAST TWO DAYS OF CROWDFUNDING WE DECIDED TO CLOSE CAFFè INTERNAZIONALE IN THIS LOCATION!!! WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT TO OPEN IN A NEW LOCATION!!! 

 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU RECEIVE

 

We are asking for 50k

MOVING TO  THE NEW SPACE!!!

 Acoustic reinforcement, sound-proofing  and Audio Recording Equipment 15k

Video Recording Equipment 10k

Programming lectures and workshops and inviting international teachers and artists 15k

Refurbishing  and remodelling to accomodate new activities 5k

Show production and development of young artists 5k

 

WHY ARE WE DOING THIS?

 

Now that we have identified locals we believe have international appeal and/or are able to communicate, share, learn, teach and collaborate effectively, we would like to help them establish an international platform. 

There is no real structure for them beyond University level to evolve the skills acquired in University and they tend to go away to London or Berlin for work but most are not happy outside of Sicily. We want to give the the option to build and stay here in Sicily. The opportunity to establish and grow with an open mind. To learn to be entrepreneurs and to capitalize on the new and rapidly growing population  of tourist and newcomers to the city.

Palermo also has a large new African and Asian immigrant community that are now deciding to stay and raise families. There are many cultural differences and we would like to integrate cultural exchange programming into our space. To again, share food, openly discuss cultural differences and get to know one another better. 

We have been quite successful at integrating these communities with the little resources we have available.

 

ARE THERE RISKS & CHALLENGES?

 

We were afraid of Palermo… at first. Then we realized they were afraid of us as well. 

You see, Sicily is a place that has a history of being taken over by outside forces. And then there is the mafia… The culture of the mafia does still exist but it has been minimized but the fact that the locals realized that without participating, they have little strength. There is an organization called addiopizzo which addresses this issues and affectively helps to protect local business owners but sheer numbers and transparency. 

There is also the issue which took us a while to understand. People here are accustomed to being entertained for free. They are more apt to sit in a piazza  with friends on a gorgeous night than to go to a bar and spend money. For them to go to a concert is seen as a big expense because the unemployment rate is so high and sitting in the piazza is just part of the culture. Our goal has always been to create unique programming we felt would have a positive impact and that we would actually want to see! Genuineness. 

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

 

We understand that some of you will not be able to contribute financially.

We also accept donations of your time, equipment you may have laying around your house you do not use any longer, connections and contacts you feel could help us forward our agenda.

story:
Summary


With your support, March 10th will witness an historic cultural event in Phnom Penh, at Vann Molyvann's iconic Chaktomuk Theatre. This semi-staged performance of A Cambodian Magic Flute (CMF) is the result of two unprecedented artistic workshops bringing together Cambodian traditional musicians with a talented young Singaporean orchestra. The March performance of Mozart's masterpiece will be the first time a classic opera has ever been performed in Cambodia.

Mozart’s much loved The Magic Flute — a universal tale of love and hope — is a cornerstone of the Western operatic tradition that can also lay claim to have been the first hit musical, enjoying an unprecedented run of over a hundred performances in its first year...

Mozart at Angkor and Amrita Performing Arts are working together to bring this to pass, ultimately intending to present three performances using a 12th century temple as an incomparable backdrop. 

5 reasons to give

1) Contribute to Cambodia's cultural regeneration, after 40 years where culture and art has been crushed or stifled

2) Be a pioneer in what will ultimately be a world historic event - the first opera ever staged in Cambodia, in the spectacular setting of Angkor Wat

3) Be part of a project which allows Cambodian talent to flourish and develop their own artistic paths

4) Support a Cambodian adaptation of a classic masterpiece which can become a regular part of the cultural calendar

5) Show your support for culture as a regenerative force in post-conflict societies

Why now?

Cambodia is currently in the middle of major economic regeneration and recovery, but its culture still lags behind, still scarred after decades of civil war, much of which was aimed directly at art and artists. There have been notable NGOs which have worked hard to recover Cambodian traditional arts, and now is the time for them to rejoin the international cultural community, to the mutual benefit of all parties.

Why this opera? 

Mozart's Die Zauberflöte, "The Magic Flute", is a story of the universal search for truth that cuts across national boundaries and beliefs.  The simple humanity of the story has clear parallels to the Reamker, the Cambodian version of the ancient Hindu Ramayana story and the most popular narrative in Cambodia.

Cambodians of all ages and visitors from all over the world will be able to relate to the simple humanity of this story with its powerful mythological and allegorical content. One of the great musical creations of all time, Mozart’s enchanting Magic Flute has enduring international appeal.  Moreover, the opera’s quasi-religious morality has clear parallels with the Ramayana story and other elements of Hindu and Buddhist symbology. 

The entirely Asian-based artistic team will draw on these parallels as well as incorporate traditional Cambodian disciplines such as lakhoan bassac, lakhoan khaol and sbaek thom in the production.

 

History of the project

A Cambodian Magic Flute was conceived as three distinct stages.

1) Work began with a week of auditions in 2016 at the Royal University of Fine Arts allowing Robert Turnbull and the production team to see the extent of the talent and begin to make casting decisions. One year later a series of workshops brought an orchestra from Singapore together with local Cambodian musicians and singers. Parts of Mozart’s score was re-conceptualized by conductor Aaron Carpene for a Cambodian ensemble while director Stefano Vizioli worked with Amrita dancers to begin blocking a production.

2) March 10, 2018 semi-staged concert in Phnom Penh

3) A full production at a 12th Century temple in Siem Reap in early 2019.


The participants

20 Cambodian dancers from Amrita Performing Arts
9 Cambodians playing traditional instruments
28 piece orchestra made up of 24 members of the Ho Chi Minh Philharmonic Orchestra and four from Cambodia
8 Asian soloists, three from Cambodia

                                                                                       Kang Rithisal, Executive Director

 

Amrita dancers

Created in 2000 Amrita Performing Arts has emerged as one of Southeast Asia’s leading dance company in Cambodia. Initially trained in classical dance the troupe of around 30 dancers have since adopted contemporary dance techniques through proximity and training by western choreographers such as the American Mark Morris. When Amrita performed as the Guggenheim Museum during the Seasons of Cambodia festival in New York, the New York Times wrote : ‘their dancing had mimicry, charm and virtuosity throughout; sometimes its spell goes deeper yet’.

Saigon Philharmonic Orchestra resident orchestra of Ho Chi Minh Conservatory of Music

South Vietnam leading orchestra was founded in 1995 out if the city’s leading Conservatory of Music. The orchestra plays for the both and city’s opera and ballet companies in the Opera House, a colonial structure in the heart of the city. They also perform abroad and were chosen to form part of the orchestral forces for the Southeast Asian premieres of Wagner’s The Flying Dutchman IN 2016. The European style conservatory has been shaping the raw material of talent as the demand for opera grows among Vietnam’s increasingly sophisticated public young generation of musicians. The country produces some of Asia’s finest singers.

 

Soloists

CMF aims to bring Asian soloists from around the region. Asia as a region has its own rich history in the performing arts and until the last decade or so has been slow to catch onto this Western medium, with only the northern countries of Japan and Korea performing operatic repertory with any regularity. All that has changed over the last few decades. Today resource-rich China has built a number of opera houses while Thailand can boast six different establishments producing opera. Increasingly smaller companies, sometimes with quite ambitious plans are challenging the more established regional companies.

CMF has been following these developments and assembled a team of soloists with exactly the right voices for the roles. Contrary to some views, Mozart is not easy to sing and requires a purity of line and control that eludes many trained singers.

Traditional instrumentalists

In collaboration with Amrita Performing Arts, the Rome-based conductor-stage director team Aaron Carpene and Stefano Vizioli are working with a group of Cambodians to re-conceptualize sections of the score for local instrumental forces. The flute solos of the Fire and Water Trials will be taken by the kloy, while Papageno’s magic bells, usually played on the glockenspiel are played on the pin, the traditional Cambodian harp recreated recently by the French ethno-musicologist Patrick Kersale from bas-relief images of Angkorian temples.

‘Our idea is to capture the magic of Papageno's instrument through the beguiling sounds of Cambodian traditional instruments’, says Carpene. ‘Mozart's music for the glockenspiel will be transformed by a Khmer ensemble tantalized by the thought of what Mozart would have done himself if he had had access to Cambodian musicians in Vienna in 1791!’ 

One of the ancient instruments included in our Magic Flute ensemble is the ‘pin’, or  ornate harp, whose design is based on a 7th century sculpture found at Sambor Prei Kuk—the most important pre-Angkorian site, located in central Cambodia. 

The man behind it is Patrick Kersale, a French ethnomusicologist who reconstructed a collection of 50 Angkorian and pre-Angkorian instruments by studying wall sculptures on a number of Khmer monuments.

Use of the harp probably ceased in the 1300s, claims Kersale, who has miraculously revived not only the instruments but the tonalities of the royal cortege that set the musical narrative for the Angkor empire in its prime.  For the first time we can imagine the ‘sound of Angkor’.

‘Finding musical instrument-makers to reproduce the ancient drum and string instruments was not difficult, Mr. Kersale said. However, crafting a long-forgotten harp was not so simple, so Mr. Kersale went to Burma where the harp still features prominently in traditional music.

On his return to Cambodia, it was only a matter of time before he found locals prepared to learn the instrument, and we are very proud to welcome two of his students into our project.

The educational opportunity

Four Cambodian Musicians playing Flute and Clarinet will join the Orchestra, first for four rehearsals days in Vietnam Ho Chi Minh and finally for the concert at the Chaktomuk.


 

We will take the opportunity having all of these talented artists together in once to offer open rehearsals to all musicians students in the Royal University of fine Arts as well as free open workshops about Singing and Conducting. 

Behind the Project

 




 

The point

  • To bring all forces together for the first time under an internationally recognized conductor
  • To introduce Cambodian elements to the staging that will give a foretaste of the final fully-staged production at Angkor.
  • To introduce preparations for the production at Angkor to the public, media and potential sponsors.
  • To introduce Cambodian performers for the first time into a classic opera, and one that represents a high point in global culture.
  • To reveal for the first time the similarity between The Magic Flute and the Cambodian Reamker, the local version of the Ramayana.
  • To open up the rehearsal process to Cambodian musicians not directly involved in the production and conduct masterclasses.
  • To present the work to potential sponsors, with the aim of engaging them in the final production at Ankgor in 2019.

How is this money spent?

The costs of this performance are divided into several categories.
Production (Executive director, Stage-Director and Conductor, Venue, Equipment…)
artists' fees, logistics (Transportation – flights tickets – Accommodation)  Marketing and communication. 

Details: 

Direction fees: $6,000
Direction transportation and accommodation: $800

Saigon Philharmonic Orchestra: $13,460
Transportation and accommodation (estimation): $4,500

International soloists fees: $8,000
Transportation and accommodation (estimation): $3,000
Cambodian musicians fees (included transportation to HCM for training): $4,300

Amrita Dancers: $3,250
Dancers Costumes: $4,453

Theatre Rental fees: $500
Light and sound system: $3,000
Catering for VIP reception: $1,000

Video recording of the Performance: $6,000
Communication and marketing: $2,000
Visual Designer: $500
others: $5,000

Press

http://www.khmertimeskh.com/50105919/mozart-at-the-mansion/

https://whatsonphnompenh.com/2018/01/25/cambodias-first-ever-opera-is-going-to-be-magic/
