story_txt:
SummaryWith your support, March 10th will witness an historic cultural event in Phnom Penh, at Vann Molyvann's iconic Chaktomuk Theatre. This semi-staged performance of A Cambodian Magic Flute (CMF) is the result of two unprecedented artistic workshops bringing together Cambodian traditional musicians with a talented young Singaporean orchestra. The March performance of Mozart's masterpiece will be the first time a classic opera has ever been performed in Cambodia.Mozart’s much loved The Magic Flute — a universal tale of love and hope — is a cornerstone of the Western operatic tradition that can also lay claim to have been the first hit musical, enjoying an unprecedented run of over a hundred performances in its first year...Mozart at Angkor and Amrita Performing Arts are working together to bring this to pass, ultimately intending to present three performances using a 12th century temple as an incomparable backdrop. 5 reasons to give1) Contribute to Cambodia's cultural regeneration, after 40 years where culture and art has been crushed or stifled2) Be a pioneer in what will ultimately be a world historic event - the first opera ever staged in Cambodia, in the spectacular setting of Angkor Wat3) Be part of a project which allows Cambodian talent to flourish and develop their own artistic paths4) Support a Cambodian adaptation of a classic masterpiece which can become a regular part of the cultural calendar5) Show your support for culture as a regenerative force in post-conflict societiesWhy now?Cambodia is currently in the middle of major economic regeneration and recovery, but its culture still lags behind, still scarred after decades of civil war, much of which was aimed directly at art and artists. There have been notable NGOs which have worked hard to recover Cambodian traditional arts, and now is the time for them to rejoin the international cultural community, to the mutual benefit of all parties.Why this opera? Mozart's Die Zauberflöte, "The Magic Flute", is a story of the universal search for truth that cuts across national boundaries and beliefs.  The simple humanity of the story has clear parallels to the Reamker, the Cambodian version of the ancient Hindu Ramayana story and the most popular narrative in Cambodia.Cambodians of all ages and visitors from all over the world will be able to relate to the simple humanity of this story with its powerful mythological and allegorical content. One of the great musical creations of all time, Mozart’s enchanting Magic Flute has enduring international appeal.  Moreover, the opera’s quasi-religious morality has clear parallels with the Ramayana story and other elements of Hindu and Buddhist symbology. The entirely Asian-based artistic team will draw on these parallels as well as incorporate traditional Cambodian disciplines such as lakhoan bassac, lakhoan khaol and sbaek thom in the production. History of the projectA Cambodian Magic Flute was conceived as three distinct stages.1) Work began with a week of auditions in 2016 at the Royal University of Fine Arts allowing Robert Turnbull and the production team to see the extent of the talent and begin to make casting decisions. One year later a series of workshops brought an orchestra from Singapore together with local Cambodian musicians and singers. Parts of Mozart’s score was re-conceptualized by conductor Aaron Carpene for a Cambodian ensemble while director Stefano Vizioli worked with Amrita dancers to begin blocking a production.2) March 10, 2018 semi-staged concert in Phnom Penh3) A full production at a 12th Century temple in Siem Reap in early 2019.The participants20 Cambodian dancers from Amrita Performing Arts9 Cambodians playing traditional instruments28 piece orchestra made up of 24 members of the Ho Chi Minh Philharmonic Orchestra and four from Cambodia8 Asian soloists, three from Cambodia                                                                                       Kang Rithisal, Executive Director Amrita dancersCreated in 2000 Amrita Performing Arts has emerged as one of Southeast Asia’s leading dance company in Cambodia. Initially trained in classical dance the troupe of around 30 dancers have since adopted contemporary dance techniques through proximity and training by western choreographers such as the American Mark Morris. When Amrita performed as the Guggenheim Museum during the Seasons of Cambodia festival in New York, the New York Times wrote : ‘their dancing had mimicry, charm and virtuosity throughout; sometimes its spell goes deeper yet’.Saigon Philharmonic Orchestra resident orchestra of Ho Chi Minh Conservatory of MusicSouth Vietnam leading orchestra was founded in 1995 out if the city’s leading Conservatory of Music. The orchestra plays for the both and city’s opera and ballet companies in the Opera House, a colonial structure in the heart of the city. They also perform abroad and were chosen to form part of the orchestral forces for the Southeast Asian premieres of Wagner’s The Flying Dutchman IN 2016. The European style conservatory has been shaping the raw material of talent as the demand for opera grows among Vietnam’s increasingly sophisticated public young generation of musicians. The country produces some of Asia’s finest singers. SoloistsCMF aims to bring Asian soloists from around the region. Asia as a region has its own rich history in the performing arts and until the last decade or so has been slow to catch onto this Western medium, with only the northern countries of Japan and Korea performing operatic repertory with any regularity. All that has changed over the last few decades. Today resource-rich China has built a number of opera houses while Thailand can boast six different establishments producing opera. Increasingly smaller companies, sometimes with quite ambitious plans are challenging the more established regional companies.CMF has been following these developments and assembled a team of soloists with exactly the right voices for the roles. Contrary to some views, Mozart is not easy to sing and requires a purity of line and control that eludes many trained singers.Traditional instrumentalistsIn collaboration with Amrita Performing Arts, the Rome-based conductor-stage director team Aaron Carpene and Stefano Vizioli are working with a group of Cambodians to re-conceptualize sections of the score for local instrumental forces. The flute solos of the Fire and Water Trials will be taken by the kloy, while Papageno’s magic bells, usually played on the glockenspiel are played on the pin, the traditional Cambodian harp recreated recently by the French ethno-musicologist Patrick Kersale from bas-relief images of Angkorian temples.‘Our idea is to capture the magic of Papageno's instrument through the beguiling sounds of Cambodian traditional instruments’, says Carpene. ‘Mozart's music for the glockenspiel will be transformed by a Khmer ensemble tantalized by the thought of what Mozart would have done himself if he had had access to Cambodian musicians in Vienna in 1791!’ One of the ancient instruments included in our Magic Flute ensemble is the ‘pin’, or  ornate harp, whose design is based on a 7th century sculpture found at Sambor Prei Kuk—the most important pre-Angkorian site, located in central Cambodia. The man behind it is Patrick Kersale, a French ethnomusicologist who reconstructed a collection of 50 Angkorian and pre-Angkorian instruments by studying wall sculptures on a number of Khmer monuments.Use of the harp probably ceased in the 1300s, claims Kersale, who has miraculously revived not only the instruments but the tonalities of the royal cortege that set the musical narrative for the Angkor empire in its prime.  For the first time we can imagine the ‘sound of Angkor’.‘Finding musical instrument-makers to reproduce the ancient drum and string instruments was not difficult, Mr. Kersale said. However, crafting a long-forgotten harp was not so simple, so Mr. Kersale went to Burma where the harp still features prominently in traditional music.On his return to Cambodia, it was only a matter of time before he found locals prepared to learn the instrument, and we are very proud to welcome two of his students into our project.The educational opportunityFour Cambodian Musicians playing Flute and Clarinet will join the Orchestra, first for four rehearsals days in Vietnam Ho Chi Minh and finally for the concert at the Chaktomuk. We will take the opportunity having all of these talented artists together in once to offer open rehearsals to all musicians students in the Royal University of fine Arts as well as free open workshops about Singing and Conducting. Behind the Project  The point
To bring all forces together for the first time under an internationally recognized conductor
To introduce Cambodian elements to the staging that will give a foretaste of the final fully-staged production at Angkor.
To introduce preparations for the production at Angkor to the public, media and potential sponsors.
To introduce Cambodian performers for the first time into a classic opera, and one that represents a high point in global culture.
To reveal for the first time the similarity between The Magic Flute and the Cambodian Reamker, the local version of the Ramayana.
To open up the rehearsal process to Cambodian musicians not directly involved in the production and conduct masterclasses.
To present the work to potential sponsors, with the aim of engaging them in the final production at Ankgor in 2019.
How is this money spent?The costs of this performance are divided into several categories.Production (Executive director, Stage-Director and Conductor, Venue, Equipment…)artists' fees, logistics (Transportation – flights tickets – Accommodation)  Marketing and communication. Details: Direction fees: $6,000Direction transportation and accommodation: $800Saigon Philharmonic Orchestra: $13,460Transportation and accommodation (estimation): $4,500International soloists fees: $8,000Transportation and accommodation (estimation): $3,000Cambodian musicians fees (included transportation to HCM for training): $4,300Amrita Dancers: $3,250Dancers Costumes: $4,453Theatre Rental fees: $500Light and sound system: $3,000Catering for VIP reception: $1,000Video recording of the Performance: $6,000Communication and marketing: $2,000Visual Designer: $500others: $5,000Presshttp://www.khmertimeskh.com/50105919/mozart-at-the-mansion/https://whatsonphnompenh.com/2018/01/25/cambodias-first-ever-opera-is-going-to-be-magic/https://lepetitjournal.com/cambodge/a-voir-a-faire/opera-un-air-de-flute-enchantee-souffle-sur-le-cambodge-221798https://www.siemreap.net/magazine/events/mozart-navutu-masterpieces-opera/https://www.cambodiadaily.com/archives/years-in-the-planning-mozart-at-angkor-takes-shape-78488/

story:
¡Hola! Somos Josymar Rodriguez y Stefan Gzyl, arquitectos y parte del equipo de Incursiones, iniciativa social que crea contenido y escenarios capaces de promover interacciones entre ciudadanos. Diseñamos y ponemos a prueba experiencias e intervenciones en el espacio público que muestran nuevas formas de agitar la cotidianidad promoviendo prácticas ciudadanas constructivas y la exploración de la ciudad.

En esta oportunidad, queremos poner a prueba cómo diferentes actores compartimos el espacio de la ciudad. La calle ha pasado de ser entendida como un espacio dedicado a mover vehículos a uno en el que interactúan diversos medios y velocidades, contribuyendo a una mayor riqueza de la experiencia urbana, mayor seguridad y beneficios económicos. Siguiendo el ejemplo de Bogotá, Copenhague o Nueva York, numerosas ciudades se han dedicado a cambiar el status quo sobre lo que se considera debe ser una calle. Igualmente, el ciudadano ha pasado de simple receptor a tener un rol activo, alguien que demanda y participa en el cambio. Esta dinámica ha abierto la puerta a numerosas iniciativas que se originan de abajo hacia arriba, exigiendo de instituciones gubernamentales otras actitudes hacia el espacio público. El diseño debe ser parte fundamental de cómo se abordan estos reclamos.

El tráfico de México es uno de los peores del mundo, lo que funcione en Ciudad de México puede funcionar donde sea. ¿Por qué CDMX? Entre el 17 y 20 de Marzo se celebrará Mextropoli 2018 y fuimos seleccionados para hacer una intervención urbana en el marco del festival. Este evento es único en nuestro continente y contará con la asistencia de más de 50.000 personas. El objetivo de nuestra intervención, ejecutada de la mano con los participantes, buscará promover la peatonalidad y reducir el impacto que el vehículo privado tiene sobre el espacio de la calle.

Ayúdanos a intervenir el suelo de una intersección del centro histórico de CDMX, un cruce en el que existen conflictos de movilidad. Nuestra idea es poner a prueba una estrategia de “camuflaje de deslumbramiento”, que no busca esconder sino desorientar, desarrollada durante la 1era Guerra Mundial y luego reinterpretada por el arte moderno. Nosotros la usaremos como una manera de hacer consciente a todos los usuarios de los estímulos del ambiente a partir de alterar su atención y su percepción del espacio, borrando las diferencias entre calzada, acera, rayados, etc., visibilizando por igual a todos los actores.

 

  • Objetivos

1. El poder del diseño. Demostrar que con recursos y materiales limitados se pueden producir intervenciones de alto impacto y calidad visual.

2. Poder del ciudadano. Demostrar la capacidad de organización del individuo para generar cambios en la ciudad.

3. Descontextualización: evidenciar cómo el cambiar la manera de ver nuestro entorno permite abrir nuevas posibilidades y formas de relacionarnos con este.

¡Se parte del grupo de ciudadanos activos, que como nosotros busca impulsar cambios en nuestras ciudades!

 

GRACIAS

story:
Overview 

 

We are LVnTheLife! A Public Benefits Corporation aiming to empower the disabled, provide for the helpless, and give exposure to local artistic talent through digital engagement.  Local artists are always seeking a way to be exposed and find voice within the outskirts of their own community. We hope to broaden their horizons. We also want to give voice to the disabled, who are often neglected for their ability as artists in our community. We put on a show called “LView” to provide the support to reach our mission by interviewing artists of ATX and we have fun doing it! Thus far, we have done 3 seasons of LView and plan to continue the show through the spring totaling 7 seasons. But we need your help! 

What We Need & What You Get

Costs adding up towards any project are anticipated and surmountable. This show was created freely from our heart, not anticipating any pay because we believe Art can make a difference. However, for consistency, quality, and growth we ask for your donation. 

LVnTheLife will be applying for the Community Initiatives Impact Award from the City of Austin Cultural Arts Divsion to support the show financially in order to cover pre-production, production and post-production costs such as rental of space, crew, the artist’s time in being interviewed, and editing for three shows. Our crew is small, consisting of two hosts, A cameraman, two assistants, editors, plus the interviewees in addition to the generous space given by Genuine Joe’s Coffee Shop to make this show come to life.

In the summer we will have a party free to the public to meet and mingle with the artists of the show. However, the award is only accepted if we meet a cash match of $750.00 minimum. Here is where you come in! And guess what?? You get a perk and get exposure through one of our social media platforms! Instagram is the big one, but we also have Youtube, Tik-Tok, Firework, Twitter, and others. It’s your choice.. And who knows, maybe you will be on the show! 

The Impact

We aired the very first season of the show on August 18, 2019 and we want to continue until June 14, 2020 with a party end of June.

We are fiscally sponsored by Austin Creative Alliance which advances, connects and advocates for Austin’s arts, cultural, and creative communities in order to strengthen and protect the character, quality of life, and economic prosperity of our region.

Your support towards LView will raise greater awareness in the artistic and disabled communities of Austin, TX and provide a platform for locals to share their passion and love for what they do, why they do, and how they do. Don't forget to share the campaign and your support in the Arts Community.

www.lvnthelife.com

www.instagram.com/lvnthelife/

story:
In March 2021, Muzewest Concerts was overjoyed to receive the news that we won a grant from the BC Arts Council in order to purchase technology to keep our recitals running! (Yes, we hear you clapping!)

 

This grant provides us with 75% of the budget needed to equip ourselves with audio equipment for our live streamed and in-person concerts. We purchased two sets of stereo microphones, a Yamaha sound mixer, and a case for the mixer. 

 

According to the terms of the grant, we are responsible for raising 25% of the project budget. We would love to be able to purchase the following:

 

- Roland VR-1HD AV Mixer ($1621.76 - tax included)

- Sennheiser XSW1-825 Dual microphones ($524.80 - tax included)

- Radial Catapult Mini Compact Cat 5 Analog Snake ($121.08 - tax included)

 

$2268.64 - total

 

While we hope to move to in-person audiences as soon as possible, we recognize that live streaming is still an option that our audience will appreciate us continuing as we move forward. It offers an affordable and safe option for audience members who remain cautious moving through BC’s reopening plan while facilitating reaching a wider audience that is not constrained by geographical location. Many of our performing musicians are international artists who have a following that would gladly tune into a concert from the comfort of their homes in other cities and countries. Finally, live-streaming equipment allows us to create and maintain an archive of our performances. These performances will be available to our audience and those who contribute to this fundraiser.

 

If we reach our fundraising goal, we will allocate the extra funds toward investing in video equipment. Currently, that important work is outsourced to local videographers. Any additional money raised will also be used to help pay for insurance for this valuable equipment.

 

Thank you for your support as we navigate the new musical world in which we find ourselves!

 

PERKS

 

Innovator 10 (donation of $10) - You will receive 1 Muzewest virtual performance for your personal viewing

 

Innovator 25 (donation of $25) - You will receive 2 Muzewest virtual performances for your personal viewing

 

Innovator 50 (donation of $50) - You will receive 2 Muzewest virtual performances for your personal viewing and one free ticket to a live performance

 

Innovator 100 (donation of $100) - You will receive 3 Muzewest virtual performances for your personal viewing and two free tickets to a live performance

 

Innovator 200 (donation of $200) - You will receive 4 Muzewest virtual performances for your personal viewing and four free tickets to a live performance.

 

Innovator 300 (donation of $300) - You will receive 4 Muzewest virtual performances for your personal viewing, four free tickets to a live performance, and a 45-minute music lesson with a Muzewest artist.

 

Innovator 500 (donation of $500) - You will receive 4 Muzewest virtual performances for your personal viewing, four free tickets to a live performance, a 45-minute music lesson with a Muzewest artist, and join us for an after-concert reception with the artist.

 

Innovator 1000 (donation of $1000)- You will receive 4 Muzewest virtual performances for your personal viewing, four free tickets to a live performance, and 30 minutes of recording time in order to make a music video that will be edited and produced for you by a professional sound engineer and videographer.

story:
About GreenSound Media

Hey there! We're GreenSound Media, and we exist to help small businesses and artists, the backbone of our economy, utilize digital media marketing to gain the presence and growth they deserve. We created this business in the midst of a global pandemic to help navigate through the new digital marketing frenzy, and haven't turned back since!

As previously working for large marketing and PR firms, we noticed a large amount of small businesses and artists who weren't getting the attention they needed, and were paying way too much to not be a top priority. With our professional experience and dedication, GreenSound Media's focus is providing extraordinary value for small businesses and artists for a competitive price.

With your help we can take on more talent while maintaining the close attention and care that initially inspired us to start this business. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $15,000 to provide job opportunities for professional, personable individuals who know how to market effectively to different audiences both in the small business and entertainment world. 

We provide high-quality logo design, copy writing, photo/video editing, licensing, email marketing, PR and much more. With that being said, it takes quite a bit of funds to successfully operate. If we don't reach our goal, that is totally okay! We're grateful for any donation, and will stick to our mission no matter what.

The Impact

Our clients had to chase a moving target and face challenges they've never experienced. Challenges that required new strategies and a partner who could help them adapt to life in a pandemic.

Rather than taking traditional approaches, we found new opportunities to position our clients for success during a difficult period of time. We introduced new campaign structures, incorporated innovative technologies and grew our expertise to meet audiences where they were in the moment.

We’re passionate about solving difficult problems and applying actionable ideas and insights to help our clients surpass their goals. When we help small businesses grow, we are ultimately hoping to provide more job opportunities and contribute to progressing communities around the world.  So, why fear change when we can thrive in it?

Challenges We Face

We are a team of two who dedicate our career to growing small businesses and artists. While we want to take on every project we come across, we can't give our undivided attention to every client when we grow. We will need to bring professional marketing & PR members onboard who put every client as top priority.

Other Ways You Can Help

Contributions come in many shapes and sizes! We would love if you passed our name along to any business or artist you think would benefit from our services. You can easily share our campaign with the Indiegogo share tool, or visit our website at www.greensoundmedia.com

Thank you immensely for taking the time to read about our mission! We hope to unlock endless potential in every business and artist we interact with.
story_txt:
About GreenSound Media
Hey there! We're GreenSound Media, and we exist to help small businesses and artists, the backbone of our economy, utilize digital media marketing to gain the presence and growth they deserve. We created this business in the midst of a global pandemic to help navigate through the new digital marketing frenzy, and haven't turned back since!
As previously working for large marketing and PR firms, we noticed a large amount of small businesses and artists who weren't getting the attention they needed, and were paying way too much to not be a top priority. With our professional experience and dedication, GreenSound Media's focus is providing extraordinary value for small businesses and artists for a competitive price.
With your help we can take on more talent while maintaining the close attention and care that initially inspired us to start this business. 

What We Need & What You Get
We are looking to raise $15,000 to provide job opportunities for professional, personable individuals who know how to market effectively to different audiences both in the small business and entertainment world. 
We provide high-quality logo design, copy writing, photo/video editing, licensing, email marketing, PR and much more. With that being said, it takes quite a bit of funds to successfully operate. If we don't reach our goal, that is totally okay! We're grateful for any donation, and will stick to our mission no matter what.
The Impact

Our clients had to chase a moving target and face challenges they've never experienced. Challenges that required new strategies and a partner who could help them adapt to life in a pandemic.
Rather than taking traditional approaches, we found new opportunities to position our clients for success during a difficult period of time. We introduced new campaign structures, incorporated innovative technologies and grew our expertise to meet audiences where they were in the moment.
We’re passionate about solving difficult problems and applying actionable ideas and insights to help our clients surpass their goals. When we help small businesses grow, we are ultimately hoping to provide more job opportunities and contribute to progressing communities around the world.  So, why fear change when we can thrive in it?

Challenges We Face
We are a team of two who dedicate our career to growing small businesses and artists. While we want to take on every project we come across, we can't give our undivided attention to every client when we grow. We will need to bring professional marketing & PR members onboard who put every client as top priority.

Other Ways You Can Help
Contributions come in many shapes and sizes! We would love if you passed our name along to any business or artist you think would benefit from our services. You can easily share our campaign with the Indiegogo share tool, or visit our website at www.greensoundmedia.com
Thank you immensely for taking the time to read about our mission! We hope to unlock endless potential in every business and artist we interact with.

story:
Hibernian Transmedia NFP was founded in 2013 as a 501C3 public charity that promotes and preserves Irish and Irish-American culture through film, TV, radio, theatre, literature, and the Internet. We currently produce three weekly Irish American radio programs and The Annual Irish American Movie Hooley film festival in Chicago at the Gene Siskel Film Center.

Now we’re producing a pilot for a potential weekly TV show to pitch to networks. We're spreading Irish culture worldwide and you can help with your tax-dedutible donation today!

Each week our host, international Irish fiddler and performer Katie Grennan, introduces the audience to one of her favorite Irish pubs and some of her favorite Irish musicians and dancers as they host a half-hour party at the pub. We’ll meet the proprietors of each pub and get some of the history of their establishment as well as enjoying the music of international and local Irish performers.

Chicago is home to many cozy Irish pubs that each feature “music sessions”, sometimes several sessions per week. There is usually a session leader, and then more musician show up to jam with the leaders. It creates a very lively, family atmosphere to experience the warmth and ambience of listening to authentic traditional Irish music in the cozy snug of an Irish Pub.We anticipate taping the show weekly and look forward to visiting many of Chicago’s Irish Pubs, for a look inside their music and history. Eventually the show will expand to include Boston, Philly, Pittsburgh, New York, Milwaukee and all the Irish American cities of the USA. We also want to take the show to include Irish pubs in Ireland, Australia, Japan, and the UK.

We filmed a sizzle reel at The Fifth Province Pub in The Irish American Heritage Center last Christmas. You can watch it here: https://vimeo.com/200900462,  Hibernian Transmedia produces a weekly Irish radio program at the Heritage Center, The Craic, taped before a live audience with performances by a variety of Irish bands and musicians. Katie Grennan, an international performer who has toured the world with The Chieftains, Women of Ireland, and The World Champion Trinity Dance Company, is our host of the show. She has a first hand knowledge of the music and great rapport with all the musicians.

This show will help fulfill our mission to spread Irish and Irish American culture throughout the world. You can be part of that by making a small tax-deductible donation TODAY!

Take a look and, after a short visit to OUR IRISH PUB, you will find yourself yearning to return each week.

This show has potential for syndication and reruns as well.

And your donation is tax-dedutible!

We’re offering some unique perks for those who donate, including the opportunity to be interviewed on the show some night.  We’ll make you a star of the show!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t afford a minimal donation of $10, a measly ten bucks,  we still value your ability to spread the word about the show and get your friends involved. So please share the Indiegogo links to this page and help us reach our goal. If you don't like using a credit card online you can send a check payable to: Hibernian Transmedia NFP, PO Box 5650, River Forest, Il. 60305

It's tax deductible!

Hibernian Transmedia and our family have produced theatrical productions and feature films that have aired on WTTW PBS Chicago as well as in film festivals across the nation from Chicago to Austin, Texas, to Park City, Utah.  Like any theatrical endeavor, we offer no guarantees that the show will ever be broadcast, but we're confident based on meetings we've already had with a couple of networks, that this show will be picked up. Actually they told us to "you're on to something, now go make a more structured pilot" than our sizzle reel, so here we are. We've been working in media collectively for over a hundred years. You can read more about us at http://hiberniantransmedia.org

story:
What is Chuan Fa America?

Chuan Fa America Arkansas is a 501c3 non-profit organization that seeks to provide free martial arts training to people of all ages and all backgrounds. We believe everyone should have the ability to defend themselves. No one should be turned away because of a financial inability to afford instruction. That is why all our classes are 100% free to everyone. 

Our Goals:

  • Reach out to and provide a positive environment for children with little supervision (latchkey children) as well as neglected and abused children
  • Give students tools to defend themselves and others
  • Create a safe haven for young adults and survivors
  • Teach a variety of arts to help promote open mindedness
  • Work with local school systems and universities to
    • fight bullying
    • teach women’s self-defense courses
    • promote rape prevention awareness
These mission goals will be accomplished through the completion of Project Zen.
 

Project Zen

Project Zen will provide a center for the growth of our citizens by providing an eclectic mixture of martial arts styles, philosophies, languages and customs. Not only will Project Zen offer the aforementioned items, it will create a visual landmark within Northwest Arkansas - whether by its uniquely designed structures, or by its meticulously landscaped gardens meant to be appreciated not only by students, but by any visitors or tourists.
 

Phase One

The first step towards completing Project Zen will be purchasing land for the site of our building. We have recently secured the support of the University of Arkansas Fay Jones School of Architecture as well as many other UofA departments' support. Honors students from each department will create design concepts for the site. 

Estimated Project Costs
  • 60+ acres centrally located within Fayetteville - ~$1,900,000
  • Costs of interior design blueprints - ~$4,000-$7,000
  • Construction materials - awaiting blueprints
  • Labor - awaiting blueprints
  • Insurance (specialized needed, currently 50 students or less) - ~$1,150/yr
This will be our first fundraiser to jump start the project. Our immediate needs will be to purchase a warehouse building for training as we have outgrown our current space. Once we have completed Project Zen this warehouse will be used for storage. This campaign should get us about halfway there. 100% of profits go towards Project Zen. If we don't reach the entire goal, all funds will be entered into a savings account until we have enough funds for the warehouse. All future fundraising will focus on purchasing the land for the final project. 

Ultimate Goal

Upon the completion of Project Zen in its entirety, Chuan Fa America Arkansas will provide FREE training for anyone. We will launch a summer camp program as well as provide a Scholarship Program for Financially Challenged Children. The scholarship is estimated to be $3,200/yr. per child. It will include the uniform and belt (when earned), class meals, instruction costs (for visiting instructors), sparring gear, testing fees, summer camp fees/ clothing/ meals, and seminar fees. We wish to inspire and empower the youth and sexual assault/domestic violence survivors. Chaun Fa America Arkansas will become a beacon of hope and truly give back to our community by paying it forward.  
 

The Impact

More than another gym or martial arts dojo, the hope of Chuan Fa America Arkansas is that Project Zen will become a landmark within the city of Fayetteville. What the Walton's Crystal Bridges Museum brought to NW Arkansas in terms of a fine art experience, Project Zen aims to bring with respect to the martial arts and East Asian cultures of Japan, Korea, China, the Philippines, and South America. 
It is our desire that these opportunities are made available to community members who could not otherwise afford a commercial martial arts school, to survivors of assault, and to those who are seeking a family oriented, yet disciplined, training atmosphere in which to learn a valuable skill and hopefully grow as individuals in the process.
We are also beginning to discuss launching a Project Zen - New Mexico. It will have the same goals as this campaign, but aim to partner with local universities near Albuquerque, NM. We hope eventually Chuan Fa will have many locations across the nation!
 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone will be able to monetarily contribute to our cause. That's okay! You can still help us reach our goal by spreading the word and letting others know about this amazing program. Project Zen is not limited to Northwest Arkansas alone. Once we get doors open, we hope to have visiting instructors from all over the United States, and possibly other countries. Chuan Fa America Arkansas will outreach nationally, and maybe someday, even globally!
If you still have reservations about supporting us or more questions, feel free to visit our Facebook page or website: chuanfaamerica.com 
If you're in the area, you can also come by one of our classes and see what we're all about!

story:
(For English version please scroll down)

***Dosegli smo naš inicijalni cilj od $8.000 - beskrajno hvala svim podupirateljima! Nastavljamo i dalje do novog cilja od $10.000: sva prikupljena sredstva iznad $8.000 bit će uložena u razvoj audiovizualnog centra muzeja Image of War.***

 

Zašto Image of War?

Ratovi su jedna od najvećih tragedija koje pojedinac i društvo mogu iskusiti, ali istovremeno, u javnosti i medijima sve se češće o njima govori s nevjerojatnom lakoćom i indiferentnošću. Kao reakciju na to, željeli smo stvoriti mjesto koje će kroz umjetnost potaknuti dijalog i educirati o razarajućim posljedicama rata i važnosti održavanja mira za društvo u cjelini. Ništa manje bitno, željeli smo stvoriti muzej s aktivnom misijom mijenjanja stvarnosti za one koji su izravno pogođeni ratom danas: dio prihoda od ulaznica bit će namijenjen izbjeglicama i žrtvama rata.

 

 

 

Muzej u kojem ima mjesta i za vaše priče

Image of War svojim će izložbama kroz vrhunske fotografije posjetitelje upoznavati s temom ratnih sukoba i njihovih posljedica. Prva izložba bit će posvećena ratu u Hrvatskoj od 1991. do 1995. godine, a uz profesionalne fotografije domaćih i inozemnih fotografa, u nju ćemo uključiti i najbolje osobne priče i amaterske fotografije prikupljene kroz kampanju #GdjeSiBio91.

 

U planiranje i realizaciju muzeja Image of War uložili smo mjesece vremena, iznimno puno volje, truda i vlastitih resursa, ali želimo da on bude mjesto zajednice - prostor uključivosti i mjesto učenja, muzej koji je i vaš i naš. Planirano otvorenje muzeja je u srpnju ove godine na adresi Hebrangova 4, a u prostoru muzeja osim izložbi želimo organizirati i radionice i tribine edukativnog sadržaja. Neke od planiranih tema idućih izložbi su djeca vojnici i Srebrenica - kronika jednog masakra.

 

Kako mogu pomoći?

Kako bismo sve to postigli, potrebna nam je vaša pomoć! 90% sredstava već smo osigurali, ali nedostaje nam posljednjih 10% sredstava kako bismo finalizirali postavljanje izložbe Rat u Hrvatskoj i otvorili vrata našeg i vašeg muzeja ovog srpnja. Uz malo pomoći, muzej ćemo zajednički postaviti na noge, a svatko od vas može postati suosnivač.

 

Uz $8000 moći ćemo osigurati postav i prezentaciju kakvu prva izložba zaslužuje, a nećemo ni vas, naše podupiratelje, ostaviti praznih ruku! Nađite među našim nagradama nešto za sebe ili sebi drage ljude, osigurajte ulaznice po povoljnijim cijenama, dođite i posjetite nas!

 

Ako ne prikupimo dovoljno sredstava, uložit ćemo sva prikupljena sredstva u postavljanje izložbe. Ipak, vjerujemo da, zajedno, uz pomoć svih vas, ovo možemo ostvariti!  

 

Zašto nas podržati?

Još uvijek se nećkate? Image of War je:

  • neovisan projekt nevezan uz ijednu političku ili ideološku opciju
  • muzej s misijom: podupirat ćemo izbjeglice i žrtve ratova danas
  • mjesto u kojem će sadašnje i buduće generacije učiti o važnosti mira
  • mjesto u kojem će se o ratu govoriti s ozbiljnošću 
  • mjesto u kojem će se izlagati vrhunske ratne fotografije

Kao takav, Image of War je jedinstven projekt u Zagrebu, koji još uvijek nema muzej posvećen ratnoj fotografiji, ali i u cijeloj Hrvatskoj.

...a možda vam se jednostavno sviđaju naše nagrade. I to je u redu! 

 

Tko je već prepoznao naš projekt?

Zahvalni smo našim prijateljima i partnerima koji su već prepoznali ovaj projekt i pružili mu podršku. Riječ je o:

  • War Photo Limited
  • Galerija 11/07/95
  • Memorijalni centar Srebrenica-Potočari
  • Muzej vojne i ratne povijesti Pakrac
  • Are You Syrious?

 

Svaka riječ je bitna

Sviđa vam se kampanja, ali ne možete doprinijeti novčano? Pomozite nam da se o kampanji čuje! Podijelite informaciju o kampanji s drugima usmeno i na društvenim mrežama uz pomoć share opcija u gornjem desnom kutu stranice. Pratite naš web i društvene mreže: nalazimo se na Facebooku, Instagramu i Twitteru. Službeni hashtag kampanje je #SpremimoRatUMuzej. 

 

(English version here)

***We've reached our initial goal of $8.000 - infinite thank you to all the supporters! We're moving on to our stretch goal of $10.000: all of the funds collected that surpass our initial goal will go towards establishing an audiovisual centre within Image of War museum.***

 

The idea behind Image of War

Image of War’s purpose is to respond to the increasing trivialization of war and its consequences. Public discourse regarding armed conflict has become increasingly callous and indifferent. As a reaction to that, we wanted to create a place that will, through art, stimulate dialogue and educate about the devastating consequences of war and the imperative of peace for everyone. Last but not least, we wanted to create a museum with an active mission of changing realities for those directly affected by war today: a portion of all tickets sold will be donated to refugees and war victims.

Photo credit: Božidar Vukičević

 

 

We've invested months of our time and all of our efforts and resources in the planning and realization of this museum, but what we really want is to build a place for the whole community - a place of belonging and a place of learning, a museum that is equally yours and ours. Planned opening of the museum is in July of this year and, together with the first exhibition that will cover war in Croatia from 1991-1995, we are planning to use the museum as a venue for various workshops and educational events. Exhibitions that will follow will cover the topics such as child soldiers and the Srebrenica massacre.

 

How can I help?

In order to achieve all this, we need your help! We have already secured 90% of the funds, but we are missing the last 10% of the funds to finalize the first exhibition on war in Croatia and to open the doors of our and your museum this July. With a bit of help, we will put this museum on its feet, and each of you can become not only a museum's funder but also its founder.

 

With $8000, we will be able to set up our first exhibition and open the doors of our museum in time, but we are also not planning to leave you, our dear supporter, empty-handed! Feel free to scroll though our perks and find something for yourself or your loved ones and we'll make sure to ship it to you or, even better, purchase your perks and come and visit us!

 

If we do not collect enough funds, we will invest all the funds raised in setting up the exhibition. However, we believe that, with all of you on board, we can make this happen!

 

Why should I decide to support Image of War?

Still hesitant about supporting us? Let us briefly introduce ourselves once more! Image of War is:

  • an independent project unrelated to any political or ideological movement
  • museum with a mission: we improve lives of refugees and victims of wars today
  • a place where current and future generations will learn about the importance of peace
  • a place where war will not be trivialized but taken seriously
  • a place where state-of-the-art war photography will be exhibited

And as such, Image of War is a unique project in both Zagreb and Croatia (and possibly even further!). As a country that still struggles with societal and economic consequences of the last war that happened in the 90s, we believe that this type of place is highly needed.

... and maybe you'll supports us just because you like our perks. That's also perfectly fine! (We love them, too!)

 

Who has already supported us through this journey?

We are grateful to our friends and partners who have already recognized and supported our vision and this project. These are:

  • War Photo Limited
  • Gallery 11/07/95
  • Srebrenica Genocide Memorial
  • Military and War History Museum Pakrac
  • Are You Syrious?

Spread the word!

You like our campaign, but can't contribute financially at the moment? Help our voices be heard! Share the information about the campaign, talk about it with others and spread the word through social networks with share options in the top right corner of this page. Follow our webpage and social networks as well: you can find us on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter. The official campaign hashtag is #SpremimoRatUMuzej #WarBelongsInAMuseum.

Thank you!

Image of War svojim će izložbama kroz vrhunske fotografije posjetitelje upoznavati s temom ratnih sukoba i njihovih posljedica. Prva izložba bit će posvećena ratu u Hrvatskoj od 1991. do 1995. godine, a uz profesionalne fotografije domaćih i inozemnih fotografa, u nju ćemo uključiti i najbolje osobne priče i amaterske fotografije prikupljene kroz kampanju #GdjeSiBio91.

 
U planiranje i realizaciju muzeja Image of War uložili smo mjesece vremena, iznimno puno volje, truda i vlastitih resursa, ali želimo da on bude mjesto zajednice - prostor uključivosti i mjesto učenja, muzej koji je i vaš i naš. Planirano otvorenje muzeja je u srpnju ove godine na adresi Hebrangova 4, a u prostoru muzeja osim izložbi želimo organizirati i radionice i tribine edukativnog sadržaja. Neke od planiranih tema idućih izložbi su djeca vojnici i Srebrenica - kronika jednog masakra.

 

Kako mogu pomoći?
Kako bismo sve to postigli, potrebna nam je vaša pomoć! 90% sredstava već smo osigurali, ali nedostaje nam posljednjih 10% sredstava kako bismo finalizirali postavljanje izložbe Rat u Hrvatskoj i otvorili vrata našeg i vašeg muzeja ovog srpnja. Uz malo pomoći, muzej ćemo zajednički postaviti na noge, a svatko od vas može postati suosnivač.

 
Uz $8000 moći ćemo osigurati postav i prezentaciju kakvu prva izložba zaslužuje, a nećemo ni vas, naše podupiratelje, ostaviti praznih ruku! Nađite među našim nagradama nešto za sebe ili sebi drage ljude, osigurajte ulaznice po povoljnijim cijenama, dođite i posjetite nas!

 
Ako ne prikupimo dovoljno sredstava, uložit ćemo sva prikupljena sredstva u postavljanje izložbe. Ipak, vjerujemo da, zajedno, uz pomoć svih vas, ovo možemo ostvariti!  

 
Zašto nas podržati?
Još uvijek se nećkate? Image of War je:

neovisan projekt nevezan uz ijednu političku ili ideološku opciju
muzej s misijom: podupirat ćemo izbjeglice i žrtve ratova danas
mjesto u kojem će sadašnje i buduće generacije učiti o važnosti mira
mjesto u kojem će se o ratu govoriti s ozbiljnošću 
mjesto u kojem će se izlagati vrhunske ratne fotografije

Kao takav, Image of War je jedinstven projekt u Zagrebu, koji još uvijek nema muzej posvećen ratnoj fotografiji, ali i u cijeloj Hrvatskoj.
...a možda vam se jednostavno sviđaju naše nagrade. I to je u redu! 
 
Tko je već prepoznao naš projekt?
Zahvalni smo našim prijateljima i partnerima koji su već prepoznali ovaj projekt i pružili mu podršku. Riječ je o:

War Photo Limited
Galerija 11/07/95
Memorijalni centar Srebrenica-Potočari
Muzej vojne i ratne povijesti Pakrac
Are You Syrious?


 
Svaka riječ je bitna
Sviđa vam se kampanja, ali ne možete doprinijeti novčano? Pomozite nam da se o kampanji čuje! Podijelite informaciju o kampanji s drugima usmeno i na društvenim mrežama uz pomoć share opcija u gornjem desnom kutu stranice. Pratite naš web i društvene mreže: nalazimo se na Facebooku, Instagramu i Twitteru. Službeni hashtag kampanje je #SpremimoRatUMuzej. 
 
(English version here)
***We've reached our initial goal of $8.000 - infinite thank you to all the supporters! We're moving on to our stretch goal of $10.000: all of the funds collected that surpass our initial goal will go towards establishing an audiovisual centre within Image of War museum.***

 
The idea behind Image of War
Image of War’s purpose is to respond to the increasing trivialization of war and its consequences. Public discourse regarding armed conflict has become increasingly callous and indifferent. As a reaction to that, we wanted to create a place that will, through art, stimulate dialogue and educate about the devastating consequences of war and the imperative of peace for everyone. Last but not least, we wanted to create a museum with an active mission of changing realities for those directly affected by war today: a portion of all tickets sold will be donated to refugees and war victims.

Photo credit: Božidar Vukičević
 


 

We've invested months of our time and all of our efforts and resources in the planning and realization of this museum, but what we really want is to build a place for the whole community - a place of belonging and a place of learning, a museum that is equally yours and ours. Planned opening of the museum is in July of this year and, together with the first exhibition that will cover war in Croatia from 1991-1995, we are planning to use the museum as a venue for various workshops and educational events. Exhibitions that will follow will cover the topics such as child soldiers and the Srebrenica massacre.

 
How can I help?
In order to achieve all this, we need your help! We have already secured 90% of the funds, but we are missing the last 10% of the funds to finalize the first exhibition on war in Croatia and to open the doors of our and your museum this July. With a bit of help, we will put this museum on its feet, and each of you can become not only a museum's funder but also its founder.

 
With $8000, we will be able to set up our first exhibition and open the doors of our museum in time, but we are also not planning to leave you, our dear supporter, empty-handed! Feel free to scroll though our perks and find something for yourself or your loved ones and we'll make sure to ship it to you or, even better, purchase your perks and come and visit us!

 
If we do not collect enough funds, we will invest all the funds raised in setting up the exhibition. However, we believe that, with all of you on board, we can make this happen!

 
Why should I decide to support Image of War?
Still hesitant about supporting us? Let us briefly introduce ourselves once more! Image of War is:

an independent project unrelated to any political or ideological movement
museum with a mission: we improve lives of refugees and victims of wars today
a place where current and future generations will learn about the importance of peace
a place where war will not be trivialized but taken seriously
a place where state-of-the-art war photography will be exhibited

And as such, Image of War is a unique project in both Zagreb and Croatia (and possibly even further!). As a country that still struggles with societal and economic consequences of the last war that happened in the 90s, we believe that this type of place is highly needed.
... and maybe you'll supports us just because you like our perks. That's also perfectly fine! (We love them, too!)
 
Who has already supported us through this journey?
We are grateful to our friends and partners who have already recognized and supported our vision and this project. These are:

War Photo Limited
Gallery 11/07/95

Srebrenica Genocide Memorial

Military and War History Museum Pakrac
Are You Syrious?


Spread the word!
You like our campaign, but can't contribute financially at the moment? Help our voices be heard! Share the information about the campaign, talk about it with others and spread the word through social networks with share options in the top right corner of this page. Follow our webpage and social networks as well: you can find us on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter. The official campaign hashtag is #SpremimoRatUMuzej #WarBelongsInAMuseum.
Thank you!

story:
The Project - Snow Carving Competition 
A major part of our festival is the International Snow Carving Competition held every year! We attract internationally recognized snow carvers, and invite them to take a chisel at our most abundant natural resource... snow! Year after year we have rave reviews about the quality, consistency and abundance of the carving medium offered up here. Carvers express wonder at the fact that their sculptures, usually doomed to have a short life expectancy, will live on for the entire month, being appreciated by the public eye! The snow carving competition is an essential part of our festival, and an amazing free public spectacle. Most importantly, with your support, it has the potential to become an internationally recognized competition!

The SKWF team aims to make our festival as accessible as possible for the public! The snow carvings are purposely done outside castle walls, in part to provide carvers with ample space, but also to provide a 24/7 free public spectacle that decorates the backdrop of the frozen lake throughout the month of March. 

In order to continue the growth of the carving competition, we need your support! We can see greater participation, more entries, and participants from every corner of the world travel to showcase their skills. We can put the SKWF not he map of international snow carving competitions! Not to mention the amazing draw that it will have for the entire Snowking Winter Festival, and the community around us. With your support, we can keep the event as a free public attraction, and we can bring more artists to Yellowknife to participate in the creative process.

What We Need

  • Raising our level of professionalism, means meeting hospitality standards for artists and carvers. We need to purchase:
    • Flights
    • Hotels
    • Meals
  • We need to rent special equipment to prepare the material (snow) for carving
  • General operational expenses for the event, which always add up quickly! 
  • To run any successful event, advertising is essential! We need to produce promotional material for advertising purposes (Videos, photography, graphic design, etc) and we need to promote our festival on a national scale to create awareness.

All of these elements are specific to the carving competition, and does not bring into account the long, hard and COLD hours that are put forward by an amazing team of staff and volunteers. 

Amazing Facts about the competition....

  • There are on average, 5 participants from 4 countries.
  • 150 volunteer hours go into putting on just the carving competition!
  • The volunteer hours that go into the creation of the castle, and the operational hours that go into the festival are in the thousands!
  • Participants are honoured castle guests during and after the competition!
  • The carvings stay visible under the Northern Lights for the entire month of March!

We need your help to grow this competition, and make it the event that it can be! Support us today....

story:
Background

The Uyghur people are a “super minority” of China, with a population of 10-20 million in the country’s northwestern Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region. Typically, their cuisine has a very Central Asian flavor (think, for example, of Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, or Uzbekistan), with dishes such as rice pilaf (plov, polo) and hand-pulled noodles (leghmen) being the major staples, bolstered by such side foods/snacks as skewered meat (kawap, shashlik), flatbread (nan), steamed buns (manta), and baked buns (samsa). Though not incredibly diverse, there is something incredibly “catchy” about the simplicity and flavor of this cuisine, and so it is not rare that a tourist will come to Xinjiang and, after only a short time there, end up falling in love with the food. Unfortunately, Uyghur restaurants outside of Xinjiang and Central Asia can be difficult to find, especially if they are to be good and authentic.

 

Scope

My plan is to visit and discover the different Uyghur kitchens operating today in “inner China” (roughly speaking, China without its western territories of Xinjiang and Tibet). Intended to span some fifty cities and approximately eight months, my journey will aim to put together a special kind of “food guide” to all the restaurants started up by different Uyghur chefs/entrepreneurs outside of their home region. In it, I want to include a basic review of each restaurant that

  • rates the main dishes on a 1-5 scale,
  • gives the prices,
  • provides the restaurant’s address, contact info, and working hours.

I also hope to go one step further and collect the “stories” behind the different establishments by having at least one good sit-down interview session with the owner or boss. Basically, I want to discover the unique character of each place and to convey it in the small write-up that follows. As someone who speaks Uyghur at an advanced level (nine years of study), who has spent three years in Xinjiang (currently based there), and who is involved in a number of Uyghur projects (see www.ccapprox.info), I believe that I am qualified to do a good job!

 

Sample

A sample restaurant review/description is provided below for a diner in Urumqi where I used to volunteer waiting tables. Being in Urumqi, it will not be included in the final version, but I am posting it here so that you may have an idea of what to expect for each restaurant I visit.

 

Logistics

After investing some time into searching both Chinese/Uyghur internet forums and into asking friends/acquaintances, I have built a list of all the potential Uyghur restaurants in inner China. For the most part, these places are confirmed to exist as of late 2016, with a minority (10-20%) unconfirmed or rumored – these I plan to learn more about on the spot. A good number of restaurants I’m also familiar with from my own experiences of having traveled around China and having visited them in person. All in all, they span about fifty cities, of which a few (e.g., Shenzhen, Yiwu, Shanghai, Beijing) have big clusters of up to ten or fifteen restaurants while most others only have one to three. To try the different foods at each place and to be able to get a feel for its story and character, I plan to visit each 2-4 times, which gives me an estimated 7-8 months needed for the completion of the journey. I plan to depart Urumqi at the very end of 2016 and to return there somewhere in the middle of April.

The complete list and order of cities, with the number of potential restaurants in parentheses, is as follows:

Xining (1) > Lanzhou (4-5) > Tianshui (1) > Xi’an (4-5) > Mianyang (1) > Chengdu (2) > Chongqing (4-5) > Kunming (1) > Guilin (2) > Haikou (2) > Sanya (1) > Zhuhai (2) > Guangzhou (4) > Shenzhen (5) > Xiamen (1) > Taizhou (2) > Yiwu (5+) > Hangzhou (2) > Keqiao (1-5) > Shaoxing (1) > Shanghai (10+) > Suzhou (2) > Changshu (1) > Wuxi (2) > Taixing (1) > Changzhou (1) > Nanjing (2-3) > Hefei (2) > Wuhu (1) > Nanchang (1) > Changsha (3-4) > Wuhan (2-3) > Xiangfan (1) > Luoyang (1) > Dengfeng (1) > Zhengzhou (1) > Handan (1) > Xingtai (1) > Shijiazhuang (1) > Jinan (5+) > Jining (1) > Xuzhou (3) > Linyi (1) > Qingdao (1) > Dalian (1-5) > Dandong (1) > Harbin (2) > Changchun (2-3) > Shenyang (2-3) > Tianjin (1-2) > Beijing (10+) > Hohhot (2) > Yinchuan (1)

 

Funding

I am launching this crowdfunding campaign because I need assistance with defraying the costs of transportation implicit in my visiting all these cities – I am not asking for help with paying for the food or housing, since I figure that I already have those in my standard cost of living. Thankfully, travelling in China can be very cheap, especially if you travel by train and don’t mind sitting, and this is precisely what I plan to do. After solving the traveling salesman problem (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Travelling_salesman_problem) to find the shortest path that lets me visit all the cities, I have calculated the corresponding travel costs (vast majority being “hard seat” train tickets, with the exception of a few buses and a boat to Dalian) and have found that the total nicely comes up to just about 600 USD. This is fairly modest, given the distance covered, but I would nevertheless be extremely grateful for any aid in covering it, as this really would take off a lot of stress and allow me to better focus on the project – i.e., on eating, talking, and writing!

 

Final Product

This is a volunteer project stemming out of my own interests, with the goal of making a useful and original niche contribution to the Uyghur and food-guide literatures. It is not intended to be marketable in any serious sense of the word, and I don't intend to sell it to make a profit. As such, after writing up the reviews and descriptions of all the restaurants, I plan to put them together into a book that will, most likely, be available for free download on my personal site (though I may consider other options between now and then). I also hope to make a limited number of color prints and to have them sold to interested tourists/travelers in the city where I reside (Kashgar). Complimentary copies will also be sent to those donors who pitch in 50 USD or more.

story:
Why Musalaha's summer camp is unique in Israel:

This is a unique opportunity for many of the participants as it is one of the only times they are able to come together to play games, learn more about the Gospel, and build friendships with those who have a different identity than themselves.

These camps are important because they are able to break down the prejudice and hate that most grow up learning in their separate communities. We are also happy that most of the children involved continue with Musalaha for years to come as youth leaders.  

 

Why we need to invest together:

Within a few years, many of these young kids will be serving in the military, attending university and joining the work force. Yet, the principles of reconciliation that they have learned from a young age will remain with them.

These children represent the future of this land, and if we do not invest in them now, and help them understand their common humanity as individuals made in the image of God, we will have missed a wonderful opportunity to impact their perceptions and decision making processes early on.

 

Why we need you to partner with us:

We anticipate we will have a total of around 300 children, volunteers, and counselors who will participate. We have two one-week camps - one in Bethlehem in July, and one in Galilee in August. 

You not only make these camps possible with your financial gifts, but you are also a vital part of making an impact on the children’s lives.  Running as well as sponsoring the camps is our joint effort. The cost for each child is $500 and we are eager to serve as many children as possible.

 

We appreciate every sponsorship you might consider to invest in the next generation, reaching out to them through our summer camps.

 

Peacemaking begins with children.

 

Listen to one of our camp leaders (2018):

story:
The future of the New York State Pavilion begins with you!

We at the National Trust for Historic Preservation, in collaboration with Heineken USA, are on a mission to help revive one of New York City’s most inspiring landmarks. With your support, we’ll be one step closer to reopening its soaring towers for new generations of awe-struck visitors.

Designed by architecture legend Philip Johnson, the New York State Pavilion was a skyline-defining feature of the 1964-65 World’s Fair, which drew more than 50 million visitors to Queens for a celebration of culture, technology, and “man's achievement on a shrinking globe in an expanding universe.” The playful, Jetsons-like structure combined a theater, three observation towers, and an open-air elliptical ring dubbed the “Tent of Tomorrow.” Underneath its suspension roof—the world's largest at the time—fair-goers frolicked on an extensive, 567-panel terrazzo road map of the entire Empire State.

Quirky in every possible way, the Pavilion was unlike anything anyone had ever seen. And people loved it.

After the fair came and went, most of the structures and monuments built for it were either relocated or demolished. But not the Pavilion. Intended from the start to live on as a vibrant space, the Pavilion hosted concerts for legends like Led Zeppelin and Joni Mitchell for years—and even at one point became a community roller skating rink.

By 1976, however, the tent’s iconic roof was declared unstable and then removed, leaving the ornate map of New York State exposed to the elements. Suddenly, after years of entertaining visitors and intriguing passersby, the Pavilion’s future was in question.

Luckily, a dedicated group of local activists and elected officials kept the dream of the Pavilion alive. Their tireless work to repair and reopen the landmark has recently brought in millions of dollars in restoration funding, but there is still a gap to fill and important projects to tackle. That’s where you come in.

Success! We're happy to report that our campaign raised $39,487! That's $24,487 above our original goal of $15,000!

Over the years, the floor at the entryway to the “Tent of Tomorrow” has crumbled and buckled so badly that the structure can no longer be safely accessed—even by restoration crews. Thanks to the generouos support of our backers, we’ll pitch in for the revival by replacing the Terrazzo tiles at what is essentially the Pavilion’s front door. By retiling the entryway, we’ll ensure that the restoration can continue so that someday we can all walk in, look up, and be amazed.

Please stay tuned to the updates section of this page for additional project news.

I claimed tickets to the Bruno Mars: 24K Magic World Tour as my perk and have questions.

Thank you for supporting our project! You will find answers to your questions in our FAQ. If you have specific questions about how to redeem your tickets, please email fulfillment@lifeinmobile.com. Enjoy the show!

About The Projects

What is the National Trust for Historic Preservation?

The National Trust for Historic Preservation, a privately funded nonprofit organization, works to save America’s historic places. We are the cause that inspires Americans to save the places where history happened. The cause that connects us to our diverse pasts, weaving a multi-cultural nation together. The cause that transforms communities from places where we live into places that we love. As the leading voice for preservation, we are the cause for people saving places.

Our mission is to protect significant places representing our diverse cultural experience by taking direct action and inspiring broad public support.

Where is my donation going?

More than 90% of all funds raised will support the cities' projects and the National Trust’s ongoing work to save historic places in New York City and around the country. Up to 10% will cover Indiegogo costs and processing fees, as described in Indiegogo’s Terms and Conditions.

When will I get my perk (non-ticket)?

Perks will be delivered later this summer (July/August).

Can I visit the project site?

Yes! You can visit the New York State Pavilion, but going inside is another story. The entryway is unsafe, even for preservationists.

When will the project be complete?

Saving places takes time! But with your generous support, we hope to get the New York State Pavilion project completed as soon as possible.

How do I get support for my project? Or can I submit a project for consideration?

We at the National Trust are always interested in hearing about what is important to you. Although we may not be able to save it immediately, you can always contact your state’s historic preservation office and see how you can get started on the road to preservation!

Is the National Trust involved in other restoration projects?

Yes! We’re the country’s leading advocate for saving historic places. As such, we’re on the ground in communities across the nation. Visit our website to explore other historic places that we are trying to save like Queens’ New York State Pavilion.

Media Inquiries:

For further media inquiries about these projects, check out our Press Center.

My question wasn’t answered above. Who can I contact?

First, please see the full FAQ for the Cities Project.

If you have questions about the projects or how to claim perks other than tickets, please email cities@savingplaces.org.

If you have questions about how to redeem your tickets, please email  fulfillment@lifeinmobile.com.

If you have questions about the Cities Project, please email corporaterelations@heinekenusa.com.
story_txt: The future of the New York State Pavilion begins with you!We at the National Trust for Historic Preservation, in collaboration with Heineken USA, are on a mission to help revive one of New York City’s most inspiring landmarks. With your support, we’ll be one step closer to reopening its soaring towers for new generations of awe-struck visitors.Designed by architecture legend Philip Johnson, the New York State Pavilion was a skyline-defining feature of the 1964-65 World’s Fair, which drew more than 50 million visitors to Queens for a celebration of culture, technology, and “man's achievement on a shrinking globe in an expanding universe.” The playful, Jetsons-like structure combined a theater, three observation towers, and an open-air elliptical ring dubbed the “Tent of Tomorrow.” Underneath its suspension roof—the world's largest at the time—fair-goers frolicked on an extensive, 567-panel terrazzo road map of the entire Empire State.Quirky in every possible way, the Pavilion was unlike anything anyone had ever seen. And people loved it.After the fair came and went, most of the structures and monuments built for it were either relocated or demolished. But not the Pavilion. Intended from the start to live on as a vibrant space, the Pavilion hosted concerts for legends like Led Zeppelin and Joni Mitchell for years—and even at one point became a community roller skating rink.By 1976, however, the tent’s iconic roof was declared unstable and then removed, leaving the ornate map of New York State exposed to the elements. Suddenly, after years of entertaining visitors and intriguing passersby, the Pavilion’s future was in question.Luckily, a dedicated group of local activists and elected officials kept the dream of the Pavilion alive. Their tireless work to repair and reopen the landmark has recently brought in millions of dollars in restoration funding, but there is still a gap to fill and important projects to tackle. story:
De qué se trata?

100 años del Natalicio de Santiago Álvarez, ese habanero, por convicción hermano de Fidel y de la causa revolucionaria. Del 06 al 12 de marzo de 2019, volveremos a encontrarnos en Santiago de Cuba, esta edición 17 será un desafío: nos llegó el Centenario; y es menester honrar al realizador acerado e incansable, que ha contribuido al conocimiento de las causas más justas de la humanidad.  Ven con nosotros a esta fiesta del documental, vive el sabor de la isla caribeña y comparte con cineastas e invitados de diferentes países.

Cuba será el país invitado, y tu aporte nos permitirá hacer un documental para reseñar todo lo que acontezca, además de fortalecer las diferentes áreas del evento, muestras paralelas, seminario teórico y concurso de fotografía.

Sólo nos falta una pequeña parte para lograrlo. Y contigo, será posible.

 

What is it about?


100 years of the birth of Santiago Álvarez, that Havana, by conviction Fidel's brother and the revolutionary cause. From 06 to March 12, 2019, we will meet again in Santiago de Cuba, this 17th edition will be a challenge: the Centennial arrived; and it is necessary to honor the steely and tireless filmmaker, who has contributed to the knowledge of the fairest causes of humanity. Come with us to this documentary party, experience the flavor of the Caribbean island and share with filmmakers and guests from different countries.

Cuba will be the guest country, and your contribution will allow us to make a documentary to review everything that happens, in addition to strengthening the different areas of the event, parallel exhibitions, theoretical seminar and photography contest.

We only need a small part to achieve it. And with you, it will be possible.

 

Un Festival, una imagen para la historia

La 17 Edición del Festival Internacional de Documentales Santiago Álvarez in memoriam y el Centenario del cineasta serán acompañados por la ciudad de Santiago de Cuba, por su gente, su historia.

Es un reto, hacer el Festival y hacer el documental sobre el Festival. Queremos mostrar la grandeza de "Santiago", la ciudad y el cineasta que entregó una obra en conjunto que fue declarada Memoria del Mundo por la UNESCO, que fusionó una denodada y hasta terca inclinación por “volver crónica” cada suceso, grande o menudo, donde se vieran involucradas el alma política y la lucha de los pueblos del mundo –junto a su dimensión humana- por liberarse de los yugos.

Amamos el cine documental, porque estamos convencidos que es un potente medio de unión, defensa y reflexión del contexto histórico, político y social que nos rodea, al cual no podemos estar ajenos. El cine documental es un arma de lucha.

 

A Festival, an image for history

 

The 17th International Documentary Festival Santiago Álvarez in memoriam and the Centennial of the filmmaker will be accompanied by the city of Santiago de Cuba, for its people, its history.

It is a challenge to do the Festival and make the documentary about the Festival. We want to show the greatness of "Santiago", the city and the filmmaker who delivered a joint work that was declared a Memory of the World by UNESCO, which merged a bold and even stubborn inclination to "chronicle" each event, large or small, where they were involved the political soul and the struggle of the peoples of the world -together with their human dimension- to free themselves from the yokes.

We love documentary films, because we are convinced that it is a powerful means of union, defense and reflection of the historical, political and social context that surrounds us, to which we can not be oblivious. Documentary film is a weapon of struggle.

 

 

Festeja y nos apoyas!!

Los recursos financieros se encargarán de posibilitar el vuelo de parte del equipo, la logística, realización y procesamiento del material. Al igual que fortalecerán el seminario teórico y su divulgación posterior. La Solidaridad es el tema del concurso de fotografía que también lo haremos con tu aporte.

Celebra con nosotros de manera presencial o remota, únete al Maestro del documental, al inmortal cronista de los pobres, quien modificó la inmediatez del informe audiovisual y logró establecer un lenguaje propio, áspero y tierno a la vez.

 

Celebrate and support us!

The financial resources will be in charge of enabling the flight of part of the equipment, logistics, realization and processing of the material. As well as strengthening the theoretical seminar and its subsequent dissemination. La Solidaridad is the subject of the photography contest that we will also do with your contribution.

Celebrate with us in person or remotely, join the Master of the documentary, the immortal chronicler of the poor, who modified the immediacy of the audiovisual report and managed to establish his own language, harsh and tender at the same time.

 

 

Distribución/Presupesto:

- Personal técnico y de apoyo, tanto del Festival como del documental  $33.000
Producción, logística del evento  y documental    $52000
Gastos administrativos $6000

 

Otra manera de contribuir

 

Si quieres divulgar nuestra campaña entre tus amigos, dale click a nuestros enlaces, me gusta a nuestras publicaciones y comparte la información para que podamos alcanzar nuestra meta!!

Saludos y honor a un grande, inmortal cronista de los pobres, aguzado ojo de la Revolución mediante su cine urgente, como ya nos dejara anotado el escritor brasileño Amir Labaki.

 

Another way to contribute

If you want to spread our campaign among your friends, click on our links, I like our publications and share the information so we can reach our goal !!

Greetings and honor to a great, immortal chronicler of the poor, keen eye of the Revolution through his urgent cinema, as the Brazilian writer Amir Labaki will already note.
